Žaidimo eiga vyksta laikrodžio rodyklės kryptimi. Kairėje esantis žaidėjas traukia kortelę ir perskaito temą. Tada žaidžiantysis pasirenka vieną iš 3 klausimų ir bando į jį atsakyti. Jei atsakymas teisingas, žaidėjas paeina tiek, kiek vertas buvo klausimas. Jei neteisingas, lieka stovėti vietoje arba eina atgal jei taip yra nurodyta specialioje kortelėje. Laimi tas, kuris greičiausiai surenka 12 taškų.
Šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "IQ ringas: Nr. 2" ir "IQ ringas: Nr. 3" kortomis.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Κλεφτοκοτάς (Chicken Thief)
description:
Chicken Thief is a real time game of observation and quick reaction! In includes 3 games, for different children development levels:

A) Grab the Chicken
Cornelia the Chicken is craving a treat of a specific color! Check your card. If you have that color, be the first to grab the chicken by the neck, to get rid of your card!

B) Coop Party
Cornelia the Chicken is now asking for a specific number of veggies!Count the veggies on your cards and if they match the number, grab the chicken first to get rid of them!

C) Go Figure!
This time, Cornelia the Chicken is asking for specific items. Search among the cards spread on the table and be the first to spot the item to win its card. First player with 7 cards, wins the game!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Party Game

name: Storabelt
description:
This is a strategic game to scramble for the territory of the Scandinavia peninsula.
You choose one among seven actions and send soldiers to the battlefield and build the defensive wall.
When a certain territory was completely surrounded by the defensive wall, the player whom influence is higher in gets a score.
You can purchase a card strengthening own action to push forward a game strategically.
The card which you purchased finally gets a score in this way.
The winner of the game is the player who got more territories and achievements.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Worker Placement

name: Morning Coffee Dungeon: Just a Dungeon
description:
Morning Coffee Dungeon is a dungeon crawling puzzle that can be completed with your morning cup of coffee. Limiting randomness to the treasure/loot drops, each delve into the dungeon is more a series of calculated decisions. Will you be able to complete the campaign with the most victory points?

Just a Dungeon: is a normal dungeon as any other. There are monsters. There are treasures. There is probably a mold problem. Our hero, Sadie Cat, finds themselves treasure hunting in hopes of finding some relief from their crippling student debt. Beware of gold thieves hiding in treasure chests!

What Do I Need to Play:

1d12
10 health chits / markers
10 level chits / markers
10 VP chits / markers

Rules / How to Play

You may move your character to any spot. It may not move through walls or undefeated monsters.
If your character encounters a monster, resolve Battle in order.
You may leave the dungeon at any time. The total number of Victory Points (VP) earned is your score. If you lose all your health, you lose all your Victory Points.

Battle Rules (Complete in Order)

Calculate Damage: monster level - your level = damage to you, with a minimum of 0. Example: Monster Level 5 - Your Level 3 = 2 Damage to you.
Earn VP: if the monster is the same level or higher than your level, gain 1 VP.
Gain Level: if the monster is the same level or higher than your level, gain 1 Level.

—description from the designer

name: What's Poppin'? Movie Quiz
description:
Packaged in cinema-style popcorn box packaging this fun quiz contains 300 questions on everything movie-related from the classics to action and horror. Perfect for every film buff.

The aim of this movie quiz is to be the first player to correctly answer one question from each of the six genres:

Action
Sci-Fi/Adventure
Comedy
Horror/Thriller
Classics
General Knowledge

name: Simplicity in Practice: Horse and musket rules
description: Simplicity in Practice is a set of miniature wargame rules for the Horse-and-Musket period published in the wargaming magazine Battlegames (Issue 23). It is designed for playing 'tabletop teaser' scenarios of the kind written by Charles Grant, Stuart Asquith, Henry Hyde and Steve Jones amongst others, with a small number of figures on a small board (typically 3'x2'). It aims to use very simple mechanisms to aid understanding and speed of play.

name: Find Your Way Out
description:
Are you ready to lift the secret of the library?

With horror you discover that you're trapped inside the dark Monestary library. Your only chance to escape are 30 riddles you discover hidden in a Bible...

A bible themed escape game for home..

name: Gathering of the Wicked: Cruella De Vil & Jasper and Horace
description:
A new villain team to add to the game:

Cruella de Vil:

Before each group vote, insist that a certain player votes against another player of your choice. If they refuse, they are automatically vanquished.

Jasper and Hoarace:

Jasper and Hoarace do not have a special ability. Disney Henchmen who vote against their Disney Villain couterpart run serious risks. If they choose to vote against their Disney Villain, and if the Disney Villain is vanquished and found to be a member of Team Mayhem, then the Disney Henchman is immediately vanquished too!

Promo pack was available for free with purchase of the game during launch.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Trekking the World: Trivia
description:
Trekking the World Trivia is a family trivia game that lets players experience countries all around the world in a fun and interesting way. You don’t have to be good at trivia in order to play and love this game. Players will make their best guesses at the question to earn points. Anyone can play and win. Plus setup is easy—just open the box and start playing within minutes.

It doesn’t matter if you’re looking for a trivia game, games for teens, or family games, this one is perfect for your next family game night. The box is small (8x8), which makes it easy to take on the road or in the car.

name: Let It Snow
description:
A tiddly-wink based drafting/set collecting game! Accumulate Holly, Ice, Silver and Gold and even Coal! Take some fire, but too much could burn down your tree. Draft carefully and while you're at it, stick your neighbor with something they didn't want. It is Christmas after all.

—user summary

Let it Snow is a brand new, instant classic set collection game. Draft to improve your score, hurt your opponent's score or ideally both! Draw, draft and score your way to victory in this celebration of winter, snow and all things cold! And since you have no place to go, let it snow!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Space Cat
description:
Space Cat is a game of dexterity. You have to complete your part of Galaxy take cards from the space. To get a card you have to launch your rocket onto the right planet or right star. You can also attack your opponents and take a card from them.
The first who completes their board is the winner.

—user summary

name: PicNic
description:
It’s time for a picnic! Rabbits and foxes work together to find as many fruit and vegetables as they can, as quickly as they can. So that they don’t get lost, they decide to tie themselves together with a string. Which team will gather the most carrots, watermelons, apples and pineapples?

Your meeples, a fox and a rabbit, are tied-together and you have to move them to take fruit optimizing their movement. Each turn, a wheel will be spun and you have to move according your meeples that are tied together so have limited movements.

When three pineapples have been taken, the player with most fruit will be the winner.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Siehst du aus wie dein Hund?
description:
In this fun memo game dog and master or mistress must find each other. 50 cards feature funny photos of dogs and their owners with humorous text in an enclosed booklet that includes descriptions of the 25 dog owners and their furry friends.

Why do people look like their dogs in the first place? Is it shared personality traits, barely suppressed narcissistic tendencies, or do they grow together over time like old married couples? This game explores the intense bonds we develop with our dogs.

name: Innomination
description:
Innomination, the customizable card game. Set in a world of Science Fantasy, select a Nation of various humans, lizardman, or giant insects, pick a leader, make a deck, and battle with another player. This is a one-versus-one game where you win by defeating your opponent. The language on cards does allow play with more than two players (but the game isn't competitively balanced around this).

Innomination is a customizeable card game with deckbuilding elements. It similar play structure to games like Magic: The Gathering with elements from Yu-Gi-Oh!, Force of Will TCG, and the Pokemon TCG. Digital card games like Hearthstone and Shadowverse were also in mind. If you've played any of these, Innomination may feel familiar to you. Innomination is not a trading card game (TCG). It is to be sold as a complete game right out of a box, like a board game. You'll get a full playset of every card. No rarities, no booster packs, no time spend scouring the secondary market for singles... Open the box knowing you have a complete card game.

Every turn, you will set a Source card into play. Source cards produce Aether, the main resource used to play cards in your hand. The better the card is, the more Aether it costs. Unlike most games, the Source cards are in their own deck, and you get to choose which card you put into play every turn. There are six nations, each one with their own people, culture, and each specializing in an archetype, like aggro (win early with cheap, efficient cards), midrange (playing progressively stronger cards), and control (hold on until the late game and win with powerful, expensive cards).

The Named Deck is the main mechanic of Innomination. Use the Named Deck to name (evolving) your nameless cards in the Main Deck into upgraded versions. You can only do this as a player action once per turn, but there are many Nations that have ways to do this multiple times.
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination

name: Cohetes
description:
Rockets is a card game where the goal is to build a rocket and be the astronaut who goes the furthest on his space journey. The more basic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division) you perform, the more fuel you will receive.

It is a game that, at the same time as a useful resource to consolidate basic procedures for solving (mathematical) problems, we learn facts about history, numbers, planets and various curiosities!

With several alternative game modes for different ages, difficulty and number of players.



Cohetes es un juego de cartas donde el objetivo es construir un cohete y ser el astronauta que más lejos llegue en su viaje espacial. Cuantas más operaciones básicas (suma, resta, multiplicación ydivisión) realices, más combustible recibirás.Es un juego que a la vez de un recurso útil para consolidar procedimientos básicos para la resolución de problemas (matemáticos), aprendemos datos de historia, de números, de planetas yde curiosidades varias!

Con varios modos de juego alternativos para diferentes edades, dificultad y número de jugadores.

(from the publisher)
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Space Exploration

name: めるかるた (Meru Karuta)
description:
めるかるた (Meru Karuta) is a Karuta game from Japan. Karuta is a classic card game in which one person reads a line on a card from a classic poem, and the other two players must snatch or guard the open card that has the successive couplet.

In this game, Meru Karuta, the cards have tricky Kanji, the Japanese characters that derive from Chinese. Kanji are often hard for experienced Japanese readers, and the game plays on that problem.

Each Kanji in the game is some version of a word with '-meru'. So players only have to get to something-meru in order to identify the card in question. However, the kanji are so tricky, and the game gives no assistance to help the readers, so there is no expectation for anybody to read it correctly, not the reader nor the players. Everybody is just meant to make the best they can and hack through it without worrying too much about accuracy.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Gondolieri
description:
It's not easy to take all the tourists to the sights they want to see in Venice — because everyone wants to admire the same beautiful and impressive monuments.

In Gondolieri, players slip into the role of the gondolieri, who take their passengers to the most sought-after sights. After the first roll of the dice, the player decides with which of their gondolieri they want to advance. Each gondoliere has a different destination that they want to get as close to as possible. You can roll the dice more if you'd like, and as long as you roll the right color, the gondoliere can continue to move forward.

There is only one problem: There is always a traffic jam at the Rialto Bridge — and after that the gondoliere has to continue in one go until they reach their destination because otherwise they will be too late for new guests. Keep an eye on the opposing gondolieri as they can still profit from the remaining dice!

name: TANK You Very Much
description:
This is a WWII Tank skirmish game. It is primarily a two player (two team) game played on 3d terrain using miniature tanks. Each side controls 1 to 4 WWII era tanks in a fast-paced skirmish game of tank-on-tank warfare. The game is over when one side loses their last tank or when a pre-determined objective has been met.

This is a dice allocation game and each tank starts the game with 5 basic d6 and 1 special leader d6. These dice constitute the command decisions made by each tank and will determine which actions can be taken by that take in a give round as players allocate dice to activation spots.

Tank commanders must be careful for as damage accumulates they can lose command dice temporarily or permanently representing the pressures and confusion of battle. Additionally, tanks will take physical damage disabling specific tank functions.

As a tank commander you must gauge the risk/reward of confrontation. The initiative system creates a fog of war and uncertainty on when your enemy will move and what maneuvers they have in store.

Button up your tank commanders, the enemy is in sight, now the mettle is tested and only the steadfast will emerge once the smoke of battle clears.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Random

name: US-China Clash: Modern Naval Battle Taiwan Strait
description:
US-China Clash: Modern Naval Battle Taiwan Strait is the same system as our magazine No. 74 Japan-China-Korea-Modern Naval Battle Three Kingdoms and describes the clash between the US and Chinese navy in the sea near Taiwan that may occur in 202x. It is a board simulation game.
The surface ship / submarine unit is one unit per ship, and the character characteristics of each individual ship and each weapon are reproduced.
Ship-to-ship, ship-to-air, ship-to-submarine, air-to-submarine, and air-to-air combat are reproduced with a simple game system, and you can play three-dimensional modern naval battles.
In addition to the three introduction scenarios that can be played in a short time, one campaign scenario that asks for strategy planning that combines each weapon on a wide range is attached, and you can enjoy various plays.

Scenarios

Introduction scenario 1: Kinmen Island defense operation
Introduction scenario 2: Break through the first island chain!
Introduction Scenario 3 : Ghost of the Great Ship Giantism
Campaign scenario: Crisis approaching the Taiwan Strait!


Topic: Possible US-China naval clashes in the waters near Taiwan in 202x
Game design: GJG Design Team
Number of counters: 198 pieces
Maps: 1 full map

Game duration: 16 hours to 3 days (depending on scenario)
Unit size: 1 unit per ship (naval vessels) / several to several dozen aircraft (aircraft)
Game scope: The waters around Taiwan and the entire East China Sea
Scenarios: 3 introductory scenarios, 1 standard scenario

Play time: 1-3 hours (depending on scenario)
Number of players: 2 players
Difficulty (5 levels, 5 being the highest): 2 - 3

—user summary (translated and adapted from publisher's Japanese description)


Issue game of Game Journal #81.

name: Rentnerjagd: Basisspiel
description:
As a special task force of extreme geriatric nurses, you face an army of cyborg retirees who have gotten out of control due to advanced dementia.

The basic version of the game is full of retirees and tricky adventures that you have to endure as a team.

Every mission begins with a briefing. In it you will be called to post offices, restaurants or supermarkets, where defenseless civilians were overrun and surrounded by pensioners. After you have equipped your team for the mission, you move out to confront the marauding Kalkhirns and instruct them in high-security shelters. But be careful! The retirees of the future have supernatural powers and can cause enormous damage with their teeth. You will only survive the mission if you succeed in combining the skills of all team members sensibly and adapting your strategy to changing challenges.

Every round each hero draws a new retiree card. By combining their capability cards and their special abilities the heroes try to overcome the face up retirees. Afterwards the undefeated retirees strike back and try to cause damage to the heroes.

Rentner Jagd is a cooperative strategy game. In turn-based battles you compete against the game as a team of 1-4 players. Random elements in the game setup and during the game always present you with new challenges, even if you play the same missions multiple times.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Battle Dice
description:
Battle Dice is a table top fantasy game that combines strategy and chance. Two or more players compete in a series of choosing and rolling dice, to eliminate opponents while maintaining their own survival. The last player left standing wins! This fast paced, easy to learn game was designed and produced by Aaron Gordon.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Player Elimination

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 1
description: Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine continues the tradition of hard-hitting stories set in the war-torn interstellar future of the 31st century and beyond. Fire up your 'Mech's fusion reactor, secure your neurohelmet, and wade into battle with stories from the merciless front lines of the Clan Invasion and other eras, conspiracy theory articles, game scenarios, and more from veteran BattleTech authors, fan favorites, and some new recruits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The Whiskey Game
description:
A board game to match your favorite tipple.

Work your way around the board by answering History cards, Mixology cards and Connoisseur cards, collecting different whisky varieties to win

Fill your Whiskey board with a full set of whiskies from around the work (1 Wheat, 1 Scotch, 1 Irish, 1 Bourbon, 1 Japanese, 1 Rye)

Travel to the game board center to win

name: Circuitry
description:
Build the circuit board with the help of 30 double-sided cards. Move strategically your pawn from a CHARGE POINT to the MASTER NODE and collect and play the charge cards. You can change the circuit board's pathways, or force your opponents to move when they don’t want to. The goal: build and negotiate the pathways to reach your charge point, before returning to the master node and eliminate other players.

How to Play:
Take circuit-board card #1 and put it with the numbered side face-up between all the players. Each player chooses a coloured pawn and places it on the matching coloured NODE of card #1.

The CHARGE POINT circuit-board cards (#2-#7): each have a different coloured charge point.
Each player takes the CHARGE POINT card that corresponds to their pawn's colour and the rest of the CHARGE POINT cards are now put away and no longer used.
The remaining circuit-board cards (#8 - #30) are shuffled and each player is dealt an additional 3 so each player now has 4 circuit-board cards in hand (which includes their CHARGE POINT card). The rest is put away.

The gold-back mini cards (movement and certain action cards) are shuffled and placed in their own deck (face down). The green action mini cards are separated into their own corresponding piles (6 of them) and placed face up.

Turns:
Each turn a player selects 2 mini cards of any combination that they wish to take.
A player can have as many mini cards in hand as they wish, and may play any amount of mini cards in any order during their turn

Each turn a player may also play (but does not have to) a single circuit-board card at any point in their turn, any way up and in any orientation, as long as it connects to a corresponding edge of another card (i.e. longest edge to longest edge, etc - you get the gist).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cross
description:
The goal of the players is to lay a continuous path from their own corner to the opposite corner on a square game board. To do this, they draw face-down tiles with single-lane and double-lane paths and lay out up to 3 tiles per turn.
The winner is determined by scoring over a previously agreed number of games.

—user summary

name: Viceroy: Times of Darkness Promo Cards
description:
A pack of 10 cards for the 3 modules of the Viceroy: Tides of Darkness Expansion.

There are cards for each of the modules.

Aristocrats Module - 1 Law card
Life Peerage: At end of the game: Copy the lower-section reward of any Aristocrats character in an opponent's pyramid.

Invasion Module - 6 Monsters, 1 Law card

2 Tier I Monsters: Dragon Kin, Quetzalcoatl
2 Tier II Monsters: Crystal Golem, Hellrider
2 Tier III Monsters: Djinn, Ogre


Military Exercise: Each player may immediately combat current monsters. Player's don't get penalty cards in this combat. Don't discard monsters after this combat.

Underworld Module - 1 Law Card
Indulgence: At end of the game: Discard any number of your Bribe Tokens by paying 3 Gemstones for each.

There is also one Character card that can be used with all three modules.
Mistress: 2 Power Points for each token on your combat card.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Director Tecnico Pasion total!
description:
The game takes place on a tabletop that represents a soccer stadium. The role of each participant is that of Soccer Technical Director and owner of a soccer team. The strategy is applied to the technical direction of the team and a good administration of the franchise to win as many encounters as possible. The more games you win, the more wealth you will be able to generate for your team.

Each season, your team obtains income that will allow you to have sufficient resources to achieve the purchase of the biggest stadium and the players that score the most goals and earn the most profits. Good administration is key because you have to cover the costs and fines to which your Team may be credited. If you run out of resources, you will be disqualified from the tournament.

The challenge is to achieve an optimal balance between sports and administrative decisions to meet the objective of the game and show your opponents that you are the best Soccer Technical Director!



JUEGO DE FUTBOL ESTRATÉGICO Director Técnico DTEl juego se desarrolla en un tablero de mesa que representa un Estadio de FUTBOL. El rol de cada participante es el de DIRECTOR TÉCNICO DT y Dueño de un Equipo de FUTBOL. La estrategia se aplica a la dirección técnica del Equipo y a una buena administración de la franquicia para ganar la mayor cantidad posible de Encuentros. Mientras más partidos ganes, lograrás generar mayor riqueza económica para tu Equipo.

En cada Temporada, tu Equipo obtiene ingresos por diferentes conceptos que te permitirán contar con recursos suficientes para lograr la compra del Estadio de mayor capacidad de espectadores y al Equipo que cuenta con los jugadores que te darán mayor puntuación por cada gol anotado y, a su vez, mayores ganancias. Una buena administración es clave porque deberás cubrir los costos que representan las multas a las que pueda hacerse acreedor tu Equipo, ya que si te quedas sin recursos, serás descalificado del torneo.

El reto está en lograr un balance óptimo entre las decisiones deportivas y las administrativas para cumplir con el objetivo del juego y demostrar a tus contrincantes, ¡que tú eres el mejor Director Técnico del Fútbol. Poner en práctica tus habilidades estratégicas COMO DIRECTOR TÉCNICO DT para ganar la mayor cantidad de Encuentros, generando riqueza económica para comprar la franquicia DEL MUNDO y el Estadio DE LAS ESTRELLAS. Los dos activos más cotizados y rentables del kit de DIRECTOR TÉCNICO DT.

name: Bloody Retribution: The Battle of Inkerman
description:
Bloody Retribution: The Battle of Inkerman is a two-player Grand-Tactical level board-wargame of the largest Russian offensive of the Crimean War. Even so, both players have the necessity of both attacking and defending. It uses the alternating-actions system introduced in Paper Wars issue no. 93 Wagram and issue no. 98 Alma games.

The emphasis is on players’ mastery of overall operations rather than the minutiae of tactics. In effect, they role-play the supreme commanders, not the whole chain of command as is common in most complex tactical-level games. It’s a mechanically simpler approach that is at the same time more realistic, given the fact no individual in such situations would have the timely knowledge needed to make detailed decisions.

The battle was personally ordered by the Czar as a final attempt to break the Allied siege lines along Sevastopol’s southern perimeter. The British were initially caught by surprise along the steep slopes of Mount Inkerman. Both sides threw in everything they had available, hoping for a decisive victory. That made for a fierce day of back and forth combat characterized by soldier-level heroism and high-command incompetence. In the end the Russians retreated, but it was a near-run thing that could’ve gone either way.

Each hexagon on the map represents 200 yards (183 meters) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver are brigades, regiments and battalions. Each full turn represents one or two hours of real time. The first two turns were dominated by dense fog across the whole battlefield; therefore they each represent two hours to take into the account the inescapably slower tempo of operations under such conditions. Artillery is represented abstractly via bombardment markers. There is one full sheet of 228 medium-size (5/8”) iconic counters. Playing time is about three hours, and complexity is low-intermediate.

Published in Paper Wars issue 100

—description from the publisher

name: Achtung, frecher Frosch!
description: Players hop their frog by dice roll across a pond of leaves to a field of water lilies to catch a fly and bring it to the finish line. On the way back, a frog may lose its fly to another frog. The first to reach his target field with a fly wins the game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nordens ark Familje-Qiuz
description: In the Nordens Ark Familje-Quiz, everyone, regardless of age, can test their knowledge of animals, nature and the environment. The game includes children's questions for the youngest, junior questions from 8 years and senior questions from 15 years and up. The game is quick and easy. Roll the dice to decide your question. If you answer correctly, you can take an animal badge out of the "secret bag". If the animal on the badge is the same as on the question card, you may take another badge. Who, with the help of knowledge and a little luck, first manages to gather three identical animal badges to win?

name: Family Telly Addicts
description:
Based on the popular BBC TV show of the 80's and 90's, be the first player to get all four of your Star Tokens around the board and back to your remote control.

Along the way, answer questions to double your move, or take on the "Hoofer Doofer". Hoofer Doofer squares involve your opponents guessing a TV prgogramme via either an impression, charade or hummed theme tune.

Some tactics take place with up to two of your tokens on the board at any one time, as you have to decide whether to play it safe or risk gifting an opponent an extra move.

name: Sichere Six
description:
Sichere Six is the second entry in the "Nein Nine" series of trick-taking card games, and it introduces Fate's Mercy and Mirth. Players have the opportunity to stick their opponents with the painful penalty cards. If they feel brave, they can try to collect all of the penalty cards and bring down their opponents' scores even more. Sichere Six begins as a free-for-all. As the game progresses, temporary partnerships will form, backstabbery will ensue, and only one will escape Fate's game with the victory.

Over the course of no more than nine rounds, players will be trying to collect as many tricks as possible while avoiding dirty tricks that contain 9's.

During each round, the player who first collects a 9 becomes The Chosen and is granted Fate's Mercy. They get to exchange one card with the kitty. If they are feeling brave enough, they can try to collect all of the 9's and trigger the special scoring known as Fate's Mirth.

The first player to earn 9 points wins the game. If the game does reach the final round, the player with the highest score wins.

name: Roll & Colour: Hearts
description:
Roll & Colour: Hearts is a two-player game, played on an A5 greeting card. Imagine giving a card that is also a ten-minute game! On the front of the card is a picture, while on the back the rules are laid out neatly.

The aim of the game is to color in the hearts in different colors. One player takes the inside of the hearts, while the other takes the outside. You score points for hearts that are not next to, i.e. that don't fall into the same row and column as, a heart of the same color. To play, lay the card flat on the table. Label the columns 1-3 and the rows 4-6. Next, choose a different color for each roll of the die, so 1 might be red, 2 might be orange, and so on.

On a turn, you roll three dice, then allocate one of the results to a column, one to a row, and one to a color, then fill in a blank heart in that column and row using that color. So if you roll 3, 4, 6, then you could fill a heart in column 3 and row 4 with color 6, or you could fill a heart in column 3 and row 6 with color 4. The game ends when all hearts are colored, and whoever has the most points wins.

name: BONC!
description:
BONC! is The Battle Royale Of Card Games, it is a fun, intense, and strategic card game for kids and adults alike.

All players start with 5 lives each. Take turns playing one card face-up on the discard pile.

Try to BONC! the player right before you by matching the number of the card they played.
Or get fancy & use wild cards for special attacks, protection, & healing.

If you lose all your lives, you’re out of the game. The last one standing wins!

—description from the designer

name: Ruthless Conquest
description:
This is a strategic war game that uses real-world effects to make for a realistic experience. In this game, the players could build businesses, collect taxes and use this money to build an army to conquer the world. Here, any alliances formed for battle can be broken and trust can end up being limited. The costs and taxes can change with business cycles and trades between players are allowed.

At the start, each player starts off with two countries. The game will be conducted in rounds. Each round a player can choose to do an action with their cards, trade or even start wars with their resources. The player that gets a clear majority (more than half) of the countries under their control wins.
mechanics: Alliances, Investment, Map Addition, Traitor Game

name: Nine Worlds: Creatures and Monsters
description:
The battles for control of the Nine Worlds become more dangerous as monsters that haunt the darkest of our legends are unleashed. No longer can the gods and leaders of the realms merely focus on domination of the worlds. They must join forces to defeat these horrors or else suffer losses and destruction at their hands. For those who find the courage and resourcefulness to take on these enemies, honour and rewards beckon, some of which may help tip the balance in the wars between the worlds.

The Nine Worlds: Creatures and Monsters expansion introduces a new dimension where players divert some of their player stones to the fight against the monsters.

Defeat of the monsters will yield rewards. Failure to tackle the monsters means that various players will suffer penalties with the least courageous, who have done the least to fight the monsters, treated harshly by the norns who govern the fates of all.
The key to this expansion is balancing the division of the action points between actions in the Nine Worlds and engaging the monsters.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: Chapter 4: The Moonlight Escapade
description:
Chapter IV sees you infiltrating a small desert camp to locate and decipher a secret message left for you.

You must figure out your next steps by examining the items left in the camp, deconstructing them and reforming them into new tools.

---

Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Blood Bowl: (Second Season Edition) – Glorious Gifts Promo Card
description:
Promo card found in Issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

"Every year, gifts are exchanged at the end of the season. Will our players get what they wished for this year? Or will it be more patterned socks and spare underwear!"

TIMING

Play this card during the pre-game sequence, after step 5 but before step 6.

DURATION

This card expires at the end of this game.

EFFECT

When you play this card, select a player on your team, roll a D6 and apply the corresponding effect until this card expires:

On a 1, the selected player has opened a brand new pair of socks Woo. This card has no additional effect.
On a 2-3, the selected player gains a Primary Skill of your choice.
On a 4-5, the selected player gains a Primary Skill, Secondary Skill or a Trait of your choice.
On a 6, the selected player may improve their MA, ST, AG or PA by 1.

name: Vrahode: The Calteeryn Ascension
description:
Vrahode - The Calteeryn Acension is an adventure/dungeon crawl board game, the second in a series of five games, designed by Jeffrey Irving. Following the initial game Age of Prophecy (2024) this massive "core box" is a solo/co-op game for 1-6 players where players can choose to journey through huge multi-quest campaign that sprawls over the heights and depths of the mysterious world of Vrahode or choose one of five other modes of play as well as four difficulty levels!

The core box campaign victory condition: "Calteeryn" (the chosen one) must learn the ruhl (magic) of each crafted race in the game while facing mounting threats. This is done by journeying through the eight unique biomes of the Overlands, Underlands, and Oceans of the world of Vrahode.

Dice-based combat is enhanced by powerful skill deck building and racial abilities unique to each race. Every enemy encounter is different, with the enemy behavior deck threatening to change how the heroes must fight them each battle!

The world of Vrahode is based on a narrative first imagined in 1990 by designer Jeffrey Irving. The Vrahode series of games includes a introductory game Vrahode - Age of Prophecy and three additional expansions: The Enlightened & The Enslaved, Facing The Storm, and The False Gods' Deceit. All are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content, adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode! This game is compatible with our proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger, players can create dynamic, multi-level dungeons up to five levels deep.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Minimap Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Fickle: Decree Rules Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Decree Cards add an option rule to make each game of Fickle even more unique. During the set up of your next game, choose a Decree Card and follow the new rule(s). Each Decree adds a new twist that makes your game more challenging.

Each Decree Card uses the same icons to signal how the rule changes Set Up, Direct Action or Scoring for the entire game. Where the rule book conflicts with a Decree Card, follow the Decree Card instead.

Includes 3 double sided cards:
Rules Card / Family Feud
Alpha Player / Top 10
Hidden Ally / Race to the Bottom

name: Star Realms: Merc Captain Garcia Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack B from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Cost: 3
Damage: 5
Text: Choose a faction. You count as having an additional card of that faction in play this turn.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Dothraki Screamers
description:
The warrior ways of the Dothraki might make them appear as simple barbarian savages, screaming into the sky as they charge into battle. And many commanders have underestimated them because of those stereotypes. A Dothraki will spend more time on their horse than they will off of it, and with that experience comes skill that regular training will never achieve. Despite being unarmored, it is still difficult for a trained swordsman to land a significant hit on a mounted Dothraki.

The Dothraki Screamers unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Targaryen commanders a solid cavalry unit for their forces. These fearsome fighters can charge quickly into battle, dealing out deadly blows. Skilled commanders will use them as a lightning-fast strike force, avoiding getting them into protracted combats, lest their fewer numbers start to catch up with them.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Fairy Tale Inn: Pixie Promo
description:
Originally available as part of Pack B from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Add her card to the selection of character cards to play during setup.

Includes: 1 Character Card, 1 rules card, and 1 unpunched token sheet

name: Unlocked
description:
You might keep secrets but
Your phone knows the truth.

By the end of the night, we’ll all be better friends after sharing things we never thought we would…like Netflix passwords.

Drink up, it’s time to unlock the dirty truth.

In Unlocked players take turns pulling cards and either asking questions or proposing dares to the group. Each round there will be one winner declared who will receive the card as a point. At the end of play, the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Adeptus Custodes
description:
The Adeptus Custodes are demigods of war, sworn to defend the Emperor to their last breath. In this dark and dangerous age, that mission compels them away from Holy Terra and out into the stars, for no longer can they stand upon the ramparts of the Imperial Palace and watch the galaxy burn. They are the most elite warriors in the Imperium, clad in auramite armour and wielding some of the finest weapons ever created by Mankind. Whether teleporting into the heart of battle, storming to war aboard ancient Land Raiders or streaking through the skies astride Dawneagle jetbikes, the Custodians are death incarnate to their enemies. Alongside them fight the Sisters of Silence, a secretive order of psychic blanks to whom falls the task of protecting the Imperium from rogue psykers and sorcerers. Together, they are the Talons of the Emperor, and where they take to the field no foe of the Emperor can stop them.

This mighty tome contains pages of background and rules dedicated to the Emperor's most elite guardians – the Adeptus Custodes. Discover the history and hierarchy of the Talons of the Emperor, and the legendary heroes that have stood by the Emperor's side for over 10,000 years, as well as the myriad ways they wage war in Terra's name.

Inside the 104-page hardback book, you'll find:

In-depth background and lore on the Adeptus Custodes and the Sisters of Silence, who make up the Talons of the Emperor, plus information about War Zone: Terra, where the Custodes battle insidious threats
Exquisite art that exemplifies the deific nature of these unparalleled warriors
All the rules you need to play your Adeptus Custodes army, including 20 datasheets covering every unit from the brand new Blade Champion to the Custodian Guard and Prosecutors
A full suite of rules for playing Crusade and narrative games, including Agendas, Battle Traits, Requisitions, Crusade Relics, plus Battle Scars, and Artefacts of the Vault Relics unique to the Adeptus Custodes
An 'Eavy Metal miniatures showcase including variant Adeptus Custodes colour schemes


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: SINS: Collector
description:
SINS is a fast past, highly competitive deck-destructor with a push-your-luck mechanism. It is built from the core to be an aggressive game of powers and weaknesses. Attacking and defending will cost you profoundly and exhaust your hand. Therefore, be careful not to be too aggressive or too defensive, as you might lose your advantage. Pick your battles, save your strength, take the hit and fight back when your opponent is exhausted.

The game is for 2-6 players. and a big box in which you can fit up to 6 sleeved decks.

SINS Collectors Box includes three Battle Packs: Rise of Wrath, Gloom of Greed, Ooze of Gluttony.
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Soldier Kings: Pragmatic Sanction – Europe at War, 1740-1748
description:
In October 1740, Holy Roman Emperor Charles VI ate a poisonous mushroom and died, leaving no sons. Over the weeks that followed, one European power after another reneged on their promises to support his daughter Maria Theresa’s inheritance of the “crown lands” of Austria, Bohemia and Hungary. In December the newly-crowned King Frederick II invaded Austrian territory without the courtesy of a declaration of war.

Maria Theresa’s ministers counseled compromise. Her husband urged Maria Theresa to placate Frederick with gifts of territory. The 23-year old Archduchess refused. “I found myself,” she wrote later, “without money, without credit, without an army, without experience and knowledge of my own and finally, also without any counsel because each one of them wanted to wait and see how things would develop.”

The War of the Austrian Succession would last for eight years and eventually involve almost all of Europe. The resolve of Maria Theresa and the fierce loyalty of her soldiers assured that Austria would not perish.

Pragmatic Sanction is a complete game for two to eight players, based on the events of the War of the Austrian Succession. Players represent the crowned heads of the great powers of Europe: Austria, Prussia, Russia, Sweden, Britain, France, Spain and the Ottoman Empire. It uses the same game engine as our Soldier Kings game, and is very similar to Soldier Emperor.

—description from the publisher

name: Munchkin Babies
description: Munchkin Babies delivers 168 cards full of sweet, adorable baby adventurers . . . who are just as good at backstabbing and loot-grabbing as their elders from Munchkin. Play a cute Orcling, Dwarfling, Elfling, or Quarterling (half a Halfling). Go to preschool to learn your Class: Wiz Kid, Ankle Biter, Crumb Snatcher, or Holy Terror, and then arm yourself with the scariest items from the toy box: the Kazoo of Constant Whining, Kid-Safe Stabbinator, Blame-Resistant Pajamas, and of course, the Extremely Pokey Spoon. You must fight fearsome monsters such as the Jealous Kitty, the Hootin' Nanny, the Napmare, and, worst of all, the Pediatrician! Grab their treasure and crawl your way to Level 10!
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Hobby World, Pegasus Spiele, Steve Jackson Games

name: メガチェン-Clear- (Megachen -Clear-)
description:
メガチェン-Clear- (Megachen -Clear-) is an expansion pack for メガチェン (Megachen). The deck has transparent plastic cards with the glasses, so you can overlay them onto the customer cards.
user summary

name: Shiryū de la Balance promo card
description:
A card to add to Saint-Seiya The Deckbuilding Game.

Détruire : Un Héros en jeu gagne +1 Force et +1 Cosmos
Destroy: A Hero in play gains +1 Strength and +1 Cosmos

Vaincu : Blesser tous les Personnages utilisés pour le vaincre, puis piocher autant de cartes que de Personnages ainsi blessés

Defeated: Injure all the Characters used to defeat him, then draw as many cards as Characters thus injured
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Coin Set
description:
Coin Set is a game in which you and a group of friends compete to find patterns and sets in a selection of coins, plucked at random from a bag. Each coin has a number of different characteristics. Your task is to locate sets of three coins where each of these characteristics is either all different, or all the same. And you have to do it quickly – because everyone’s competing at the same time and waiting for the opportunity to spot patterns, shout “Set!” and claim the coins for themselves.

The game is played exactly like Set, but the rules simply state the winner is the person who manages to find the most sets during the course of the game. The game ends when the bag is empty and no more sets can be found.".

It’s trickier than it might seem, because every one of every coin’s four defining characteristics needs to be considered. As a result, Coin Set is a test of your observation and thoroughness as well as how quick-witted you are. If you think you’ve found a set, but have failed to consider one of the characteristics, you’ll lose three of the coins you’ve collected so far. So you need to pay real attention to detail, thinking fast but not being too hasty. One thing is for sure: keeping a cool head will help you find order in the chaos.

Legend has it that these coins were found at the bottom of the Med by none other than Jacques Cousteau. But whatever the backstory, Coin Set is a quick and quirky brain-teaser, a fast-paced and intermittently frenetic way to test your attention to detail and your ability to see a slightly bigger, more complex picture than one coin alone can show you. Plus: it’s small enough to fit in your pocket, and encased in a robust little tin that’ll keep it safe wherever you might take it.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Set Collection, Speed Matching

name: Mars Rover Rescue
description:
In the Mars Rover Rescue Memory Card Game, players assemble a combination of cards including a ship, base, truck, and explorer crew to be the first to find the lost rover.

It's quick and easy to play even for young children, taking around 15 minutes. It’s a stand-alone companion to the Mars Rover Rescue book.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Spacematch
description:
SpaceMatch is a fun, quick, and easy to learn solar system card game. You explore, trade, and steal cards from other players to assemble as many planet-moon sets as possible (e.g., Jupiter-Io-Europa-Ganymede-Callisto).

SpaceMatch is full of educational facts, but it's easy for kids (around 6+) to play while learning about the planets, moons, and asteroids of our solar system. Though designed with kids in mind, the game includes enough strategy to be fun for adults - making it perfect for classrooms and family game nights.

—description from the publisher

name: Code Kakuro
description:
Each player receives 2 score counters of one color and places them on the game board. Place the hourglass next to the game board. Choose any kakuro and place it in the magic board. The rules of the game: Each player now has 1 minute, clockwise, to place numbers on the board. The time is measured by the hourglass. Players receive points as follows:

1 point for each correct number
3 points for each number that completes a group


Example: If a player places 2 numbers correctly on the board and another number that completes a group, he receives 5 points for it (2 points for the 2 numbers and 3 points for the number that completed the group).

The bonus points are awarded only if the player can complete a full group within his minute (there are no bonus points for completing a group already partially placed by other players).

If a player places a number incorrectly, his turn ends immediately. In addition, the wrong number is removed from the board again. The player who notices a wrongly placed number receives the number of points for a correctly placed number. The game ends when the Kakuro is completely solved. The player with the highest score wins the game.

_________________

One year earlier in 2005 JUMBO started the mini-series of 'Japanese Cult Riddle Games' with Code Sudoku.

name: Città-Stato: Expansion
description: The Expansion introduces two new Cities (Gaeta and Noli), 15 new powerful cards, and the fifth player's contents. This allows the players to add variability to their games and to play also in 5 players.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Political
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: In the Stars
description:
In the Stars is a 1 to 6 player roll and draw constellation game. In the game, players will create two constellations (three in a solo game). In the turn, the active player will choose a blue die and roll it with the rest of the non-blue dice. Then, the active player chooses three dice to draw and creates a constellation. Other players will choose a type from the rest of the three other dice to draw and create their own constellation.

When a player completes their constellations, the game will end when the last player finishes their final turn. Players score points based on the constellations created, the number of alien visits, and wormholes discovered. The player with the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Connections, Die Icon Resolution, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Guardians: Dagger Isle (Western Expansion)
description:
Expansion for Guardians (FPG): 123 new cards.
Adds new creatures, spells, items, shields and terrains to the game.
Also adds the Freebooter's Stronghold with 3 upgrades cards and 2 new Vierkuns, Grahzue and P'Tal.

name: Guardians: Drifter's Nexus (Even More Western Expansion)
description:
Expansion for Guardians (FPG).
Adds new creatures, spells, items, shields and terrains to the game.
Also adds the Drifter's Nexus Stronghold with 3 upgrades and 2 downgrade cards and 2 new Vierkuns, Sikura and Vek-Nadra.

name: Aux Armes!
description:
A set of 9mm Napoleonic miniatures rules published in issue #61 of Panzerfaust magazine.

It was meant for fairly compact battles, with 4-5 figures for a battalion with a 1.5"x0.5" stand, and decent battles playable in a three foot square area.

This was the basis for the later Grand Army rules published in 1975.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Calabozo: Una nueva aventura
description:
The four legendary dragons have been stripped of their sacred gems and require the help of intrepid adventurers who are experts in combat, each dragon will qualify the most suitable to fulfil the mission and as help, they will receive a legendary weapon, not counting the magical elements that can obtain during your adventure.

You must rescue six sacred gems and return them to the dragon that recruited them before the other adventurers

You move around the grid rolling the normal dice, you must defeat the wolves along the way, and keep moving until you find an enemy creature, the combat is done with custom attack dice and a damage track.
If you defeat the creature, you get one of the sacred gems.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – T'au
description:
The T’au are a young and dynamic race of technologically advanced aliens whose empire is spreading like wildfire across the stars. Ruled and guided by the enigmatic Ethereals, the T’au seek to unite every sentient being under the light of the T’au’va, or Greater Good. They prefer that others join this growing alliance willingly, but do not hesitate to use force to fulfil their destiny wherever they must. At the forefront of this fight are the Hunter Cadres of the Fire Caste. Comprising highly mobile and well-armed soldiery, led and supported by veteran warriors piloting deadly battlesuits, gunships and strike fighters, these armies sweep all before them in a blizzard of devastating firepower. Signature battle strategies such as the decisive Mont’ka or the cunning ambush of the Kauyon see the enemy outmanoeuvred at every turn, while their potent blend of technological might and ideological fanaticism ensure the T’au achieve victory after victory.

This 136-page book comprehensively covers the T'au Empire. It has everything you need to bring the technological might of the T'au to bear on the tabletop in order to expand the empire, plus a selection of lore and art to inspire your own collection.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Nachmund – Vigilus Alone
description:
The worlds of the Vigilus System have echoed to the clamour of cataclysmic war for decades, assailed not only by xenos, but also the armies of Abaddon the Despoiler. A fragile survival was bought at terrible cost – now Vigilus itself must stand or fall without its most heroic saviour.

The planet is besieged, its neighbouring systems imperilled with the Great Rift closing in. If it cannot stand, then this beleaguered bastion world and all its defenders will be damned for eternity.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Octarius – Book 1 – Rising Tide
description:
In the Octarius Sector, the Imperium's worst fears have been realised. For years, the Tyranids of Hive Fleet Leviathan have been locked in a war of attrition with the Orks. Now, the conflict has spilt out into surrounding space, and the xenos forces descend on Imperial planets, hungry for battle and biomatter.

The combined forces of the Deathwatch, numerous Space Marine Chapters, and the legions of the Adeptus Mechanicus rush to stem the tide of destruction that threatens to engulf the Pankallis Sub-sector in war. Not all hope is lost: Inquisitor Athocles Van Roth is brewing a plan – a high stakes endeavour that may result in the total defeat of the Tyranid forces. The Imperium must be ready to do whatever it takes to stop the Octarius Sector from falling to ruin.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this supplement.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Octarius – Book 2 – Critical Mass
description:
Hive Fleet Leviathan bears down on the Octarius sector's heart, while the critical forge world of Sigma-Ulstari fights for its life against repeated xenos invasions. As battles become desperate and the fate of billions hangs in the balance, forces on all sides marshal their deadliest weapons in preparation for the Octarian War's apocalyptic conclusion.

From the ashes of Octarius a victor will emerge, tempered in the bloodiest conflict seen in millennia, but who will it be? The Tyranids pit their finest strategic mind, the Swarmlord, against the uncompromising brutality of the Overfiend of Octarius, all while Imperial systems battle to contain the overflowing carnage.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this book.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Skilled: Das Bike Spiel
description:
A game to experience the world of cycling and to explore the cycling world of Austria.
A combination of tactics and concentration as well as muscle power provides the necessary variety to win the game and to become the best biker who feels just as comfortable on trails as on racing bike courses.

The aim of the game is to “cycle” 500 points on the points table.
The biker (player) who does this first is declared the winner.
The last biker to reach the finish invites the winner to a bike ride. :-)
The points can be collected on the bike routes on the game board in the individual bike regions of austria, when passing the starting fields and through clever tactics with the playing cards.

name: White Elephant: A Gift Exchange
description:
White Elephant is a negotiation game featuring a gift economy system. In White Elephant, you pass gifts around and collect the most items you can. Be the one who scores the most items in your group of friends.

The deck of gifts contains an assortment of cards with one, two, or three gifts, among six different types. The game starts by randomly determining play order by shuffling and dealing out the player aid cards, which have the numbers one through six on the back. The play order stays the same throughout play. Players create two score sheets, one for each of the left and right hand neighbors at the table. At the end of the game, each player will receive points for the number of gifts shown on the cards they collect for each of the scoring categories on the score sheet. Before play, decide whether the play will be "generous" or "greedy."

Beginning with the first player and proceeding in order, turn gifts face-up from the top of the draw pile until there are six or more gift icons showing. Choose who will get which cards. In "generous" mode, you must give away all but one card (but may give away all of them). In "greedy" mode, you must give away at least one card (but may give away as many more as you like, up to all of them). Players negotiate and make suggestions about who should get which cards, but ultimately, the current player decides. You cannot refuse a gift.

At the end of the round, count up the number of each kind of icon, and score points for each according to how your neighbors filled out the two score sheets they passed to you, except that you don't score any points for the type of icon you collected the most.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Memory, Negotiation, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Bias, Closed Economy Auction, Commodity Speculation, Hidden Victory Points, Induction, Memory, Negotiation, Set Collection, Take That, Turn Order: Random

name: En la Punta de la Lengua!: Versión Jóvenes
description:
A game where laughter and creativity come from the tip of your tongue.

Teams are assembled and the game begins. When it is your turn, you have to give clues so that your classmates guess the secret word (the one that is underlined), but without saying any of the words that appear on the card (or their family of words). WATCH OUT! That the opposing team will be monitoring you.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Rex
description:
The new battling dinosaur bidding game everyone wants to try. As you enter the jungle battle for points with some of the dinosaurs on your side, the struggle will get exciting. When the Royal Juraissteers, King Rex, Prince Don, & Duke Rus get involved, you had better hope that they are also on your team.

The game is played with a deck of 48 cards, containing 3 suits (Rex is red, Don is green, Rus is purple). Each suit consists of 16 cards numbering from 1 to 13 with an addition of 3 royal cards in each suit. The game can be played with 2 to 6 players.

Cards are dealt, player left of dealer is first player and plays a card. All players must follow suit, if they can. If not, they play another. After the dealing of cards, each player is required to bid the number of points they expect to make. If the points made are equal to or greater than their bid, the amount of the bid id added to the score. If the player fails to make their bid, then the bid is deducted from their score.

The first player to reach 500 points wins.

name: Piesku, szukaj domu
description:
Educational game for children. It shows the fate of homeless dogs, both those living on the street and those that ended up in animal shelters.
A dog running in the streets may be caught by the guards. By throwing the dice, we check if he has a chip with an address. If he has, he goes to the owner. If not, he ends up in a shelter. A homeless dog can also run into a car, and then goes to the vet for treatment. If he has a chip, it returns to the owner, if not, he goes to the shelter. The dice rolls decide about the events. Someone can come to the shelter to get the dog. A dog from a shelter can also appear on television and attract attention so that someone adopts he.
The winner is the player whose first four dogs (pawns) find a home.

The game is co-financed by the "Program for the care of homeless animals and prevention of animal homelessness in the capital city of Warsaw" prepared by the Environmental Protection Office of the Warsaw City Hall.

name: Magicon
description:
A family card game which leads to story creation, supporting logical thinking and improving perceptual abilities.

You play saviors of the mysterious realm Magicon, which suffers the invasions of the dark forces. Your party travels to the outskirts of Magicon, but only one of you will succeed. Which one of you is the chosen one who will make the journey to the Wizardon? Who is the one who becomes the savior of the eternal light, entrusts them to the hands of the Great Mage and ignites the hope for the whole Magicon?

A strategy game for 2-6 players. The goal of each round of the game is to get rid of all the cards. You place your cards one by one so that the color markings expressing the journey through the land of Magicon. The score depends on the last card dealt. The more northern the region, the more points. It doesn't matter whether the player finished sooner or later.

The game is played on multiple rounds. Every time the game is finished, players mark their points on the scoring board with a playing figure of the chosen color. Whoever reach 10 points on the scoring boar, wins.

name: Conductor: Stories from the Underground Railroad
description:
In this solitaire roll-and-write game, you’ll become a conductor on the Underground Railroad, shepherding a party of self-emancipated fugitive slaves on a flight to freedom.

Designer's note: These rules apply to the standard form of the game. The system is designed to support scenarios representing individual slave narratives. Each may modify these basic rules. Played together, they offer a survey of this important literary genre, and the personal histories it sought to depict.

A game about fugitive slavery is not to be taken lightly. My intention has been to represent something of the experience of slave narratives in ludic form. I have approached my subject not as a trivial pursuit, but as an effort to explore how games may represent the most serious parts of our past. In this spirit, I invite you to play and share your thoughts.

—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Educational, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: SHASN: Game board for 2-3 players
description:
A 2 player version of the original game.

SHASN is a political strategy board game where every player takes on the role of a politician in the midst of a political campaign. With each turn, players must draw an Ideology Card and take stands on divisive and urgent political issues. These choices will help them gather resources to influence voters or purchase strategic powers. Players can build diverse Ideologies with every policy decision, to best reflect their beliefs and play style. As they progress in the game, players must choose between sticking to their ideals or molding them as per their needs. In a game of trading, coercion, and strategy, players must do whatever it takes to survive and dominate.

name: Dungeonrunner: Muckelf Swamp
description:
The goblin bandits and the muckelves who dwell in the swamp are constantly fighting. Just passing through, you are caught in the middle. Neither side cares.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: Tower of Saxon
description:
The Tower of Saxon has been left alone for ages. Some think it was taken over by dark machinations, others think it is cursed. They are both right.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: Mountains of Zokar
description:
The inhospitable mountains are patrolled by numerous actions. Armies cannot make their way though without a fight...but perhaps a lone wolf could.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: Caverns of Grot
description:
Grot's tunnels curve and confuse as creatures lurk and linger. Some attack out of instinct, but others seem to be aware of you. Grot's Ogre-Magi knows you are coming.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: Roads of Tonar
description:
The Roads of Tonar connect all the cities and villages in the land. If you have a destination in mind, the Road of Tonar will take you there. Don't expect to be alone.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Herewith the Clues
description:
Crime Dossier 4 of a 4 book set that was an early progenitor of the modern mystery suspect / cold case tabletop games.

The story of the crime is laid out in dossier form, with cablegrams, handwritten documents, photographs, pieces of evidence (including hair), and is presented to enable the reader to take the place of the investigating detective and solve the crime.

name: Wicked Apples: Grim
description: The Wicked Apples: Grim expansion adds 4 new apples (Telekinetic Apple, Apthulu Apple, Shadow Apple, and Cursed Apple) which can be swapped with apples from the original deck to change up the game.

name: Catch the Wave
description:
It had to end eventually! Humanity has finally become extinct. Just the Tanuki survived.

These legendary Japanese creates have all the random leftover stuff from people in the bin and have only picked up a few memorabilia. The hottest boards in the world! They surf as much as possible. Infinite space, free beaches and the big surf battle every weekend, when the waves hit first and then glow. Everyone catches a huge wave here. Which brings us to the topic. This game is like life. In the end, the one who gets their shit together wins. Get as many cards as possible in the correct sequence resulting in the longest wave — and on it the winner surfs away.

—description from the rulebook

Each turn, players draw a card with a value from one to twenty from the central pile of cards. Then, they add it their own row of cards. The goal is to arrange your cards in ascending order, but after you've placed a card in your row, it is turned face-down, and you'll need to remember where you put each card.

The game ends when the pile of cards runs out. The player that has created the longest sequence of ascending cards wins the game.

—user summary

name: Honey
description:
Honey is a game of bag building we hope will get you buzzing! Players work simultaneously on their own player sheets using roles dice results to fill in abilities as well as gain knowledge about flowers.

Beekeepers set up gardens to produce certain blends of Honey and now you will too! Knowing your flowers, then getting the bees to produce the most expensive jars will be among your tasks. Additionally, every five rounds players will choose a scoring option from a bonus card! Maximize your resources, rolls, and get ready for bag building with dice!

Players complete 25 total rounds and at game end will score points for completed flowers in rows and columns as well as scoring bonuses for Honey and bonus abilities. The winner will have earned the most points from their in-game and final scoring!

Honey plays 1-100 players. Roll and write your way through the tulips as you gain knowledge of blooms to grow your apiary and bee the best you can bee!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Die rasante Dino-Rallye
description:
Oh no, the Spinosaurus attacks! It's your mission to help the Colby brothers, who want to safe the other, peace-loving dinosaurs and bring them to their shelter. And don't forget to rescue the Colby brothers, too. The final task to win, is to put the safety fence into action. Players act in a cooperative way to achieve this, all together win or lose.

The game is driven by dice rolling mechanics. Depending on the dice roll, you have to move either the Spinosaurus or one of the Colby brothers. Each of the brothers has to move once, before they may move again. On their way back and forth they collect Dinosaurs and put them into their trailer, bringing them to the shelter. The Spinosaurus always moves towards the shelter. If the Spinosaurus reaches the shelter before this, you fail.

name: Sköna Sverige
description:
Sköna Sverige is a trivia game about the history of Sweden. Each of the 165 cards depicts a historical event on its front side, and has the year of the event on the back side.

There are two different gameplay modes: In the drafting mode, you try to arrange drafted cards into chronological order. The player with the fewest misplaced cards wins.

In the trivia mode, you try to guess the correct year by placing markers on the gameboard. The game is played over a fixed number of rounds, and whoever has the most points at the end wins.

name: BadNews
description:
BadNews is a French implementation of Cards Against Humanity, based on the French YouTube show BADNEWS.

The lead player in turn chooses a News with a blank space, other players must choose an answer with a combination of two different cards maximum (Action or/and Bad) that must be funny.

The game, particularly provocative, is reserved for an adult audience.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – T'au Empire
description:
The T’au are a young and dynamic race of technologically advanced aliens whose empire is spreading like wildfire across the stars. Ruled and guided by the enigmatic Ethereals, the T’au seek to unite every sentient being under the light of the T’au’va, or Greater Good. They prefer that others join this growing alliance willingly, but do not hesitate to use force to fulfil their destiny wherever they must. At the forefront of this fight are the Hunter Cadres of the Fire Caste. Comprising highly mobile and well-armed soldiery, led and supported by veteran warriors piloting deadly battlesuits, gunships and strike fighters, these armies sweep all before them in a blizzard of devastating firepower. Signature battle strategies such as the decisive Mont’ka or the cunning ambush of the Kauyon see the enemy outmanoeuvred at every turn, while their potent blend of technological might and ideological fanaticism ensure the T’au achieve victory after victory.

This 136-page book comprehensively covers the T'au Empire. It has everything you need to bring the technological might of the T'au to bear on the tabletop in order to expand the empire, plus a selection of lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this hardback codex you'll find:


The origins of the T'au Empire, their desire for unity through the Greater Good, and their will to expand as a species
A detailed description T'au's caste-based society, the various Spheres of Expansion, the Septs that form the Empire, and the technological and military might of the T'au
Background information on the Ethereals, as well as characters such as Aun'Shi, Shadowsun, and Commander Farsight
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
37 datasheets for the units that make up the T'au forces, from squads of Fire Warriors, to incredible Battlesuits, and heavily armed tanks
Battle-forged rules that represent how the T'au wage war, from Sept Tenets, Cadre Commands, Independent Powers, as well as Bespoke Stratagems, Prototype Systems, and more.
Crusade Rules that let you bring the Greater Good to various planets through overpowering force and subtle diplomacy
And more!


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Klangraupe
description:
Klangraupe is a memo game. The matching pairs have the same name in German, but look completely different (homonyms).

Klangraupe ist ein Memo-Spiel. Passende Paare heissen gleich, sehen aber ganz unterschiedlich aus (Homonyme).
