name: Bidding Room: Underground
description:
As an art agent in Bidding Room: Underground, you have been employed by powerful families to represent them in a secret underground bidding room for illegal artifacts. Your task is to spend their money wisely to get goods that are worth points. Additionally, you have secret tasks and privileges that will sway how you bid.

To set up, one player takes the role of auctioneer and deals each other player a face-down agent card that includes a breakdown of all 27 artifacts in the game, while listing that player's specific privileges, such as receiving extra money for winning certain types of auctions. The auctioneer records the starting funds for each player — $40-50M depending on the player count — and sets up the artifact deck by shuffling three gift cards with the 27 artifacts. Only 10-20 items will be sold during the game, with that number being determined by the player count.

For each auction, the auctioneer reveals the item, then conducts the auction specified by that item, such as an open auction in which players write bids on their personal boards and raise them, an auctioneer bid in which the auctioneer calls out amounts and players lower their hand to drop out, a sealed bid in which agents reveal their bids simultaneously, and a second price bid in which the winner pays only the amount of the second-highest bid. If the auctioneer reveals a gift card from the deck, this gift goes to the player who won the most recent bid.

The auctioneer tracks the funds that all players have available, and an agent must track their own holdings — and everyone else's — mentally. If they win a bid for more than they have, they must sell off previously acquired items at their listed opening bids to acquire funds.

Once the specified number of items have been sold, whoever has the most points wins.

name: Two Trumps and a Lie
description:
We aren't fans of not knowing fact from fiction, but sometimes you have to laugh to keep from crying. And what better place for a much-needed laugh than game night with friends?
So we’re taking an old favorite game — Two Truths and a Lie — and updating it for truly crazy times. Can’t tell the actual Trump quotes from ones that are completely made up? SAD. But hilarious! So Make Game Night Great Again!

—description from the designer

In turn, players are given a three statements from a card, read by the player on their right, and they must guess which one was not made by Donald Trump. If they guess correctly, they keep the question card; if they answer wrongly, the player who read out the statements keeps the card. After a set number of rounds, the game ends, and the player who has collected the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

name: Just Tell Me What to Do
description:
Have you ever struggled with how to make a big, tough life decision like, Should I marry a mime? Or, Should I jump into a pit of sharks for Youtube???

We get it. Life is full of hard decisions, so we created a game about the BIG questions in life and then advise you with quotes from funny famous people! In Just Tell Me What to Do, a Decision Maker reads aloud a funny decision they're making each round. Other players (the "Advisors") advise them using Advice Cards from famous comedians, authors, and that wisest of sages, Anonymous.

Each player gets 45 seconds or less to argue why their advice is best, and then the Decision Maker awards the best Advisor with the Dilemma card. You win if you get 4, but honestly, it's a party game, who's keeping score?!

name: Fences: 5-6 player expansion
description: Expansion for the game Fences to play with up to 6 players.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Print & Play

name: Pangaex
description:
Pangaex is a world-conquering game with aspects of Risk, Catan, and Terraforming Mars. The game is played on a modular board (81 2"-square tiles), each of which indicates one of the following resources: Culture, Food, Weapons, Commerce, Mountains, or Lakes. Each player starts with a Capital game piece and two village game pieces, which are placed in a snake-draft system. Each player also begins with some resources and a soldier, who begins the game on the Capital tile.

The game is played in two repeating phases: Production phase (collecting resources based on villages and/or soldiers in play), and Action phase. The Production phase happens simultaneously, where all players collect resources at the same time. The Action phase is where the bulk of the game is played. Players can move their soldiers; they can also use resources to build villages, train soldiers, and even convert enemy villages to their own culture. Like Terraforming Mars, each player may take up to two actions on their turn--however, a pass is not a pass for the whole Action phase, but merely a pass on a given turn. The Action phase ends when all players have passed consecutively.

Soldiers are more than just soldiers in Pangaex. Soldiers raze enemy villages, but they also help to rebuild their own villages. They prevent peaceful cultural conversion, and they even collect resources at times.

When any player plays their final village, the game ends after the Action phase concludes (i.e. final village signifies final round, not final play). Points are awarded for villages on the board, enemy villages that you've collected (by razing or converting), and other metrics to balance out the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Income, Modular Board, Square Grid, Turn Order: Progressive, Worker Placement

name: The Carniverse: Tales of Survival Vol. 1
description:
Welcome to the very first Tales of Survival supplement for the Carniverse. Inside you'll find many different elements to change up the standard method of play, and to add tons of content to your games all for the price of a couple cups of coffee!

In this first volume you will find the following additions to the core rule book.

1 new Leader
3 new Character types
2 new Ranged weapons
1 new Melee weapon
5 new Gear items

New Base expansion rules
2 new Base Facilities
2 new Dinosaur species
4 new Scenarios

New random Weather based rules
New Time of Day rules
New Special Cache rules
New rules for Injured Dinosaurs
New Solo Play rules
mechanics: Action Points, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: 1980's A Decade of Trivia
description: 1980's A Decade of Trivia is a far out card game! A fun card game to play at a BBQ, take to the beach, or on game night with friends. You'll enjoy this sweet deck of trivia fit for fans of the rockin' 80's.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Geneva 1955
description:
It is early July 1955, and Geneva is preparing to host a historical summit. The leaders of the USA, UK, France and USSR – the four most powerful countries in the world - are meeting to foster peace between East and West and to stave off the rapidly growing divide now dubbed The Cold War. Naturally, the summit will be neck-deep in spies, rumours and complex loyalties. But as head of the Swiss security forces, you must descend into this miasma of truth and half-truth, for you have learned there are traitors here, anarchists that would gladly catapult the world into lawless chaos. Can you identify all of the anarchists before they derail the summit and threaten global security?

Each card in the deck represents a person who was actually present at the 1955 Geneva Summit, from Ike Eisenhower, US President, down to Germaine Goutte, French Personal Assistant. A pile of random anarchists is dealt at the start of the game, with the remaining cards acting as informants from which you might extract clues. A cunning series of icons lets you compare the front of an informant with the back side of a hidden anarchist to detect whether they match by suit, value, or as a multiple or factor of the value. By clever hand management and astute use of clues you may deduce the suit and rank of each anarchist. But can you find them all before your clues run out and they act?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Math, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Real Battle
description:
This is a tactical simulation game that reproduces the combat in "Armored Trooper Votoms", a Sunrise TV anime broadcasted from April 1983 to March 1984.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armored_Trooper_Votoms
This game reproduces the confrontation between the two camps, does not reproduce battle royale in multiple camps.
30 AT data cards
80 armament cards
8 summary sheets
8 displays
522 counters
3 maps
6 pages of rules

name: ダンジョン＆ダンゲロス (Dungeon & Dangerous)
description:
ダンジョン＆ダンゲロス (Dungeon & Dangerous) is a dungeon crawl game from Japan, aimed at older players. Players are the students of a school that discover a monster-filled dungeon in the basement of their school. Aided by faculty and staff, students and friends, they explore the dungeon and defeat the various demons and creatures below. Their goal is to find a secret legendary book somewhere in the dungeon.

The game is designed to be played multiple times, with one to four players if playing co-op. Players choose from eight different characters With modular components, abundant friends to choose from, and a variety of scenarios, the game also includes online elements to maintain the uncertainty and suspense.

Subsequent to its publication, the designer has created more characters and scenarios to be found online.

A DX edition was published originally which gave more characters, six more scenarios and a guidebook and reference material to enable players to build their own characters and scenarios.
user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Kagami Kyosuke Works (架神恭介ワークス)

name: Raid: Asgard Expansion
description:
An expansion for Raid, including:

2 each of 3 new God cards (6)
2 each of a new power rune card (2)
2 each of 5 new weather cards (10)
12 each of 3 new elite warrior cards (24)
4 sided fate die

name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander – Silverquill Statement Deck
description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a white-black deck with a political theme and a +1/+1 counters subtheme, featuring Breena, the Demagogue as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Silverquill Statement" is based on Silverquill College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.
mechanics: Bribery, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Sudan Jihad
description: A military miniature skirmish game designed for fast action between small groups of Mahdists and Egyptians. The game primarily covers the period 1880 through 1885 in the Darfur and Kordofan regions of Sudan. The illustrated rules include a brief history of the conflict, scenarios and translucent movement and artillery templates.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: 18 Dywizja Piechoty
description:
A wargame faithfully recreating the actions of 18th Infantry division in the Polish–Soviet War, 1919-1921. Despite the fact that this unit had well-trained officers and disciplined soldiers, it suffered very high looses in the battles near the Wkra River and the village of Sarnowa Góra.

Rules System: WB-95

—description from the publisher (translated)

One of the scenarios is indeed a battle on two unconnected maps simultaneously, that impact each other. These can be played separately.
This game is an introduction to the WB-95 rules system.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: Don't Get Got!: Con Edition
description:
Extra pack of stand alone challenges given away at various conventions including Airecon 2022.

This game is all about completing secret missions, so when you open the pack, make sure that you read the rules and don't look at all the cards. Otherwise, you won't be able to play - which would be very sad indeed.

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M24 Chaffee Expansion
description:
The M24 Chaffee is a real speedster, combing high initiative and movement to find the perfect spot on the battlefield. Combine this with the new Commanders Vision System and you can aid your allies by stripping away an enemies Cover for the rest of the phase.

The American built M24 Chaffee brings a new Light Tank to the battlefield and unlike the older Valentine this one is fast… we mean really fast! Combining high speed and good initiative with a gun that cannot be easily ignored, it is a threat to every other tank on the battlefield. Befitting it’s role as a spotter, an easy addition is a Commanders Vision System. This allows the Chaffee to strip away enemy tanks cover bonus, making them an easier target for other friendly tanks.

The key there is to make sure you have the highest initiative possible on this tank and if you need a little buff to achieve that, then the 75mm Gun M17 is exactly what you need.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Crusader Expansion
description:
Widely known for it’s performance in the deserts of North Africa the Crusader is perfect for high speed attack runs on an unsuspecting enemy. Combine its naturally high initiative with Improved Communications to give a boost to the entire platoon.

The Crusader, used by the British in the deserts of North Africa, is another speedster like the American M24 Chaffee. It gains an additional hit point over its American friend, but at the cost of two crew slots and the Arrow Shot special rule (which means it is less likely to cause critical hits). This means that straight of the box it will hang around longer, but possibly at the cost of dealing less damage… but if you are in the fight for one extra round that may be all the time you need to win the game! If you are looking to reduce the cost of your tank you can upgrade the gun to an OQF 3-inch Howitzer MK.I which removes the Arrow Shot rule and gives your tank High Explosive. This is a great option if you are feeling lucky with your dice… well are you?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Prime Stone
description:
"Rainbow ore is a legendary mineral that is more beautiful than any mineral. Many alchemists are trying to figure out how to make Rainbow ore from different minerals. Every day these alchemists have to find the necessary ore. But finding the required ore is not an easy task. They may have to rely on some luck sometimes. Sometimes it may be ore, But sometimes it might get a stone."

Prime Stone is an educational board game designed for classroom use. The game rules are simple enough to develop calculating skills, which are a necessary basis for learning mathematics at a higher level. The prime Stone game can be used to educate about integer factorization and review content such as the greatest common divisor and least common multiple, prime numbers, composite numbers, powers, and other related topics. Teachers can use it to schedule classroom activities and play outside of school hours. Parents can play with their children to help them improve their math skills.

Players can choose to do one of three things: Pick, Mix and Build. Details are as follows: 1) Take two tiles from the bag and place them in front of the player. If the player picks up one stone tile, the player places the picked tile in front and puts the stone tile back into the bag. 2) Combine two or three tiles placed in front of the player using Multiply and put the old and new tiles back into the bag. 3) Create Rainbow ore from the target card. Using two or three tiles placed in front of the player multiplies any number of the target cards. Players can use those two or three tiles to create rainbow ore by having the player put the tile used to create it back into the bag. Then put the target card in front of the player and put the number of stone tiles specified in the target card into another player's bag. (will give stone tiles all with one player or distributed to multiple other players) and then open a new target card to replace it.

There are two conditions to ending the game, either 1) the player generates eight rainbow ore or 2) the player collects four target cards. When one of the players meets the condition, play that round as the last round and count rainbow ore number. The player with the most number of rainbow ore is the winner.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection, Take That

name: Undertow: The Beach Game
description:
It's a fine day at the beach and everyone is out swimming. But the Undertow is pulling you, your family, and friends out to sea! It’s a race to see who can get their family back to the beach safely before they are lost forever…

Undertow - The Beach Game is a quick and fun rainy day game where you roll dice and try to rescue your friends and family before the other players.

During setup players roll a number of dice (determined by how many players) and take turns placing them in the water (the game board) based on the number rolled.

Each turn consists of rolling three turn dice; two for movement and one modifier die. The movement dice determine how many outward and inward moves need to be made by the players swimmers. The modifier die changes these moves including bonuses like "The Big Wave" that allows more inward movement, and "Undertow!" where all movement needs to be outward.
The game ends when any player has moved all their swimmers to the safety of The Beach.

—description from the designer

name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander — Witherbloom Witchcraft Deck
description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a black-green deck with a life-gain and life payment theme, featuring Willowdusk, Essence Seer as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Witherbloom Witchcraft" is based on Witherbloom College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander – Lorehold Legacies Deck
description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a red-white deck with an artifact theme, featuring Osgir, the Reconstructor as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Lorehold Legacies" is based on Lorehold College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Dinosauria: New Gen Expansion
description:
Having successfully revived a stable, first generation of dinosaurs, it's now time to set bring the next generation to life.

Dinosauria Nex Gen is a stand-alone expansion to Dinosauria, bringing all new dinosaurs to the game, plus two more Colleagues, Rom and Oceana, to play against in Solitaire Mode.

Dinosauria Nex Gen can be played solo, but adds more depth when combined with the Core Dinosauria game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: 人狼コロシアム (Jinro Colosseum)
description:
人狼コロシアム (Jinro Colosseum) is a werewolf style card game from Japan.

Players start with a hand of character cards, play one form their hand, and draw another from a circle of cards. Players have two lives, and try to attack each other. If a player loses both lives, they are out of the game. If they draw a werewolf from the circle, they are also eliminated.

The game is won if one player is left standing. Otherwise, the player with the highest ranking character in hand is the winner.

The game comes with a standard deck of 16 cards for a quick, game, another 32 cards to be added to make an advanced game for 20 minutes. Finally, a set 5 cards makes a delux set for a longer game.

The standard deck includes characters such as Citizens, Fortune Teller, Bodyguard x2, Hunter, Tough Guy, Jester, Monk, and Werewolf. The advanced deck has more like Doctor, Assassin, Magician, Hermit, Lover, Knight, Sniper, Revolutionary, Queen, Musician, Mad Wolf, White Wolf. The delux set is a Lone Wolf, Black Cat, Cow Man, Demon Fox, and a Demon.
user summary

name: Dark Files: 01-KOMA
description:
Dark Files: 01-KOMA is a multimedia detective game experience in a realistic criminal case.

Detectives work together to solve a case with the help of the information provided in different ways: Some information is provided by the printed media within the game (like newspapers, photos, business cards, letters etc.), another part of the information is provided digitally (on websites, by phone calls or SMS). Therefore the following tools are necessary to play the game: mobile phone and internet browser.

What happened to Ben? - You find your friend Ben (39) knocked out and unconscious in his kitchen. After taking the necessary steps to help him, you wonder what could have happened. As a friend and close confidant, you dive into Ben's life and try to find out with your mutual acquaintance Larissa why Ben fell victim to this crime. And what does his current case have to do with it?
A gripping and multidimensional TRUE CRIME detective game experience.

Koma is the 1st case of the dark files detective game series. Each case is self-contained. Dive into the exciting world of detective games. Solve puzzles, crack codes, examine documents, combine evidence and facts, draw conclusions and solve the case!

name: Stressful Rally
description:
Created with the spirit of arcade gaming : you put a coin inside the machine, push the start button, play 5 minutes, lose, put another coin, play 5 minutes, lose again, you don't have coins anymore, you leave, it's fun. Play a hand-drawn rally game from behind the wheel with a top notch view !

With a simple accelerate/decelerate mecanism thanks to 3 dices, an ABS system which gives you a dice bonus, a damage system and up to 3 unique vehicles and 6 stages to choose from, this game is a good filler which can take a short time to play thanks to multiple modes like "Quick race" or "Championship".

Participated in the 2021 7th Roll & Write Contest on BGG as the first board game of Kikwik.
categories: Print & Play, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ロジカル真王 (Logical Thinking)
description:
ロジカル真王 (Logical Thinking) is a two player deduction game from Japan. Designed by a manga artist and published by a manga publisher, the game is sold in their stores and has a manga produced with it.

The deck has cards numbered from 0 to 9, and each card has a special action on it. Each player chooses two cards and hides them from the other player, standing them up in small standees. The players must deduce which cards are hidden.

The players start with two hit points. Each time a player makes a correct deduction, and accurately identifies a hidden card (an attack), the hiding player loses a hit point. When a player gets to zero, or starts their turn with no hand cards, they lose the game. But players can recover points when playing cards during the game.

Each player has a hand of the remaining cards, and take turns playing a hand card and then making a guess. The hand card played has a special demand, such as, 'is this card a 5 or higher?', or 'which card has the higher value?'. Other cards have actions such as, return a played card to your hand, and, your opponent may not attack this turn. As cards are played out to the table, it becomes more obvious what cards are hidden.

However, when a hidden card is revealed, it goes back to the player's hand and they may place another card hidden.

By logical deduction, a player should be able to work out which cards are hidden and eliminate their opponent.
user summary
publishers: コロコロコミック編集部 (Corocoro Comic Editorial Department), 小学館 (Shogakukan)

name: First Watch
description:
The shadows deepen around your campsite in the first watch of the night. An enemy appears. Rouse your companions!

In the First Watch box, you’ll find 85 verse cards suited by the Fruit of the Spirit. These are divided into a 50-card Lightraider deck and a 35-card Battle deck. You’ll also find rule cards plus a key card to help you use this deck with other Lightraiders games. The Battle deck includes the cards you need to score victories. These are verses used when battling allegorical enemies in the Lightraiders realm.

If you don’t remember the verse referenced on the battle card in play, use a lightraider card from your hand that matches its suit. Or recite a verse from a card in an opponent’s hand. Of course, you can only see the reference on the back of your opponent’s card, so you’ll have to rely on memory.

Lightraiders play this game on the road and at Lightraider Academy to practice sacred verses and prepare for battle. Now you can play First Watch at home. Even better, use your First Watch cards for organization and reference during other lightraider adventures. This set makes a great companion to the original DragonRaid Vintage Boxed Set or Starlots the Game. Game effects are listed on each card, and each card also incorporates a real-life Scripture application to expand your discipleship learning.

Intended as Bible memory verse tool that has been gamified to support an expanded/enhanced play method for DragonRaid and/or Starlots.

name: Burger Bear Bonanza
description:
The Burger Bear Bonanza! Game from Mudpuppy is a fun new game to see who can really stack up!

Players can match, stack & steal toppings to build burger bears! Whoever completes 2 burger bears wins and is the bear to beat!

name: Blockbuster Trilogy Box Set
description:
Three great movie games in one big VHS. Each one is like a round of Movie Charades mixed with Family Fortunes.

Lord of the Rings. Back to the Future. The Godfather. There’s been some great trilogies over the years — but this one’s a real show-stopper.

Introducing the Blockbuster Box Set. Three dynamite party games about the movies you know and love, all wrapped up in one giant VHS bundle. Play them one at a time or combine all three games together for a big-budget, Blockbuster-style showdown. All you’ll need to bring are the players... and a decent amount of popcorn.

name: Fairmarket
description:
Fairmarket is a gambling game for 2-6 players. The game uses the “Knotts Deck,” a unique deck from DeVere’s South Coast, in the Dew Point universe. The deck has three suits (flags, cups, and bells), and an unusual distribution of numbers: Ace through 9, then 10 through 60, and three face cards.

Players ante five coins to begin, and divide these coins into five pots in the center of the table.

Players then receive five cards and stack them in order on the table.

Round by round, players cards compete against each other, and cards in the center, to win the money in those pots.

It’s a simple and fast card game with lots of variations and plenty of action!

name: Supply Chain the card game
description:
A combination of Tetris, rummy, Sim City, and dominos. Buy properties and build your business empire. But make sure all your suppliers are linked, or it can all fall apart.

You can play a solo game, or competing against others, or play co-op. There are over 200 cards with over 150 of those being unique.

Each player starts with a main office and a family business. Players buy, sell, and trade properties to grow a sprawling cityscape. All cards have links so you may connect a producer with its suppliers. Watch out for run-down derelict properties that your competitors might stick on you.

When all the properties are gone, the game is over. Players add up their victory points to determine the winner. Different properties vary in point values. An iron mine might have only 1 VP while the coveted Department Store has 10 VP.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Hand Management, Income, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Cosmic Convoy
description:
“The computer is going berserk, Captain! Our charges are exhausted, and we need to collect new ones, but the computers starting to spit out random code. I'm worried that it’s going to shoot us off the ship if we go to collect the new charges from the generators.

This was supposed to be a simple delivery! Who designed this ship?!?!”

Construct your ship using the deck and collect all of your charges (crystals or cubes) using your crew(meeples) before the modules of your ship flip; possibly sending your charges and crew into space.

Can you recharge the engines and get your crew home safely?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Transportation
mechanics: Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Impulse Movement, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Flu Season Dice Game
description: A companion dice game to the original card game about staying healthy while eliminating others by getting them sick. Roll the dice to determine if you gain or lose heart tokens, the life point tracking mechanism for you turn. Then repeat process. Optional rules allow you to play with character powers and different game play styles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Kill Steal, Player Elimination, Re-rolling and Locking, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Hordes of Power
description:
Welcome to the Isle of Prymal, spelled with a "Y", so you know it's bad a$$. Once, long ago, the isle was home to a technologically advanced super civilization that utterly destroyed itself... and from the ashes arose the barbaric and beautiful land of Prymal as we know it today. A land of enigmatic prophecy, where it has been foretold that peace will only return when a champion of destiny arises and assembles a legendary Horde of Power: a fabled force with the strength of 25 mountains! Are YOU that champion of destiny? Do you have what it takes to build a Horde of Power and rule the Isle of Prymal?

Can you assemble and lead an army of heroes, villains, monsters, robots, pirates, sorcerers, and ex-girlfriends, all the while fending off your opponent's attempts to weaken your forces through murder, kidnapping, and brainwashing?
mechanics: Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection, Take That

name: For Sale Autorama: Promo Card Pack
description:
Originally vailable as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

During setup, you may replace any 2 auto cards with the auto cards from the promo pack. You may also replace any 2 check cards EXCEPT 0 value check cards with check cards from the promo pack.

name: Biblical Duel
description:
The game plays out the story of Jesus Christ. Players choosing between factions the Messiah and the Evil to influence the mankind right way (by their intensions) or overpower their opponent.

Dice rolling dexterity asymmetric game where players roll dice over cards in play to get advantages over their opponent. There are two ways to win - get maximum victory points or beat the opponent by getting all 5 cards in play your side up.

Rolled dice land on cards in play and trigger cards effects or flip cards to their side depends on specific cards:

Landing on opponent’s cards – flip if land dice sum reaches at least value of the cards.
Landing on active’s player cards – it triggers specific card effect – incrementing value of another rolled die, acquiring the specific abilities, and gaining victory points. Special abilities are specific for each faction.


The game mainly consists of 9 cards:

5 both sided cards (each side belongs to specific player)
2x faction card for each faction (to track victory points and special abilities)
2x ability card for each faction (one of abilities used by placing to cards in play)


The game was made for 2022 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Print & Play, Religious

name: Kolm Keltek
description:
A free Roll and Write game where you are trying to create the best Celtic knot possible.
From a roll of three dice, select two for the coordinates on the board, and draw one of the four different patterns in that spot, selected by the third die.
As you play, score points for placing perpendicular shapes next to each other. You will lose points if you're unable to place any shapes for that roll.
The game was designed as an entry for the 11th Roll and Write Contest.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Flu Season Card Game
description: A card game about staying healthy while eliminating others by getting them sick. Play cards against other players to cause them to lose heart tokens, the life tracking method for this game. Classes include Official, Rude Stranger, Introvert, and Scientist.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Humor, Medical
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Kill Steal, Player Elimination, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Traitor Game

name: Glow Spotters
description:
The Glow Spotters Troop is on a nature adventure, trying to count fireflies to earn their Firefly badges. Each player has a set of firefly boards numbered 1 to 10. Players roll the die and collect various shaped Glow Tiles to reach the sum of fireflies on their boards. The first player to complete all their boards wins the game and receives their Firefly badge.

Skills Focus : Addition, Spatial Reasoning

—description from the publisher

name: Bairs of the Radiant Realm
description:
Bairs of the Radiant Realm is a two player dice placement game, where you take on the role of one of the Bears of the Air. Always looking to fly higher, further and faster, you are working to build a new aircraft. You will fly your wonderous machine across the Radiant Realm, helping its inhabitants, who will then help you in return by giving you resources or special abilities to build your new flying wonder

Developed as part of the 2022 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest.

—description from the designer

name: Gloschli
description:
A card game in which players aim to get rid of as many creatures as possible or exchange them with an opponent's card.

The first player who manages to have five or less points in their cards triggers the last round by announcing "Gloschli". Their cards are now protected and can no longer be claimed by their opponents. After the other players have finished their last turn, all players turn their cards face up. Each player's total points are calculated. As soon as the first player exceeds 100 points, the game is over and the player with the fewest points wins.
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Common Decency
description:
Scandalise your friends, startle your colleagues and unnerve your casual acquaintances with this irreverent party game!

Read a card aloud and on the count of three, everyone points to the person most likely to answer yes to that question. If everyone guesses right, dispose of the question card. If everyone guesses wrong, gain another question card. The goal is to get rid of all of your question cards, or have the least at the end of the game.

name: Scoops Meow
description:
Scoops Meow is the purrfect flavor-matching ice cream game. Reveal a cone card and quickly memorize the flavors and toppings. Then be the quickest to find your matching ice cream and wafer cards. If you think you've got it right, place your face down cards in front of you. IF you're the first, grab a cherry and put it on top of your cards. Once everyone is done reveal and everyone who is correct grabs a cherry. If the player who was first was correct, they also get to keep their bonus cherry. First player to reach 7 or more cherries will win the game!

—description from the designer

name: Mastro Alice
description:
The game was conceived by Aldo Spinelli in 1989 and develops on a chessboard of 4 squares per side.
Each player has a traditional six-sided die, which is moved from one square to another in an orthogonal direction, rotating on an edge of his choice as many times as the value expressed by the top face.
The dice can change direction after each rotation and can also retrace the squares already traveled during the same move. The die can only pass into empty squares.
The player who manages to finish his move in the square occupied by the opponent wins, so that, after the last rotation, his die shows on the upper face a value identical to that indicated at that moment by the upper face of the enemy die.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: The Miniature Book of Miniature Golf
description: Dexterity game of minigolf in a form of a "book". Game is played used miniature golf club and a tiny golf ball. Game contains 9 fairways with varying themes. Player with least strokes at the end is the winner.

name: Throne of Under
description:
Throne of Under is a strategic, turn-based table-top adventure game. Two to four players move their characters on the map across sixteen lands to the very last land. Players use the playing cards to move, battle faerumentals: the monsters of these lands, and challenge opponents. The goal is to be the first one to collect four keys to open the Throne room, enter it and win the last battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Matching, Move Through Deck, Race

name: Cuba Libre: Calixto Bot Update Pack
description:
The Cuba Libre Calixto bot update pack brings the successful Jacquard bot system to Cuba Libre. Like its predecessors in Gandhi and Fall of Saigon, Calixto is quick to use and easy to implement but presents a challenge to any Cuba Libre player.
When selecting Operations and Special Activities, cards are drawn from the Calixto deck—there are six cards for each Cuba Libre faction. Each card examines the current state of the game and selects the appropriate action for the active faction. A single, faction-specific table then determines where that action will occur. The same table is used to select spaces for Operations, Special Activities, and Events, minimizing the need to flip between multiple player aids.

Playing against Calixto feels like playing against a human opponent. It is unpredictable yet responsive to strategic needs, it goes after its enemies while keeping an eye on its ally, and makes moves until now limited to human players—like choosing a Limited Operation to block an opponent’s Event. Calixto can take the place of any faction in a Cuba Libre session and can be used in any combination of player and non-player setups.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Sussed?: Orange
description:
Family and friends quiz game of Selecting and Guessing

Each player is dealt a card. In turn players select and read a question aloud. Then the selector secretly chooses the answer closest to them personally. The other players secretly guess which answer (A B or C) the selector chose and win points if they are correct.

The game is played until all questions on all cards have been asked and answered.

name: Merchants of the Crystal Sea
description:
Merchants of the Crystal Sea is a two player, push your luck card game. Expeditions will gather new resources discovered on the island and return them back to the ship. Your goal is to score as many resource points as possible before the end of the game. But your opponent might have other ideas. Both players have to decide when to return back to the ship with the current resources or press your luck, trying to weather the events and retrieve a much bigger load.

Your ship has five expeditions to send out and collect resources. When it is time, collect the resources and return back to your ship and count the booty. Events may alter the success of your expedition. The longer you stay on the island the greater the chance you have to deal with these events (good or bad!).

—description from the designer

name: Kuddly Kymera
description:
Play cards from your hand to create the cutest animal for yourself and leave your opponents with a hideous monster! Modifier cards rule, like a rainbow tail for bonus points to you or scaly skin to an opponent for negative points. Appropriate for all ages.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Matching, Player Judge, Tile Placement

name: SavannaScapes
description:
Players take turns moving around the play area choosing species tiles and placing them next to others to provide those species with their needed habitats and create an ecosystem.

Point tokens are earned each time a player meets the needs of their animals or when an event tail is played. The player with the most points when all the rounds are complete wins.

name: Sous Scellés: La Clef
description:
In Paris, the famous puzzle creator Fable Table is organizing a test for his new escape room...but at the end of the evening, his dead body is found. You thought you had come to play, and now you find yourselves in the middle of a crime scene...

La Clef ("The Key") is a murder-solving escape-room board game with a crime inside an escape room.

—description from the publisher

name: Sheep Leap
description:
Somewhere in Ireland there is meadow with grazing sheep and a shepherd to take care of them.
Everything is peaceful...
...and so boring until the sheep start to jump over the fences.
Can you skip over all four fences before the shepherd catches one of the sheep or you run out of clovers?

Sheep Leap is a puzzle-ly solitaire in-hand game with only 17 cards. You can either use a regular card deck or the provided cards.

The game comes with 6 one-card expansions that you can mix and match to make it even more brain twisting.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Mythology, Print & Play

name: Vividz
description:
The purpose in Vividz is "Faster than your opponent" for the three set missions to clear!
Run through the Vividz world with fame!
The stage of the story is called "Vividz"
Virtual real world!
On a variety of stages, equip weapons that change from stage to stage and fight!
Achieve the exhilaration of manipulating many cards in one turn.
"Running experience" with a play feel unique to Vividz!
First, let's play with the "β card" that is being distributed for free.
With Vividz official remote battle system (Link Vividz)
Match your opponent.
Feel free to play with players far away!
Feel the feel of the card, both real and online
Enjoy Vividz TCG!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Vividzにおける目的は
設定された3つのミッションを、「対戦相手より早く」
クリアすること！
名声をかけて、Vividzワールドを駆け抜けろ！
物語の舞台は「Vividz」と呼ばれる
バーチャルリアルワールド！
バラエティに富んだステージで、
ステージごとに変化する武器を装備して戦うよ！
1ターンの間にたくさんのカードを操る爽快感を実現。
Vividzならではのプレイフィールで"疾走体感"！
まずは無料配布中の「βカード」で遊んでみよう。
Vividz公式リモート対戦システム（Link Vividz）で
対戦相手をマッチング。
遠く離れたプレイヤーと気軽にプレイできるよ！
リアルでもオンラインでも、カードの手触りを感じながら
Vividz TCGを楽しもう！

—description from the publisher

name: Tomato!
description:
Throw your cards in the vegetables! Why? Why not?! Open the tomato, shuffle the cards, deal and off you go! TOMATO contains over 80 numbered cards from 1 to 10, which must be thrown into the open tomato in the correct order. Correct sequence? The rules are very simple: if the number on one of your cards is one higher or one lower than the top number on the discard pile, then you may discard it. The sequence 1 – 2 – 3 – 2 – 3 – 4 would be perfect! Easy right? Just always +1 or -1. All other differences are not allowed. But you have to be careful, because everyone is throwing wildly at the same time. And who wins? The first player to get rid of their hand cards wins. Understood? Then off to the vegetables!

—description from the publisher (translated)
publishers: Hutter Trade GmbH + Co KG, Megableu

name: Dicetopia: Faction Pack #2
description: 5 new community based Factions for Dicetopia!

name: Boss Monster: Portable Power Pack
description: Expansion for Boss Monster 2: The Next Level that introduces the concept of portable rooms, allowing a player to take rooms they have built with a portable effect, and place it back in their hand during the Build Phase. The boss makes all rooms Portable.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Something Fishy
description:
The ocean world holds you, the solo King of the reef, the job of keeping the reef full but not too full. As fish show up you tell them where to reside, sneakily putting together groups of the same fishes so they will leave and make a home elsewhere. You only have this position for a short time, and then one of the other fish will take this responsibility. Don't let the reef get too crowded or you fail and the reef falls to decay.

In Something Fishy, a solo mostly abstract game, the player takes the position of Reef King. The job that is placed on each King is to maintain a balance of fishes. Fish tokens are drawn randomly, two each turn. The player will roll three dice to indicate where the tokens may be placed. The player take two of the rolled dice, add them together, forming a number of an area to place the token.
Each area of the reef, has 1-2 numbers that correspond to it, providing an overlap for each number, so each area has two groups of numbers for placement, kind of like a Venn diagram with "lanes" that hold three fish each, and an area consisting of two lanes that overlap to the left and right groups of numbers as well.
If, after the two fish tokens are placed, eachv area is checked for three or more fishes of the same color; those fish tokens are taken off the board and placed to the side, making more room for others "arriving". If, after 24 turns and the reef areas have not been overran by having three fish in one lane, you win. If, after checking for full lanes, and removal of the threes that are duplicates, a lane is still full with three tokens, you lose.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Math, Nautical, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Código Secreto: Expansão promocional Portugal
description: This promo pack is produced by Devir and has 10 cards with 20 new words from Portuguese.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Sivatagi Bújócska
description: The meerkats are cheerfully hiding in their desert homes. Where they hide, where they emerge from their lair. If you manage to get a small animal in all the passages of a nest, you will be rewarded. Who can collect most of the butterfly disks? Try to hide the meerkats from the outpost in the nest! If they run back, find them another flight!

name: Word Poker
description:
Word Poker takes the well-known framework of poker and transforms it into a compulsive family word game. Instead of normal playing cards, it uses letter cards with each letter having its own score value. The aim is to make the highest-scoring word using any combination of the five cards on the table and the five cards you are holding. There are rounds of betting where you can bet on the strength of your word to win the pot of chips. Quick start rules mean that you don't need any knowledge of poker to get playing.

—description from the back of the box (adapted)

The rules are for Texas Hold 'Em poker. All the steps are there: the flop, turn, river, etc. Besides using letters to make words, the only rules difference is that players start with a hand of five cards rather than two.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Spelling

name: Warband: Wargaming Large Scale Dark Ages or Early Medieval Skirmish Battles
description:
This is a set of rules for wargaming large scale Dark Ages or Early Medieval skirmish battles. It can be used with any scale figures (typically 15mm or 28mm).
Each figure on the table represents one man, and the game is designed for battles of around 50 – 100 figures per side.

Basic Concepts:
This game is played on a hex grid. Each hex must be big enough to contain at least 8 singly based foot figures, or four mounted figures.
It is designed to be played with singly based figures.
The game is card driven, so each player has a hand of cards, and cards are played to activate groups of figures and for other events.
There are no units in this game. Figures can move around freely, although they will benefit from the presence of Leaders. Figures are activated for movement, combat and shooting by hex (so some or all of the figures in a hex may move, shoot or fight when activated).
Each army has a Warlord and some Leaders. All rules applying to Leaders also apply to Warlords.

Game mechanisms:
All dice used are normal 6 sided dice. When the rules refer to a particular number that must be rolled, that number or higher must be rolled for success.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Breaking the Luftwaffe
description:
Breaking the Luftwaffe is a scenario and campaign book for the popular Check Your 6! Air Combat and Campaign Rules. The book provides three campaigns and 26 scenarios under one cover. The first 9 scenarios follow the beginning of the US 8th Air Force’s escorted strategic bombing campaign over western Germany between October 1943 and January 1944; the next 9 scenarios recreate the intense combat during the “Big Week” air offensive in early 1944; the final 8 scenarios bring together the desperate fighting during Mission 250, the first daylight mission to Berlin. The book also features some of WWII’s top aces including Robert S. Johnson, Gabby Gabreski, “Bud” Anderson, Heinz “Pritzl” Bär, Anton Hackl, and Heinz Knoke. The scenarios can be played individually, linked to form three mini-campaigns, or combined as one grand campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, World War II

name: Home Before The Leaves...FALL!
description:
This game is based on a paradox. The fact that two armies went to war with modern equipment, and tactics based on experiences of another century. The belief that the bayonet and the massed charge of men and horses was mightier than machine guns and rapid firing field artillery, that stuck in the minds of the Generals and statesmen, even when proved wrong. The beginning of the 1914-1918 saw a "mobile war" of sort, a planned "blitzkrieg" of marching men and railway timetables that broke down. Could it have succeeded? This game cannot give an answer, only a hint.

Game includes 1 tabloid-size map, 3 pgs. of rules, 88 counters (unmounted), and charts. This appears to be a game taken from Combat magazine. Description verbiage is taken verbatim from the game.

name: Flying Colors
description:
An abstract game of spreading coloured chips around, Flying Colors is a game for 2 or 3 people.

Piles of chips get moved around the hexagonal grid, with each player trying to make bits of three adjacent discs of the same colour for points.

name: SKAL!
description:
SKAL! (or SKÅL!) is a Viking-themed dice-stacking dexterity-based drinking game! Designed by Andrew Prowse, art and illustrations by Janette Ramos, graphic design by Sebastian Koziner, published by Gameland and distributed by Spiral Games and Quartermaster Logistics.

Players take on the roles of Viking gods and goddesses: Odin, Loki, Thor, Freya, Idunn and Heimdall. Everyone collects a player mat, coloured dice and drinking cup. Each turn, the leading player turns over a card, showing an arrangement of dice then the players race to stack their own dice (plus extra from a shared pile) to match the pattern on the card. They then grab their cups, raise them into air and call out, “SKÅL!” (Cheers in Norwegian). Whoever does this first wins the card, which is worth 1 or 2 points, depending upon difficulty. The first player to 9 points wins!

There are extra cards, rules, special powers and added challenges to keep the game interesting. It can be played as a fun family game or as a rowdy adults-only drinking game if you choose. It plays really quickly (10 – 20 mins) and will be fast-paced, loud, exciting and fun!

—description from the designer

name: ツミカブリ(Tsumikaburi)
description:
It's been a long time, dear magicians. Welcome to the auction hall where demons dance with malicious intent. This time you need all eight demons in your possession to complete the dark ritual. Don’t worry if you don’t collect them all this time, you’ll get another chance. As long as you collect more than the other magicians, you will get out of here alive.

ツミカブリ(Order of Sin) is a bidding and deckbuilding game where you try to collect Demon Cards. Every player starts with the same deck of cards. All you have to do every turn is lay down a card from your hand and point to the card you want.

The important question is whether you and another player point to the same card. If only one player points to a card, they acquire it without revealing their bid. If multiple players point to the same card, they reveal their cards to decide the winner. Some revealed cards also activate special effects.

At the end of the game, the winner is the player who holds the largest number of different Demon Cards in their hand.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Walt Disney's Cinderella Game
description:
This is a simple racing game for children based on Walt Disney's 1950 animated film "Cinderella." The multicolor gameboard includes a folding card backdrop with the game's title and movie characters, which creates an effect similar to a stage.

Each player choose a pair of colored metal slipper tokens. Then, one of each pair is dropped into a bag and placed at the race's end (the castle). Progress is determined by drawing character cards that tell how many spaces to move, with each player moving using their remaining slipper. The player who gets to the castle first chooses a slipper randomly from the bag and if it matches theirs, they win the game and become Cinderella. If not, they go back and start the race again from the middle of the game track.

—user summary

name: The Princess and the Pea
description:
The Princess and the Pea is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Be the first to play all your cards on the ever growing pile of mattresses and pillows. Either play 1 card that is higher and changes colour or 1 or more cards that are lower and matches colour. First to empty their hand of cards is the winner.

About the fairy tale:
On a dark night it knocks on the door, and out in the rain a princess seeks shelter. Yet is she a true princess? The queen tests her and does so by providing a bed with a huge tower of mattresses, and a tiny pea placed at the bottom. In the morning the princess wakes from a terrible night's sleep, proving she is a true princess.

-description from publisher

name: Vendée 93
description:
At the beginning of 1793, after the execution of King Louis XVI, France was drawn into a war against a coalition of most European monarchies. On 24 February, the National Convention decreed the mass draft of 300,000 men to defend the eastern borders. Throughout the country, revolts broke out against this conscription, everywhere they were brutally repressed with success. However, an insurgent territory, called the "Vendée Militaire" resisted. Determined to engage in a trial of strength with the new revolutionary regime, the Vendéens gradually organised themselves until they formed a "Catholic and Royal Army".

Vendée 93, a card driven two player wargame, takes you back to this particularly epic period in the French history, which pitted the young French Republic against the Royalist insurgents from March to October 1793.

"White" or "Blue", choose your cause and take command of your troops!
"White": you will have to take the advantage quickly at the risk of seeing the Republican forces inexorably strengthen, forcing you into a sinister "Virée de Galerne".
"Blues": time is on your side, resist the first assaults of the "brigands" to then be able to face the hell of the bocage in order to definitively extinguish the insurrection.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Simulation

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Idrottsbragder
description:
The quiz for those who love sports. Questions about the biggest swedish and international sports events,
accomplishments now and then, athletes, records and moments to remember from the world of sports.

Contains 60 questions and a category tile to make this an expansion for the big Bezzerwizzer games.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kamigami Battles: HP Lovecraft promo
description:
Promo handed at at origins 2021.

ACT Reduce the cost of moon artifacts by 1 diamond this turn
ACT Draw 1 Card
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Dwarf Mine: Barrier Mountains
description:
The Barrier Mountains are the site of a strange falling star from years ago! Your mine will strike the earth at the Barrier Mountains, and uncover the secrets of an ancient artifact buried deep below. Will you discover its secrets? Or will your mine fall to the odd creatures that inhabit these mountains? Play to find out, as your mine tells its story!

Barrier Mountains is an expansion to Dwarf Mine (the Dwarf Mine base game is required to play).

Like Dwarf Mine, Barrier Mountains is a game played by drawing a mine on graph paper. On your turn, you will first draw (dig) rooms, hallways, and ladders for your mine! Rooms will benefit your mine, and hallways and ladders let you reach other areas of your mountain.

After drawing, you will make two dice rolls - a treasure roll, and a combat roll. These rolls determine what treasure you find, and what creatures you may encounter in the mountain - after all, mining is dangerous business!

Each mine made has a story, and every story has a beginning, middle, and sadly, an end. Your game ends when your population reaches 0. By the end of the game, you’ll have created rich and unique history for your mine – no two games are the same!

Players are getting VP during the game and trying to see how many VP they can get each time they play. Kind of like a high score.

Barrier Mountains expands on this experience, by offering a sci-fi style of gameplay, which includes:
A brand new Dwarf Mine map
4 new rooms for your Dwarf Mine
4 new final bosses to fight
4 new Treasure Tables (one for each mine level)
4 new Combat Tables (one for each mine level)
New mechanics unique to this map

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Day at the Races
description:
The horses are lined up and under Starter's Orders... and they're OFF!

Now all you can do is watch and shout encouragement as the mighty steeds thunder around the track, racing towards the finish line. Will you have backed the winner?
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bye-Bye Black Sheep: 2022 Promo card – Heidelbaer
description:
Heidelbaer:
If this card is drawn every player gives all his hand cards to the player sitting left to him.

name: Loot Your Brain: Das Videospiele-Quiz
description:
Loot Your Brain - Das Videospiele-Quiz is a quiz game about video games for 2 – 4 players. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the last field with a lot of knowledge about video games, clever tactical playing of the lootbox-cards and a little luck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Party Game, Trivia, Video Game Theme

name: Wreck
description:
Wreck is a two player card game of strategy and cunning. The goal is to be the first to at least 21 points at the end of your turn. Each turn, a player can draw a card or play a card (either as points or as an effect). Players can prevent their opponent from winning by playing cards to attack: capturing or removing cards.

—description from the designer

name: At the Edge of Dreams
description:
In At the Edge of Dreams, you play as the dreamer, wandering through a land beyond conscience, and encountering good and bad things.
Every sign you find and bring to focus while sleeping can be useful in your quest, but only if you don't get restless, or take too much time.
Can you control your dream landscape enough to achieve a lucid dream?

Gameplay

You start with a few tiles/cards on the table, and 3 stacks of new tiles/cards to the side.
Tiles/cards are double-sided. One side is a "dream", the other is a "vital sign".
Each turn you must play 1 tile onto your dream. You decide which side the tile will be played on, but only get to see the "dream" side before deciding.
You must bring "vital signs" into focus by placing adjacent dreams that match the sign requirements.
If you have too many vital signs of the same kind, you become restless, and those signs are removed, causing some dreams to become signs, which in turn can cause restlessness.
If you run out of tiles from two stacks or from the play area, you wake up and lose.
You win by achieving a lucid dream by bringing all 6 different vital signs into focus.


—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Hush: Four Points
description:
June 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

Map postcard: Four Points
Character card: Wildfeet
Nocturnal Creature card: Bazoo
Spirit card: Treasure Spirit
Structures card: Anvil / Net

name: Final Strike
description:
Final Strike is a competitive deck forging game, where players strategize for position, fighting for the glory of defeating enemies and earning the glory that comes with dealing - the Final Strike.

All players start with the same starting deck, and will shuffle and draw a hand of 5 cards to begin the game. On any given players turn, players MUST play one weapon on their turn - dealing that weapons damage to a monster and collecting that much blood from their target (knowing that every 4 points of blood will be turned into 1 point of Glory at the end of the game, and the player with the most glory at the end of the game being the winner!)

The player can choose to play a stronger weapon that deals more damage, or use a "Magic Hammer" that deals only 1 damage, in order to forge a weapon from their discard pile, destroying it and gaining a new more powerful weapon from the blacksmith - a randomized market of weapons, ranging from strong re-occurring played effects, ongoing field abilities, or the tactics to deal extra damage when that weapon is shuffled from a discard pile back into their deck!

While dealing damage is one way to victory, true 'glory' can be found by dealing the 'Final Strike', aka removing the last point of blood from an enemy - earning the reward listed on the bottom of that foe.

The game progress over three 'Act"s with each act ending when the boss for that act is defeated - where as all players will then wash off all their blood (converting them into glory at that time.)

After the Act 3 boss has been defeated and the final rewards have been tallied - the player with the most glory, is deemed the winner of Final Strike!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Number, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Chaining, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Kill Steal, Market, Team-Based Game

name: Cheese Factory
description:
Choose a Chef (each with their own special ability, build cheese machines, collect ingredients to make the cheese and burn down your competitors factories with cheese fires!

Manage your hand of ingredients and build the most effective cheese factory to be the first player to make 20 points worth of cheese.

Another fun Jason Anarchy Games and Tiny Snek Comics team up.

name: FUSION: Clan War
description:
FUSION: Clan War is a SciFi 3X Roll'n'write game centring around space combat in asteroid fields. Each round, players gather dice based on their expansions; roll the dice and take turns running commands. They can research technology, mine for resources, build ships and bases, move between asteroids, attack each other, and gain prestige. Destroy your opponent's bases or get to 20 Prestige to win the game!

-description from designer
categories: Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Set-up

name: Warhammer: The Horus Heresy – Liber Hereticus Traitor Legiones Astartes Army Book
description:
The Space Marine Legions of the 31st Millenium field a diverse and formidable range of genetically-enhanced warriors and advanced war machines, superior to any other military force in the galaxy. As an Age of Darkness falls across the stars and the fires of rebellion rage out of control, the armies that were used to forge the Imperium turn upon each other in an apocalyptic civil war – the Horus Heresy.

Of the eighteen Space Marine Legions, fully half have betrayed their oaths. Defiant servants of the Warmaster, these Space Marines gather strength to overthrow the Emperor and claim the Throneworld of Terra. In the turmoil of the Horus Heresy, the Traitor armies unleash powers and ambitions beyond mortal reckoning, waging bitter war against their former brothers – those that still cling to their oaths and stand by the Emperor. By the determination and fury of these rebellious warriors will the fate of the Imperium, and that of humanity itself, be decided.

This book is an essential guide for anyone who wants to command a Traitor Legiones Astartes force in Warhammer: The Horus Heresy. It contains all of the rules you need to field every unit and formation available to Traitor forces, from core units and weapons shared by every Space Marine Legion to specialist rules for each of the Traitor Legions – including Rites f War, unique wargear, signature units, and their legendary Primarchs.

Inside this 352-page hardback book, you'll find:


Rules and unit profiles covering every unit, weapon, and piece of wargear available to the Traitor Legiones Astartes in Warhammer: The Horus Heresy
Legion-specific special rules, Warlord Traits, Reactions, Rites of War, wargear, unit profiles, and unique characters for each of the Traitor Legions: the Emperor's Children, Iron Warriors, Night Lords, World Eaters, Death Guard, Thousand Sons, Sons of Horus, Word Bearers, and Alpha Legion
Profiles for each of the Traitor Primarchs: Fulgrim, Perturabo, Konrad Curze, Angron, Mortarion, Magnus the Red, Horus the Warmaster, Lorgar Aurelian, and Alpharius
A visual showcase for each Traitor Legion, containing heraldry markings, colour schemes for infantry and vehicles, and a small gallery of stunning miniatures photography


—description from the publisher
categories: Civil War, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Novel-based, Religious, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Bias, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Force Commitment, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Order Counters, Physical Removal, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Claim: Awakeners
description:
Alternate faction that can be added to Claim or Claim 2.

After phase 1, shuffle the discarded cards and form a second deck. If you win a trick with an Awakener in phase 2, you draw a card from the second deck and place it in your Score Pile.

name: Astronautas
description:
The players are young Astronauts and they have the important mission to visit unknown planets and make contact with their inhabitants.
They depart from Earth, and by rolling dices, they start the journey. On each planet visited they need to learn the typical gestures of each native civilization.
During the journey, our travelers can find intriguing space curiosities.
The Astronaut who manages to return to Earth first will be the the winner
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle of St. Louis Game
description: Battle of St. Louis is a low to moderate complexity tactical wargame covering the British / Native American attack on St. Louis during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Spanish and the other player commands the British.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: ZEL'LoTE
description:
A game of strategy, tactics, and fate.

A two player game in which players take turns moving, attacking, and defending, in an attempt to move their 'Zealot' across the battleground, while preventing their opponent from doing the same.

Five heroes are available to help the Zealot reach it's goal. Each is able to perform the same, simple attacks, but each also has a unique ability they bring to the battle. But be warned: Only four units (per player) may be on the battlefield at a time, and only a Zealot can win the game.

Combining positional strategy, with a card based attack/resource system, ZEL'LoTE is a game that is never the same game twice. Strategy, tactics, and fate; all will play a hand in victory, but when it comes right down to it, you'll probably need a miracle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Impulse Movement, Induction, Moving Multiple Units, Multi-Use Cards, Physical Removal, Variable Set-up

name: 10 Days Before Christmas
description:
It's December 15th, Christmas is almost upon us, but the house is not ready to celebrate yet!
The tree is in its place ... but it's bare!

In these 10 days you will have to decorate your tree in the best possible way, filling it with lights and balls to make it the most beautiful in the city!
But it won't be easy ... as it has to shine the same colors both night and day, the balls you place on the tree will have the same color of the light in that spot.
Remember not to close the curtains! If Santa sees a ball he likes, he will reward you with gifts and decorations!

The game consists of placing the various Christmas lights tiles on the tree.
Depending on the predominant color on each single intersection of the various triangles, players will be able to place balls of a color, ornaments for the room or receive gifts from Santa Claus. All this will allow players to earn points to win the match.

Who will be able to make the most beautiful tree?
We will find out only after unwrapping the gifts!

—description from the designer

name: Kamigami
description:
In this game you will play as god, create world, send people there and make them happy.

First of all, every player chooses random god card and gets several world cards. Then player during turn can extend common world with card or make human born or move human to another world card that can change mood. The winner is the god with better mood of his people.

—description from the designer

name: Hussars and Tripods
description:
Rules for miniatures covering the “historical” War of the Worlds Martian invasion of Earth. The game is designed for fast play. Some changes were made to the Martian capabilities described in the H. G. Wells novel to make the game competitive. Martians are limited in their supply of Black Gas and cannot simply fire at every copse insight.

One miniature stand represents one Martian tripod, one infantry company, one cavalry troop or one artillery battery.

name: Drop Pods
description:
Drop Pods is a roll and write, print and play, solo player, tabletop game. You will need two six sided dice, a pencil, the rule book, contract and map.

The world has changed….

These are dark times. The world is being battered by an alien threat. We did not know what to call it at first but now it is known as Pod Fall. A wave of unidentified objects, hundreds of thousands of pods, carried by a solar current, struck the planet atmosphere and rained down upon the lands. Where they came from nobody knows but it was soon clear that the pods carried aggressive alien creatures bent upon terraforming the world in their own image. To our horror the pods were too numerous to repel, the outer shells hard to crack and the aliens within monstrously difficult to fight. But they had one vulnerability. They take time to hatch and so traps can be set up around the pods and as they emerge, they are triggered, and the aliens would have an unexpected and often lethal welcome to our world.

The fight back began. There were too many pods for the military to destroy by themselves though and the tide turned against us. So, the general public came forward and formed Pod Task Forces, small groups that went in and setup improvised traps around the pods the army did not have the resources to deal with. Even lone fighters embraced what was being called the Human Responsibility. Now the future has a chance as the tide has been slowed as fewer aliens can break free to seed the world in their terrible image. But it is on a knife edge as circumstances could easily turn in the enemy’s favour. So, until enough of the newly emerged aliens have been exterminated, the Pod Task Forces must continue their work for the sake of humanity.

Your Role

You have gathered together some willing volunteers and formed a small Pod Task Force and will be taking available Pod Contracts. These are issued at the town hall by Sarge, the resident Warrant Officer. By setting up the Pod Contracts the government acknowledges that, as well as doing their duty, ordinary civilians should be rewarded for carrying out the trapping of pods and therefore the killing or injuring of aliens. If completed these contracts reward the player with Experience Points and Resources Coupons. The world has come out of a ravaging few months and resources are in short supply and the government needs to distribute these who they can trust to do the job properly.

“We must be seen to be helping the cause and when the time comes, and the world is free of the vile alien grip, then those who have fought the invasion will be rewarded.”
Sarge reminds you of your responsibility.

Aim

The aim of the game is to eradicate as many aliens as possible, through the use of traps, in your allocated Pod Contract location. Pods will attempt to hatch when they sense movement nearby so there is a small window in which to construct the trap and then see it triggered as the alien attempts to confront the intruder. In each session you have one Pod Contract and encounter one location but once cleared there are plenty more and your Pod Task Force can continue on their campaign of eradication. You can keep the same characters and try harder maps as they become more experienced.

—description from the designer

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Challenger
description:
Wave 7

1:100 Scale

World of Tanks Miniatures Game is an easy to learn, quick play game, where you take command of a unit of tanks, seeking to destroy your opponent and secure victory! All the models in World of Tanks come ASSEMBLED, PAINTED, and BATTLE READY!

The British Challenger is the perfect tank-destroyer for an aggressive commander, combining 3 Mobility to quickly relocate and find enemy flanks with 6 Firepower to dish out huge damage, whilst having great staying power with good Survivability and Hit Points. Mounting the Avenger Turret paired with the OQF 32-PDR AT Gun Mk. II turn the Challenger into a glass canon, trading some of its Survivability for even more Firepower for when you really need to blow some tanks up. Additional Upgrades include Smooth Ride (when Shooting, treat this Tank's Movement token as one less when calculating its target's Defense dice), Improved Rotation Mechanism (+2 Initiative during Movement Phase, +1 during the Shooting Phase), and Commander Cayden Tole.

Plastic components.

Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ Challenger Tank
1 Tank Card
5 Upgrade Cards
Online Bonus Code for New & Existing Players
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Burger Bash
description:
It's burger time!

Fill orders by stacking your ingredient cards the fastest. Careful not to make too many mistakes, or your customers won't be pleased...

The player with the highest points earned from their completed orders, wins!

Full rules:


Each player is given 5 each of 10 ingredient cards. They can arrange the ingredient cards in front of themselves however they choose.
The order deck is shuffled and placed face-down in the center of the table. 3. All players take one card from the order deck without looking at the card, and hold the cards above the center of the table face-down. One player takes two cards. The order cards are placed face-up in the center of the table at the same time.
Everyone races to make one of the burger orders from their ingredient piles. All players go simultaneously.
When a player finishes an order they grab the order card from the center of the table and place it on top of their gathered ingredients. They place the stack in their section of the table and flip over a new ingredient card from the order deck.
When building a burger the player should hold the cards for the current burger they are working on in their hands.
Ingredients must be in the same order they are on the order card with the top burger ingredient on top and the bottom ingredient on the bottom of the stack.
Players can make an order from any of the cards that are flipped over, they do not have to make an order from the card they flip over.
If another player completes an order and grabs the order card you were working from, you need to start over with a different order.
Players can only build one burger at a time, but they can always modify their current, un finished burger that is in their hand.
Once a player picks up an order card for their burger, the player cannot modify that burger anymore.
