A player can grab any face-up order card whether or not their burger fulfills the order. If it doesn’t fulfill the order exactly, the player may lose points.

Players continue to make orders until one player runs completely out of one of their ingredients. Once they run out they say DONE and everyone must stop what they are doing immediately.
Players now become the customers and move one spot to the left to verify each burger order is correct for that player.

name: Ardennes 1944-45
description:
Ardennes 1944

System: Great Battles 1939-45 (WB-95)

Complexity: medium

Scale: Regiment

Boards: 2 × 50/20 cm

Scenarios: 4

Description: The last German major offensive of the western front was a Hitler’s poker move. In desperate attempt to recreate the 1940 success, German armored divisions attacked Americans in Ardennes, fighting their way to cross the river Meuse and to capture Antwerp. But despite the initial successes, Germans failed to capture Bastogne and some other key points. With Allies reinforcements coming every day, German offensive was stopped, even the use of the 150th Armored Brigade, armed with the captured US equipment, couldn’t change it. Game for the players who like risky, daring maneuvers and desperate attacks.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: I'm Survivor
description: Players must consume water and food every day to keep their characters alive. To do this, you must collect as many supplies as possible during the day and exchange supplies with other players to ensure that your characters are fully viable. And when relief comes, supplies are needed to raise the priority of rescue.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fighting, Negotiation
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: LÆST
description:
LÆST ("READ") is a game for everybody who loves literature. Mostly about Danish literature from present times and 100 years back, but LÆST also reaches further back and further out in the world. LÆST contains questions about everything from the poets of avant-garde to the biographies of sports idols and treats all books with respect - and lack thereof - for the world of literature is not only intelligent and exciting - it can also be petty, elitist and banal. READ is for young and old, and the really old can join in too!

Everyone gets a piece that starts in the start field, and the one whose first name comes first in the alphabet starts.

You roll the die, which goes from 1-3, and move the number of spaces rolled, then you have to answer a category's question, all depending on which place you landed on.

If you answer correctly, you get to roll and move again. If you answer incorrectly, the turn goes on to the next player.

If you land on a question field, the other players jointly decide which category to answer before they have read the question on the card. If you answer correctly, you must move an opponent two steps back and get a roll and move again. If you answer incorrectly, you take two steps back.

If you land on a hypnosis field, the journey continues to the next player.

There are four different categories of questions:
Forfatterliv (Authors life), Set og Hørt (Seen and Heard), Rundt om bogen (Around the book), and LÆST (READ where the start of a book is read aloud).

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Lakota Language Game: Elk in the House
description:
Stop the animals from entering your house and get the animals in your opponent’s house! Open other players' house doors, play rooms and matching animals on your opponents' homes, play closed doors on your own rooms, and use traps to remove animals from your house. The last round begins when the last card is drawn. Whoever has the least animals in their house wins!

Learn: Rooms of the house, animal names, basic conversation phrases, immersive group conversation.

name: Roundabouts
description:
Roundabouts is a 2-4 player tile-laying card game. Players take turns drawing and placing square cards to create a grid of winding and charming roundabouts.

While most cards are quarters of circles with a few arrows here and there, some cards have some extra text on them that increases (or decreases) their scoring power.

The goal of the game is to score the most points out of everyone else when the game ends. Points are gained by finishing a roundabout.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Explosion in the Laboratory
description:
Explosion in the Laboratory is a push-your-luck 27 card game where you mix chemicals to create valuable compounds and try not to cause a major explosion!

In Explosion in the Laboratory, you are all chemists mixing compounds in an experimental laboratory. Caution! Being careless could cause disaster. A fire would be unfortunate, as there is a library not too far away...

This is a 27 card game set in the Fire in the Library universe that has the same press your luck and strategy from the base game, but in a small portable science-y version!

During the game players will take turns trying to score points by following a set order of phases: Planning, Mixing Compounds, Scoring Beakers, and triggering Unstable Mixtures.

The planning phase allows players to play 1 time use special ability cards (process cards) that can effect scoring for your turn. Mixing compounds has players laying out chemical cards from the deck to find out what chemicals they must mix based on the fire level in the laboratory (the higher the fire level grows the more volatile the mixtures become). The chemicals mixed can be placed in your available flasks for the turn and the process is repeated until you decide to stop to score or an explosion is triggered by an unstable mixture with certain combos of chemicals in your flasks. The more chemicals you can safely mix the more points you are able to score, but your luck may run short when the wrong chemicals get mixed causing an explosion (and ending your turn without scoring).

Beaker cards sitting in the middle of the table act as a game timer and indicate the fire level and scoring potential of mixtures. As players score beakers and at the end of each round beaker cards rotate changing the point values of the chemicals you've mixed while also moving it closer to the end of the game as once a beaker reaches it's boiling point it will bring an explosive and abrupt end to the game. Whichever player earned the most points throughout the game wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Basho
description:
A love letter to the fascinating sport of Sumo, Basho is a push and throw trick-taking card game for two players. It mixes traditional trick-taking gameplay with modern card powers and position control.

You and your opponent collide with the simultaneous reveal of a single card to determine who takes the lead. From that point on, each trick's winner pushes the token closer to its loser. Use power cards to change the trump suit or dodge the trick completely to dominate within the arena.

There are three ways to win the round: keep the token in your opponent's area for 1 point, push the token out for two points, or win by throw for 3 points. Go for the throw with caution! Failing the throw means a big loss in positional control.

Multiple rounds are played, and the first person to earn 5 points or more wins the game.

-description from designer

name: BÁTR
description:
In BÁTR, players will build warbands of Viking warriors and use them to raid and conquer local islands.

BATR is a game of area control and warfare where players will need to strategize and choose which island they should raid and in which order. They will also need to balance gold for the best outcome. The game comes in a small box and is easy to set up.

-description from designer

name: Ladrón de Frutas
description:
Ladrón de Frutas ("Fruit Thief") is a simple and straightforward game for family and friends, from 2 to 8 players. The main objective is to gather the specific fruits that appear in one of the game cards.

Ladrón de frutas es un juego simple y sencillo para la familia y amigos, de 2 a 8 jugadores. El objetivo principal es reunir las frutas concretas que aparecen en una de las cartas de juego.

name: Patou'che
description:
In Patou'che!, each player embodies a shepherd who dreams of having the largest flock of sheep. But watch out for the prowling wolf, he also likes sheep, but to eat them! In order to protect their sheep, players can count on their faithful sheepdogs: the Patous. A cooperative mode also allows everyone to play together against the wolf.

On a player’s turn, they can roll the dice up to 3 times, keeping at least 1 die after each roll. The wolf side causes the wolf to move, the sheep side wins a sheep, and the sheepdog side wins a patou. Once the result of the dice suits the player, or after a maximum of 3 throws, the action of each die is applied.

As soon as a player has 6 Sheep cards, each of the other players plays one last time. The player with the most Sheep on all his cards is declared the winner. In case of a tie, the player with the fewest Sheepdog cards wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Dwarf Mine: Magestone Mountain
description:
Deep below Magestone Mountain there lies a source of great power. Leylines of magestone wind their way through the stone of the mountain! Your mine will dig deep as you gather the two types of magestone – pure and corrupted – and learn the arcane spells needed to unleash their power. Will this magic bring glory and prestige to your mine? Or will the dangerous elementals and power-hungry wizards that roam deep in the mountain spell your doom? Play to find out, as your mine tells its story!

Magestone Mountain is an expansion to Dwarf Mine (the Dwarf Mine base game is required to play).

Like Dwarf Mine, Magestone Mountain is a game played by drawing a mine on graph paper. On your turn, you will first draw (dig) rooms, hallways, and ladders for your mine! Rooms will benefit your mine, and hallways and ladders let you reach other areas of your mountain.

After drawing, you will make two dice rolls - a treasure roll, and a combat roll. These rolls determine what treasure you find, and what creatures you may encounter in the mountain - after all, mining is dangerous business!

Each mine made has a story, and every story has a beginning, middle, and sadly, an end. Your game ends when your population reaches 0. By the end of the game, you’ll have created rich and unique history for your mine – no two games are the same!

Players are getting VP during the game and trying to see how many VP they can get each time they play. Kind of like a high score.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ダービージョッキー (Derby Jockey)
description:
In ダービージョッキー (Derby Jockey), players will complete in 4 trial races, building up to a final derby race.

The game includes cards corresponding to different horses with speed, strength, and stamina numbers; cards that show special abilities that can be acquired; and cards that give horses a boost.

Most turns involve a player rolling a die and advancing that many spaces; players may use "leg" cards to increase their die, but must declare how many they are using prior to rolling the die.

The player who wins the derby race wins.

name: SOKO Unvergessen: Fall 1 – Emilia Horvath
description:
Join Inspector Karl Klugmann's team and investigates the murder of the young student Emilia Horvath in the first criminal case of SOKO Unforgotten
Who has a motive, who has an alibi? Use the police portal P.I.C.A. to question suspects, write e-mails and make phone calls or look up vehicle registrations
Research on the Internet, solve puzzles and draw conclusions from new and old findings. But remember - there are many ways to solve the case and your approach will affect which new clues you receive...
For a full gaming experience you need internet access on a laptop, pad or smartphone
No mandatory entry of personal data required
1 to 6 players: inner from 16+
approx. 2 to 3 hours playing time

Suitable for the deaf
NOTE: The game is designed to respond to player actions and trigger individual actions.
This means the game can only be played once.

name: SundayQuest Adventures: Volume 2
description:
This small print expansion pack includes 12 Quests that were originally released on he Ye Olde Inn's companion Facebook group.

It continues where Wizards of Morcar left off. It is assumed that players will have completed and be familiar with Kellar's Keep, Return of the Witch Lord, Against the Ogre Horde and Wizards of Morcar expansion packs to the original game. On occasion the Quests will also dabble with elements taken from the U.S. version of the game system's two additional expansion packs: The Mage in the Mirror and the Frozen Horror.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy

name: SundayQuest Adventures: Volume 1
description:
This expansion pack includes 12 Quests that were originally released on the Ye Olde Inn's companion Facebook group.

HeroQuest: Adventures continues where Wizards of Morcar left off. It is assumed that players will have completed and be familiar with Kellar's Keep, Return of the Witch Lord, Against the Ogre Horde and Wizards of Morcar expansion packs to the original game. On occasion the Quests will also dabble with elements taken from the U.S. version of the game system's two additional expansion packs: The Mage in the Mirror and The Frozen Horror.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Role Playing

name: Supersystem: Showdown!
description:
Showdown is an exciting supplement for SuperSystem that includes Quick-Start Rules for new players to give the game a try, new maneuvers, a complete power list including new and revised powers, four new scenarios, over twenty new characters to add to your SuperSystem games, and conversion notes to use them in the HERO System and M & M Superlink. Grab your SuperFigs and start saving the world today.

Includes: a set of quick-start rules, new and revised rules, new and revised powers, additional scenarios, and new Four-Color universe characters with stats for two popular Superhero RPGs.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: DUO: Was passt?
description:
Learning German easily and playfully? This is now possible with the pairs of cards from "DUO - What fits?". Players have to concentrate, memorize words and react quickly - but luck also plays a role with surprise cards.

The ideal fun game for all German learners, young and old, from level A2.

The game contains 2 decks of 100 cards each. In the three variants of the game, trick-taking, placement and memory, the aim is to identify and collect matching pairs of cards. Jokers, different point values ​​and the hourglass bring additional dynamics into play. The player who has the highest number of points with the cards collected at the end wins.


The entertaining card game for learning German with three exciting game variants.
Versatile language learning effect thanks to 9 content categories: opposites, colors, parts of speech, image-text pairs, compound words, comparisons, regional terms, idioms, synonyms
Language skills, luck, concentration and some tactics lead to success


The game materials:

Game instructions with three game variants
200 playing cards
Hourglass (15 sec)


—description from publisher (translated)
mechanics: Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Speed Matching, Trick-taking, Variable Set-up

name: Victory at Sea: German Altmark Tanker
description:
The oil these tankers provided proved to be the life blood for nations and their armed forces, and often represented the single most important ships within convoys.

Length: 500 feet
Displacement: 7250 tons
Speed: 16 knots
Crew: 50
Commissioned: 1939

-description from the publisher's product info card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Postcard Coral Sea
description:
Micro game necessitated by postcard format.
11 day and night turns. SECRET Allied code-breaking possibility to get Yorktown as well as Lexington fleet carriers.
Neat Port Moresby landing rule: number of surviving (of 11) Japanese transports plus UnDamaged shore-bombarding Japanese cruiser units roll 2 dice to see if they take it. Battle can continue in following game turn.
Japanese Surprise advantage possible if Surface Combat happens and is at night.
HORRIBLE weather 50% contact capability even in same hex! Air ops: blind 1st wave airstrike, PBY&Mavis Recon, 2nd wave airstrike, with possibility of 1st wave catching an enemy 2nd wave on deck.
High Altitude bombers CAN be risked at Low Altitude.
It's a little monster. }:-)
Diminuation of Coral Sea: Naval Battle for Australia, May 1942 minigame which I have yet to finish.
Plays in about an hour. This one can go extremely either way, and fast.

And anyone is free to print this or my other 3 (so far) postcard games off in postcard format ... as long as my copyright statement and the Dedication are retained ... to mail/give to family and friends.

(Of course, for your own personal copy you will want to photocopy-enlarge the components ... the front at both A4 (for the units) and A3 (for the chart) and the back/rules as large as you need them. :-) )

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: The Little Flower Shop Duel
description:
Spend a relaxing day creating a beautiful display on the shelves in your little flower shop. Carefully arrange bouquets in pretty vases, place them on your shelves, and add cute little knickknacks. Make your shop the envy of all other florists with the prettiest display!

In The Little Flower Shop Duel, you and your opponent compete to take flowers, vases, and knickknacks used to create your shop display. The game is based on the original card-drafting game, The Little Flower Shop, in which players choose flowers, vases, and hanging plants to decorate their shop window.

In this BYOP (Bring Your Own Pencil) game, players choose items from the warehouse and use those to fill their shops. Players are not only trying to collect sets of flowers to match certain vases, but some of the flowers will become more valuable as the game progresses.

—description from designer

name: Tennessee Waltz
description:
A light, tactical abstract game played with stones on the intersections of a triangular grid in the shape of a hexagon. Complexity varies with board size. The goal is to form pairs of stones and keep them from merging.

The board starts empty, with players alternating in placing a stone of their color onto an empty node of the board.

When the placement forms a pair, the player chooses a grid direction in which to move the pair, pushing all the stones in front of them one step. However, the move must not cause any of the opponent's stones to be pushed off the board, nor may either stone of the pair, itself, move directly off the board. (Other friendly stones can be pushed off by the move, if desired.) The moving player becomes the leader if, after the push, he now has more pairs of stones than the opponent.

The game ends when both players elect to pass, or when the player who doesn't have the leader's token has no way to form a new pair in the future. Then the leader wins. Playing time is shown for an order 4 board, which is the smallest playable size.

—description from the designer

name: Monopoly: Edizione Rimini
description: Edition of the historic board game set in the charming Italian city of Rimini.

name: Fire in the Steppe: 49th Mountain Corps
description:
The massive tank battle at Brody-Dubno in June 1941 included the two divisions of the German 49th Mountain Corps and the Adolf Hitler Life Guard Motorized Regiment of the Waffen SS party militia. These battles were not included in Fire in the Steppe, based on the clashes at Brody and Dubno, since Fire in the Steppe doesn’t include pieces for German mountain troops or SS.

49th Mountain Corps is a Campaign Study, a short book adding 10 scenarios based on these battles to Fire in the Steppe.

To play those 10 scenarios (which come with two battle games, too), you’ll also need Fire in the Steppe, Parachutes Over Crete and Slovakia’s War.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Radio Game for Little Folks
description:
This children's variation on Pachisi was released to take advantage of the trend in radio-based entertainment. Unlike Ludo, it uses two dice but only provides players with two pieces each. Up to four players compete to be the first to get their pieces - colored metal "Radio Horns" - all the way "Home," capturing opponents whenever they can and forcing them to start again.

The player colors correspond to real radio stations of the period: Blue is KOA Denver; Black is KHJ Los Angeles; Yellow is WEAF New York; and Red is the (still very famous) WGN Chicago.

name: Carcassonne: Promo Carcassonne Spain 2022 (fan-expansion)
description:
This set consists of 4 tiles with 3 mini expansions:


Carcassonne Spain 22 QR-code Promo tile.
The Bear and the Strawberry Tree.
Alcázar of Segovia.


These tiles were given to the 2022 national Carcassonne Championship participants.


Carcassonne Spain 22 QR-code Promo (1 tile): allows drawing a second tile to choose one, and placing a meeple on an adjacent tile. The QR-code on the tile leads to the Carcassonne Spain website where you can download the rules for these expansions.
The Bear and the Strawberry Tree (1 tile): It comes with 7 wooden cubes to be used as inn markers that provide extra points to roads and the cities connected to them.
Alcázar of Segovia (2 tiles): It provides points to the players with the majority in its vicinity, when fully surrounded.

name: Quabble
description:
Quabble is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white. The board squares alternate between a light and a dark color in a checkered fashion. On odd-sized boards, the center square must be light-colored.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform exactly one of the following actions:


Place a stone of your color on an empty light square and on each adjoining dark square that you now control. You control a dark square if your stones occupy more than half of its adjacent light squares.



Place a stone of your color on an empty dark square that you contest. You contest a dark square if your stones occupy exactly half of its adjacent light squares.


You win by completing a chain of interconnected stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color. Two stones are connected if they occupy orthogonally adjacent squares or diagonally adjacent dark squares.

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.



VariantsQualos: On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty light square, or place a stone of your color on an empty dark square that you contest or control, or flip an enemy stone on a dark square that you control. To flip a stone is to replace it with a stone of the opposite color. Controlling and contesting are based on orthogonal lines of sight rather than on mere adjacencies, and stones on dark squares also count towards them.

Fast Quabble: On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty light square and on each adjoining dark square that you now control. You control a dark square if your stones occupy at least half of its adjacent light squares.

Conquare: Play on an uncheckered square board. Vertices take the place of light squares, and spaces take the place of dark squares. Two stones are connected if they occupy orthogonally adjacent spaces or a space and an adjacent vertex.

Fast Conquare: Conquare with the control rule from Fast Quabble.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Panzer Grenadier: Lithuania's Iron Wolves – Legend of the Iron Wolf
description:
In Panzer Grenadier: Lithuania’s Iron Wolves we told the stories of four campaigns that never happened, stories of Lithuanian resistance to Polish, German and Soviet aggression. In the actual events, the out-numbered and out-gunned Lithuanians did not offer armed resistance. Lithuania suffered brutal German and Soviet occupation anyway.

Legend of the Iron Wolf is a Campaign Study that continues the story with two more campaigns that never actually happened, both involving the Lithuanian Army. Campaign Five sends Lithuanian troops into battle against the Soviets in Operation Barbarossa. Campaign Six has them fighting the Germans in June 1941. In both cases, you get to use all of those tank pieces on the Lithuania’s Iron Wolves sheet. Each campaign of course wraps up with a battle game.

Two play all ten scenarios, you’ll need Lithuania’s Iron Wolves as well as maps from Fire in the Steppe, and pieces from Fire in the Steppe, 1940: The Fall of France and Slovakia’s War.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: One and Done
description:
One and Done is a casual card game with a dash of mischief and unpredictability. Players take turns giving one-word clues to get their team to complete as many fill-in-the-blank phrases as possible in 60 seconds. Clues should be chosen wisely, because players can only say one word and their team will only get one guess. But beware! At any point the opposing team can play 1 of 16 unique Set Back cards. These are challenges and disadvantages the other team must endure. They might be things like: erase the points you earned in the last round, steal your best player for the rest of the game, or make you dance non-stop while giving clues. The first team to survive the sabotage and correctly guess 21 fill-in-the-blank phrases wins.

One clue. One guess. Don't go _______!

—description from the publisher

name: Boundary T20 Cricket
description:
Print and play cricket replay game which uses three dice and cards for the batsmen and a chart for everything else, principally bowler economy, how wickets fell, which fielder made any catches etc.

Batsmen are graded from 11 to 55 and the card for their grade is used to determine how many runs they score / whether there's a wicket possibility for each delivery (roll of the dice). It takes under an hour per innings if you record full batsmen/bowler details throughout.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sewerville Shootout
description:
A Laserburn scenario featuring 3 map cards, an 8 page umpire folio and a 4 page player folio.

Or to boldly go where no man has gone before.

This scenario is set in an old complex of sewers, code-named "Sewerville". The ends of the main access tunnels collapsed ages ago, sealing this area off. No attempt was made to rescue the workers and robots that were trapped, and it was not long before they were forgotten.

Recently though, it was discovered that the "Android Liberation Front" has its headquartesr down there. The Imperial inquisition has succeeded in getting one of their agents accepted by the ALFists, but the only information he has been able to sneak out is that they are camped in the lower level of the system, and that a large scale attack will soon be launched by them.

Rather than risk their agent being discovered by the Frontists by bringing in Inquisition agents from all over the city, they have decide to risk the lives of an expendable group of mercenaries. Of course, the question of payment rears its ugly head, and rather than chop it off (the usual Inquisition tactic), the mecenaries will be paid.

- from the players manual
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Role Playing, Square Grid

name: Quick Urban Integrated Combat Kriegsspiel
description:
Quick Urban Integrated Combat Kriegsspiel (QUICK) is a semi-abstract Tactical level board-wargame about opposing modern-day forces engaging in kinetic conflict in a large city. In the game, players take on the role of Division or Group Army commanders, vying to gain control of critical terrain within the city known as Objectives. To succeed, they must successfully manage Enablers, the array of skilled troops and machinery that exist to support and augment the power of the main Maneuver Units in the forces they command and maneuver these units for victory.

The game is played in rounds. Each round both players will draw or select colored cubes and then take turns using them to perform actions. The color of a cube determines what can be done, and with what unit. During play Enablers will be brought onto the battlefield or returned to it by being allocated to larger Maneuver Units, and these reinforced Maneuver Units will engage the enemy assisted by the special powers and abilities of their allocated Enablers.

The player who is best able to exploit the mechanisms and timing of movement, combat and appropriate design of task forces will win. The game system also permits construction of interesting scenarios.

—description from designer

name: Glyph Spooks
description:
A card game played over several hands where you are trying to empty your hand first.
Which card you can play depends on which color card was just played, causing an ever-changing situation. This fluidity is increased by some cards changing some rules of the game.
The player with the fewest points at the end of the game wins!

name: 魔女ハンターパニック！(Witch Hunter Panic!)
description:
This is a game based on the basic concept of the anime "魔法少女まどか☆マギカ"(Puella Magi Madoka Magica) that was broadcast in Japan in January 2011. In this game you are a magical girl who fights together against the root of evil in the world, the evil witch.
But in the process of fighting, the magical girls will not be able to bear the mental torment, the trauma of the spirit, the body and mind will gradually become filthy, and become the worst enemy of the magical girls - the witch. As the approach approaches, the companions of the magical girls also decrease one by one, and in the end, will the remaining magical girls be able to successfully defeat Witch Night, or will the witches eventually devour the souls of all magical girls?

—description from the publisher (translated)

這是一個以2011年1月在日本播放的動畫"魔法少女まどか☆マギカ"為基本概念設計的遊戲。在這個遊戲中你是一位魔法少女，共同與世界上的罪惡根源，也就是邪惡的魔女進行戰鬥。
但是在戰鬥的過程中魔法少女們會受不了精神的折磨，精神的創傷，身心漸漸變得污穢不堪，而變成魔法少女們最大的敵人--魔女，在瓦爾普魯吉思夜到來的日子不斷迫近之下，魔法少女們的同伴也一個一個的減少，而最終到底是剩下的魔法少女們能夠成功擊倒魔女之夜，還是魔女們最終可以吞噬所有魔法少女的靈魂呢？

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Space Crusade: New rules
description:
These new rules for Space Crusade allow you to take on the Alien player equipped in the Imperium‘s dreaded Terminator armour or the head of a squad of Space Marine Scouts or mob of Ork Boyz!

If you‘re the Alien player, you can now include Genestealer Hybrids or awesome Tyranid Warriors in your Army!

To use the rules you‘ll need the appropriate miniatures from the Warhammer 40,000 range.

Originally published in White Dwarf 134. Includes Order and Equipment cards needed to use Ork Boyz instead of Space Marines.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Hunting Season: Rocky Mountain Edition
description:
Get geared up for the ultimate hunting board game, Hunting Season! Filled with twists, turns, true to life scenarios, fun, excitement and lots of laughs is what's in store for all who dare to play!

Your adventure starts at the campground when you choose your weapon and the kind of animal you want to go after. Find your way to the general store to gear up before you head out. Did you remember your camo, your cover scent and your binoculars? How about your four wheeler? Maybe you'll need it, or maybe you won't. Either way, it's a wild adventure just getting to the hunting ground! Once there, you spot and stalk your animal, and the tension mounts as you move ever closer, but be careful. You might be spotted and miss your chance to take your shot!

Players use a combination of dice and events cards to move and determine their success in hunting their prey. Success is not guaranteed. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: 911 Operator
description:
Compete against other 911 operators to increase your
reputation to be the next in line for promotion! The competition will be hard but beware! Don’t let your ambitions get in the way and let the city fall into chaos.

In this game, players use their units to solve incidents to keep Public Tension in check. The goal is to solve the highest scenario incident (the one in the “III” deck) while keeping the Public Tension from reaching the end. To reach that goal, players recruit units and send them to incident locations to solve them according to their unit’s power.

Each player must keep the Public Tension in check. If things get out of hand and the Public Tension reaches the end, the game ends and all players lose the game. So players should plan, communicate and work together to solve the incidents while racing to collect more reputation to win the game.

—description from the designer

Link to the eponymous video game: 911 Operator
mechanics: Action Points, Hidden Victory Points, Point to Point Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: First Martians: Rescue Team
description:
The MCEI astronauts have received a distress signal. It was sent from somewhere on Mars - the planet they belived to be alone on! Who sent it? Can the rescue mission reach the location on time? Will you succeed in a task on which the future on the Martian mission may depend?

Become a Martian astronaut and feel the flow of the boardgame! "Rescue Team" is a single player gamebook, showing the boardgame's challenges in a brand new way: dwindling resources, tense relations between a closed group of astronauts, the need to make tough decisions.

GO THERE, BE THE MARTIAN RESCUER, AND DISCOVER THE MYSTERY OF THE SIGNAL!

—description from the publisher

The gamebook Rescue team is a single player add-on for First Martians highlighting the challenges in a new way.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Chapter Approved – War Zone Nephilim Grand Tournament Mission Pack
description:
This edition of Chapter Approved is a fantastic addition to the gaming toolbox of any Warhammer 40,000 matched play fan, offering updated ways to muster your armies, secondary objectives for every faction, and missions designed specifically for this season of the game. Whether you're a tournament regular or simply like to ensure your battles are always fought on an even footing, this is the essential supplement for matched play games of Warhammer 40,000.

Inside this 136-page softback book, you'll find:

– Two mission packs, each comprising nine missions each for Incursion and Strike Force battles, each designed to offer a wide array of challenges to players
– Warzone Nephilim secondary objectives, featuring three default secondary objectives for this Grand Tournament Mission Pack, bespoke secondary objectives for every Warhammer 40,000 faction, and a host of general secondary objectives for common use
– Dynamic new rules for allocating and generating Command points, as well as changes to choosing Relics and Warlord Traits
– Guidelines for setting up and playing a matched play or Grand Tournament-level competitive game, including suggested battlefield size, time limit, and how best to determine secondary objectives
– A blank tournament scoring sheet for you to photocopy and use, with an annotated example of how to fill it out
– The full core rules needed for matched play games of Warhammer 40,000, including a glossary and explanation of rare rules, as well as an introduction to the Battle Ready standard of painting for your miniatures

Take your matched play games to new heights with a wide range of secondary objectives for every faction, new rules for Command points, and a range of balanced and competitive missions. Whether you're a seasoned veteran or a newcomer to the exciting world of matched play, Chapter Approved: War Zone Nephilim has something for you.
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Steampunks vs Solarpunks
description:
Imagine a world where punks are in control! But will it be Steampunks or Solarpunks? And what about the Chromepunks and the mysterious Cyberpunks? Battle it out, to see if solar or steam will dominate in this attractive futuristic-themed card game.

Steampunks vs Solarpunks is a game for two to five players aged 7+ which takes about half an hour to play. With a bag that constantly flips to show trumps, the game rewards careful bidding and trick-playing skills.

Each round, once the cards have been dealt, the players start by bidding to indicate the number of tricks they think they'll make. These bids are revealed simultaneously and then the round is played out. Trumps are either 'Steam' or 'Solar'. This can change several times in a round, keeping everyone on their toes. The round-winner is the most accurate bidder, with the Chromepunks used for breaking ties. Up to seven rounds are played in all.

Steampunks vs Solarpunks makes a great 'filler' game for a wide range of ages. Simple to learn, the game-play has surprising depths and keeps everyone in with a chance of winning right to the end.

—description from the publisher

name: QuarterMaster
description:
Box contains 70 square tiles and instructions for two different games to play with them. The edges of the tiles come in 4 different terrains: Farm, Ocean, Beach, and Forest. The terrain of adjacent tiles must match.

The QuarterMaster Game
The tiles are divided evenly among 2 - 4 players. Players take turns adding tiles to the board. Players get extra turns for playing next to multiple existing tiles. The winner is the first player to play all their tiles.

QuarterMaster Solitaire
Removing 6 random tiles, the goal is to form an 8 by 8 square with specific terrains on the outer border. The result is scored by adding the size of the largest contiguous area of each terrain.
mechanics: Matching, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Titans: King's Emissaries
description: Kickstarter exclusive expansion that contains 15 Secret Mission Cards and some tokens. Each Nation gets 3 Objective Cards (emissaries) with their flag, besides the regular Secret Objective cards. Players will try to accomplish them for additional victory points, as well as race to get the special token that will stay with their army on the board. The number of tokens is limited, so the faster you complete 1 of your Nation Objective Cards, the wider choice you have.

name: Una Scurta
description:
Sick of listening to your friends talk about work?

Save your evening with Una Scurtă - 600 cards (until you lend it to someone), exactly like in the show Una Scurtă, but home. And without comedians, but with pizza.

It plays with 3 to 10 players, but seriously, if you had 10 friends, you wouldn't have bought a card game.

Players take turns being judge and playing a black card (which has the premises for the joke) and all other players play a red card simultanously as a punch-line. The judge decides which red card is best and the black card is passed to the winner as a victory point. Play continues clockwise and after everyone has been judge, you play an unseen round. Each player plays a red card without a black one being revealed before. The black card is revealed after and players then vote which card was the funniest one. Play continues in this way for the agreed duration, the player with the most black cards is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ruins of Lorn Keep
description:
“The Lorn Keep was once a magnificent castle that guarded the entrance to a wealthy valley kingdom. The masters of the keep grew rich collecting taxes from the merchants seeking safe passage into the valley. With time, the kingdom fell and the keep along with it. Now the ruins are a popular destination for adventurers and treasure hunters, many of whom are never seen from again.” - Jaden the Elder

Ruins of the Lorn Keep is an easy-to-learn, quick-to-play dungeon crawl. Play a warrior, a thief or a wizard searching for treasure, powerful magical items, and fame. Each character excels at one of the three different dungeon challenge types. Part dungeon crawl, part memory game, Ruins of the Lorn Keep is highly portable and can be played nearly anywhere.

During a player's turn, a card is turned face-up and dice rolled to try and beat a monster or win a treasure. Each card is worth victory points. The first player to 10 points wins.

name: Oh Nutz!
description:
Battle to be the squirrel with the most nutz stashed for winter. But don't drop your nutz!

Each player takes turns rolling the die and drawing cards into their hand. Cards have values for how many nutz they are worth. Try to get as many nutz from your hand into your stash as you can. Or use them for special advantages such as spying, stealing, or making others drop their nutz.

The player with the most nutz wins.

name: Final Fantasy: The Stolen Seed (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
In this Final Fantasy themed expansion, explore some of your favourite locations from the beloved game series.

Level-up your characters, and upgrade your equipment to help complete your mission.

A battle focused scenario, with some puzzles, and other fun events, such as chocobo racing, and more.

A new way to fight: Stagger your foes to stop their attacks.

Encounter foes who have their own unique abilities.

Use the JRPG Backpack to store non-time-stamped items, securing them for the next run.

Do everything you can to retrieve The Stolen Seed.

(Even if you've never played a Final Fantasy game before, I believe you'll still find this to be an enjoyable expansion. For sure, some characters and references will be lost on you, but the game and story as a whole should still make sense as a fun fantasy campaign. No knowledge of Final Fantasy is needed to solve the puzzles or to complete your mission. I'm really interested to hear how opinions differ between those who are familiar with Final Fantasy and those who aren't).

Best of luck Time Agents.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fulbo!
description:
Fulbo! a card game for up to 4 players, in which each player must help their team win by scoring the most points after ten matches.
Matches will be heated, players will get sweaty, and everyone will try to bring those points home.

In Fulbo! players must improve their teams stats, boosting them through players, coaches and stats cards.

But watch out! Because others can try to stop you in your tracks on your way to the top, either by sending you hooligans to cause trouble, injuring your players, creating internal conflicts in your team, or meddling in your matches scoring goals or causing a power outage in the stadium .

Fulbo! The game where no one is booked for excessive celebrations.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Take That

name: D-Day Solitaire
description:
D-DAY SOLITAIRE is a fast-playing roll n' write dice game for one to five players.

The game attempts to recreate the Normandy landings of World War II in a simple yet challenging manner. The design is meant to be a quick, fun, and historical beer & pretzels simulation. There is a map sheet of varying difficulties for each of the five Normandy beaches -- Sword, Juno, Gold, Omaha, and Utah. You play as the Allied D-Day forces that hit the beaches on June 6th, 1944.

In the multi-player variant, each player plays on one of the five beach maps against their own German A.I. opponent. The beach landings vary in difficulty; therefore, "extra points" are awarded based on the beach's level of difficulty in order to achieve a relative balance among all of the beaches. The player who achieves the highest score is declared the winner.

D-Day Solitaire is an entry in the 2022 Wargame Print and Play Game Design Contest

Link to Work-in-Progress thread: [WIP] D-DAY SOLITAIRE (Contest Ready)
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Funkoverse Strategy Game: Squid Game 101
description:
In the Funkoverse Strategy Game, you combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in exciting game scenarios. Each turn, you select one of your characters and perform two actions. Each character has access to basic actions like moving and challenges as well as several unique abilities that may be performed only by spending ability tokens. Funkoverse uses an innovative “cooldown” system — the more powerful the ability, the longer it will take for the ability token to become available again — so players have to spend their ability tokens wisely. Each character in Funkoverse is unique, so players are encouraged to try out different combinations of characters and items in order to discover their favorite synergies and powerful strategies for the different game scenario.

Two characters in one! Includes two character cards with unique abilities so you can play as the faceless Masked Manager, or remove the mask and play as the undercover detective Jun-ho!

When playing as the Masked Manager, stay as still as possible to increase the reach of your attacks!
As the detective Jun-ho, gather Evidence Tokens to power up your abilities!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Goblin Wars
description: Goblin wars is a fantasy miniatures combat game. Players move their units of miniatures around the table, shoot missile weapons and engage in melee. There are rules and stats for many weapons, including gun powder weapons, and for many fantasy creatures. There is a small section covering rules for magic. The goal of the game is to defeat your opponents army. The game is intended for armies of between 75 to 200 miniatures with games lasting 3 to 6 hours.

name: Star Realms: Rise of Empire – Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
Promos sent to Kickstarter backers with the Rise of Empire campaign.

This pack contains 61 Promo Cards, the largest promo pack to-date, for the game Star Realms.

Promo Card List:

3 Plasma Pod
3 Recovery Bot
3 Privateer
3 Freight Rocket
1 Trade Cluster
1 Refitting Station
1 Dorianne's Derelict
1 Defense Satellite
1 Larva Queen
1 Mechlord Green
1 Fleet Marshan Chasteen
1 Fleet President Hintz
2 Scavenging Pod
2 Hunter Bot
2 Imperial Freighter
2 Enforcement Drone
1 Feeder Wurm
1 Data Pirate
1 Support Station
1 Stellar Rig
1 Worker Larva
1 Tech Priest Shirland
1 Lieutenant Brons
1 Chief Engineer Dixon
3 Cluster Pod
3 Guard Bot
3 Watcher
3 Defense Drone
1 Fire Moon
1 Nanobot Armada
1 Merchant Carrier
1 Frontier Fortress
1 Warrior Larva
1 Divine Engineer Piotr
1 Vice Admiral Storm
1 Fleet Manager Moss
1 Battle Cluster
1 Mech Armory
1 Firing Point
1 Shuttle Bay
1 Armada Wurm
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Droga do Nieba
description:
In the game, we go through earthly life and our goal is heaven. We move on the board with meeples using the dice. One by one we go through the sacraments which — as in life — help us grow and mature in faith. There are also bonuses on the board fields that can be obtained by answering questions on religious knowledge. Our movement can be accelerated by the graces of the Holy Spirit or of the Eucharist. When answering questions, we collect good or indulgence cards. There are also saints on the way to heaven, which can make children familiar with the saints.

—description from the publisher

Players take turns by rolling dice and moving their meeples through part of the board representing earthly life. While doing so they need to answer Christianity-related questions and gain positive cards that speed them up or negative ones that slow them down.

Once a player reaches the last judgment the cards gained impact on how many fields (if any!) the player has to cross in the purgatory before finally reaching heaven. While moving within the purgatory players need to do extra tasks.

After the player finally reaches heaven, they keep moving and helping other players reach there as well. The game ends once all players reach heaven in which case, they all win. But should even one of the players show up on the last judgment with a grave sin in their cards they might go to hell instead and the game is lost.
mechanics: Different Dice Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stupefy!: Dobby & Socks
description:
If you take a Dobby and/or Sock card during the Share Rewards phase, place the card(s) in your House’s Box and announce out loud “Dobby” and/or “Sock”.

At the end of the game, add points to your House depending on which cards were added to your House’s Box.
• Sock card only: 0 points.
• Dobby card only: 5 points.
• Dobby and Sock cards: 50 points.

name: Coast To Coast
description:
The race across America is underway! Six cars are competing, but which ones will you support? Play speed cards to boost your chosen racers, but watch out for the police. Speeding cars will be booked! The first car to reach Los Angeles wins the race and scores the most points. The player who backed the most successful collection of cars claims victory.

Coast To Coast features a unique movement system whereby players add speed cards to a communal movement tableau, the dashboard. Each player controls only a portion of the dashboard, which determines movement of the cars. On their turn the player may try to accelerate their own cars towards the next checkpoint, or possibly even try to get their opponents' cars caught by the police.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Investment, Moving Multiple Units, Multi-Use Cards, Race, Resource to Move

name: ELÄÄ ROTU
description:
Once, there was a struggle between two races.
The "Erma" tribe, who have lived in the forest since ancient times, lived peacefully.
One day, however, the Otta invaded the forest.
The Otta tribe cut down the trees in the forest and captured the Elma tribe.
The Elma tribe, utilizing the resources of the forest, oppose the Otta tribe.

This is a board game for two players only.
Players fight for the survival of their own tribe as either the Otta or the Elma.
The Otta tribe invades the forest where the Elma tribe lives, while strengthening their own power.
The Elma build treehouses and traps to defend their forest against the Otta invasion.
The goal of the Otta is to annihilate the Elma, while the goal of the Elma is to survive.

The game is asymmetrical, so there are different things to think about depending on which tribe you are playing.
This game is recommended for those who like to think about where to move their frames on the game board and how to strengthen their own power in short rounds.
In the later stages of the game, there is more to do and more to think about.
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid
publishers: DEBUG MONKEYS (デバッグモンキーズ)

name: Stakz
description: A tile-matching, stack-building game in which 2-4 players race to empty their hands of pentagonal tiles. Tiles are matched by either 1 of the 5 colors or by 1 of the 5 symbols, and should a stack reach 5 colors, the stack splits in 2, increasing the odds of playable tiles on future turns. At the end of each round, once 1 player has stacked their last tile, each other player scores 1 point for each tile left in their hand. Rounds continue until one player has a score of at least 12, at which point the player with the lowest cumulative score wins.

name: L'Obsidienne
description:
As the young captain of the Obsidian, a mercenary troop that offers its military talents, your responsibility is immense: you must take the best decisions for yourself and your troops.
Employed by the King of Hauora, earn the respect of your three corps, analyze the battlefields to adopt the right strategies, listen to the advice of your lieutenants, and mount your horse. Make the right choices, because you are the hero!

L'Obsidienne is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Ediciones MasQueOca, Makaka Editions, Van Ryder Games

name: Great Tarot
description:
A trick-taking tarot card game that mixes the tradition of a historical deck and the innovation of a Bridge-inspired bidding system.

Bid the perfect contract with your partner and play your cards to win points and tricks.

Be aware of the special properties of cards like the Bagatto, the Fool and the World.

A deep but fast-paced card game.

—description from the designer

name: Succulents
description:
You’re at the end of your 3rd year studying garden design at a prestigious college and are starting to get a little frustrated. Yes, you’re having the time of your life and loving all your classes, but nobody is taking you seriously. You keep telling your parents that there is a career for you and you won’t become a starving artist. When you find out that your local botanic garden is holding an open competition for a succulent wall installation, you’re ecstatic. Finally, a way to prove your legitimacy! However, your professor knows the board and cautions you to submit two designs. Since succulents are trendy, the board will not choose the design that is the most popular, but the one that will be the least controversial. Can you make the best arrangement while navigating the shifting tide of public opinion and secure your first installation?

In this game, you and your opponent will select cards from a display to place in one of your two succulent walls. Cards must follow three simple rules when being placed

In each column, each card must have a higher number than the card above it.
In each row, each card must have a color further to the right in the ROYBGV coloring order.
No orthogonally adjacent cards may share the same number or color.


At the end of each round, you and your opponent will place one card to increase or decrease the point values of each type of succulent. At the end of the game, only your lowest scoring wall will count, so be careful in your choices!

—description from designer
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Investment, Market, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Namastè: Il gioco dello yoga
description:
A fun and unique game!

Namasté introduces players to the world of Yoga through 5 different simple and engaging motion games.

The game was developed with Lorena Pajalunga, founder and President of the Italian Yoga Association for Children AIYB.

The positions of yoga are numerous.

We have chosen 40, which are representative and affordable for children. These 40 positions were illustrated by the magical pen of Lorenzo Terranera (Ballarò and many other spells) and then placed on large-format cards, which are divided into two groups.

There are 20 “easier” positions, the cards with green backs, and 20 “less easy”, purple ones, so that all children, in different age groups, can experiment and play.

On each card the name of the asana is written in Sanskrit, the ancient language of India, but don't be scared ... it's just to learn something more, because in the 10 pages of the book with the detailed explanation of all 40 positions you will find the Italian translation of the name of the asana. For each asana the inspiration is also described, the detail of how it must be performed and, very nice, what you learn by practicing it.
Many different games can be played with the contents of this box.

In addition to those that you can invent yourself, 5 are described below, which aim to entertain children (and adults) in many different ways, stimulating creativity (game 1: "Invent your story), memory ( game 2: "Remember the sequence" and game 4: "Make the quartet") and learning the names of the asanas (game 3: "Guess the name"), developing with everyone the improvement of the practice (game 5: "Overcome the teacher").

If playing with children under the age of 6, it is recommended that an adult play the role of the moderator, or teacher. From 6-7 years onwards, the role of the Master can be played, in turn, by the players themselves.

Even if a specific game mode is indicated, all 5 games can be played:

with a single deck of 20 face down cards and taking the top card of the deck from time to time, as in game 1
with 5 piles (4 cards of each type) and throwing the fuchsia die to choose the card, as in game 2
with 4 piles (5 cards of each color) and rolling the black die to choose the card, as in game 3
throwing both dice and looking in the deck for the corresponding card, as in game 5
Before starting to play it must be emphasized that the practice of Yoga must never hurt, and for this reason the positions must always be performed slowly. it is important to respect your limits and not forget that our bodies are not all the same: ease and difficulty vary greatly from one person to another, and an easy asana for one player could be difficult for another.

Contains: 49 cards, 2 dice, 1 gong and 1 book of 24 pages.
categories: Dice, Game System, Memory, Party Game, Religious

name: Nani e Giganti
description:
Nani e Giganti is the new board game for children by Lisciani. A fun adventure to be able to overcome many obstacles by managing two characters together.
Simplicity reigns supreme with Dwarves and Giants. For all children who are approaching board games for the first time or for those who do not want to learn too many rules. Fast and immediate.
We prepare the board in the center of the table and place our Dwarf and our Giant in the starting boxes. We make the Movement deck, the Help deck and the Unexpected deck available to everyone. We take 2 Talisman tokens each.
We begin to advance on the board by drawing a Movement card and discarding it immediately. We will choose to move either our Dwarf or our Giant in the direction that interests us most, even backwards. Warning: the Dwarf cannot cross the Ravine and the Giant the Web unless they have Help cards that specify otherwise.
The effects of the boxes:
- Purple box (neutral) - nothing happens.
- Weed, Swamp, River box - if you end the movement on one of them, you will need to draw an Unexpected card and immediately apply its effect.
- Help Box - the relevant card is drawn and held without showing it to the other players.
Help cards will serve us to attack others or to defend ourselves.
If you draw the Witch card in the Movement deck, you can defend yourself by spending a Talisman. If there are none, the game for that player will be over.
Spending a Talisman will also serve to bring one of our eliminated characters back into play.

The game is won by the player who brings both characters to the exit or, if all are left with only one character, the single who reaches it first.

name: Tic Tac K.O.: Dragons vs Unicorns – Hoarder Promo Card
description:
A holographic promo card that was originally available at conventions.

Special Dragon Card:
-When this card enters the Grid, each player on your team may DRAW a card for each Objective your team has completed.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Interrupts, Square Grid, Take That, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Clinic: Deluxe Edition – Biohazard
description:
Biohazard is the 8th expansion of Clinic Deluxe Edition.

At the time of publication it was advertised as the final expansion, but was followed in 2024 by a 9th expansion: 6th Extension.

“To conclude the Clinic: Deluxe Edition series, I wanted to focus on the disposal and recycling of all the refuse produced when patients are treated. This final, lone expansion is compatible with all expansions, because it merely depends on having nurses and orderlies, which are part of the base game! If you can include Janitors from The Extension, you can experience my full vision. I know the janitors already have a lot of challenging work, but as CEO of my own game, I am now adding a new role to their job description: They must tend to biohazards!”

—description from the rulebook
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement
publishers: AVStudioGames, Capstone Games, Giant Roc, LudiCreations

name: Robo en el museo
description:
A tip-off sends the guards of the world's rarest works of art on the hunt for the most audacious picture thief. What they did not expect is that thief ​​​​is one of them!

A game of hidden roles where finding the culprit and going unnoticed becomes increasingly difficult. The thief will make up lies, divert attention, and even make you look guilty to get his way.

The goal is to become the person with the most victory points at the end of the 8 game rounds.

To do this, the participants must connect their minds by selecting the same card when they are security guards and trick their rivals when they are the thief.

-description from publisher

name: Dwarf Mine: Underdark
description:
Hidden well beneath the great mountains, there exists a gloomy and gargantuan cavern inhabited by the dark civilizations of the world. Goblins, Dark Elves, and Dark Dwarves build their armies and thrive in the empty spaces between the stone. Your mine will dig deep and reach the fabled Underdark. Will you navigate the dangers of the Underdark and survive in the dark place beneath the mountain? Or will the dangerous creatures spell your doom. Play to find out, as your mine tells its story!

Underdark is an expansion to Dwarf Mine (the Dwarf Mine base game is required to play).

Like Dwarf Mine, Underdark is a game played by drawing a mine on graph paper. On your turn, you will first draw (dig) rooms, hallways, and ladders for your mine! Rooms will benefit your mine, and hallways and ladders let you reach other areas of your mountain.

After drawing, you will make two dice rolls - a treasure roll, and a combat roll. These rolls determine what treasure you find, and what creatures you may encounter in the mountain - after all, mining is dangerous business!

Each mine made has a story, and every story has a beginning, middle, and sadly, an end. Your game ends when your population reaches 0. By the end of the game, you’ll have created rich and unique history for your mine – no two games are the same!

Players are getting VP during the game and trying to see how many VP they can get each time they play. Kind of like a high score.

-description from designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: Γράμματα-Τέχνες - Συμπλήρωμα (Quiz Hunt: Arts and Letters – Supplement)
description: 384 supplementary questions to go alongside the base game

name: BBC Earth Animals
description:
This family board game helps teach you fun and interesting facts about the planet, the animals and wildlife that inhabit it. A special website provides beautiful videos and trivia questions.

The aim of the game is to answer questions, collect animal cards and win by being the leading player after the final trivia round.

The game also includes photo cards to enable play without an internet connection.

All footage is supplied by the BBC, featuring iconic moments across many of their award winning BBC Earth series and titles.
publishers: Albi, Goliath Games, Identity Games International B.V.

name: Jack & Detectives
description: Jack and Detectives is a game with the theme of the Jack the Ripper incident that occurred in London in the 19th century. The player will be the character in this case as the murderer ‘Jack the Ripper’ (Jack), the ‘Detective’ chasing Jack, or the ‘devoted” who cooperates with Jack. If two victims are killed, the investigation will be terminated, and Jack will be nominated and arrested among the detectives, and the game will be settled.

name: Fly Fight Win: Afterburner
description:
Fly Fight Win: Afterburner is a hex-based, miniatures wargame rules set for air-to-air combat. The game emphasizes the importance of speed, altitude, and pilot skill and minimizes tedium. It includes statistics for many frontline fighters from the early Korean War era through the end of the Cold War.

Afterburner is a standalone rules set and the second game in the Fly Fight Win series. All games in the series are designed for playability but retain sufficient detail to recreate plausibly historic outcomes. Most scenarios can be played in under 60 minutes.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Korean War, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: El alquimista de los dados
description:
El alquimista de los dados ("The alchemist of the dice") is a family game of 2 to 4 players, between 20 and 40 minutes, of set collection, and taking risk with the dice rolls, where you will try to be the first to elaborate the necessary potions to recover the trust of the count.

To do this, you will gather flasks of ingredients, special potions, ancient grimoires, and you will have a small chance to bother your rivals, with the aim of being the first to score 10 points with your potions.

On each turn, players will be able to perform one of 4 actions. Draw 2 flask cards, either from the deck or face up cards. Get special flask, these modify the result of the dice or change the color of an ingredient flask.
Claim a grimoire, paying its cost in cards. Or try to brew a potion, discarding the corresponding cards.

To be successful brewing a potion, it will be necessary to at least obtain the required value with a roll of the dices. That's where the grimoires and special flask will come into play if you have them.

If you are successful, place the collected potion in your play area. If not, you must discard 2 of your used cards when trying to brew the potion. If you get the exact amount, you will have an extra turn.

Players will alternate turns until one of them achieves at least 10 points with their potions.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Expedición Serrana
description:
Expedición Humedales is a deck of cards about the flora and fauna of the Argentine Sierras. Through four different game modes you will be able to get acquainted with the inhabitants of the sierras by sharing a fun moment with family or friends.

Playing you will learn the names, characteristics and conservation status of birds, land animals, fish and trees.

Dare to discover the endangered species and many more that inhabit our common home.

Knowing our nature we can take better care of it.

name: Enmity Engine
description: Enmity Engine is a horror-themed card fighting game for 2 players, where both players control a team of 3 Fighters. Launch Attacks to take down your opponent’s Fighters and Switch your Fighters’ positions to maneuver yourself into advantageous situations. Anticipate your opponent’s strategies and outwit them. Throughout the game, you’ll gain Insight, which you can use to Awaken your Fighters, permanently upgrading their abilities, or unleash their powerful Signature Moves. You win when you defeat all of the opposing Fighters.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Claim Action, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: The One Hundred Torii: Matcha Mini-Expansion
description:
A set of extra cards, activated with any 3 small tokens, provides unique benefits that might affect characters, tokens, or torii. Only a single card is available to each player, though, so the decisions vary from play to play.

Each player receives 2 random cards during setup and chooses 1 to keep during the game. This card may be activated by placing any 3 small tokens on it.

Card abilities vary from gaining more tokens in certain situations to hiring characters for fewer tokens.

The card's benefit happens every turn, as long as the card has 3 tokens on it. Tokens may be swapped, but if there are ever 5 matching small tokens (including on the Matcha card), they must be turned in for a large token.

Contains 10 cards.

-description from publisher

name: The One Hundred Torii: Sake Mini-Expansion
description:
Different types of sake have full and empty sides. A sake card provides an immediate benefit, such as gaining an extra token or additional tiles. However, a special effect creates a challenge on the following turn.

Cards begin play with their full side face up. A player may drink (or claim) a sake card once per turn, which grants the benefit of the full side. However, the negative effect of the empty side must be taken on their nex turn.

Benefits include gaining tokens, hiring a character for fewer tokens, and having more tiles in hand. Negative effects include losing token, paying more to hire characters, and playing with a single tile in hand.

Contains 9 cards.

-description from publisher

name: Letter Boxing
description: Letter Boxing is a word game featuring a 72-card deck of single- and double-letter cards. Players take turns placing new cards into a line in the middle of the table, and a player may fold (if they can’t go on) or challenge (if they think the opponent can’t complete a word). It’s a fast game with a mix of word play and risk management. A risky bluff at the right time could earn a huge reward!

name: Justice: Conan Doyle
description:
Justice is a new game system in which the players will participate in a trial, one of you will be the defense attorney, the prosecutor will be in charge of bringing the accusation and the rest will form the court.

Each case proposes a unique enigma, but with multiple resolutions that each game will lead to a completely different trial.

After long days of illness, on January 21, 1907, the 36-year-old journalist and writer Bertram Fletcher Robinson is found dead at his home in London. Although the symptoms fit with typhoid fever and peritonitis, there are indications that the victim may have been poisoned. Scotland Yard narrows the investigation down to three suspicious people, although only one of them is finally brought to trial a few months later...

—description from the publisher (translated)

Justice es un nuevo sistema de juego en el que los jugadores participaréis en un juicio, uno de vosotros será el abogado defensor, el fiscal se encargará de llevar la acusación y el resto formará el tribunal.

Cada caso propone un único enigma, pero con múltiples resoluciones que cada partida llevarán a un juicio completamente distinto.

Tras largos días de enfermedad, el 21 de enero de 1907 aparece muerto en su domicilio en Londres el periodista y escritor Bertram Fletcher Robinson, de 36 años de edad. Aunque los síntomas encajan con unas fiebres tifoideas y una peritonitis, se hallan indicios de que la víctima pudo haber sido envenenada. Scotland Yard reduce la investigación a tres personas sospechosas, aunque finalmente sólo una de ellas es llevada a juicio unos meses después…

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Voting

name: Thỏ Tỉnh Táo
description:
Thỏ Tỉnh Táo (Awake Rabbit) is a party game that presents challenges with three levels of difficulty, requiring you to stay sharp and have quick reflexes!

Continuously count numbers when it is your turn, but with a twist: some numbers are assigned to specific actions. So instead of saying the number, you must remember correctly and do the action(s).

name: Cartzzle: La dame à la licorne
description:
La Dame à la Licorne is a new opus from the Cartzzle range. Cartzzle is a new concept of board game containing a game, a work of art and puzzles.

The box holds a single Cartzzle, an endless one you can make with both sides of the 50 cards. Cartzzles are pictures you must first piece together by laying cards on top of each other (with or without the template, depending on your dedication). Then, start again, using challenges this time! Removing cards, flipping them, and laying them elsewhere will change the picture and also allow you to meet some challenges.

name: Cartzzle: Les jeux d'enfants
description:
Cartzzle is a new concept of board game containing a game, a work of art and puzzles. Compose the original image by superimposing your cards, then redo it by taking up challenges.

The box holds a single Cartzzle, an endless one you can make with both sides of the 50 cards. Cartzzles are pictures you must first piece together by laying cards on top of each other (with or without the template, depending on your dedication). Then, start again, using challenges this time! Removing cards, flipping them, and laying them elsewhere will change the picture and also allow you to meet some challenges.

name: Postcard Midway
description:
Postcard Midway is a lightspeed fast, simple little Battle of Midway postcard wargame.

Although it shows 16 turns, early destruction of the Japanese Kido Butai carrier striking force can decide the game in the first 4, as historically. Fog of War has been fully worked in: the US has only a 50% codebreaking chance (of setting up a Point Luck or wherever ambush), and even with that only a further 50% chance of Yorktown being repaired in time for the battle.

Movement EXTREMELY simplified, and the design emphasis is on the 2 factors critical in the battle: intelligence and timing of air attacks. Airstrikes can be sent out (up to a 1-hex range) push-your-luck blindly or (push-your-luck vulnerably, if readied) held back on deck for a daylight turn, to wait to find out what Recon finds (as the Japanese fatally did, historically).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Doctor Who Trump Card Game
description:
A game of challenge for two players in which Doctor Who and the Legendary Legion join battle with the Alien Hordes from deep space. A coin is spun to decide who plays first. Each player receives a shuffled deck of their trump cards.

Each trump card has three characteristics, the first player reveals their card, announces a characteristic, then the second player announces the corresponding characteristic and both cards are revealed. The lower scoring trump card is forfeit to the other player and adds it to a win pile.

The player who captures all the trump cards wins.

name: 4 par 4
description:
4 par 4 is a game of logic and strategy for two, three and four players which mixes cleverly thinking, observation and anticipation. Accessible for everyone in the family, it has this little great thing of being playable in two complementary rounds, but that's not all...

Very quickly assimilated in a few minutes, the mechanism leads to animated and fun games. Winner or looser, you will only want one thing: Replay !

Purpose of the game: each player has to create the highest number of 4 different colors combinations in row, column, diagonal or square.

Hundreds of thousands gaming possibilities, games always different. Complexity and thinking are increasing, you should never give 1 more point to your opponent.
publishers: Les jeux de société de Nico

name: Just Desserts: Neapolitan Ice Cream Promo
description: When we reprinted Just Desserts, we fixed a few errors but also replaced the Neapolitan Ice Cream with a Zucchini Muffin card. This promo card is for owners of the updated version (v1.1) who would also like to have a serving of Neapolitan Ice Cream. The Neapolitan Ice Cream contains the Ice Cream, Chocolate, and Fruit tastes.

name: Brovary 2022
description:
The Battle of Brovary was a clash during the Kyiv offensive of the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine for control of the suburb of Brovary, to the east of the capital city of Ukraine, Kyiv. Russian forces advanced west from southern Chernihiv Oblast and were engaged by Ukrainian forces. Control of the suburb was contested until Russian forces withdrew on 2 April 2022.

Brovary 2022 is a company scale game about the first part of the battle, covering three days long Russian assault on Brovary, led by the Russian 90th Guards Tank Division. It is a part of the Battles of XXI Century (B-XXI) system, highly detailed company scale system dedicated for the modern combat.

Game was published in the 46 issue of the Tactics and Strategy magazine, in both Polish and English languages. A copy of any boxed game of B-XXI system is required.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Strike It Rich
description:
Strike It Rich is a new board game that is played in the classic or traditional format of players taking turns rolling the dice to travel around a game board.
