The game is great family entertainment that is easy to learn and play, is fast paced, exciting, educational, and has fun player inaction. Each time around the board is equivalent to a year. Each player will get a chance each year for ten years to experience the uncertainty of either “Striking It Rich or having a setback on their quest to accumulate their fortunes. The gameboard has 4 unique sides that the players get a yearly chance to accumulate their wealth by how large of a Wage they will collect, what adventures they get into at the Family section, getting a chance on the Investment side of the board where you can test your risk/reward appetite, and then to find out what type of escapades you run into on the Lifestyle portion of the board.

—description from the publisher

name: Runar: Helblindi Promo Miniature
description:
A promo resin miniature included with Ashes Magazine: Essen Special Edition #6 from Ludus Magnus Studio. The miniature is a resin model that comes in 6 pieces and will need to be glued together using a cyanoacrylate glue or similar. In the magazine are detailed assembly instructions.

Along with an enemy card to use Helblindi as an enemy in Runar, it also comes with a card to use him as an enemy in Nova Aetas Renaissance, and the cards to use him as a mage in Black rose Wars.

Contents:
1x Mage Card, 3x Personal Spell Cards (to play Helblindi as Mage in Black Rose Wars)
1x Enemy Card, 1x Enemy Draft Card (to play Helblindi, the Cryomancer as Enemy in Nova Aetas Renaissance)
1x Enemy Card (to play Helblindi as Enemy in Runar)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Renaissance

name: Postman Pat Big Letter Day Board Game
description:
Help Pat & Jess race around the board delivering their letters. Whose bag empty first? But watch out, there's a ship on the loose which keeps blocking the road!

The aim of the game is to be the first player to deliver all your letters to the Greendale residents' post boxes and return to the Greendale station.

name: Stormsein
description:
The wind howls, the sea beats against the dunes. The storm signal is on! The islanders rush to the beach to comb washed up wood.

You leave with your pawn from your village to the beach where you will go beach combing. Whoever has first collected 10 pieces of wood, has moored his boat in the harbor and has driven the jeep back to his house, wins.

Turn sequence:

If you have colluded enough wood for a truck or boat, place it
Draw a card and follow instructions on placing new wood and floating wood
Throw the dice
Move your pieces and collect wood in the fields where you end your move

name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2019: Faceless Menace
description: Kadena, Slinking Sorcerer headlines this blue-black-green preconstructed Commander deck themed around the Morph mechanic. Faceless Menace includes a 100-card deck, a foil oversized display commander, 10 double-sided tokens, and a cardboard deck box.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Take That

name: Jungle Party
description:
There’s a party in the jungle!

Swing along with the monkey and see who’s come to visit the jungle. Throw a party with the lion, rhino, zebra and many other animals. But wait, not all animals are complete!

Collect the correct animal game pieces by walking around with the monkey. If you play smart, the monkey can run and swing faster, or slower. What’s the best move? Complete the animals and celebrate your own jungle party. Are you the first to do so? Then you’ve won this adventurous game!

During a turn players choose one of the three actions: draw card, play a card or take 3 steps. Taking 3 steps is your main action and causes the monkey to stop on a certain animal. Take that animal and add it to your collection. By drawing a card or playing a card you already drew, you can move specific steps. Try to collect as many animal-parts and create animals until your animal party is complete.

-description from publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Puzzle

name: White Rabbit Dice Solitaire
description:
This version of dice solitaire gets its name from the game’s white die constantly “hopping” back and forth between your hand and row. Additionally, the player must “hold” the white die in their hand as part of the win condition.

You have six turns to win the game by making trades between dice in your hand and dice in the row so that all dice in the row are the same value and the white die ends in your hand.

—description from the designer

name: Fortress of Terror: Mines of Darkness
description:
The great kingdom of the dwarves lay hidden under the mountain for centuries, producing items of the finest craftsmanship. Suddenly, all within the mountain grew quiet. What has happened to the dwarves and their proud kingdom?

Mines of Darkness is the sixth Fantasy Adventure Module in the Roll-With-It system, a modular, solitaire roll-and-write adventure game system with endless possibilities for adventure through an accomplish-the-task-and-escape-the-maze-style gameplay.

Gameplay is centered around a maze or map, through which the player must navigate, accomplish some objective(s), and escape the map under pressure from the enemy's attacks via the Doom die. The simple, puzzley, maze-style gameplay is approached differently in each adventure, building on the basic rules with new rules, concepts, and components that make each adventure feel fresh and unique.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: History Maker Baseball Express
description:
Tabletop baseball just got faster, with this quick-play companion to History Maker Baseball! Finish full games in 10 minutes or less, without losing the full-play drama and excitement! Use the HMB cards you already have, watch players perform with the same realism as its sports board game big brother. Includes game charts and rules booklet, use dice and cards from the full-play version of the game.

Please note that the express game does not include dice or teams, it’s designed to be used in tandem with the HISTORY MAKER BASEBALL game you already own! While the express game’s rules booklet is comprehensive, we’re assuming that you already own the full-play game and understand the basic mechanics and procedures. We don’t, for example, explain in the rules booklet what a WHIFFER is, or what makes a pitcher FRESH. Unless otherwise specified, full-play concepts apply to the express game and you should refer to your full-play rules booklet for interpretations.

—description from the publisher

name: Runebound: Korona Starszych Królów
description: Korona Starszych Królów contains three additional card sets to Runebound: Druga Edycja: Korona Starszych Królów, Artefakty i Sprzymierzeńcy and Mroczna Puszcza.

name: Hint: Demo version
description:
In HINT, your teammates have to guess what you are trying to tell them. Along the way you both mime, draw, hum and talk. You must be both quick and creative, but beware! There is always one forbidden word that you may not use. An entertaining party game for everyone that gets the hint.

HINT is ein Partyspiel, im dem du auf verschiedene Arten Hinweise gibst. Mime, summe, erkläre und zeichne die verrücktesten Dinge, um dein Team auf die richtige Spur zu führen!
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Singing, Team-Based Game

name: Holland '44: Operation Market-Garden – Alternative Airborne Landing Locations
description:
Alternative Airborne Landing Locations for Holland '44 by Trevor Bender: Trevor Bender drops into Operation Market Garden again with a "variant (that) is a follow-on to my previous article in Special Ops Magazine #4, pp. 10-13 in 2013 titled, Operation Market Garden as a Topic for Operations Research. There I laid out rules for alternative drop locations and timing for MMP’s Monty’s Gamble."

This variant contains 4 pages of instructions and a set of counters, included in C3i Magazine Issue #33.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Detective Society: Family Adventures
description:
HAVE YOU EVER WANTED TO BE A DETECTIVE? NOW IS YOUR CHANCE!
Contains three cases - each one is an exciting mystery to solve and a fun story to unravel. And this time, it's an adventure for the whole family!

Delve into the world of The Detective Society, interact with the characters, solve the puzzles and see if you can crack the case!

THE MISSING POTION
Professor Errol has lost his invisibility potion and needs your help to get it back before everything starts to disappear!

TIME TRAVEL TROUBLE
A time travelling clock has been stolen from a museum, and four of its artefacts have vanished from history. Can you work out who is responsible?

THE SMASHED PIÑATA
Gavin has had his birthday piñata smashed and you need to find out who did it! But the biggest mystery you need to solve is why...

Age guidance 8+.
Recommended adult supervision.
Internet enabled device required for digital parts.

name: Orsza 1514
description: The game simulates the Battle of Orsha, 1514. The forces of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania and the Kingdom of Poland fought against the army of the Grand Duchy of Moscow. As a result of the battle, the army of the Grand Duchy of Moscow was defeated.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Edgehill: The First Battle
description:
A very rare war game that was included in Combat Magazine #2 published in 1977.

Edgehill is the first battle of the English Civil War taking place in 1642. 4 Geomorphic paper maps and 133 unmounted, paper counters.
categories: American Civil War, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: The Hunger: Alternate Starting Deck Promo
description:
Given out from local dealers at Organized Play Events.

Comment from the publisher Pegasus Spiele side:
"... everyone who takes part in Organized Play will receive a set of six starting cards as a participation goodie, each replaces one of the 'normal' vampires starting cards from the basic game. The winner will also receive a "Golden Rose", a particularly valuable card ..."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Race
publishers: Cranio Creations, Origames, Pegasus Spiele, Renegade Game Studios

name: Aurora Decree
description:
The Dynasty is in retreat. At the edge of their old border, newly liberated sectors are finally free to determine their own fate. As provisional governments gather to issue an Aurora Decree, the blueprint for their ideal future, they may find that old grudges and rival interests are hard to overcome...

In Aurora Decree you’ll be playing as representatives of planets in the sector. Each turn either a new topic is introduced for discussion to tease out more details about the sector, or a proposal is made to angle for the changes your character wants. Proposals need to be passed by a vote to achieve your goals, but every character has their past... a revelation may expose their secrets and influence the voting! Who will be chosen to lead the sector into the future?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Negotiation, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: 18-card Cricket
description:
Live the full, rich and exciting experience of Cricket in just 18 cards: 10 for the Fielding team, 8 for the Batting team. In addition, you need a good-sized table and three dice to represent the 'in' batsmen and the bowler's delivery result.

The fielding team lays out their fielders, nominates a bowler for the Over and then tests the Batsman with a series of testing deliveries; the batsman, in turn, chooses the appropriate shot (3-2-1!) to score as many runs as possible.

Play five overs, 20 overs or a full 5-day test: it's entirely up to you!

—description from the publisher

name: ペルソナVS (Persona VS)
description:
Players compete in a "festival," each playing as one of the protagonists from Persona 3, Persona 4, or Persona 5. Each player starts with 30 HP and battle to get their opponent to 0 HP.

Each player character comes with a prebuilt deck consisting of Persona cards and support or react cards featuring other characters from the games.

Released as part of the Persona 25th Anniversary events.
publishers: Banso Inc. (株式会社バンソウ)

name: Sopa China
description:
The objective of the game is to be the first player to ring the bell by discovering 5 identical vegetables on the game table, and try to eliminate the opponents by obtaining all 56 cards from the deck.


Reimplementation of Halli Galli.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Ultimo
description:
A 2-player game with an ordinary deck, with elements of ulti, tarock, schnapsen. Players bid to take 100 card points and for achieving certain feats in winning tricks, such as winning the last trick with a trump 7, or capturing all four aces. Declarer plays against a defender playing two cards to the trick: one from their hand and one from a mini-dummy hand that gets replenished after every trick.

In Ultimo each and every time you make a bid in the auction you must first donate one card to the kitty that will be available to your opponent right after, and donate another card to what will become a dummy played by whomever turns out to be defender. Deciding which cards to plant in the dummy and which to give your opponent is a conundrum, especially before you know if you’ll be playing the dummy or against it. You can even raise your own bid or bluff trying to get better cards–but when do you stop this game of chicken?

(Part of the Traditional Two Player Trilogy: Esculenta, Ultimo, Schmegegge)

—description from the designer

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Sexton II
description:
The British Sexton II is an SPG for the commander on a budget. Use Burst HE Shells to cause a massive explosion, stunning all nearby tanks, or load Light HEAT Shells for more damage. Add Requesting Fire and your British can now receive support anywhere on the table.

Contents:
1 Painted Plastic Tank
1 Tank Card
5 Upgrade Cards
Crew Stunned Tokens
Online Bonus Code for New and Existing Players
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – SU-76M
description:
The Soviet SU-76M is a low-cost Tank Destroyer for the budget conscious commander needing some additional support. Swap out to the SU-122A, and you have an SPG with a massive 7 Firepower ready to fling shells across the entire battlefield.

Contents:
1 Painted Plastic Tank
1 Tank Card
5 Upgrade Cards
Crew Stunned Tokens
Online Bonus Code for New and Existing Players
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Ora et Labora: Die kleinen Wunder der Abtei Liesborn
description:
26 new "Wonder" tiles that replace the eight tiles from the base game. Unlike the old tiles, the new tiles have a variable value, that depend on a player's situation.
This mini-expansion was part of the German edition of the customer magazine "Neues vom Ausguck" (News from the Lookout) 18.

name: Take Gem All
description:
Take Gem All reinvents word games by mixing mechanics from 2 games from our childhood: Stad - Land - River and Jungle Speed.
Be the fastest player to find a word that starts with 1 of the 4 letters on the table and is related to the current theme.
Player with the most gems wins.
Watch out for the special cards and the diamonds that can slow you down and some twists.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Take Gem All réinvente les jeux de mots en alliant la mécanique du célébrissime Petit Bac de notre enfance à la folie d'un Jungle Speed. Emparez-vous d’un maximum de pierres précieuses en étant le joueur le plus rapide à donner une réponse correspondant au thème joué et commençant par l’une des quatre lettres en jeu ! Mais attention, méfiez-vous des cartes pièges qui pourraient vous ralentir et des diamants qui risqueraient de bouleverser le cours du jeu...

À vos marques, prêts ? TAKE GEM ALL !

—description from the publisher

name: Der Fluch des Waldes IV (fan expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood)
description:
With this adventure booklet you can experience another exciting adventure of Robin Hood and his companions. It plays around the same time as chapter 4. The story of the adventure plays independently of the others and therefore no prior knowledge of other chapters is necessary.

Since new elements and tiles from later adventures have been added, it is recommended that you have already played the basic game. All outlaws already have their own special abilities. The functions for new items can be found on the following page. No prior knowledge of this adventure is required.

The outlaws had managed to stop the curse and track down the magician Alatar. They ended up accompanying the magician Alatar to the castle, because that's where his friend, Walter Fitzgerald, was supposed to be, probably in the dungeon. However, not all of the outlaws were convinced by this act to accompany the magician into the castle and instead stayed outside the castle walls.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Tanto Cuore: Memento Mori – Twilight Manor
description:
Tanto Cuore is a Japanese deck-building card game which has a mechanism similar to Dominion.

Each player plays as the Lord of a mansion and hires maids to fill out their house to become the King of Maids! The end goal is simple enough, the player who has the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins! Players acquire Victory Points by employing a variety of maids and "Love" cards that allow for different strategies. You can even employ Private Maids that stick around to use their special powers each per turn! Some give you a bonus, or affect your opponents in a negative way. But beware, your opponents can make your maids sick or give them bad habits, affecting your maids in negative ways and decreasing your Victory Points!

In this new standalone expansion (can be played on its own or combined with previous Tanto Cuore games), the players are in a rush to complete dilapidated rooms in Twilight Manor, avoid the ghosts, and perform seances to help with their goals. However, the spirits are not always willing to play along, and they can at times go out of their way to mess up your strategy if they turn evil!

It’s now your job as the new owner of the manor to employ Workers to help you collect combinations of symbols in order to accomplish the task of Finishing a Room, while also Employing your Maids and Butlers to keep the Ghosts at bay with the assistance of Madam Damnable and her Seances. As players face the fate of her Tarot cards, what amazing glimpses into the future—with great fortune or a taste of ill fates—await them?

Tanto Cuore 6 has just opened the door to the supernatural: Are you willing to take a peek inside for this new paranormal adventure?

-description from publisher

name: No Thank you, Evil!: It's Raining Cats and Dinosaurs
description:
A creature called Kabloom! is stealing all the power from the Flowering Fields. Can the heroes stop them and restore this beautiful corner of Out the Window?
Four new adventures.

It’s Raining Cats and Dinosaurs!
Oh No, Snow!
Flower Power!
Gloom and Doom Steal the Moon

name: Stock Car Racing Team Game
description:
The Stock Car Racing Team Game is themed around American stock car auto racing that began in the late 1940's in the southeast U.S. that grew from a regional to a national auto racing sport.

The game requires 2 to 6 players, each player has six like colored race cars to choose from, Red, Yellow, Blue, White, Green and Orange. Each race car has it's own unique number on the roof of the car. For each team, the first digit on the roof will start with 1,2,3,4,5 and 6. Each player navigates their six race cars by the roll of three dice. Two white dotted dice that determined the number of spaces to move forward on the race track and one green six sided numbered die that determines which car is to be moved.

The object of the game is to be the first player to move all six of like colored race cars around the race track and past the start/finish line but only after earning a predetermined number of race tire tokens for each teams six race cars. This is accomplished by making green flag or yellow flag pit stops and avoiding engine failure or running out of fuel.

This is a game of attrition, the first player to successfully cross the start/finish line and remove all six of their race cars wins the race. Their is also a point system for those that want to play multiple races and therefore there is incentive for players that do not win the race to finish 2nd, 3rd etc.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Push Your Luck, Race, Track Movement

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition –  Lizardmen Team Card Pack
description: Full set of reference cards for Lizardmen Blood Bowl teams including position players, special play cards, and Star Players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Ogre Team Card Pack
description: Full set of reference cards for Ogre Blood Bowl teams including position players, special play cards, and Star Players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Goblin Team Card Pack
description: Full set of reference cards for Goblin Blood Bowl teams including position players, special play cards, and Star Players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Wood Elf Team Card Pack
description: Full set of reference cards for Wood Elf Blood Bowl teams including position players, special play cards, and Star Players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Elven Union Team Card Pack
description: Full set of reference cards for Elven Union Blood Bowl teams including position players, special play cards, and Star Players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Drunk Tales: The Horror Movie
description:
Drunk Tales: The Horror Movie is a humor-driven party game designed to get you and your friends tipsy while howling with laughter. As you race around the board, you’ll take on one of over a hundred and forty different drinking challenges, each inspired by your favorite horror movie tropes.

The game will invite you to perform with, share with, and befriend the other players as you compete to become the sole horror movie survivor. You’ll face unique drinking challenges all themed around various horror movies—and all designed to get every player grinning from ear to ear.

—description from the publisher
categories: Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Player Judge, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Take That, Track Movement, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Patent na złodzieja
description:
This is the age of technology. Age of progress. Age of experiments. And You are one of its most famous inventors - or want to be one.
Players take the role of inventors. They make experimets (play cards) and file patents for new devices (when they get matching set of experiments).
But successfully devising and patenting something is only half the game. The other - and most exciting - half is lawsuits: it is possible that inventions patented don't belong to the player that filed them... If such an invention is challenged, the fraud loses points.
If, however, the invention turns out to be legitimate - it's the suitor that's penalized!

name: Cross Clues: Tantrum House Promo Pack
description: 20 board game related words on 10 new cards. This was part of the Tantrum House season 8 Kickstarter.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Warriors of England: The War of the Roses
description:
The War of the Roses was a 32-year conflict in the mid to late fifteenth century that had the rival houses of Lancaster and York fighting for control of the Plantagenet dynasty and control of the English throne. Starting with the First Battle of St. Albans when Richard of York captured Henry VI, the two houses fought for control of England until the controversial king, Richard III, was killed at the Battle of Bosworth Field in 1485.

After his victory at Bosworth Field, Henry VII married Elizabeth of York. With this marriage the House of Lancaster and the House of York were combined, and the House of Tudor was born and gained control of England.

Warriors of England is a quick playing game covering the War of the Roses (1455-1487) and uses similar game mechanics as Multi-Man Publishing’s Warriors of God game covering The Hundred Years War.

Each player controls Nobles from their respective house (Lancaster and York) and vies for control of lesser Nobles who may leave your cause during battle. Each Noble controls troops and participates in campaigns to gain control of areas that add to their victory points. Control of areas also allows nobles to raise more troops for the cause!

Battles can lead to the death of your nobles, exile to a foreign land (Scotland, France, and Burgundy) or even imprisonment in the Tower of London. If nobles die in battle, they may be replaced by their heirs who may continue to fight for your claim!

Contents

Full color rulebook
22”x34” mapsheet
Two counter sheets (1” counters)
Two Player Aid Cards
dice


—description from the publisher

name: Murder by Magic
description:
Ready to save the world? Of course you are. You're a wizard, after all. With a good heart. A hero, some would say. Alas, there are bad wizards, too. Dark wizards. Wizards with ideas as to how society should function that are different than your own. The kind you'll need to Murder by Magic, in order to do all that saving of the world you fancy so proudly. However, they're trying to murder you, as well. Because, although you think they're the bad guys, they think you're the bad guy. Only one of you is right.

How To Play:
Each wizard is given a number of cards from the white deck depending on the player count (7/6/5 for player counts 2/3/4) which are then placed face up in a line for all to see. These are each players' total health points. The player with the lowest total amount of health takes the first turn. For each turn, each player must make 3 moves. A move consists of either drawing one card from the black deck or playing one card from their hand.

Spell cards are played on top of any opponents health cards in order to deplete said opponent's health. When the value of the combination of attack spells meets or exceeds the value of health points listed on the card the opponent must place your attack cards on the discard pile and flip over their attacked health point card to show it has been depleted.

When played, each attack spell card counts as one move. The only exception is if you have 2 or more of the same type of spell. They can be played together and it will count as one move. Other cards may help you to heal, add additional health or provide an extra turn.

When a player's total health is completely depleted, they are dead and out of the game. Be the last wizard standing at the end and you win!

name: The Lost Treasure of John Augur
description:
Prepare for an adventure on the high seas, from the glory days of piracy in the 18th century to present day. Can you help the intrepid Kelsey Franklin piece together one of the ocean's deepest mysteries?

The Lost Treasure of John Augur is a narrative puzzle game experience where players will collaboratively search through a trove of artefacts, treasures, official documents, diary entries, pirate maps, and other windblown scraps to seek out the lost treasure of pirate John Augur.

There is no traditional game board or pieces, no turn order or set roles. Instead players will unbox the mystery together, scouring for clues, searching for hidden messages, and ultimately following the treasure trail hidden within the contents.

Will you find the lost treasure or be doomed by the unfathomable powers beneath the waves?

name: Aernaval
description: Argentinian war game from 1950's.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame

name: El Juego de la Desregulación
description: Old Argentinian economic game.
mechanics: Auction: Dexterity, Auction: Multiple Lot, Auction/Bidding, Closed Economy Auction, Constrained Bidding, Investment, Loans, Market, Negotiation, Selection Order Bid, Trading

name: The Aragón Front: The Spanish Civil War in Eastern Spain 1936/39
description:
The Aragón Front is an operational simulation depicting the successive campaigns along the Ebro river valley, in Eastern Spain, during her last bloody Civil War (1936/39).

The game is a two player, chit pulling and hex movement design; counters range from regiment/brigade to division and hexes span 10km (6 miles) from side to side.

The game can be played as a whole campaign or in smaller limited scenarios; these include:

Durruti´s drive on Zaragoza.
Belchite.
Teruel.
Franco´s drive to the Mediterranean.
Valencia.
The Ebro.
The invasión of Catalonia.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Zone of Control

name: Roll 'n' GOL: Fase de Grupos
description:
With the possibility of doing different tricks, decide which teams deserve to go to the next round and put together the matches trying to get the most results right.

Contains: Special game block + manual
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Snailspace
description:
Deal 25 cards face down Opening layoutin a 5x5 square, then turn the next card face up and place it at the centre, as illustrated. (Here it happens to be diamondJ.) Use the remainder to deal a hand of 13 cards to each player.

To add cards to the grid in a spiral direction in such a way as to form and score for combinations based on those of Cribbage, namely pairs, prials (three of a kind), double pair royals (four of a kind), sequences of three or more, and (with some restrictions) flushes of three or more. There is no score for fifteens or thirty-one, unless you really want to make it complicated. With scores being made as you go along, it may help to use a Cribbage board.

Each plays in turn, starting with the non-dealer, who plays a card face up to the right of the starter. The next card must be placed immediately below this, the next to its left, and so on, until the spiral is complete at top right, leaving you each with one card unused. (The purpose of this is to give you a choice of two on your last turn.)

The rules are available on Parlett's website here: https://www.parlettgames.uk/oricards/snailspace.html

name: HE.R.O: Level Up
description:
The Level Up - Expansion brings several new elements to your board, the most notable one being the solo mode.

We felt that if you played a solo mode, you don't want to play a reduced version of a cooperative game. You want to use all elements of the game - and since all expansions are compatible with one another, you would want to use all the material from all the expansions, right?

Inside Level Up you'll find the rules for the Solo mode. In this new game mode, you'll take on the night shift alone. But you'll get help not only from staff members, but also from automated HEROes that you either chose or select randomly before the night shift starts. These automated HEROes can counsel with you, treat patients on their own and hence add to the feeling of a real night shift.

In the expansion, you'll also find 4 brand new HEROes for you to play - in all available game modes for HE.R.O. These four have been on many adventures together and for some reason, they got thrown into a board game and have to face a night shift now.

There's also 15 new patient cards and 5 more diagnosis to add to your copy of HE.R.O - so you'll face even more different patients and have to adapt.

—description from the publisher

name: Tricky Mixes
description:
This is a may follow trick-taker that features a hex board that players will be interacting with to score points. Every trick will result in each player claiming a space on the board depending on their order in the trick and the cards played.

The trick winner will also get a potential bonus reward, mixing paints, for winning a trick. Primary color cards that are played in a trick can be mixed to create a secondary color.

The player that scores the most points from their board positioning and color majorities from tiles collected will win the game.

name: Eko Smakosz
description:
Players take on the role of families planning their grocery shopping and meals for the next seven days of the week. Each round, they buy groceries at the market, compose meals, and take care of the well-being of their family members. Players earn points for a properly balanced diet and good management of their own time and money. At the same time, they must remember to minimize the waste left over from preparing meals and to meet their family's different daily and weekly goals. The player with the most points after seven rounds wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Gracze wcielają się w rodziny planujące swoje zakupy spożywcze oraz posiłki przez kolejne siedem dni tygodnia. W każdej rundzie kupują artykuły spożywcze na targu, komponują posiłki i dbają o samopoczucie członków swojej rodziny. Za właściwie zbalansowaną dietę oraz dobre gospodarowanie własnym czasem i pieniędzmi gracze zdobywają punkty. Równocześnie muszą pamiętać o minimalizowaniu odpadków pozostałych po przygotowaniu posiłków oraz spełnianiu różnych dziennych i tygodniowych celów swojej rodziny. Gracz z największą liczbą punktów po siedmiu rundach wygrywa.

—description from the publisher (Polish)
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Worker Placement

name: Bios: Origins Promo Pack 1 – Live Long and Prosper
description: Bios: Origins Promo Pack 1 - Live Long and Prosper features new technology cards for epoch I, II, III and IV themed towards health and sanitations in various ways. In total 10 new cards.

The Dixit Puzzle Collection contains 14 different Puzzles with Dixit artworks, 6 with 500 Parts and 8 with 1000 part.

name: 応仁の天下 (Onin Tenka)
description:
Onin Tenka is a multiplayer game that takes place during the chaotic Onin War (1467-77) from a bird's-eye view like "History of the World".
天下 (Tenka) means the whole country.

Each player plays a faction card.
Cards represent powers, non-player powers, events and culture.
Can you survive the Onin War, where betrayal and conspiracy swirl?

Contents

130 counters
1 A2 size map
45 full-color cards (3 sheets)


Game period: almost the entire period of the Onin War (8 turns)
Game area: almost all of Japan except Okinawa and Tōhoku (north)
Playing time: 1-2 hours
Number of players: 3-4 players

(description from the publisher, translated and adapted, and user's description)

name: The Last Tower
description: The object of The Last Tower is to capture as many tokens of your opponents, by forming towers of tokens, as possible - while avoiding having your own captured as much as possible. The downloadable game parts include: 1.) a PDF file with instructions; 2.) PDF files of the game board in two paper sizes (explained in instructions file); 3.) a photo of the game in progress. Additional pieces required to play: stackable game tokens (explained in instructions file) and one six-sided die.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Stacking and Balancing

name: HE.R.O: The Pandemic
description:
The Pandemic Expansion brings the exciting pandemic mode to your table and is - of course compatible with all other modes in HE.R.O!
There's 4 new diagnoses and a total of 10 new patients. You'll also find pandemic dice and pandemic markers, which are needed for the Pandemic Mode.

Any new patient shows up? Roll the dice! if it's a green side, everything continues as usual. But if you roll a red side, the patient is infected! At the end of the round, every infected patient that didn't get treated will spread the infection to adjacent patients! So you can plan ahead and isolate them accordingly.

With that not being challenging enough, if you treat a patient, the treatment station (or ICU, or OR,....) will stay dirty! Any new patient brought in there will automatically be infected.

If you have no more "clean" areas, you automatically lose.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medical

name: Dat Hep Gestaan Op Feesboek
description:
A hilarious Dutch party game based on statements that have actually appeared on the internet. From bizarre conspiracy theories to silly sales ads. From right-wing 'wappies' statements to left-wing bicycle boomer quotes. Everything passes by.

The goal of the game is similar to the goal of life: raking in as many likes as possible. You do this by making status updates. Is your status the most hilarious one on the table or is it so tasteless that your fellow players like it? Then you will receive likes.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk Attachments 1
description:
There are an unknown number of tribes that live north of the Wall. These tough and hardy people will often form up and head south, looking for more hospitable land to call their own. Unfortunately, there’s usually already people occupying that land. So, the Free Folk must be willing to fight for it. While mostly a motley crew, there are still tribal chiefs and other veterans that have honed their skills against the terrors in the far north. They bring that expertise to whatever unit they join up with.


Contents:**



12 Miniatures

2 Raid Leaders
2 Champions of Bone
2 Chosen of Styr
2 Cave Dweller Alphas
2 Spearwife Matriarchs
2 Walrus Clan Chieftains


12 Attachment Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Golden Company Elephants
description:
Under the right guidance, the Golden Company War Elephants have the potential to wreak havoc on the battlefield. These armored beasts can take up to 8 Wounds and have the ability to charge and viciously Stomp over enemy troops, causing unblockable hits.

Contents:
2 Miniatures
‣ 2 War Elephants on Large Solo Tray
2 Unit Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Het verloren meesterwerk
description:
Create an mathematically inspired modular artwork by buying pieces of art to match the work you already created. To buy the pieces you have to bluff or buy wisely to get the most for your money. Watch out that you do not buy a counterfeit piece that doesn't fit in your artwork.

During the game, players construct a painting out of tiles, that are arranged in a 3x3 grid. Each turn, several of these tiles are revealed, and players bid on them using money cards. When a player wins a tile, they have to add it to their existing tiles in such a way that its edges matches the adjacent edges. If this cannot be done, the tile is considered counterfeit, and is not added to the painting, but kept aside.

Players now get new money cards depending on the value of the tile they gained during the bid, with tiles that are worth more points giving less money.

The game continues until someone completes their 3x3 painting. Then, players add together the point value of their tiles and subtract the point value of their counterfeit tiles. If only one player completed their painting, they get a bonus of two points. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Łukasiewicz: Nafta i Gaz
description:
Ignacy Lukasiewicz has just invented a way to convert oil into kerosene. The black gold fever begins in Galicia. With little capital, one begins to invest in oil parcels, build oil wells, merge into companies and try to be more successful than the competition.

The way to success is to invest in technology, because with inventions you can get ahead of your opponents. The one of you who has the most parcels, cash and patents for inventions at the end of the game will win. Are you ready to follow in the footsteps of Ignacy Lukasiewicz?

Łukasiewicz: Nafta i Gaz is a game for 2 to 5 players aged 12 or higher, which enables us to recreate the early days of the oil extraction in Galicia. Players incarnate entrepreneurs, who will compete for land, contracts and inventions. The most resourceful will emerge victorious.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hexagon Grid, Income, Tile Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Pop It!: PRO
description: The addictive bubble popping classic meets fast fun electronic gaming. 3 modes of gameplay, Including a clever multiplayer mode and a solo player blitz mode. Pop all the lit bubbles as soon as they appear, and then press the big button on the back to reset the bubbles before time runs out. Keep popping the bubbles fast to level up.

name: Vines
description:
Vines is a suite of more than 20 original games and variants with a unique 5-suited deck. This suite of games has been more than five years in the making, and we are thrilled to finally bring you the finished deck with custom artwork!

The Vines deck has 55 cards in five suits, with stunning artwork by Cheyenne Wright, and the usual meticulous attention to detail and unnecessary backstory that you have come to expect from Crab Fragment Labs.
categories: Card Game, Game System, Print & Play

name: Durch's Ländle
description:
A travelling and quiz game with roundabout 6000 questions from Upper Swabia.

You roll a die and travel to six target cities in Upper Swabia answering questions on each stop and then return to your starting city. For each correctly answered question you receive points.
The one with the most points wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Golden Journal No. 48: Black Helicopters
description:
Golden Journal No. 48: Black Helicopters is built around the 28 helicopter pieces that were used in the old Secret Weapons book (part of a larger sheet including the heavy tanks in Golden Journal No. 37: Heavy Metal).

You’ll need Parachutes Over Crete (for the German mountain troops), River Battleships and Fire in the Steppe (for the maps and most of the other pieces) to play all of the scenarios.

-description from publisher's website

name: Equi Quiz
description:
The Great Horse Knowledge game Equi Quiz is a board game for everyone who loves horses.
The more you know about these noble animals, the faster you can build your dream stable.
The board game is for all horse lovers from 12 years old. You play the game with 2 to 4 people.
It is also possible to play with several people, but then teams must be made.
The questions are divided into 6 different categories:
Behaviour, Anatomy, Sports & Recreation, Nutrition & Health, Grooming & Equipment, and Breeds & History.
There are 60 different questions per category – so 360 in total.

Answer a question each turn. You can earn victory points by answering the question correctly. With these profit points you buy dream stable parts. There are 7 different dream stable parts that must be collected by each player. The first player to collect all 7 different dream stable parts wins the game.

Along the way you will face windfalls and obstacles, just like in real life.
You will come across “The masked horse” and “The prince on the horse”. If you end up on “The Horse Stable” then parts can be exchanged. But you know the well-known proverb: “Exchanging leads to crying”. Who knows, you might even laugh! Be surprised.

It doesn't matter if you are a professional or a hobby rider, this horse knowledge board game is challenging for all horse lovers of all levels.
The playing time is between 30 and 60 minutes.
Equi Quiz is a true must-have for anyone who loves horses!

-translated from the publisher site'

name: The Family Dinner: Kid's Table
description:
New Ingredient cards for The Family Dinner.

The Kids Table expansion adds new menu items and short, childish prompts to bring out your inner child.

name: The Family Dinner: Meat Sweats
description:
New Ingredient cards for The Family Dinner.

The Meat Sweats expansion adds new meat menu items and hard hitting topic prompts to make your dinner companions sweat.

name: The Family Dinner: Tea Time
description:
New Ingredient cards for The Family Dinner.

The Tea Time expansion adds new menu items and gossipy prompts perfect for light-hearted meal time discussion.

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Archer
description:
Wave 9

1:100 Scale

World of Tanks Miniatures Game is an easy to learn, quick play game, where you take command of a unit of tanks, seeking to destroy your opponent and secure victory! All the models in World of Tanks come ASSEMBLED, PAINTED, and BATTLE READY!

The British Archer is a unique way to bring a lot of firepower to the table for a low cost. Built on the Valentine chassis, it has low Mobility and Survivability, but with the Tank Destroyer special rule finding some Cover can mitigate this. The OQF 17-Pdr AT Gun Mk. VII is an easy way to get that extra attack dice!

Plastic components.

Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ Archer Tank
1 Tank Card
5 Upgrade Cards
Online Bonus Code for New & Existing Players
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Jagdtiger
description:
Wave 9

1:100 Scale

World of Tanks Miniatures Game is an easy to learn, quick play game, where you take command of a unit of tanks, seeking to destroy your opponent and secure victory! All the models in World of Tanks come ASSEMBLED, PAINTED, and BATTLE READY!

The German Jagdtiger is a one-tank-army, with 7 Firepower and 4 Survivability so all it needs is a clear line of sight and a target! The massive gun also gains the Big Gun rule. Equip a Binocular Telescope to upgrade another Hit to Critical provided this tank stays Stationary, and you have an unshiftable tank destroying machine!

Plastic components.

Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ Jagdtiger Tank
1 Tank Card
5 Upgrade Cards
Online Bonus Code for New & Existing Players
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield – Astral Radiance
description:
Meet the Radiant Pokémon of the Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Astral Radiance expansion. This expansion introduces a sparkling new mechanic unique to Shiny Pokémon. Each player is only allowed to have one Radiant Pokémon in their deck at a time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: Skip-Bo Masters
description: Each player is dealt a stockpile of 30 cards. The winner will be whoever manages to empty their stockpile first. Cards are played onto four shared building piles in numerical sequence from 1 to 12. On each turn, a player draws until they have five cards in their hand, and then plays cards from: their hand, a top card of their discard piles, or their stockpile, or they can use a coin in place of a card, or they can use a coin to take a card from their opponents stock pile or discard pile. Some cards require using coins to pay a toll. At the end of their turn, a player must discard onto one of their four personal discard piles. Strategy involves the organizing of cards into the discard piles and using your coins wisely, care in not setting up the next players for good plays, knowing when to play from which option, and especially the timing of playing a valuable "Skip-Bo" wildcard. Players still try and get rid of all the cards from their Stock Pile, but the coins can be used to help fill in a sequence of cards or even to buy a card from another player's Discard Pile or Stock Pile!

name: The Airport Game
description: The Airport board game is a challenging family board game where each player operates a delivery company which transports goods for customers from one city to another via airplanes. Players play cards from their hands to finish the delivery job, but each city can be occupied only by one player, so plan your routes carefully!
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Trading

name: Villa's Vengeance: The Raid on Columbus, New Mexico, March 9, 1916
description:
The Mexican Revolution that began in 1910 with the overthrow of dictator Porfirio Diaz degenerated into civil war following the assassination of President Francisco Madero. By end of 1915 the forces of President Carranza were arrayed against a variety of leaders supporting either themselves or General Victoriano Huerta. Pancho Villa, commander of the Mexican Army del Norte, at first supported Carranza, but then went rogue after the US Government recognized Carranza’s government. Historians still debate Villa’s reasons, but in early March 1916 he decided to enter the US and raid the town of Columbus, New Mexico. Although the town was where the 13th Regiment US Cavalry was garrisoned, he knew most of the troopers were scattered along the border. Believing the town was only weakly guarded, his force of just under 500 men were to steal arms, provisions and horses while also wreaking as much havoc as possible. Such a raid he believed could galvanize the US government into a retaliatory strike that would drag Carranza’s government into a war with the US it could not win, or a humiliating capitulation that would outrage the Mexican people. Either way, Villa reasoned, it would mean the downfall of Carranza.

Villa’s Vengeance is an introductory level wargame simulation portraying the March 9, 1916 raid on Columbus, New Mexico. Players are cast in the roles of Villa’s raiding force and the defending US regular and militia forces.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civil War, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Full Ahead!
description:
The Full Ahead! miniatures wargame rules were devised to enable wargamers to refight the seemingly forgotten naval battles in the last years of the nineteenth and the early years of the twentieth century (1894-1905). During this period naval technology advanced at a rapid pace but tactically everything was still uncertain, heavy guns, light quick firers, the ram and torpedo all having their proponents, with nobody having the concrete evidence of a major action to confirm or refute their theories.

It is hoped that these rules have captured the spirit of the period they purport to represent without too much of its complexity. Indeed these rules were written with full scale fleet actions in mind with each player assigned the role of a commander in charge of anything from a squadron to an entire fleet. The rules are therefore designed to enable players to concentrate on tactics rather than book keeping and complicated time consuming gun v armour charts etc.

These rules were written with particular reference to the naval actions of the following wars:

Brazilian Civil War 1893-1894
Sino-Japanese War 1894-1895
Spanish-American War 1898
Russo-Japanese War 1904-1905

—description from the rulebook

name: Panzer Korps: Series 2
description:
Panzer Korps: Series 2 includes both Panzer Corps series game MOSCOW '41: Operation Typhoon and RED TYPHOON: The Soviet Winter Counter-Offensive '42 previously separately published in Command Japan magazines.

Contents:

2 rulebooks (8 pages each)
2 countersheets (12.5mm square)
2 maps (A1 size)
1 chart (for Moscow '41)
1 dice

name: Allow Me to Mansplain
description:
Allow Me to Mansplain is a conversational party game that places an emphasis on the words that men say before they mansplain. With light elements of improv and roleplaying, players must mansplain topics to their teammates in three categories: define, explain, and compare. The team with the most correctly guessed mansplained topics wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Dungeon Drop: Tavern Tales – Talk of the Tavern and Inside out Dungeon Scenario
description:
This double-sided card offers two new ways to play/ scenarios for Dungeon Drop: Tavern Tales
- Talk of the Tavern
- Inside out Dungeon

It was given out at Gen Con 2022 from Phase Shift Games
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Postcard Stalingrad
description:
"Postcard Stalingrad" is a relatively fast and simple but historical 9-turn wargame about the 23Aug42-19Nov42 Battle for Stalingrad city.
12 starting units - mostly divisions - for Germans and Russians, each, with some Russian reinforcements and replacements (if they make it across the Volga) and (more) time pressure of Turn 7 withdrawal of 1 motorized and 1 panzer division to cover campaign's flanks which were becoming "worrisome." }:-)
German airpower and 1 later turn of Pioneers/Engineers bonus. Pressed attack.
Russian east bank artillery and "hugging" tactic. Chuikov. Snipers Zaitsev vs. Koenig.
Russian "No land East of the Volga" No Retreat! orders.

And anyone is free to print this or my other 5 (so far) postcard wargames off in postcard size/format only (4x6/A6 or 5x8/A5)... as long as my copyright statement and the Dedication are retained ... to mail/give to family and friends.

(Of course, for your own personal copy you will want to photocopy-enlarge the components.)

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Fast Food
description:
Card game with fast food restaurant theme in which 2-5 players compete who will be first to fullfill customers orders.

There are 6 types of food/drink items (hamburger, french fries, pizza, ice-cream, lemonade, coffee) and orders with 1, 2 or 3 coins representing tip money.

Each player gets 6 random cards with food or drink and they also draw 1 card each with order. When everyone is ready, they put their order cards on table at once. Players take turns in throwing 2 dice with food/drink icons to complement cards on hand to be able to fullfill orders on table. Order can be fullfilled with maximum of 2 cards and at least 1 die.

Everyone can fullfill any order on a table. The harder it is to fullfill an order the better tip money it rewards.

If players can fullfill order, he needs to ring a bell and if order is fullfilled, he throws away food cards and take order card instead as reward. Then players draw cards to fill 6 cards in hand from food/drink set.

Game last untill there is not enough food/drink cards for everyone to have 6 cards in hand or if there are no orders cards left.

Player with most tip money on his order cards wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Matching

name: Category X
description: Player spins the wheel which determines the category from list of 10 categories. After this a card is flipped to determine the starting letter and players have 10 seconds to write a word on their whiteboard. If the word that they have written fits the category, starts with the given letter and is not on any other players' answer then they score a point. First to 10 points wins the game.

name: I Made You a Mixtape
description:
It’s the early 90s. Baggy jeans and flannel shirts reign supreme, and the unmistakable sound of dial-up internet fills the air. Dan DiLisio, the coolest kid in your neighborhood, is heading off to University, and is letting you and your school friends raid his beloved music collection before he goes.

In return he’s asked you to make him a mixtape for his road trip up to college. To make things more interesting he's said that the kid who makes the best tape will win his Quantum Leap poster signed by Scott Bakula.

Man, you really want that poster…

In “I made you a mixtape” you will be competing with the other players to make the best compilation possible out of an album collection. You will be recording one track from each album. Your tape will be judged on how well it’s themed, how the tracks flow with each other, and the balance of lengths between side A and side B.

-description from designer
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection

name: Lords of Vegas: Americana
description:
A multi-expansion for Lords of Vegas, featuring all new boards and components representing the other gambling meccas of the United States. Contains gameplay for playing in Atlantic City, Reno, and 1881 Tombstone. Each game is for 2–6 players, except Lords of Reno is 2 or 3. Requires the Lords of Vegas base set (any edition) to play.

Components include:

4 Boards (Reno, Tombstone, Atlantic City, and New Orleans)
1 deck of 56 cards
60 Tombstone lot markers
1 Reno arch tile
5 New Orleans riverboat tiles
5 wooden Ferris wheels
6 wooden cowboys
5 resident tokens
1 Rulebook
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Random Production, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Douzanimo
description:
COOPERATIVE MEMORY GAME
The 4 Tours company offers animal safaris... with a twist. Whether you’re looking for a lion, a crocodile or a monkey, first you need to put them back together!

The youngest player starts, followed by the other players, taking turns in a clockwise direction.
The player must now try to find the 2 tiles that complete this animal.
He picks 2 of the small tiles in the centre of the table and turns them face up.

If the 2 tiles match the animal, the player positions them on either side of the central tile.


Well done – the animal is now complete!

If only 1 tile matches the animal, the player should position that tile next to the central tile and turn the other tile back over, face down, on the table.
If neither of the tiles matches the animal, the player should turn them both back over, face down, on the table.


The game comes to an end when all of the animals have been completed. Well done – the game is won!

+++ Several difficulty levels available:

Beginner with fewer animals and Expert with a shorter play time.

—description from the publisher

name: Roll and Rails: USA Map Pack 1
description:
USA map pack 1 expansion for Roll and Rails game. It includes 3 new maps:
New England for solo play
Mid Atlantic for duel play
Midwest for multiplayer game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: INX InCountry: Rulebook
description:
InCountry is a blistering fast paced tabletop game system used to represent modern day combat and intelligence operations.
​
InCountry is a flexible game that can be played using two dimensional or three dimensional terrain with multiple players or playing by yourself!

Create exciting modern combat scenarios and play them in no time at all! Learn the rules in only a few minutes and enjoy intense tactical combat for hours on end.

InCountry plays extremely rules light and focuses on player strategy in relation to where and when their Models engage each other in combat! Forget adding +1's and +2's instead focus on applying real world military tactics to your games! 

The rulebook includes print at home intel cards and a full suite of rules for US Rangers, Russians, and Insurgents!

Also includes a full Armory to create your own forces, Scenarios, and indepth rules on how to play InCountry!

name: Cookie Run: Speed Rush
description:
Cookie Run: Speed Rush is a card game that all player simultaneously trying to get rid of their cards by playing them in the middle area called Earthbread.

There are no turns and all players play at the same time until the round ends.

The cards are played on top of other cards of the same color in ascending order from 1 to 10. Number 1 cards can start a new pile in the middle area.

Once a player empty their deck called Witch's Oven, the round is over.

Help Cookies to escape while the Witch is away!

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Number, Real-time, Video Game Theme

name: Word Wipeout
description: Word Wipeout is the fast-paced word game that's sure to elevate your next family game night! Race to collect the most letters by spelling a word related to the category. The rounds get progressively more challenging as fewer letters remain. Pick from 200 beginner or advanced categories in a race to get the word out!

name: ブルームコンパス (Bloom Compass)
description:
A fleeting and beautiful tile arrangement game.

Tile Placement x Resource Management

Invite 9 kinds of flower fairies and make a flower bed.

When you place a fairy tile, the flowers diagonally next to it will bloom or wither.
If you have seeds from these flowers, the fairies may come to you!

Arrange the fairy tiles well to collect seeds and make the most beautiful fairy bouquet as quickly as possible.

-- Publisher Description (Machine translated)

Bloom Compass is a tile laying, puzzle card game with simple rules.

On their turn,the player will take one of 2 actions:

1) Move the gardner pawn, and draw a card from the deck the pawn finishes on, adding it to the flowerbed

or

2) Replace a face-up card in the flowerbed with a seed and move the card elsewhere

After completing one of these actions, the player performs a Compass check, determined by the card just placed.
publishers: めめめのアトリエ (MeMeMe No Atelier)

name: Panjshir '82
description:
Command bands of Mujahideen fighters in the infamous Panjshir valley during the Soviet-Afghan war. Raise your warband's fighting ability as they seek to accomplish their objectives within the valley and evade patrolling companies of USSR units.

This is not a wargame in of the traditional hex & counter style: there are limited units on the board and a wide range of dynamic encounters that will make each session unfold differently. The goal is to evoke the aesthetic and feel of the 1979-1989 conflict in Afghanistan.

An asymmetric single-player table-top wargame, two player-controlled Mujahideen bands roam a hexed valley attempting to amass the ‘Combat Power’ necessary to undertake two risky ‘Critical Strikes’ – the significant actions that presage game-ending withdrawals. Most of the time it’s in your interest to avoid the five Soviet companies that also wander the map. These formidable foes patrol randomly, but will bee-line towards player units in response to certain random encounters and battle results.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Cosmic Portal: Mirror Zone (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: A strange vortex suddenly appears over Carcassonne, shifting the entire landscape into an alternate dimension where nothing is what it seems. This expansion features 8 new tiles for Carcassonne C1 and C2 that when played have major effects on the way points are given...or taken away. This expansion is the first of a series; the 2nd, Cosmic Portal II: Exploring the Multiverse, will explain what happens when you place a follower inside the cosmic portal
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Battles of Napoleon: Volume II – QUATRE BRAS 1815
description:
Battles of Napoleon is an epic wargame series that simulates the most famous battles of Napoleon on a Tactical level sharing the same basic rules.

The series portrays the most important aspects of battles of the Napoleonic era with easy to learn and remember rules, intuitive mechanics and procedures. Players may focus on taking decisions and playing rather than consulting rules.

The system focusses on the “cat-and-mouse game” of coordination and timing of the various formations of the different arms without too much crunchy chrome.

Infantry was the predominant and most important element in every European army of the period. It usually formed between 60 and 90 per cent of an army in battle, and was both the cheapest and the most versatile type of troops. The foot soldiers had to endure most of the fighting and casualties. Depending on their task, they were either deployed in line (fire power), column (maneuver and assault) or square formation (protection against enemy cavalry).

Cavalry were screening the own army and provided the shock element on a Napoleonic battlefield. Due to their shock power they fixed enemy infantry and forced them to take shelter in square formation. If infantry failed to form square they were overrun. If infantry was fixed in semi-static squares they were very vulnerable to artillery fire.
Artillery, the queen of the battlefield, was on the one hand having devastating effects on square and closely packed formations, on the other hand artillery alone was extremely vulnerable when getting charged by enemy units.

Generals are tasked with taking advantage of favorable terrain like the famous Duke of Wellington who mastered the reverse slope tactic.

By a simple game mechanic, players will never know the exact strength and power of an enemy unit. Units have a number of strength points that will gradually decrease while engaged with enemy units.

An innovative chit-based Command system, where players randomly draw activation chits determines which army may activate a formation, leads to highly interactive game play. Reaction follows action. We bring the chit-based Command system to a new level: In this games series, players decide which formation is activated when a chit is drawn. A formation may be activated several times per turn. But by each new activation it performs less effective.

During a game turn the players are under constant pressure to decide which formation to activate. By efficient timing of activation players are in the “driver’s seat” to dictate the pace of a battle.

Formations are given orders at the beginning of a game turn and are therefore limited by the actions they can perform on the battlefield. The more “aggressive” orders formations will receive, the more likely is the army will collapse due to fatigue. On the other hand, an army is more likely to gain the initiative on the battlefield by “aggressive” orders.

The scale of the series is appr. 150 meters per hex, infantry units are battalions, artillery is batteries and cavalry is represented as regiments.

Quatre Bras 1815, depicting the encounter at the Quatre Bras crossroads, is the second volume in this series. Special rules like the possibility to activate the French light cavalry brigade, the defense of special structures, the possible arrival of d'Erlon's I Corps add distinctive flavor of the battle.

—description from the publisher

name: Bring Guns to Bear
description:
Bring Guns to Bear (BGB) is a simulation of modern era (WWI & WWII) tactical naval combat.

[All game files available below: Rule Book, Player Aids, Ship Database.] SCENARIOS AVAILABLE UNDER 'VARIANTS' FORUM.

Simple rules are employed for fast play while still retaining the essence of ‘big gun’ naval surface engagements.

Typically, up to 14 Individual ships may be represented in this hex and counter game (no rulers or protractors). Played by two players in opposition or as a solitaire game using the AI.


Movement by impulse allows reduced footprint and avoids extended range hex counts.



Dice rolls are always to some immediate purpose (not just to see what further table to roll on), either 2d6 or (2d6 + 1d6); no buckets of dice!



Separate targeting tables for WWI and WWII.



Ships weakened by damage become progressively more susceptible through reduced damage control capability.



Minimal logging requirements using simple strikethrough.



Includes random scenario generator.


All games files are posted with this listing for free use (I retain copyright), and I am open to ongoing design tweak suggestions from the community. I'm also open to approaches from publishers interested in producing a 'deluxe' version.

—description from the designer
categories: Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Line of Sight, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Lawyer Up: Season 2 – Private Eye: Game Boy Geek 2022 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

3 promo cards for case #04 from Lawyer Up: Season 2.

Incudes 1 defendant (Lukas Litzsinger) and 2 allies (Rashon Monroe and Jeremy Kaufmann).

Lukas Litzsinger (can only be called by the defense)
Called: Attempt to solve the case. If you get the Murder Weapon correct, discard 2 of your opponent's claimed witnesses.

Rashon Monroe
Investigate: If you solve a clue, discard the card from the Prosecution's examination with the highest value.

Jeremy Kaufmann
Investigate: If you solve a clue, reduce the prosecution's influence by 6.

name: Betakkuma's Fart & Furious
description:
“Ding-Dong!” The elevator door opens as the bell goes off. Everyone hastily steps into the cabin. It is just another boring morning where all of you have to cramp yourselves into the same old elevator to go up to your office. The very moment the door shuts tight, a rumbling sound breaks the silence. The atmosphere suddenly intensifies. A foul smell immediately hits you in the face. It is as simple as that - an eye for an eye, a toot for a toot!

Fart & Furious is a putridly-amusing party game for 3-8 players where you and your friends will fare against each other in a battle of PFFT!

—description from the publisher

name: Crazy Driver
description: Try to be the first to reach the finish line on the modular track. On the way you have to pass various mini-games in the interactive app and avoid the attacks of your opponents.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Decorations
description:
Deck the halls and roll the dice in this holiday game of chance and strategy! In Decorations, you will use your dice rolls to carefully place ornaments and lights on your Christmas tree, aiming for the perfect combination to earn the most points. With a mix of luck and skill, can you create the most dazzling tree?

Designed for one player and taking just 15 minutes, Decorations is perfect for kids aged 8 and up. So grab your dice and get ready to trim the tree in this merry and exciting game!

name: Fantastic Tempostick
description:
Michiru and Nobara compete to see who can best control Tempo. The winner will be crowned Drum Major of the marching drum and fife band!

The goal is to arrange your Temposticks ("Tempos") in a specific pattern within the Finish Zone of your Scale board. Each round, players will draft dice and assign them to their dice coasters. The value of a die, combined with which coaster it is assigned to, determines which Conducting Technique you will perform to move your Tempos.

Under certain circumstance, such as if your opponent drafts a die of your color, you may be able to move a cube around your Baton Performance Board. When your cubes complete laps on this board, you gain special benefits.

Additional features include:

Tuning Tokens (dice manipulation)
Chance Cards (once-per-game abilities and/or end-game points)
Target Cards (bonus points for achieving certain Tempo patterns throughout the game)
Point Cards (cumulative and increasing end-game points)


—user description
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Ordering, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Track Movement
publishers: Yureru tsubomi wo mederu kai (揺れる蕾を愛でる会)

name: Warriors & Writings
description:
A print-and-play game of daring adventurers in dangerous dungeons.

You play as a brave adventurer in a fantasy world of magic and monsters.

You explore a map, fighting enemies as you go, searching for treasure in every corner.

After a limited number of rounds, each player that has defeated the dangerous boss enemy compares their collected loot. The player with the most gold is the winner!

Each hero has their own advantages and special abilities. Each map presents a different set of challenges. By playing different combinations of heroes and maps, the game provides a variety of experiences and stays fresh through many plays.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Wicked Wizard of Oz
description:
The Wicked Wizard of Oz is a portal to the Marvellous Land of Oz, in which you take on the role of the one of the protagonists of L. Frank Baum’s The Wonderful Wizard of Oz as they embark upon a new and perilous quest, as they find themselves called upon to save the world once more.

Hunted by the Wicked Witch of the West's winged monkeys and joined by her friends – the Scarecrow, the Tin Woodman, and the Lion – Dorothy Gale sets off for the Emerald City. Surrounded by enemies on all sides, will you uncover the secrets of The Wicked Wizard of Oz?

You decide which route to take, which perils to risk, and which of Oz’s strange denizens to fight. But be warned – whether you succeed in your quest or meet a dire end, somewhere over the rainbow, will be down to the choices YOU make. Are you ready to return to Oz?

name: Battle of Maldon
description:
991 AD: Olaf the Dane came with his ships and army to the towns of east England. The Danes overran these places, one by one, until they arrived at Maldon. Here Ealdorman Byrhtnoth marched against the Danes with his army. The English held the ford between the island where the Danes had landed and Maldon on the mainland. The Danes asked permission to cross uncontested and fight on equal terms. For some reason, Byrhtnoth agreed. After great struggle, the Danes killed the ealdorman. The brave English fell in battle, the cowardly fled, and the Danes took possession of that place of slaughter.

Battle of Maldon is a two-player game commemorating this famous battle. Players take on the role of either the Danes or the English, and attempt to capture the enemy through maneuver and attack. All you need is a regular deck of cards to play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Endangered: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available in pack A of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Wildfire:
Instant Impact: Remove a Deforestation tile, then roll a die. Lose an animal that is exactly that many spaces from the space where the Deforestation was.

Tsunami:
Roll a die. If the row indicated by the die result has any animals, then remove a Pollution tile and lose one animal from that row.

name: Starships at Large
description:
12 turns. 1-6 players. A winning player can do so as soon as at the end of his turn he or his Alliance have colonized sufficient discovered (initially upside-down) planets, dead but mineable, friendly or, less easily, unfriendly.

A player's turn consists of adding a starship for each new planet he acquired in his previous turn, and then moving his starships to visit other planets, attack enemy starships or bases, or beat back Dead Zones if the Death Star has been activated and not yet destroyed. He can also move his base to another live planet.

The Alliance starts on Jord/Earth, but no more than the 2 highest scoring players in it can get credit for winning the game if the Alliance does, so others may emigrate to other planets to set up their base there and become independent and/or piratical Vikings.

Negotiations and alliances can become as cut-throat as in classic Diplomacy. After the 7th of 12 turns the Alliance can *start* a war with a competitor/Viking, if the latter hasn't already started a war with *it*.

Planets to be found and diplomatically (or militarily) colonized (for game-winning credit) are even out in the outer reaches, but then so is the Death Star which is a threat to everyone if awakened and usually requires everyone to set aside their competitions and even wars to defeat!

Bases - Earth being the first and central - 6 starships, 5 friendly planets, 5 unfriendly planets, 4 dead but mine-able planets, 5 asteroid markers, empty space markers, and the Death Star on a 37 hexagon space field.

-description from designer
categories: Negotiation, Pirates, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hot Potato, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Sudden Death Ending

name: Magic: The Gathering – Ravnica Allegiance Planeswalker Deck: Dovin, Architect of Law
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Dovin Baan is a fastidious vedalken engineer with a peerless ability to instantly spot imperfections in any system. Optimize your spells by casting them at the perfect moments and clear the way for your superior flying creatures to pummel your opponent.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Germ War: Invaders
description:
In Germ War: Invaders, you are a newly introduced germ in a petri dish, surrounded by hostile germs. One section at a time, you will have to fight the “home team” in order to gain superiority of the petri
dish.
Germ War: Invaders is a solo (with a two-player option), area control game using a traditional deck of cards. Each turn you will place your cards on the petri dish by their value, trying to gain and maintain the majority control of the sections to win the game.

In the solo game, you will play again the AI who can spread very quickly in the petri dish through a chain reaction but is limited on his growth ability. In the two-player game, its germ vs. germ. Both have the same ability, so the trick is to play the most efficient game.

name: Witchstone: Game Boy Geek Goal Promo Card
description:
New goal card from The Game Boy Geek's 2022 Kickstarter.

Score 4/7/10 points for 2/3/4+ connections to the witchstone.

name: Dwar7s Winter: A Dragon's Trade Promo Pack
description:
Originally available in pack D of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Adds a new type of disaster. Shuffle these cards with the other disasters.
