To resolve this disaster discard 4 gold and remove 2 dwarfs from the affected zone.

The dragon accepts your trade and you gain 1 wood, 1 stone, and 1 food.

Includes 3 cards + a cover/rules card.

name: Plums for trash
description:
Each player receives containers for glass, paper, plastic and organic waste. A waste dump is formed. A plum card market is created. On each turn, players sort waste by placing it in their bins, then have the option to exchange it for plums if they have enough collected waste. In addition to waste, the dump also hides special cards that can help players trade more plums by outsmarting others.

The player who exchanges the most Plums for Trash wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: Black Stories: Bloody True Crime
description:
This version of the black stories series features real crimes. These stories are 100% true.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Crannogman Bog Devils
description: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Crannogman Bog Devils includes twelve miniatures, a unit card, and a special rules card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Guilds of Ravnica Planeswalker Deck: Ral, Caller of Storms
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Ral Zarek is a quick-witted storm mage who is always one step ahead of his enemies. Disrupt your opponent's plans and pummel them with a flurry of spells on your way to victory.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: National Geographic: Rock & Mineral Game Set
description:
A GREAT WAY TO LEARN GEOLOGY! Kids will have a blast with this game set! They'll play rock bingo, mineral memory, gem-tac-toe, trivia, and have a full deck of playing cards that can also be used as flash cards. STEM has never been so much fun!

A HUGE ROCK COLLECTION! In addition to all the fun games, kids will also receive 25 rock specimens and over 150 rock, mineral, and gemstone specimens! The rocks and gems serve as game pieces, but also make a fun addition to any rock collection!

EVERYTHING YOU NEED! This kit has game boards, instructions, a specimen bag, and 52 playing cards with fascinating facts about the rocks and gems in the kit. The cards can be used in trivia, as flash cards, or as part of any traditional card game!

A GREAT WAY TO PLAY TOGETHER! Younger kids love memory games and older kids will be excited to play rock bingo and gemstone trivia games! This is a great way for kids to learn and play together, and parents are certainly welcome in on the fun too!

—description from the publisher

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2021 Planeswalker Deck: Basri, Devoted Paladin
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

The entire multiverse has opened up before Basri Ket, ready to test to his unshakeable ideals. Spread the hurt by permanently powering up an army of creatures that submit to no one.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2019 Planeswalker Deck: Vivien of the Arkbow
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Vivien is a keen naturalist-her magical Arkbow preserves the essence of each creature she encounters, allowing her to summon them at need. Master the wilds and crush your opponents with massive creatures.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: 1758 Fort Carillon: Abercromby's Fumble at Ticonderoga
description:
In July 1758, the British army made a major push north against Fort Carillon, a.k.a. Fort Ticonderoga. This was part of a three-pronged campaign against New France, led by Major-General Abercromby.

With a massive army of 17,000 men supported by 44 pieces of artillery, the 3,500 French and Canadian defenders were facing overwhelming odds. Due to unforeseen events, the battle turned out to be a decisive victory for the French commander Montcalm and his forces.

1758 Fort Carillon - Abercromby's Fumble at Ticonderoga is a detailed simulation of the battle, starting from the British landing at day break of July 6th. Lead elements included Rogers Rangers.

Each artillery piece and key leader or engineer is individually represented in the game. Combat units are 100 men each. You can build or destroy bridges or earthworks. The game also includes small boats such as bateaux that can be carried over land and larger rafts for artillery. Optional rules include ships from the small French navy on Lake Champlain.

—description from the designer
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2019 Planeswalker Deck: Sarkhan, Dragonsoul
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Sarkhan worships and communes with dragons, taking n their power as his own. Mobilize his mighty draconic forces to incinerate your opponent's defenses and expose them to an aerial attack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Fiesta de los Muertos: 5 cartes pour mettre à jour
description: Five promo cards: three new restrictions and two new characters.

name: Mexican Railways
description:
From Tijuana to Merida, from Matamoros to Merida, the entirely of Mexico is encompassed in Mexican Railways. Foreign connections to the United States and Guatemala provide lucrative incentives in this luckless economic game where the most money at the end of the game wins. Business interests drive players in continual expansion. Loans are taken for intensive capital investment, with the game ending when one player has expended all their cubes. Family money provides an initial boost to these ventures.

Mexican Railways is a stand-alone game that uses the wood cubes, the money and the base rules of Iberian Railways. The game is for 3-5 players and lasts about an hour. The 'International Mexico' bonus is a new, very powerful addition to the game as are the international connections.

Mexican Railways is the fourth game using Winsome’s Regional Railways System. The prior three games were Rhodesian Railways, Balkan Railways and Iberian Railways. The base rules for this system may be downloaded from Rio Grande Games page for Iberian Railways.

—description from the publisher

name: イッパイ烏賊が？ (Ippai Ikaga?)
description:
イッパイ烏賊が？ (Ippai Ikaga?) is a party game about counting from Japan. Players can make connections between different objects, according to how they are counted in Japanese. For example, Soba noodles are 'pieces', and fields are 'pieces', so that's a match.

数え方でセットを作ろう！
日本語でちょっと変わった 「数え方」 をする物や行動のなかから、
同じ ”読み” のモノを探して当ててみよう！ というゲームです。

例：蕎麦（枚）・　畑（枚）　⇒　点数ゲット

「えぇ？そんな数え方もあるの！？」という日本語における数え方の面白さを体験しながら自然と覚えることが出来るパーティーゲームです。
publisher summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Space Infantry: Zero G
description:
Space Infantry: Zero G is a solitaire game of combat in the future set in the world of Space Infantry: the Player will control the soldiers of the human race against the endless enemies lurking in the universe.

The game has been designed to have Zero setup, Zero space required (you only need one A4/Letter sheet) and simple rules, but capable of providing enough challenge and obviously fun. Perfect as a filler or when traveling, the game include nine battles with a progressive complexity (read: challenge), each battle playable in 10 to 20 minutes.

—description from the designer

name: T.A.P.E.S!
description: Each round you select an object, then you spin for a unit of measurement. Once the measurement has been selected you have to turn your back to the selected object and guess how big it is in the unit of measurement. Units of measurement include gummy bears, Wiener dogs, basketballs, playing cards, and several others.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Dominaria Planeswalker Deck: Teferi, Timebender
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Teferi is a master of temporal magic. Use his powers to manipulate time and accelerate our deck to certain victory.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Roll and Rails: Contracts Expansion
description: Expand your game by adding contracts expansion. This variant gives you more possibilities to score points.

name: Conqueror: The Empire Rises
description: An expansion to Conqueror: Final Conquest that adds advanced asymmetrical strategic gameplay to this epic ancient empire building game
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Colour-blind
description:
Start
Deal four hands of 13 cards, one hand to each of three players and one face down to the table. Turn the extra hand face up and spread it out in a row, overlapping the cards slightly so that all are identifiable.

Object
Count how many row cards are red and how many black. Whichever colour there are more cards of is the 'good' colour, the other 'bad'. The aim is to capture cards of the good colour and avoid those of the bad.

Play
The player at dealer's left leads to the first of 13 tricks. You must follow suit if you can, but may otherwise play any card. The trick is taken by the highest card played, regardless of suit. For this purpose cards rank from high to low AKQJ1098765432. Of equally high cards, the last played wins. Upon winning a trick, you take the current top card of the row (the one at the uncovered end), lay it face up before you, discard the trick face down to a wastepile, and lead to the next.

Score
When all tricks have been played and row cards taken, you total the face value of all cards you have taken of the good colour and subtract the total face value of those of the bad colour. For this purpose Aces count 1 each, numerals 2 to 10 count at face value, Jack counts 11, Queen 12, and King 13. If your count is positive, you record it as your score; if negative, you score zero for that round. (Thus you never actually score a minus number.) Play up to any previously agreed target.

name: Battles in the East 3: Operation Sonnewende/Pomerania and Drive to the Sea
description:
Volume 3 features two battles from 1945. Includes untried late war Axis units and Russian Rocket divisions. Components include a double-sided full-size mounted game board, 440 large counters, a 16-page series rules booklet, and scenario/exclusive rules sheets and displays, plus full-color set-up charts for each scenario, series charts and tables for each player.

—description from the publisher

name: Magic: The Gathering – Hour of Devastation Planeswalker Deck: Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Ancient and powerful, the dragon Planeswalker Nicol Bolas will stop at nothing to dominate the Multiverse. Join his cause to raise an army of afflicted undead and sap the strength of your foes until all bow before you.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Master Parfums: Pocket Quiz
description:
The Master Parfums Pocket Quiz is the travel-friendly version of the olfactory game. This deck of 120 cards, helps deepen your knowledge about perfume through intriguing and sometimes surprising questions!

This pocket version doesn’t come with scent pens, the booklet, or the paper blotters used to compose your own fragrance. Its small size is designed to be easy to pack in a bag so you can bring it wherever you go. It’s a perfect way to pass the time when traveling or to spice up a friendly gathering!

Through 120 questions/answers on fragrance, embark upon an unforgettable olfactory journey. Four categories of cards help expand your knowledge:

History, Literature, and Mythology
Perfume Secrets
The Olfactory Palette
Brands, Perfumes, and Tips

Try to be the first player or the first team to win 12 correctly answered cards. Are you up to the challenge?

Play the pocket version of Master Parfums!

120 questions, to learn about perfume culture while having fun playing the Pocket Quiz! 

Features: we’ve designed this mini version so you can take it anywhere you go and expand your knowledge of perfume trivia through quizzes. The questions are different from those in the Olfactory Game booklet, meaning the cards can be added so you can enjoy twice as many questions!

If you want to go for the full-featured version that appeals to the senses thanks to its scent pens and blotters, the olfactory game is your best bet.

The box contains 120 perfume trivia questions in a pocket size that’s perfect on the go!

Rules of the game: the first player to correctly answer 12 questions (3 in each category) wins the game and becomes the Master of Perfumes!

—description from the publisher

name: 古狼の荊 (Korou no Ibara)
description:
Polygonotes's 7th card game, 古狼の荊 ("Thorns of the Ancient Wolves"), was made around the themes of distrust and reading other people. Though the rules are simple and easy to learn, it has a high ceiling for strategy and will bring you back to play it again and again.

—description from the publisher (translated)

In Thorns of the Ancient Wolves, players are hunters caught between the conflict of a mad king trying to exterminate the ancient wolves of the nearby forest, and the wolves ready to go to war to protect their home. Each faction is represented by a suit of cards- red for the wolves and blue for the kingdom.

When it is your turn, you draw a card from a face-down pool of 3 and choose a card to play from your hand. Cards are worth points and have special effects. When it is the end of a player's turn and they have 10 or more points from a single faction in their play area, the round ends and that faction is scored as positive for all players- with the losing faction being scored as negative for everyone as well. Players tally their points and add (or subtract) them to victory points that persist between rounds, then begin a new round. If at the end of a round a player has 15 or more points, the player with the highest victory point total wins.

—user summmary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Command Cards, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection

name: Chamber of Wonders: Christmas Club Promo
description:
To celebrate Christmas and the coming of the New Year, the creators of Chamber of Wonders have created a special new Christmas-themed Club Card!

With this card, you gain 2 Fame Points for each Legendary Wonder Card displayed in 2 or more copies.

name: Чист късмет (Pure luck)
description:
Чист късмет ("Pure Luck") is a family game with lots of fun, knowledge, ambition and care for nature. The board game is entirely dedicated to environmental protection and the opportunity to live in harmony with nature. How does this happen? You will find out by following the rules of the game. Only those of you who know how waste is separated, what are the subtleties of recycling and composting will become winners!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Чист късмет е семейна игра с много забавления, знания, амбиция и грижа за природата. Настолната игра е изцяло посветена на опазването на околната среда и възможността да живеем в хармония с природата. Как се случва това ли? Ще разберете, следвайки правилата на играта. Само онези от Вас, които знаят как се разделят отпадъците, какви са тънкостите при рециклирането и компостирането ще станат победители!

—description from the publisher

name: The Faceless: Amusement Park
description:
The Faceless Amusement Park is the first dungeon crawler with compass and magnets. The main Characters are teenagers and the Action Wheel represents the difficulty of acting in certain situations of its protagonists. What will happen, turn by turn, can be conditioned by the magnetic force on the Action Wheel. Miniatures with magnets have a positive side and a negative side which will influence the movement of the Compass in the center of the Action Wheel.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Kennst du Wien und die Wiener Straßenbahn?
description:
Each player places his house anywhere on the game board, which represents a map of Vienna. Then each player draws an agreed on number of landmark cards. The players start at their house an have to visit each landmark on their drawn cards before returning home. The first to do so wins the game.

Movement is 1 space per turn. If a player uses a tram or train a die is used to determine the rate of movement. If a player reaches a landmark from one of his cards, he puts the corresponding wood model (1st edition) or block with photo on the map.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Palace Coup
description:
Historically in the Third World, coups have changed more governments than elections since World War II. Most coups involve using part of the armed forces of a country to seize power from a ruler, though there is usually little overt conflict – the coup d’etat is generally a much less bloody way of seizing power than its distant cousin, the popular revolution.

In the game, two or more players act as the leaders of political or professional factions in a fictional country. Some players will be plotting, individually or severally, to effect a change in the existing government. They will be opposed by others who wish things to remain as they are. But who is which, and what do they really want?

The game is played in two phases:

the Pre-coup Phase where players attempt to secure support for their faction in the military, paramilitary and civilian sectors and thwart the others; and
the Coup Phase where loyalist and rebel sides face off in direct combat.


Games are short and fast, normally 45 minutes or less.

—description from the designer
categories: Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Axolotl Mix
description: Axolotl Mix is an abstract game for 2 players where we put Axolotls back in order in their aquariums. It's meant for younger audiences, but anyone can play it. It has a big deal of randomness, but I found it fun to play.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: The Men Who Would Be Kings: The Last Samurai Rebellion
description:
It is an expansion for The Men Who Would Be Kings that explores the upheavals of late-19th century Japan, with its unique mixture of Western European influences and strong local military traditions.

Inside you will find:

Detailed historical context in the tradition of the H&GL
New Upgrades
New Unit Types
A series of Unique Military Commanders
Six New Scenarios
New Leadership Traits Table


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Hens: Promo cards
description: This expansion adds 7 new cards to the base game: A new breed of Pekin Bantam ("Zwerg-Cochin", 6 cards) and one Predator promo card.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: El Rey de la Charca
description:
El Rey de la Charca ("The King of the Pond") is a board game for children in which you will have to prepare your legs and get ready to jump from water lily to water lily eating delicious insects. Will you be able to eat 5 different bugs to demonstrate your refined palate and be the King of the pond?
The frogs are about to have a feast of assorted insects, a platter of flying bugs? You will have to get a taste of all five different types of insects if you want to win.

—description from the publisher (translated)

El rey de la charca es un juego de mesa para niños en el que tendrás que preparar tus ancas y disponerte a saltar de nenúfar en nenúfar comiendo deliciosos insectos. ¿Podrás comer 5 bichitos diferentes para demostrar tu refinado paladar y ser el Rey de la charca?

Las ranas están a punto de darse un festín de insectos variados, ¿una mariscada de bichos voladores? Tendrás que conseguir probar los cinco tipos diferentes de insectos si quieres hacerte con la victoria.

—description from the publisher

name: Dungeons and Feelings
description:
Dungeons & Feelings is the strategy / social board game hybrid where the only way to conquer your dungeon is to open up, dig deep, and share your opinions, stories, and feelings. Dungeons & Feelings is inspired by classic adventure video games and distills their mechanics into easily accessible board game form.

In Dungeons & Feelings, you will proceed through a dungeon of your own design. Along the way, you will fight monsters, avoid traps, and discover treasure as you gain experience, level up, and acquire loot. When you are ready, you will fight the Dragon and emerge victorious!

You will have many items at your disposal to conquer your dungeon, but to craft them, you will need to ask your fellow players to answer an interesting, thought-provoking question about themselves. Laugh, cry, and start a deeper conversation with your friends in Dungeons & Feelings.

Dungeons & Feelings is a 3-4 player, non aggressive board game designed to be played in one sitting. It fuses elements of tile placing, crafting, role playing, with get-to-know-you ice breaker question mechanics quite unlike any game you've played before.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Map Addition, Questions and Answers, Role Playing, Set Collection, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Миш Маш (Mish Mash)
description:
Do you want to create the funniest stories together with your friends?
With its millions of different possible combinations, Миш Маш ("Mish Mash") is a great activity for any gathering with friends. Those afraid to try the game will get countless hours of fun thanks to 176 unique cards that can be combined in any number of ways. The only limit in the game is the imagination of the players and their sense of humor!

Game mechanics:
Players take turns drawing and reading the beginning of a new sentence to choose the coolest and funniest ending.
Play until all the blue cards are gone, until a certain amount of time passes, or until a player reaches a certain number of rounds won.

Components:
Mish Mash contains 44 blue and 132 yellow cards. 4 of the blue and 12 of the yellow cards are blank so you can add text to your liking. Let your imagination run wild!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Искате ли да съчините заедно с приятелите си най-забавните истории?
Със своите милиони различни възможни комбинации, Миш Маш е страхотно занимание за всякакви събирания с приятели. Тези, престрашили се да пробват играта, ще се сдобият с безброй часове забавление, благодарение на 176 уникални карти, които могат да бъдат комбинирани по всякакви начини. Единственият лимит в играта е въображението на играчите и чувството им за хумор!

Механика на играта:
Играчите се редуват да теглят и прочитат началото на ново изречение, за да изберат най-страхотния и смешен край.
Играйте докато не свършат всички сини карти, докато не мине определен период от време, или докато някой Миш Машаджия не достигне определен брой спечелени рундове.

Компоненти:
Миш Маш съдържа 44 сини и 132 жълти карти. 4 от сините и 12 от жълтите карти са празни, за да можеш да допълниш играта с текст по твой вкус. Развихри въображението си!

—description from the publisher

name: JUMP
description: In the game, players take on the role of ski jumpers to perform their best jumps. In each of the jump phases in the form of cards, all jumpers try to get as many points as possible to maximize the length of their jump. A coach can help with each jump, but even here be ready for pitfalls such as injuries or a random wind factor. Jumping will take place both on the large and mammoth jumping hills.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection

name: Murder at the Disco
description: New York, 1977. Hot nightclub Disco 54 is hosting a birthday and only the coolest people are there. But before anyone can 'get down on it', nightclub owner Doctor Disco is found dead in the VIP lounge! Join us to find out whodunit!

name: Pun Intended, too!
description:
Pun Intended Too contains 1200 puns, a 1-minute timer, and a scorepad. It is like its predecessor "Pun Intended", but with new puns. (Note: You do not need to have Pun Intended to play Pun Intended, too! - it's a standalone game).

Players are divided into two teams. One player on the team is elected the reader and the others on the same team will guess. "Teams have 1 minute to guess 6 puns that all start with the same letter and score 1 point for each correct guess." Each pun will be written out on the card with a blank somewhere in the phrase. Those guessing need to come up with the "punny" answer for that blank.

Incorrect guesses do not count against the point total. The other team has an opportunity to "steal" once the timer has expired. The option to steal applies to questions that were not correctly guessed during the time limit and those that were not read before time expired.

name: I'm not afraid
description:
I'm not afraid is a game of obtaining majority for your cause. It shows the complex reality of competing movements, one fighting to keep the authoritarian power and the other struggling to change the system. Contested locations include: main cities, main groups and main unions. It continues until one of the leaders secures majority of their supporters in five locations. Once you secure a special task from the bonus cards you receive points as well as an advantage in rolling more dice. At the end of the game, players score points (the points indicated on locations) and user boards. Player with the most points wins. In case of a tie, the player who placed 5 meeples on locations wins.

—description from the publisher

name: キャンディポット (Candypot)
description:
キャンディポット (Candypot) is a shedding game from japan. Players are dealt two lollipops they must dispose of by either giving them to the candy boy in the centre, or to other players.

Each player begins their round with four cards, each with a different action, that they must choose in secret then show to each other simultaneously. The first two cards allow players to pass a lolly to another player or to the candy boy in the middle of the table, but only if they are the only one doing that action, so if two players both try to pass a lolly to a third player, they deny each other and keep their lollys. The third card blocks attempts to give you a lolly that round, and the final retrieves one card to be played again on a future round, neither of these are affected by other players choosing the same action.

When all players empty their hands, players collect their used cards and continue.

When a player empties their supply of lollipops, they win! The game ends when only one loser remains.

The game is puplished in a small jam jar.
user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ten Wickets
description:
Ten Wickets one day cricket inspired auction game. Each player takes on the role of opposing cricket captains trying to take 10 wickets for as few runs as possible. Each wicket you take gives your opponent runs (points) and the player with the most runs will win the game. Take the wickets, pay the runs and don't get caught without ten wickets at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management

name: Order Overload: Insects
description:
Let's work together to remember the names of the insects we found! It's fun just to look at the cards that use insect pictures.

In a round, you deal a certain number of cards face up and read them aloud so that everyone knows all the insects found, then you deal these cards out face down to the players. On a turn, you need to name an insect that's in someone else's hand. Fail to do so, and you're eliminated from play! If you collectively reveal a set number of insects before everyone is eliminated, then you clear the level and are ready to take on tougher challenges...

What's the highest level you can clear?
publishers: Oink Games, 小学館 Good Games

name: Cards Christians Like: Pop Culture Expansion Pack
description:
The Pop Culture Expansion is your guide to all things internet, music, fashion, and gaming. These hilarious additions to Cards Christians Like will poke fun at the trends we experience in American culture. Included in this expansion are 30 never before seen cards (25 white cards and 5 blue cards).

A collaboration with @epicchristiansmemes – Cards Christians Like base game required for gameplay.

-description from publisher's website

name: Cards Christians Like: Gen Z Expansion Pack
description:
The Gen Z Expansion is your new trendy addition to Cards Christians Like. Enjoy these lit additions that fr slap. Included in this expansion are 30 never before seen cards (25 white cards and 5 blue cards). No cap.

-description from publisher's website

name: Cards Christians Like: Cards Christians Hide Expansion Pack
description:
The Cards Christians Hide Expansion Pack is your new edgy addition to CCL. Finally, the inappropriate humor you miss hidden inside of a Christian game you trust (24 white cards and 6 blue cards).

A collaboration with @memesforjesus – Cards Christians Like base game required for gameplay.

-description from publisher's website

name: Long Long Animal
description: Simple card game where you collect card sets to complete long (or tall) animals which span across 2 or 3 cards.

name: Tinderblox: Marshmallow Mini Expansion
description:
A mini expansion that can be used with Tinderblox Day or Night.

This expansion adds 4 marshmallow cards and 4 marshmallow tokens.

These marshmallow cards work in the same way as other cards, but marshmallow tokens are not allowed to touch ember cubes.

name: AnARKey Trading Card Game
description:
In a Post Apocalyptic world you must build your tribe in do battle in the wasteland for the last bit of livable land and precious resources.

Build a deck of crazy characters and followers and do battle in this all new spin that combines classic TCG deck building with table top miniature strategy.

Choose your leader and roll your dice on your way to victory.
who will you choose? Cannibal Hippies? Rednecks with gators? Perhaps you want to assemble a team of carnival clowns and cosplayers? So many choices, but a the end of the day its going to be total AnARKey!

—description from the publisher

name: Крепость сна (Slumber tower)
description:
Slumber Tower is a board game with hidden roles. Three groups of characters (Nightmares, Good Dreams, and Dreamers) confront each other. Each player secretly gets the role of a character from one of the groups. Your task is to figure out who is playing against your group and to wake up your opponents.

—description from the publisher (translated)

It's best to play in a group of five or more people. Then it's interesting to hide your personal motives, it's harder to guess what role you're playing and what you're aiming for. You take a character card and read your goals. If you meet them by the end of the game, you'll beat your opponents and win.

But the others can not only guess who is hiding under the mask of their favorite friends, but also check them: for this purpose cards of Insight are useful. They can be obtained after a die roll (if an open eye appears on the die). Each player rolls the die at the beginning of his turn. The Insight has some suggestion written on it, which you give to the person you choose to check. For example, it says that if the card is given to the Dreamer, he loses his sleep strength. If you give it to a player who is actually a Dreamer, he silently, without showing the card to anyone, drops his sleep token to a lower level. The rest of us don't know who he is, and you've already figured it out - yes, he's a tricky Dreamer.

There are a lot of interesting things in the game, such as walking around dream locations, helping another player fall asleep more deeply, and attacking characters. Yes, yes, the most important value here is a sound sleep. That's why the characters try to wake each other up. A successful sleep attack is minus the sleep strength level.

Don't let the game make you think of peaceful pictures. The battles in it are fierce. That's why it likes both those who have long played board games, and those who love beautiful things, but are ready to dive into the intricate rules. After the first game it will be easy to play, but the first place will come to bluff each other, surprise attacks and real teamwork.

—user summary

«Крепость сна» — это настольная игра со скрытыми ролями. Три группы персонажей (Кошмары, Добрые сны и Сновидцы) противостоят друг другу. Каждый игрок тайно от других получает роль персонажа одной из групп. Ваша задача — понять, кто играет против вашей группы, и разбудить соперников.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game

name: Самые ужасные отмазки (The worst excuses)
description:
Missed friend's birthday? No worries, you have a good excuse: you had a sleeping kitten lying on your lap, you had to wait until he wakes up. In this game, you will find out absurd and wild excuses are suits you according to your friends.

Each turn, you make up excuses from random cards and vote which of your friends (or maybe you yourself?) Could really screw up and get off like that.

The goal of the game is to socialize and have fun, but you can also play for victory points.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Star Realms: Rise of Empire – Locked Promo Pack
description:
Locked Promo Pack was available as an optional add-on for the Rise of Empire Kickstarter campaign.

This pack contains 20 game cards and 1 rules card for the game Star Realms.

Promo Card List:

1 Battle Cluster (Extra copy)
1 Bombardment Platform
1 Commander Brandt
1 Commissioner Jah-El
1 Data Broker Philippe
2 Federation Blockade
1 Firing Point (Extra copy)
1 Guardsman Arman
1 Hive Mother
2 Imperial Convoy
1 Mech Armory (Extra copy)
1 Monitor
1 Reactor Well
1 Sergeant Teague
1 Shuttle Bay (Extra copy)
1 Star Captain Starla
1 Star Lord Dyal
1 Vicar Esperia


A single copy of Battle Cluster, Firing Point, Mech Armory, and Shuttle Bay were unlocked as Stretch Goals. These extra copies will make them each a 2-of in the Trade Deck.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Postcard Brittany
description:
Postcard Brittany is a relatively fast and simple - NO "Zones of Control!" - but historical little 6-turn sudden-death postcard wargame about General George Patton's August 1944 coup de main attempts to grab the major French ports of Brittany, before the Germans could organize their defenses.
Regimental level: 14 German units, 3 French FFI groups, and 11 US units in hex-and-counter format.
1-4 player game with at least initially hidden German units spread out in the peninsula.
Allied movement impeded by Strassesperren - roadblocks - as well as German units ... as well as traffic jamming on roads.
FFI groups can recon unknown German units, destroy undefended German roadblocks, and block German retreats.
Patton's special engineer-equipped Task Force A included, and it can be 'decisive.' (Thanks, George.)

Historically, Patton failed, chafing at the corps commander's hesitancy, but you can do better. Right? :-)

Good solitaire game - or in very large format, team game - with US 4th and 6th Armored Divisions necessarily going down separate east-west roads.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Push Your Luck, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending

name: Souvenirs d'Empire I: Les Insurgés
description:
Souvenirs d'Empire is a medium-complexity, two-player Print & Play wargame that recreates battles from the Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars.

Les Insurgés includes the basic rules and is the first volume in the series. It Contains :
- 1 rulebook of 24 pages with the principles of the game and numerous illustrated examples
- 1 double-sided game aid
- 1 board of 216 counters and markers to play the French armies and the Spanish insurgents in 1808
- 4 scenarios: the battles of El Bruch (June 6, 1808), Alcolea Bridge (June 7, 1808), Mengíbar (July 16, 1808) and Bailén (July 19, 1808)
- 1 A4 card and 3 A3 cards

name: Fistful of Lead: Battlesuit Alpha
description:
Battlesuit Alpha takes you to the far future where giant mechanized battlesuits rule the combat zone. Design your own mechs and vehicles and arm them with rockets, lasers and rail guns to blast your opponents to dust.

Each player controls a group of mechs and support vehicles called a Lance. Battlesuit Alpha is miniature agnostic allowing you to use whatever mech models you have, be they 15mm, 10mm or 6mm scale.

Players learn in 1 - 3 turns, but the unique card driven turn mechanic makes each battle a tactical challenge where every player is involved. Like all the Fistful of Lead games, you’ll only need 5 or 6 miniatures per player. The rules can be used for 1-on-1 games or larger skirmishes with up to 8 players.

These rules contain all the information you need to play a game, including rules for building your forces and how to set up the table for different scenarios.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Tegn pladen fuld
description:
Get together in teams and fight against the other teams.
The active team has 1 minute to draw as many words as possible, and scores point from each word. When times is up the other team(s) get a chance to guess the last drawing.
A game is eaither 16 or 32 rounds. More than 100 categories and 1000 words.

Gå sammen i hold og kæmp mod de andre i at tegne og forstå hvad din makker tegner. Jo hurtigere i er, jo flere point får i.
I spillet findes der mere end 100 forskellige tegnekategorier og mere en 1000 tegneopgaver. Ens tegneopgave bliver bestemt ved at trække et tilfældigt kort og kaste en terning.

name: Carrot
description:
Carrot is a social deduction game for 2 or more players. Players must use their cunning and wit to outsmart their opponents in order to claim the ultimate prize: the one & only carrot. Will you swap with your opponents and risk losing your only chance at victory? Or will you hold onto your card and hope it's the carrot? Be careful, one false move and you'll be left holding the short end of the stick! With endless laughter and endless possibilities, Carrot is sure to be a hit at your next game night.

In the 2 player game, you shuffle together 1 carrot and 1 stick. Each player gets one card facedown. The first player looks at their card, and may make any statement they wish (or remain silent). The second player may now ask the first player any questions or say anything else they'd like (the first player may respond however they'd like, including remaining silent). Then the second player chooses to either swap cards with the first player or keep their card. Afterwards, both players reveal their cards. The player with the carrot wins! If you play again, you swap roles and redeal cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Transporter
description:
Each player is a transport company.
The parcels arrived in Belgium by sea. The players are ready in Antwerp with your transporter to deliver the parcels to the different cities. At the beginning of the game you draw 8 city cards face down. 1 card of each region. You do not have to deliver one of these to the customer and you may cover it.
The idea is that you can reach the 7 remaining cards first and deliver a package there with your transport truck. You will receive the sum stated on the card for each city you have visited.
During your turn you may first move 3 steps forward with your transporter. Then you can roll dice. You can throw a roadblock, bridge or a car.

—description from the designer

name: Monkey Business
description:
Finally a game you can monkey around with! The goal of the game is simple—see how high you can stack. Don’t worry, the apes won’t mind—just don’t pull the wrong tail, or everything will come crashing!

—description from the publisher

Stacking and balancing games of Monkey pieces.

name: Miss Match
description:
Miss Match is a very simple massive multiplayer card game for larger parties, events, and conventions. Players start with an equal number of Miss Match cards each (at least 1) and face off in quick 1 vs 1 games. The winner, determined by a couple of card flips, will take up to as many cards as they played from their opponent (while keeping any cards they played). The player with the most cards at the end of the event wins the whole game. But players don't know how many cards are in the pool, how many cards other players have, or how many cards to play against each opponent.

The game can be played in-hand, in less than a minute, while standing or waiting. It's an ideal ice breaker game with player choice, luck, and exciting tie breakers. All the rules are on the card.

Miss Match is distributed as a Forever Free Print and Play Game for personal use.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Elea
description:
Elea is a simple unification game of pure placement invented by Michael Amundsen in May 2022. There cannot be a tie in Elea.

Rules:
Players take turns placing a stone of their own color on any empty cell of a hexagonal grid of hexagons (a hexhex board).
The game is over when the board is full, and the player with the lower score wins.
Your score is 1 point per odd-sized group and 2 points per even-sized group.

The name is taken from the birthplace of the great ancient monist Parmenides, who argued that plurality is contradictory.

—description from the designer

name: Gotcha
description:
Gotcha is a dice game for the whole family.
As a hero, try to defeat as many bad guys as possible and collect the most points. Problem is if you have 5 points of damage you are dead.

name: Speedy Delivery
description:
Speedy Delivery is a climbing game with a courier theme.
In Speedy Delivery, each round one of four players will take on the role of a courier, attempting to deliver (shed out) their entire hand of cards before the other three players can prevent it from happening by shedding out first.
Each round, players bid to determine who will be the Courier and who will be the Obstacles.
The play is standard ladder climbing play, familiar to anyone who has played Tichu, Haggis, Chimera, or many traditional climbing games.
One player leads with a card combination. Other players must follow with a higher combination of the same type, play a "bomb", or pass.
Points are rewarded for successful rounds and subtracted for failed rounds. The highest score after several rounds wins.

name: Hero Realms: Adventure Deck – Cleric
description:
Each 33-card Adventure Deck contains everything you need to bring the character all the way from 1st to 24th level.
It contains updated skill and treasure cards from the complete campaign sets (Ruins of Thandar, The lost Village, Watery Grave and two unknown ones)
So in the future, if you own all 5 campaign sets, you dont need this Deck.

With a Character Pack and Adventure Deck you can take your character through any Hero Realms adventure. For example, it will allow you to play your Druid in the Ruin of Thandar series, or bring your Wizard through the Dungeons 12-part adventure!

You can also create leveled-up characters for PVP play. Choose any level and you will have the tools you need to build your character. There are thousands of possible ways to build your character as you level up!

Or, play a legacy style PVP series with a friend. You each start at level 1. After each game, record the winner, then you both level up. First player to 13 wins is the champion!

Each Adventure Deck contains:

5 additional Skill Tree cards
7 additional Ability Tree cards
1 Bonus health card
20 treasure cards
Rules sheet with full leveling instructions including skill and ability tree diagrams.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Adventure Deck – Fighter
description:
Each 33-card Adventure Deck contains everything you need to bring your Fighter all the way from 1st to 24th level.
It contains updated skill and treasure cards from the complete campaign sets (Ruins of Thandar, The lost Village, Watery Grave and two unknown ones)
So in the future, if you own all 5 campaign sets, you dont need this Deck.

With a Character Pack and Adventure Deck you can take your character through any Hero Realms adventure. For example, it will allow you to play your Druid in the Ruin of Thandar series, or bring your Wizard through the Dungeons 12-part adventure!

You can also create leveled-up characters for PVP play. Choose any level and you will have the tools you need to build your character. There are thousands of possible ways to build your character as you level up!

Or, play a legacy style PVP series with a friend. You each start at level 1. After each game, record the winner, then you both level up. First player to 13 wins is the champion!

Each Adventure Deck contains:

5 additional Skill Tree cards
7 additional Ability Tree cards
1 Bonus health card
20 treasure cards
Rules sheet with full leveling instructions including skill and ability tree diagrams.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Hero Realms: Adventure Deck – Ranger
description:
Each 33-card Adventure Deck contains everything you need to bring your Ranger all the way from 1st to 24th level.
It contains updated skill and treasure cards from the complete campaign sets (Ruins of Thandar, The lost Village, Watery Grave and two unknown ones)
So in the future, if you own all 5 campaign sets, you dont need this Deck.

With a Character Pack and Adventure Deck you can take your character through any Hero Realms adventure. For example, it will allow you to play your Druid in the Ruin of Thandar series, or bring your Wizard through the Dungeons 12-part adventure!

You can also create leveled-up characters for PVP play. Choose any level and you will have the tools you need to build your character. There are thousands of possible ways to build your character as you level up!

Or, play a legacy style PVP series with a friend. You each start at level 1. After each game, record the winner, then you both level up. First player to 13 wins is the champion!

Each Adventure Deck contains:

5 additional Skill Tree cards
7 additional Ability Tree cards
1 Bonus health card
20 treasure cards
Rules sheet with full leveling instructions including skill and ability tree diagrams.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: CoComelon: Picture Party
description:
An enhanced take on classic matching card games with a simpler set-up and fewer pieces than other games, meaning less frustration for parents and preschoolers wanting to play together. There’s a fun twist with Scramble cards as players try to find their favourite Cocomelon characters.
To win you need to match a picture (one of three in the display) with one of numerous facedown tokens that will contain that picture. The person who has the most matches wins...the twist is that some cards cause the facedown tokens to be shuffled (so it isn't purely for memory masters)

name: Rorschach: Promo
description: 20 additional cards for Rorschach.

name: Serpientes amazónicas:conócelas jugando
description:
In this game we will have to use biological clues, such as the type of teeth and the toxicity of the snakes, to stack the cards one on top of the other until we only have one in hand.
In this way we will go in each game learning about how to identify the different species present in the Colombian Amazonia.

CONTENTS
The game consists of 60 cards: 13 cards for each family (Boidae, Colubridae, Elapidae, Viperidae), 4 jokers and 4 instructions. Each card has the following information: family name, scientific name of the species and common name, the relevant characteristic in the photo that allows it to be recognized as dangerous (red triangle), and harmless (green triangle) and the icon of the type of dentition. Two cards from each family are punishment cards. There are 4 jokers that represent the 4 types of dentition: aglyphous, solenoglyphous, opisthoglyphous and proteroglyphous; each informs about the family or families that have it, its icon, the characteristics of the dentition in text and in a drawing, and if it is associated with dangerous (red triangle) or harmless (green triangle) snakes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Carnevale: Item Cards
description:
This deck of cards contains three sets: Equipment, Artifacts, and Ill tides.

Each adds something new to gang building, from gondolas to row and single-use grenades through to powerful and unique relics. There are even cards for making your gang a little worse: the Ill Tides are washing in to level the playing field!

Made from high quality playing card material, these cards are oversized at 100mm x 60mm. Contains 33 cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Fly, You Fools!
description:
The adventurers must get the ring to the mountain by any means necessary!

Fly, You Fools! is a one-vs-many dexterity game using a single card. It combines elements of dodgeball and disc golf and can be played anywhere with up to eleven people. One player plays as "the mountain", everyone else is "the party", and the card is "the ring". The party's goal is to throw or fling the ring at the mountain while the mountain's goal is to survive ten turns without getting hit. Sounds easy? Adventurers beware! The power of the ring corrupts and can hinder your ability to throw! Depending on how it lands, players may have to throw with their weak hand or with their eyes closed.

Fly, You Fools! cleverly packs an entire epic saga into a single-card game. It will have players of all ages laughing, yelling, and crying as they desperately journey throughout the entire house in pursuit of the cursed mountain while it crawls, ducks, and leaps to evade them.

—description from the designer

name: Potencial Z
description:
Card game in which you must show your knowledge about the zootechnical potential of different wild species.
The player in turn chooses a category present in his card and bets to have a higher or lower value in said category than the other players. The player who best handles the characteristics set by the player in turn wins the round.

The game was developed in conjunction with a scientific article in which the statistical values associated with each of the parameters of the cards were analyzed, so the values in each of them correspond to the results of the study.

Introduction of the associated article:
In Latin America, the use of wildlife for different purposes is ancestral; In the last decades, the use of subsistence, that of local sale, sportive and commercial hunting stands out. The latter, related to the potential and the value or interest that exists in the species that is the object of the same. From the perspective of the agricultural sector, it seeks to meet demands for current anthropic uses such as food, skins, pets, scientific research or conservation, based on the sustainable management of wild populations.

To guarantee the sustainable use and management of wildlife, it is necessary to establish parameters and management criteria that are generated from scientific, cultural and socioeconomic knowledge of the species that we believe have some type of productive potential. Currently one of the challenges facing the agricultural sector is the development of innovative proposals that are consistent with the social, environmental and economic needs of the country. The assessment of the potential of wild species in Colombia is of vital importance to face these challenges.

In this document an approximation to the conceptual definition of zootechnical potential of a wild species is made and an evaluation of this potential is made for 48 species of wild fauna (native and exotic) that have been traditionally used in Colombia. The results are also part of a didactic strategy based on the evaluation of the zootechnical potential of wild fauna species, as a proposal for pedagogical innovation (cards attached to this booklet).
categories: Animals, Book, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Farming
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Drawing, Multi-Use Cards

name: The Fearsome Deities
description:
You have been sent to investigate strange events in a distant region. Loud noises and paranormal presences have been reported.

In this card game you must protect your sanity level, if you completely lose sanity you will be out of the game. Each card has a MONSTER RANK in roman numbers. Creatures of the Cthulhu Mythos starting with the most powerful OUTER GODS (I), then GREAT OLD ONES (II), MINOR GODS (III) and CULTIST (IV).

Each player will start with 5 cards in his hand and one mission card. Depending on your strategy, you can group cards to launch attacks and make other players lose their sanity, or you can decide to group cards that allow you to replenish your sanity points.

Choose wisely the card you will play or your sanity will be drain by outer space beings.

There are mission cards. Complete the missions and fill it with the tokens to win the game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2021 Planeswalker Deck: Chandra, Flame's Catalyst
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Powerful, passionate, possessing a short fuse, Chandra is always ready to bring the heat. Launch a burning barrage directly at your opponent's life total until nothing but ash remains.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Alien Panic
description:
The planet "Splitz" is in danger. The people who live there must evacuate as soon as possible. Several ships are ready to leave, but you will have to rely on the help of your opponents. Do they really want to help you?

Try to evacuate on the best ships and collect the most points to win.

Alien Panic is a family game with an original mechanic: you can't move your pawns, only those of the other players.

A chaotic course full of pitfalls to try to reach the end and accumulate the most points by avoiding or using the traps.

—description from the publisher

name: Squabblin Goblins: Goblin Lanes
description:
A Goblin Lanes 2-card expansion for Squabblin Goblins.


Goblin tunnels can be surprisingly straightforward. Easier to get home from a raid without twist and turns.

2 Lane cards (Loot Bag, Stone Lamp).

A Lane is a vertical path from one player to another. To play a Lane card, place it face-up in front of a pile (rather than on or under it).

If a card is played to any pile on the same side as a Lane card, the Lane card is moved to the opposite end of the Lane.

At the end of the game, the Lane cards will score points based on the Pile they are in front of.

name: Knockout Punch
description:
Clear out the living room or head outside, because you're about to show your friends a whole new kind of card game! Become King of the Ring by dodging, ducking, and landing 'punches' and throwing the squishy boxing glove at your opponents. No mercy!

Objective: Capture the most cards and earn the most points by knocking out fellow "boxers" and betting on other players' showdowns!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Catch the Leader, King of the Hill, Take That

name: Beyond the Empire: Wargames Rules for Engagements with Small Forces in the Back of Beyond and Other Places 1918 to 1939
description: Mad Barons, Chinese Warlords, Revolutionary hordes, Archaic Imperialists and Fascist interventionists- your choice is endless. Skirmish rules for any Interwar theatre, but especially the madness that is the Back of Beyond. 5-6 units a side plus armoured cars etc if you fancy. Inc 6 Scenarios.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Reavers of Midgard: Gods and Prophets
description:
In Reavers of Midgard: Gods and Prophets you will encounter new obstacles and new opportunities in your quest for glory.

The gods themselves have taken notice of your exploits and will offer their aid to those willing to celebrate them with offerings of riches.

Meanwhile, a wandering prophet (called a Volva in Norse Mythology) wanders the world offering prophecies to those she meets and a devastating Maelstrom makes treacherous seas nearly impassable.

Reavers of Midgard: Gods and Prophets expands on the base game, offering up more treasures, more spoils, and a brand new Offerings Board where players can petition the Gods themselves to join them in their voyages, giving them their powers, their abilities, and even the chance to hold a Viking Funeral. The Valkyries themselves will join you in your battles, and the Fates of the Norns will aid you in your prophecies.

Will you navigate these new challenges in a way worthy of timeless tales? Or will your rivals earn their place before you in the Halls of Valhalla?

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Follow, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Nal  Topla
description:
The object of the game is not to take cards. Horseshoes on each card you take will give you negative points. The winner of the game is the one who collects the fewest horseshoes at the end of the game.

Setup:


Each player takes 10 cards from the deck
Take 4 cards from the deck and place them under each other on the table.


How to play:


Players place a card from their hand face down in front of them.
After the last player has laid his/her card, all the cards are revealed simultaneously.
Players place their cards according to the rules


Rules:


Card which has a lower number first plays: The order of play is from the player with the lowest card to the player with the biggest card.
Increasing Numbers: The cards must appear in ascending order in the row on the floor.
Smallest difference: Each card must be played where the most minor difference is.
The row which has been full: If there are 4 cards in a row that row is called as full. If a player must play a card to here that player takes all cards in that row and his/her card becomes the first card for that row.
Choose what you want: If a player's card doesn't match with any of the rows that player takes any one of the rows and her/his card becomes the first card for that row.


—user summary

name: New Histories (fan expansion for Chronicle)
description:
New Histories is a fan-created expansion for the trick taking card game Chronicle.

The expansion adds an additional 15 History cards to the base game.

name: Falling Edge
description:
Players fight for battlefield control in this super fast card-placement game set in the dystopian sci-fi world of Falling Edge. Compete using the core rules for super fast rounds or utilise the enhanced ruleset for strategic depth with faction based combat and abilities. Play 2-4 players competitive, team-based 2v2 (or even combine multiple games to play 5+ player tournaments).

Use characters and abilities from the different factions in Falling Edge:
The Chosen, powerful humans carrying the souls of ancient heroes that try to protect the weak.
The Cult, an underground organisation willing to sacrifice anything (or anyone) for the sake of power.
The Wanderers, nomad tribes accustomed to the harsh conditions outside of the few remaining cities.
AI, the robotic beings working together as one connected mysterious artificial intelligence.
Soldiers, the military forces of 'The Cooperation' that controls the remaining human cities and the life within.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: まじかる☆ベーカリー〜わたしが店長っ (Magical ☆ Bakery: I'm the Manager!)
description:
Corone, a Magical Girl who got tired of being overworked at a poorly managed "black" bakery, has declared independence and established her own store. Can she run things clean, or will she just end up producing another bakery filled with oven theft, embezzlement and underpaid workers?

This is the sequel to Magical ☆ Bakery, which is built on a completely new game system built around strategic store management, competing to grow your store via the use of various card effects.

name: Pas Assez
description:
Pas Assez, French for "Not Enough", is a tarot based climbing game with a rather unique twist: instead of playing elaborate melds of cards, players try to out-rank each other with increasingly high numeric values.

The game is a climb up to see who can take the most tricks and squeeze the most Major Arcana cards out of the opponents, and thus score the most points.

—description from the designer

name: Ruleta Rusa
description:
A game of cards and tokens where the objective is to embezzle your friends and proclaim yourself the winner by having the biggest loot. It has three game modes to play from 1 to 6 people.

In the first game mode, you can play alone or against another player, each player starts with 6 chips, in order to place bets, the first player to embezzle his opponent by taking all the chips wins the game.

The second mode can be played by 2 to 4 players, each one of them will take a card from the deck and depending on the action of each card you will be able to obtain chips, after four rounds the chips are counted and the player with the greatest amount wins the game.

The third mode can be played by 2 to 6 players, each player starts with 5 cards, they must exchange the cards as quickly as possible in order to build a deck that allows them to make the most points and be the first to reach 15 points. of victory.

-description from designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Score-and-Reset Game, Take That

name: Choko
description:
Choko is a traditional game from the Republic of the Gambia in West Africa. It’s a typical two-phase game: place pieces on the board and then move and capture. The unique aspect of Choko is a concept called “Drop Initiative.” This means that in the first phase of the game, a player may choose to switch to movement tactics until the other player chooses to switch back again to the placement phase. The drop initiative offers players a way to respond to their opponent’s initial placement and really change up the game before all the pegs have been placed. A very interesting variation on the usual jump-and-capture strategy game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: My First Safari Board Game
description:
The safari explorers are getting ready to race through the park and see all the safari animals! But they better be quick! The sun is setting soon, and they won't be able to see any of the animals in the dark! Help them race down the path and spot all the animals before the sun sets.

Players will play cards from their hand to move one of the explorers on the board by matching the icons on the card. If they have a sun card, they'll have to play it instead, which will advance the sun token one space closer to sunset. If the sun token makes it to the last spot before all of the explorers have reached the end of the park, then the game is over and the players lose. If they can get all the explorers to the end of the path before that time then they win.

Have fun while learning new skills like cooperation, turn taking, strategic thinking and social skills!
mechanics: Chaining, Cooperative Game, Moving Multiple Units

name: Order & Opportunity: Making of the Post-Cold War World Order
description:
Order & Opportunity is a 2-4 player game (with a dedicated solitaire system) about the making of the post-Cold War world order covering the first decades of the 21st century. In the game, the United States, Russia, China, and the European Union compete over the control of the agenda and ultimately over victory points in the dimensions of economic, political, cultural, and security power projection. Order & Opportunity combines card-driven, asymmetric game play to produce a topical and thematic historical game on a global scale. The game offers a distinctive and captivating play experience at every one of its player counts.

Order & Opportunity begins in the early 2000s and covers the next twenty years of global, multidimensional power competition. In that setting, the game aims at creating a thematic experience of the period as players are faced with historical and familiar crises, challenges, and opportunities as they emerge from game play.

The winner is the power with the most victory points at the game end, or if playing with two or three players, the game is won or lost by democratic or authoritarian blocs of powers.
The game can be played in constellations of two, three, or four players or solitaire using a dedicated, easy-to-use solo play system. None of these player counts is an afterthought; they have been part of the game’s development from the very beginning.
Scoring uses a two-step, Agenda and Victory Points based system. Gaining Agenda Points represents short-term control of political and media attention. However, Agenda Points count towards your true, tangible legacy only at the game end when one type of Agenda Points will be converted into VPs. Players may also choose to spend valuable cards and actions during the game to convert Agenda Points into VPs as they go, one at a time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Income, Multi-Use Cards, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Tic Tac K.O.: Cute vs Evil – Boom Promo Card
description:
Convention Promo card for 2023

Card Text
Effect: When this cute card enters the Grid, you may look at the top card of the Objective deck, then return it face down to the top of the Objective deck.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Interrupts, Square Grid, Take That, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Tic Tac K.O.: Cute vs Evil – Evil Twins Promo Card
description:
Convention promo card for 2023

Card Text
Effect: When this card enters the Grid, return the opposing team's Objective card to the bottom of the Objective deck. They must take a new Objective card.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Interrupts, Square Grid, Take That, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Doom Crop
description:
A game of positioning, strategy, and memory, played with a standard 52-card deck of playing cards.

Draw 10 cards and arrange them into a 3x3 grid. The remaining card starts your discard pile, used for scoring at the game's end. Each turn, flip a card and use its number power or its face ability. Capture your opponent's cards into your discard pile until the draw pile is depleted, and then compare discard piles. The one with more cards, wins.
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid

name: Wrong Party: Cosplayer Promo Card
description:
2023 Convention Promo card

Card Text
COSPLAYER
Rainbow Unicorn Party Guest card
1 Point
Likes: Talking, Children, Music, Food
Dislikes: none
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Number, Party Game

name: Serbs Stand Alone
description:
Serbs Stand Alone is a strategic level board game with two-player and solo options.

The playable sides are the two resistance movements, overwhelmingly (Chetniks) or mainly (Partisans, certainly until the middle of the war) manned by Serbs.

This is a game about the guerrilla, civil and ethnic war in the Kingdom of Yugoslavia (formerly Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes) that lasted from 1941 to 1945.

The game starts in Fall of 1941. In March of 1941, the Serbs, old French and British allies from WWI, rebelled against Yugoslavia joining the Tripartite Pact. Reacting to this, the Axis conquered and dismembered the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April.

The Axis is not a playable side in the game however. The main fight is about who will be controlling the country after the war, and specifically for Mihailovich, limiting Serb casualties.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Zone of Control

name: Quests Over Coffee: Expansion #03 – Science Shmience
description:
As the popularity of the adventurers fulfilling quests reaches further parts of the world, their presence also brings with them turmoils of "being well known". Cultures and technologies clash! Is this magic? No, it's science! Science shmience, this is magic! Only you can wade through these petty fights and bring a fragmented fanbase together. Spoiler: it's science.

—description from the publisher

Expansion 3 - Science Shmience - expands Quests over Coffee, offering new cards and a new optional rule - Environments:

- 9 Environment Cards,
- 1 Shop Card
- 11 New Quests
- 6 New Items
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Immunization
description:
Discover this new educational board game for 1-4 players to understand how vaccines are developed to fight diseases.

​You are the Leader of a Biotech developing the next generation of vaccines to protect populations against fast-spreading outbreaks. Discover potent antigenic formulations, launch your clinical trials, manage your production capacity and define appropriate vaccine prices to successfully eradicate life-threatening diseases with best-in-class vaccines.

About the Game

In a world threatened by persistent diseases and fast-spreading outbreaks, you are leading a biotech company developing the next generation of vaccines.

​Your goal is to protect the most at-risk populations against infectious diseases. You are challenged to develop effective vaccines by discovering the best antigenic formulations, to launch your clinical trials, to manage your vaccine production capacity and to define an appropriate pricing strategy. Pay attention to the prices you establish since the public opinion may influence your sales.

Always remember to invest in new technologies & expertise, and wisely manage your Research & Development budget in order to develop a successful vaccine portfolio to eradicate all the diseases and save lives!

Never the same game twice!
Erasable "Disease" & "Vaccine" cards for an ever-changing fight against infectious diseases

Game Principle
Create your vaccine formulas
Acquire Technologies & Expertise to accelerate your Research
Validate your vaccines with Toxicology & Clinical studies
Manage your vaccine production capacity
Launch your vaccines to fight diseases

The Game Modes

Competitive
Quick competitive
Cooperative
Solo
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Medical
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Art Dealers Without Manners
description: In this set collection game you are an art dealer trying to collect more and more art. As you draw more cards you will want to collect more of the same suit to have the highest total amongst your opponents. When you feel you have the highest total, you indicate that you are ready for everyone else to show their hand. The person with the lowest total will need to pay up from their stash of cash. But watch out! You may need to dip into your art collection to stay in the game. Collecting art buffers you from having to pay from your cash. It's brutal! But hey, it's art!
publishers: Makers Mind Worshop, Twice Alive Games

name: Karzar
description:
Karzar is a card game. In it, each player starts his game by secretly choosing a front, Iran or Turan. With access to hero cards and support cards, players simultaneously send their heroes to the battlefield during two rounds and then help cards. There is only one rule in the battlefield, the winner is whoever is stronger at the end.

Story
"Finally, when the great battle has arrived, the Iranian and Turan armies have set up their tents and raised their shutters on the bank of the Jeyhoon river. There is an uproar. A cloud of dust covers the sun and the sound of sharpening swords reaches can be heard from all sides. All are eager to start a war. The agreement is that according to ancient customs, the warriors of both lands will fight face to face. But the strength of arms and the art of war are not their only helpers, and supernatural forces influence their efficiency from all corners, until the end of the battle is turned to one side every time, and now the history of this bloody war is in your hands..."
categories: Ancient, Book, Card Game, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Madrid Connection
description:
Madrid Connection is a fast network-/portfolio-building train game with the objective of having the most valuable stock portfolio at the end of the game. Players must start new railroads, they may expand existing railroads and they are able to trade stocks in the railroads.

There are 6 colors of wooden locomotives, each color representing a railroad. Players are dealt random hands of 5-10 (depending on number of players) locomotives, which are essentially a stock portfolio; the rest of each color are placed in a pool. On your turn, you can start a railroad or increase the value of a single railroad by placing 1-5 locomotives from the remaining pool of that company or you can trade one locomotive in your portfolio for one or two locomotives from the remaining pool in a railroad.

The game board is a map of Spain, Portugal, Gibraltar and Andorra, with cities worth anywhere from 1-4 points. Connecting to a city adds to a company's value. The game provides a bonus for crossing national borders. The game holds 3-6 players for about 30 minutes.

The game ends when 5 railroads are devoid of cubes or when a railroad has built into Lisboa. Players' scores are determined by the value of each railroad at the end of the game, multiplied by the number of stocks the player has for that railroad.

Madrid Connection uses the components found in Queen Games’ Paris Connection game. The Madrid Connection game comes with 2 11x17 maps of Spain, Portugal, Gibraltar & Andorra that require trimming and the rules necessary to play Madrid Connection. You must own Paris Connection to play this game. It is possible to play Madrid Connection using the original Winsome SNCF game, but it is not convenient.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: The Magical Card Battle of Britain
description:
Deck of 36 cards (78 x 108mm) in a rigid box. Includes an 8-page instructions leaflet.

Fight your rivals with our motley crew of Britain’s most celebrated occultists, witches, scholars of magic and folk horror characters, and channel the power of ritual objects, visions and magical sites.

Crowley VS Murray.
Hutton VS Dee.
Frazerian Neighbours VS Black Magic Bikers.
Stonehenge VS the Wicker Man.

Every round is a clash between the titans of Britain’s history of magic, real or fictional. Who will win this magical card battle?

2 playing modes:

Card Battle (plays like a classic Top Trumps game)
Magic Families (plays like Happy Families)


Conceptualised, developed and written by Maria J. Pérez Cuervo. Art direction and illustrations by Nathaniel Hébert.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: Tempo, kleine Klapperschlange!
description:
On your mark...set...loooos! The race of the small rattlesnakes through the desert begins. It's meandering and rattling like crazy! But strange: on one side a snake rattles and on the other not. A card is awarded for each correct guess, increasing players' chances of ending up with the most winning rattlesnakes!

Six colorful snakes in the form of rattlesnake cans go onto the starting space at Skunk Skip. One of the two color dice thrown is chosen by the player and determines which rattlesnake gets to move forward. But before you touch the snake, you guess whether it is rattling or not - then it is shaken horizontally and everyone listens, spellbound! If the tip is correct, you receive a rattlesnake card as a reward. The player then turns the can over and moves it one space further. Any snake that used to rattle will not do so the next time - and vice versa. If you remember well when the fastest rattlesnake reaches the goal, you have the best chance of winning snakes among your cards!
With professional version.

name: Match the game
description:
Let's play with fire ?
Guessing games, Agility games and Puzzles

One game is 1-4 players and expandable. Each game more is up to 4 players more.

The game contains multiple games in one. For example, you can win in the different games by guessing the correct number, being the fastest or throwing the best. But most games are guessing games.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Union Arena
description:
