Bandai's new trading card game, in this game, players can use characters from famous Japanese manga or anime such as hunter X hunter, Jujutsukaisen,Code Gease and so on to build their own deck and fight with the opponent.
To play this game，players should use 50 cards include character card,field card and event card to build their own deck and fight with each other, the player who defeat all life cards of the opponent will win the game.

name: Deception/CS-Files: Theme Pack – Korea II
description:
A new promo pack with eight new Korean Themed clue cards and eight new means cards.

Gat
Kimchi
Dalgona
Empty Soju Bottle
Popcorn
Makgeolli
Janggu
Hahoetal

Agrochemical
Puffer Fish
Live Octopus
Broken Ashtray
Homi
Ttukbaegi
Binyeo
Tteok

name: Pathways: Playmat Bundle
description:
A 26" square neoprene game mat with stitched edges that comes with two white acrylic disks, a score counter and a bonus rule set that can accommodate 2, 3 or 4 players in 6 additional game modes.

CONTENTS:

1 single-sided 26" square x 3mm neoprene game mat with stitched edges
2 white acrylic disks
1 English/French rule book
1 bonus cardboard score counter

name: Pathways: Four Extra Disk Set Bundle
description: Four additional game disk sets in unique colors (blue, green, purple & orange) that allow for 4 player variations of the Pathways base game AND Pathways: Playmat alternative game modes. Each set of 12 disks comes with a draw-string cotton bag.

name: Star Wars Miniatures: Ultimate Missions – Revenge of the Sith
description:
Fight climactic battles against clone troopers, battle droids, Jedi, or Sith. Whether you join the crumbling Republic, the desperate forces of the Separatists, or the bold mercenaries of the Fringe, the future of the galaxy rests in your hands.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Han Solo: Solitaire Card Game
description:
In a galaxy far, far away… the Millennium Falcon crew are traveling to Jabba the Hutt’s Palace on the planet Tatooine. Your mission is to save Han Solo from his carbon freeze block. To complete your mission, you will need to move all the cards from the Flight Path to the Landing Pads in ascending order!

In order to win the game and free Han Solo, you'll need to move all of the 52 cards onto the four landing pads in ascending order from King to Ace!

You can achieve this by moving around the cards in your "Flight Path" and placing them onto cards that are one number higher and of a different colour.

When you can no longer move a card from the seven stacks in front of you, you can utilise the draw pile or "Power Core" to assist you!

Once you've progressed from Padawan to Jedi Master, you can add in the "Carbon Freeze Card" for something a little more challenging!

Suitable for 1 player or team.

—description from the publisher

name: Etherfields: Shifting Story Promo Deck
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

Add the Shifting Story card to the Wisdom card holder. Place the rest of the cards from this deck as a separate deck in the box - referred to as the Shifting Deck.

Your goal is to look for the displayed objects on the Old Dreams. If you see an objection on the board, you may read the associated card in the Shifting deck. If you find all the objects in the Dreamworld, you will be able to read the story's conclusion.

Contains 8 cards (63x87mm):
7 Object cards (B-H)
1 Rules/Reference card (A)

name: Tantrum
description:
A twist on Rummy.

The aim is to arrange your hand into four melds as follows:

Three or four cards in suit and sequence (straight flush), Ace counting low only.
Three or four cards in sequence but all of different suits (blank straight)
Three or four cards of the same rank
Three or four cards of different suits totalling 21, counting Ace 1 and face cards 10 each.


At each turn you play as follows:

Take one card from the spread and add it to your hand
Make one meld (not more), if you can and wish, by placing three or four cards face up before you
Make one discard face up from your hand to the spread. Your discard must not be the card you just picked up.


Play continues until one player has laid out four melds. The other(s) may then each make one more draw and meld, if possible.

Scoring
For your initial four-card meld you score the face value of its highest card. For each of the three three-card melds you score the face value of its lowest card. Whoever was first to make their initial four-card meld adds a bonus of 10.

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Death Crown Inheritor Aya
description:
Toying with the foreboding crown, she casts her mind back to the events that led her to this moment. Her memory is just a pink haze bringing a vague smile to her face but never taking form.

The Death Crown Inheritor Aya is packaged in a box that includes:

1 x Hard plastic Death Crown Inheritor Aya miniature
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and insert
Large matte art print
2 x Heart Bow, Heartstop Arrows pattern gear cards
2 x Heart Bow, Heartstop Arrows patterns cards
1 x Eon Heart Legendary Phoenix AI card
1 x Undying Heart strange resources
1 x Install guide
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Imperial Eagles: Air War in the Pacific 1941-43
description:
Imperial Eagles returns GMT’s Down in Flames World War II air combat card game system to the Pacific. Volume VI in the series is a stand-alone game in which you can recreate many of the air battles of the first two years of the war between the Japanese and the Western Allies. 65 different aircraft models (19 never before represented in DiF) are depicted with full-color cards, all rated according to the latest research.
As in Wild Blue Yonder, each side uses its own functionally-identical Action card deck to complete Missions lasting multiple turns. Fighters are normally played as Elements of two aircraft. The Leader of each Element has its own hand of cards, played both offensively during your turn and defensively when attacked by an enemy. The second aircraft is a Wingman, supporting the Leader in its attacks and defending the Leader when the Element is engaged. Unlike Leaders, Wingmen draw and play a few cards only when needed for attacking or defending—you’re never sure how effective they will be.

The simplest games are Dogfights in which two to eight players each control one or two fighter Elements in fast-paced air-to-air action. Besides classic matchups such as F4F-4 Wildcats vs. A6M2 Zeroes or P-40E Warhawks vs. Ki-43-I Hayabusas, in Imperial Eagles you can explore the capabilities of lesser-known types including the Seversky P-35A, the Curtiss-Wright CW-21B, the Nakajima Ki-27, and the Mitsubishi F1M2. Mid-war aircraft such as the P-38F Lightning, the F4U-1 Corsair, the F6F-3 Hellcat, and the Ki-61-Ib Hien also return to the series.
Campaigns offer more depth as you play three or more historically-based missions in which escorted bombers face interceptors and anti-aircraft defenses in trying to destroy enemy targets such as ground forces, airfields, and ships. Dive bombers such as the SBD-3 Dauntless (and its USAAF version the A-24 Banshee) and the D3A1 “Val,” medium bombers like the B-25C-5 Mitchell and the G4M1 “Betty,” and heavy bombers such as the B-17D Flying Fortress and the B-24D Liberator feature prominently in these missions. Even reconnaissance aircraft such as the F-5A Lightning, the PBY-5A Catalina, and the large but fragile H6K4 “Mavis” are given their due. Five previously-published land campaigns (including the small “Marshall Islands Raid” which serves as an abbreviated introduction to campaign mission mechanics) have all been updated to current standards as in WBY.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Battletech: Snord's Irregulars Assault Lance
description:
With a reputation for unorthodox tactics and a fetish for collecting lost artifacts and treasures, you never know what you’re gonna get when Snord’s Irregulars hit the field. Yet they always seem to scrape out of the tightest spots.

Unleash the Snord’s Irregulars Assault Lance! Included is the new Spartan and unique-to-the-Irregulars FrankenMech, a jumping Guillotine, and new variant of the Highlander—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Happy Piggys
description: Every pig farmer has his/her own secrets of pig farming, while every pig trader has his/her own purchasing list. As an owner of a pig farm, your tasks are helping your piggies grow up healthy to breed more and completing complicating orders from the pig traders. Don’t forget your competitors also cast covetous eyes on those orders. The one who can use strategies to prosper his/her pig farm will be the best pig farmer of the year!

name: Enigma Crate: Spy
description: An escape-room like game meant to be played by 1-6 cooperative players. A series of key and combination locked containers must be opened by studying clues and solving puzzles. The difficulty level is designed for teens and adults or ambitious youngsters with a little help. In "Spy", a mad scientist in Seattle is about to do something bad. Players must stop him before it is too late.

name: Krimi total Fall 22: Die Rückkehr des Dr. Danger
description:
The secret criminal organization GIGA is in turmoil. Just before Dr. Danger could reveal his brilliant plan to his closest confidants, which would bring the syndicate unlimited power and wealth, a terrible catastrophe occurred. The island with the secret base was destroyed by a devastating volcanic eruption!

An emergency crisis meeting has been called to determine who is responsible for the death of Dr. Danger and the destruction of the headquarters. Because the eruption of the volcano at this critical moment cannot be a coincidence!

However, surprisingly, a person has appeared at this meeting who claims to be Dr. Danger. Has he miraculously survived the volcanic eruption?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die geheime Verbrecherorganisation GIGA ist in Aufruhr. Kurz bevor Dr. Danger seinen engsten Vertrauten seinen genialen Plan enthüllen konnte, der dem Syndikat unbegrenzte Macht und Reichtum bescheren würde, kam es zu einer schrecklichen Katastrophe. Durch einen verheerenden Vulkanausbruch wurde die Insel mit der geheimen Basis vernichtet!

Ein sofort einberufenes Krisentreffen soll aufklären, wer für den Tod von Dr. Danger und die Zerstörung des Hauptquartiers verantwortlich ist. Denn dass der Vulkan in diesem kritischen Moment ausgebrochen ist, kann kein Zufall sein!

Allerdings ist überraschend eine Person bei diesem Treffen aufgetaucht, die behauptet, Dr. Danger zu sein. Hat er wie durch ein Wunder den Vulkanausbruch überlebt?

—description from the publisher

name: PanDogMonium
description:
PanDogMonium is a frantically fast-paced card game full of pawesome pooches where the aim is to win as many cards as possible.

Collect cards by using fast reflexes to slap the pile whenever any of these sequences appear:
A consecutive pair of dogs,
A pair of dogs with a different dog in-between them,
3 consecutive dog toys,
3 different dog toys played consecutively,
When a bone card is played.

Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game is the top dog!

name: Pim Pam Pum
description:
A game to challenge your luck and your memory.

Search for the hidden monsters, but only the ones of the color that matches the dice!

The objective of the game is to gather the largest number of cards, whoever gets the highest number will be the winner.

Each one in his turn, must roll the dice and according to the color that comes out, it is the indicated monster to look for in the grid of cards.

A card is turned over, if it contains a monster of the color of the die, you can take the card and end the turn, or you can choose to continue play and turn over another card, as long as it contains the monster, you can continue, but do not force a lot of luck, that it can fail and if you turn over a monster of another color, you will not take anything and all the cards are turned over again. To use memory and remember where each monster is, so in your turn you take more cards!

You can always keep turning over cards, but be careful not to push your luck! Or you won't get anything. If you turn one over and it does not have a monster of the color of the dice, the hand is over, the cards are turned over again, but take advantage and test your memory to remember where they are!

The cards in the grid are filled up until there are none left.

3 rounds are played and whoever has the most cards wins.

If there is a tie, the monsters per card are counted and the tie is broken.
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck

name: SPQR: Skirmishers, Velites and Light Troops Variant
description:
This variant changes the way some light troops function in specific SPQR scenarios. Certain velites, slingers, LI, MI, and archers have their unit type and size, TQ, range, shock capabilities, and scenario availability modified.

Includes 35 variant counters, a 12-page rulebook for GBoH and Simple GBoH, and a four-page Player Aid Card with updated stats for these units.

Published in C3i Issue #36 and created by Fabio Bernardini.

(Re-implements the version published in C3i Issue #15, "Velites, Light Troops and Skirmishers" by Dan Fournie, published 2003.)

name: Minsk 1941
description:
This is a recreation of opening attack of the Army Group Center at the beginning of Barbarossa.
The sequence is a simple movement-combat procedure, but if the combat results in a retreat/removal, armoured units can advance two or three hexes and a major breakthrough or siege may be achieved.
Also, a unit with zero strength on the reverse side during combat can be treated the same as a removal, allowing the unique tensions of the untride system to be experienced.

Number of counters: 45 pieces
Map size: 1 A3 map

Game period: 22-28 June 1941 (7 turns)
Turn scale: 1 turn, 1 day
Unit size: 1 unit, 1 corps
Playing time: 1 hour
Number of players: 2 players
Difficulty (5 levels, 5 being the highest): 1


Game Journal #79 contains three games: Azuma Kagami / Three Kingdoms Jingzhou War / Minsk 1941
Designed by Tensin-Rohsi 天津老師.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Movement Points

name: Mr. Gameshow: Speaks Out on Sports
description:
Expansion game for Mr. Gameshow.

This is an additional tape to add to the base game tape that includes more specific trivia regarding sports. Gus Glitz also is the host for this expansion game as he was for the base game. Game play is not changed by the expansion - just more questions!

name: Quests Over Coffee: Expansion #04 – Magic or Magic
description:
Is it magic or is it magic? Our world is filled with what we know to be magic, which is often confused with parlor tricks disguised as magic. Who can tell the difference? Is it illusion? Is it true magic? Magic. Magic, magic, magic-magic! Magic.

—description from the publisher

Expansion 4 - Magic or Magic expands Quests over Coffee, offering new cards:


5 Quest Cards
3 Item Cards
1 Environment Card

name: Pandemic: Teacher Promo Card
description:
An unofficial promotional Role card “Teacher”, released as part of the "Pandemic: Teaching STEM Through Public Health" campaign, in collaboration with the Global Citizenship Experience Lab School.

The Teacher has a unique Role effect:

As an action, create a student pawn in the city you are in.

At the start of your turn, choose either the the Teacher pawn or one of your student pawns. Use that pawn to do actions for this turn.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Tags, Variable Player Powers

name: Battletech: Force Packs Record Sheets – Snord's Irregulars
description: This is a booklet of record sheets for the Snord’s Irregulars Assault Lance.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Battletech: Force Packs Record Sheets – Urbanmech Lance
description: This is a booklet of record sheets for the UrbanMech Lance.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Three Hags
description:
Three Hags is a hand shedding game for two crafty players. Be the first to empty your hand by adding combos of increasing power to the pile. Hags, Imps, and Brooms are special cards that come in handy for more powerful combos. Play your cards right and earn a big scoring bonus at the end of the round.

Three Hags utilizes a stock pile that players will draw from each time they play a combo. With new cards comes new possibilities. Will you hang on to cards with hope of a stronger combination later, or use them early on? Use your combos and special cards wisely to empty your hand and win the round.

—description from the designer

name: Disney Villains: Sinister Spoons Game
description:
An uproarious party game of unleashing your inner villain! Invite
Maleficent, Jafar, Captain Hook, and Ursula to your game night! Shout out their famous catchphrases, and match other players with high fives, sword fights, and other wicked actions. Then race to grab a spoon and score! Evil laugh your way to victory in this fiendish frenzy!

—description from the publisher

name: Cards of the Dead: The Road (Day 2)
description:
The Road is the first expansion for Cards of the Dead: The Board Game, where the survivors will continue their journey through the road outside the city.

Broaden the base game experience with The Road.

Find new weapons, ransack new abandoned locations and square up to new varieties of zombie while surviving for one more day.

The Survivors will need to continue their journey along the course of a long road, rather than the mazy streets of the city.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Something Wild! Star Wars Classic Darth Vader: Pink Edition
description:
A fast-paced, light card game for the whole family! Featuring a collectible pink Darth Vader Pop! mover, as well as your favorite characters from the iconic Star Wars universe.

A line of card games featuring beloved characters and collectible Pop! pocket figures. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs. Score a set to snag the character figure’s special power that helps you win! The first player to score three powers wins the game. Combine multiple games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!

One Pocket Pop! Darth Vader mover that lets you use Powers.
Nine classic Star Wars characters in full color card art.
Use new Powers to swap cards, score points, and take the Darth Vader mover away from your opponents!

Special Pink Edition makes a great Valentine’s gift for someone you love.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: A.V.G.: The Flying Tigers
description:
A.V.G. – The Flying Tigers is a book-based solitaire (or up to three player) air war game that recalls when a ragtag group of American pilots volunteered to fly for China against the Japanese. Recruited from the reserve officer ranks of the Navy, Marines, and Army, one hundred pilots signed contracts to fight. Of those, 99 went to Burma and China. Working together under Claire Lee Chennault, together they gave the nationalist government of Chiang Kai-shek an “instant air force”.

Equipped with the fast and well-armored Curtiss P-40B Tomahawk, the pilots of the American Volunteer Group (A.V.G.) held the line against a numerically superior, better-trained cadre of elite Japanese pilots, including a number of aces, who flew aircraft that were far more maneuverable.

Soon after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, the A.V.G. began its combat operations. It wasn’t long before they scored their first success. On 20 December 1941, the pilots of the A.V.G. intercepted a Japanese bombing raid flying to bomb the western Chinese city of Kunming. Of the ten Japanese light bombers that were dispatched that day, the A.V.G. claimed three. A fourth bomber crashed on the way back to its base in occupied French Indochina. On Christmas Day, they flew again, this time downing 24 Japanese bombers and fighters.

It wasn’t long before TIME Magazine covered the story of the Flying Tigers, celebrating their victories against Japan. By April 1942, just five months after the Flying Tigers combat debut, Hollywood was already filming a movie about the outfit, starring John Wayne. Their fight boosted home front morale and inspired thousands to join the US Army’s expanding air force. In six and a half months, the Flying Tigers, as the A.V.G. came to be known, downed 297 Japanese aircraft at a loss of just 14 of their own.

In this game, you take on the role of the Operations Officer in charge of managing the A.V.G., its pilots, aircraft, fuel stocks, spare parts, and airfields. You will face the Japanese as they attack relentlessly, hoping to decimate your forces and bring the Chinese leadership in Chongqing to surrender to Japan’s rule. Hanging in the balance are hundreds of thousands of Japanese soldiers who are engaged in the war in China. If China were to capitulate, the bulk of those soldiers would be available to fight in New Guinea and Australia – or perhaps continue to advance to the west and attack India.

In the game, A.V.G. - The Flying Tigers, The future of the War in the Pacific hangs by a thread. Your assets are three squadrons of Curtiss P-40B fighter planes and the pilots of the Flying Tigers in your command. You must apply them well to defend China, take the fight to the Japanese, and achieve victory.

The game utilizes the roots of the same proven narrative-style system of the top-selling game, MAG-23 Guadalcanal. At the center of gameplay is your War Diary, your aircraft complement, and your pilot roster. A Chinese village-based early warning network will provide reports of incoming Japanese raids. As well, you will fly morning reconnaissance missions to identify targets on the many Japanese airfields, and then return to strafe them later in the day. Your forces will assist the British and Australian squadrons in the defense of Rangoon in Burma as well as fly to protect the Burma Road and the aerial lifeline of C-47 transport planes flying “The Hump” from India to China to bring in supplies, spare parts, fuel, ammunition, and equipment.

The Japanese will not be an easy opponent. On almost every mission, you will be outnumbered by their fighters, the Type 97 and Type 98, and face bombing runs from light and medium bombers. The Japanese will strafe your airfields, advance with their ground forces to take Burma and ultimately attempt a crossing into western China at the Salween Gorge.

A.V.G. – The Flying Tigers is a fast-playing solitaire air war game that is in the narrative-style. It is highly engaging and fun to play – and it is easy to learn. Each of the missions can be completed in less than thirty minutes. Utilizing the MAG-23 System, the game is not a simulation of air-to-air combat between individual fighter planes, nor a realistic depiction of the air war. It is an entertaining and educational air war game that allows you to experience and learn about the Second World War and its impact on China.

A.V.G. – The Flying Tigers is for experienced and novice war gamers alike. Though dice play a role, the outcomes of your missions and the campaign depends on you. The story of your time in China is as you write it. Will your pilots succeed? How many of your men will become aces? How many will be shot down? Will the Japanese defeat China? The outcome of the war in China is in your hands.

-description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Educational, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Variable Set-up

name: Pets & Friends
description:
The pets were playing hide-and-seek in the house, made an awful mess and lost their favorite toys. Help them find the lost toys, and they will come to you gratefully! Who will find the most pets?
In the Pets & Friends game, you will be looking for toy symbols that will help you acquire pet cards. Each earned pet card is not only points at the end of the game, but also special abilities you can use during the game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Zwierzaki bawiły się w chowanego w całym domu, robiąc przy okazji straszny bałagan i pogubiły swoje ulubione zabawki. Pomóżcie im odnaleźć zagubione przedmioty, a odwdzięczą się i przyjdą do Was! Kto z Was odnajdzie najwięcej zwierzątek?
W grze Pets & Friends będziecie szukać symboli odpowiednich zabawek, które pozwolą Wam zdobyć karty zwierzątek domowych. Każda zdobyta karta zwierzątka to nie tylko punkty na koniec gry, ale również specjalne umiejętności do wykorzystania w trakcie rozgrywki!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Respuestas Abiertas: Imágenes – Variante Cooperativa
description:
A cooperative variant for Respuestas Abiertas: Imágenes, delivered in the March 2023 Ludoty Box.

Players will try to get more points than the ghost player over 6 rounds. If the duo is correct, they will score points. If they are wrong, the ghost player will score points.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Do it Yourself
description:
The compact expansion of the cult game STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN.

The ultimate game block contains 200 creative category suggestions for an unforgettable game experience with individual difficulty. Fun guaranteed!

This game promotes knowledge and creativity!

DO IT YOURSELF EDITION includes an exciting variety with 200 different categories.

Examples: Food, color, sport, body part, candy, material, street name, gift idea, profession with helmet and many more!

Innovative letter bar against cheaters.

Simply swipe your index finger across the letter bar. When one of your teammates says "STOP", the letter to play with is fixed.

This ultimate game block in A4 format contains 50 sheets. This provides for many extensive game evenings with family and friends.

Perfect to give away or the next vacation.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die kompakte Erweiterung des Kultspiels STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN

Der ultimative Spielblock beinhaltet 200 kreative Kategorievorschläge für ein unvergessliches Spielerlebnis mit individuellem Schwierigkeitsgrad. Spaß garantiert!

Dieses Spiel fördert Wissen und Kreativität!

Die DO IT YOURSELF EDITION beinhaltet eine spannende Vielfalt mit 200 verschiedenen Kategorien.

Beispiele: Speise, Farbe, Sportart, Körperteil, Süßigkeit, Material, Straßenname, Geschenkidee, Beruf mit Helm und viele mehr!

Innovative Buchstabenleiste gegen Schummler.

Wische einfach mit dem Zeigefinger über die Buchstabenleiste. Wenn einer deiner Mitspieler “STOPP” sagt, steht der Buchstabe fest, mit dem gespielt werden muss.

Dieser ultimative Spielblock im DIN A4 Format beinhaltet 50 Blatt. So ist für viele ausgiebige Spielabende mit Familie und Freunden gesorgt.

Perfekt zum Verschenken oder den nächsten Urlaub.

—description from the publisher

name: The Aetherial War Card Game: Chaos and Consequences Core Set
description:
Designed for solo play, or with up to two friends, the Aetherial War Chaos and Consequences Core Set comes with everything you need to adventure through an exciting Sci-Fi Fantasy setting. Designed by author Nathan E. Doverspike, creator of the Aetherial War novel series, this Role Playing Card Game gives players all they can handle with quick, tactical battles, and intense boss missions.
Upon completing a campaign, players will be able to open an unlock pack included with the Core Set. Each pack will feature entirely new content, from new Equipment pieces, to new enemy factions, and even new bosses!
Additional expansions will add even more variety to enemies, new playable characters, and new variations on gameplay to keep players coming back for more.

—description from the designer

name: Combat Commander: Battle Pack #8 – Minor Nations
description:
Combat Commander: Battle Pack #8 -- Minor Nations is a reprint of scenarios from the original Combat Commander (Europe and Mediterranean) with counters specific to the minor nations involved.

COMPONENTS

Two 8.5" x 11" countersheets
One cover page
Eight 8.5" x 11" scenario pages
One 9" x 12" ziplock

NOTE: CC: Minor Nations is not a complete game and requires ownership of both Combat Commander: Europe and Combat Commander: Mediterranean to play.

Developed by Kai Jensen.

Expands:
Combat Commander: Europe and Combat Commander: Mediterranean (both required)

Included in:
The Minor Nations BP is also included in the Combat Commander Master Edition which encompasses Combat Commander: Europe and Combat Commander: Mediterranean.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Advantage Token, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Extra! Extra!
description:
Players use a combination of personal and shared randomly delt cards with one letter each on them to create a word.
Other players place bets on which of the shared letters will be used.
Winner is the player with the most money when the bank runs empty
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Bids As Wagers, Spelling

name: Montessori: L'inventafavole Del Mondo Fantastico
description:
Educational game developed on the basis of the principles of Montessori pedagogy.

A rich game to free the imagination! Create fantastic stories with cards, shaped elements and the exclusive composite!

A game to stimulate imagination and creativity with the magical scenery of the castle and all its 3D characters to move around the environment.

The child will have fun inventing many stories set in a fantastic climate by making all the characters interact.

With this game the child develops his creativity and critical thinking, 2 of the Life Skills recognized by the World Health Organization.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Book, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Party Game

name: Patton Liberates Lorraine!
description:
A relatively simple 12-turn point-to-point (sudden death) campaign game about General George Patton's attempt to fight through France's Lorraine and break through the fortified Siegfried Line behind the Saar River before Winter 1944.
If his player scores big successes at the start, his fuel may *not* be diverted to Field Marshal Montgomery's (over-, it turned out) ambitious Market Garden paradrop north into Holland.
Abstract regimental/brigade level 27 US pieces, 18 German, and 6 (German) Fogs of War. (For solitaire play, the German infantrie and FOW pieces can be turned upside down and randomly mixed.) Optional stand-up pieces for German infantrie and FOW pieces.
50% hit probabilities of Disruption possibly culminatig in elimination. 3 grades of road. Bonus to US infantry for prepared, artillery supported attacks.
Free to print and play on CoatneyHistory.
Mapboard compatible with classic Champer & Sackson game Major Battles and Campaigns of General George S. Patton (1973), but PLL has a better movement and combat system, including risking No Retreat! orders.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Random Quest
description:
Random Quest is a d6 pen and paper tabletop fantasy adventure game for solo and co-op play. Slays monsters, overcome challenges, find treasure, and gain experience points.

Explore a randomly-generated dungeon and defeat the monsters that inhabit it. Level up your player character and attempt to overcome increasingly difficult encounters.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Map Addition, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Exploding Kittens: Cat Burglar Edition
description:
Exploding Kittens is a highly-strategic, kitty powered version of Russian Roulette. Players draw cards until somebody draws an Exploding Kitten, at which point they explode and are out of the game. To avoid exploding, they can defuse the kitten with a laser pointer or catnip sandwich, OR use powerful action cards to move or avoid the Exploding Kitten. In this edition, you can also use the squishy Cat Burglar figure to steal cards from opponents. But be careful! Being a great burglar also makes you a great target!

Cat Burglar is not compatible with non-English Versions of Exploding Kittens and Expansion Packs.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Zong-Heng
description:
Zong-Heng is a game in which the object is to create larger groups by adding pieces by shifting rows and columns of pieces.

You can shift the rows starting from the piece on the dark square, but you can only move the rows that contain more of your pieces.

This game is included in Generic Board "Checkered" set.

—description from the designer

name: Wiem lepiej: Wielkie miasta
description: Wiem lepiej: Wielkie miasta is an expansion for Polish version of Bezzerwizzer game. It contains 60 questions about big cities and one category tile.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Wiem lepiej: Niezapomniane filmy
description:
Wiem lepiej: Niezapomniane filmy is an expansion for Polish version of Bezzerwizzer game. It contains 60 questions about
movies and one category tile.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Wiem lepiej: Wynalazki i odkrycia
description: Wiem lepiej: Wynalazki i odkrycia is an expansion for Polish version of Bezzerwizzer game. It contains 60 questions about inventions and discoveries and one category tile.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Postcard ETO
description:
Small - 11 Allied vs. 7 German units - hex-and-counter northwest Europe 1944-45 campaign game starting with D-Day, using the factor differential plus Special Factor system of Postcard Barbarossa! and (Banner of War's beautiful edition of that,) Unternehmen Barbarossa - possible Pressed Attack *and* Desperate (No Retreat!) Defense - which makes it unpredictably good as a solitaire game too.

Army level, monthly turns. Possible early May 1944 D-Day, risking bad weather.
Shore bombardment and Allied air supremacy in support.
Atlantic Wall, bocage, Ardennes, and Siegfried Line. Special breakthrough/breakout properties for 3rd U.S. Army, 2nd British, and German 5. and 6. SS Panzer Armies.
OKW Strategic Reserve to be sent to the Russian Front (requiring Western Allies to achieve their victory objectives a month sooner) or to be used for surprise attack in the West.
Allied 1st Airborne Corps.
Battles are fought within hexes.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Lose a Turn, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: BattleTech: Welcome to the Nebula California
description:
Welcome to the Nebula California (AKA Explorer's Report: California Nebula) offers a few new venues for of-beat BattleTech adventures far from the hustle, bustle, and yet predictable chaos of the Dark Age-era Inner Sphere. Here, far from known civilizations (and from HPGs!), are worlds, societies, and technologies unlike any seen back home! Special rules, back-stories, and yes, even record sheets, are included for a host of new (and hopefully unique) new...things, ready for play in your (really) advanced BattleTech and A Time of War games.

Released as an April Fools product for 2023.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Plenty of Room in the Nebula California
description:
Plenty of Room in the Nebula California is a special follow-up to Welcome to the Nebula California, with more off-beat settings for BattleTech adventures far from the hustle, bustle, and cyclic chaos of the Dark Age-era Inner Sphere. Here in this space—where the very laws of logic, physics, and biology seem warped and twisted beyond recognition—worlds, societies, and technologies have arisen among populations long lost to the realms humanity now calls home! Special rules, backstories, and record sheets are included for a host of new (and hopefully unique) … things, ready for play in your (really) advanced BattleTech and A Time of War games.

Released for April Fools 2023
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Волшебная бродилка: в стране знаний (Magic Wanderer)
description: Players in the "Magic Wanderer" travel through the land of knowledge, and in order to successfully complete the route, they need to answer a variety of questions about the primary school program and not only. For correct answers, players receive magic fives that help them get out of traps, open ancient gates on their way and overtake other players.

name: Dongshan Island 1953
description:
The third issue of the Mini Wargame Magazine contains a wargame that simulates the Dongshan Island Campaign, 1953.

The game adopts the same system as "Kinmen 1949" designed by Yasushi Nakaguro, and does the opposite. From the the People's Liberation Army's landing battle on Kinmen Island 1949 to the KMT's landing battle on Dongshan Island 1953, it gives players a completely different feeling.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Obrazki Pełne Łaski
description:
Can you fill all the tiles with pictures? Or maybe you will choose a more difficult variant of the game and be the one who finds the card depicting the biblical story you are reading the fastest?

This smart and colorful game will make you spend your time well and while having a great time, you will learn the stories of people who met the Lord Jesus.

The goal is to determine which description describes which image. You win if you have full sets of paintings.

name: Quest for the Trident
description:
Quest for the Trident is a quick, exciting game about exploring the dangerous seas to find the powerful Trident of Poseidon! Venture into the unknown. Sink your friend’s ships. Control the ever changing seas. Gain exciting powers!

Rules Summary:

Create the map as you go! Each time you move into a blank space, you flip over a new tile from the deck to fill it. Tiles will have different effects when moving onto them, listed on the tile itself.

The goal of the game is to acquire the Trident, and bring it to one of your hideaways to win the game.

Every turn, you roll the dice to see how far you are able to move this turn. You can also attack other players and steal their stuff, or try to steal their hideaway. Gaining a hideaway gives you special powers that will help you navigate the seas.

At points during the game, you will be able to shift the seas by turning some tiles face down, and swapping them around. This will keep your opponents guessing where the dangers are hiding!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Exploration, Memory, Mythology, Nautical, Pirates, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Modular Board, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Emotional Rex
description:
Millenniums have passed. The Nisblitts, aliens not of our dimension, have discovered the remains of humanity and all of earth's other ancient relics. In order to study the emotions of these bizarre humans, the Nisblitts have revived one of these creatures and attached its mind to a device filled with fragments of 21st century language. The only problem... they didn't realize that they had actually revived a Tyrannosaurus rex.

Players will take turns becoming this talking Emotional rex that must speak sentences in emotional ways. The Nisblitt players will then assess these emotions with their data tokens. Correct guesses on the emotion award points for both the Nisblitt players and the E-rex player. The player with the most points at the end of the game knows what it truly means to be "human".

name: Green Team Wins: Tantrum House Promo Pack
description:
Collection of 30 cards for use in the game. There are 10 different new cards in each of the three categories that are all unique to this specific set. All of the cards are related to pop culture.

The card content was created through a collaboration with Tantrum House for their Kickstarter campaign.

name: Escape Box: L'Antre du Dragon
description:
An Escape Game... for children! Embark on a fabulous adventure in a land far away! Princess Elisa has been kidnapped by a dragon! You have 45 minutes to free her, before the dragon decides to devour you all. Time is running out, will you be able to solve the puzzles, without getting lost in the lair of the beast?

Included: Box with 1 booklet of 32 pages, 40 cards, 1 poster ans 45-minute soundtrack to immerse yourself in the kingdom of knights and dragons!

name: Labyrinth Adventures
description:
Labyrinth Adventures is a tabletop, dungeon crawling, adventure game system that utilizes basic roleplaying elements. Four characters are used for gameplay (each of a different class): The Warrior, Wizard, Rogue and Cleric.

If you’re new to roleplaying, this is a most excellent “starter” system! If you’re a well-seasoned gamer; you’ll quickly find that the light rules/heavy play components offer a nostalgic feel that says, “Welcome home!”

To play; you will need a rulebook, quest module, four or more 6-sided dice (each referred to as “1d6”) and a piece of scratch paper for taking notes and doing simple math (character sheets and maps are provided for you). Labyrinth Adventures may be played with up to four people and may also be played solo because no Game Master is needed for gameplay!

So; create your party, settle in for a story and… may the luck of the dice be with you!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Grid Coverage, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Aetherial War: Untold Adventures
description:
A micro game that fits in your pocket, the Aetherial War: Untold Adventures is perfect for on-the-go dungeon exploration within the Aetherial War universe. As the little brother to the Aetherial War Card Game, don’t let the small size fool you: this game packs tons of replay value and loads of achievements to try and accomplish. It may all fit inside a tin, but that doesn’t mean it can’t hold its own for when you’re looking for a fun, light-weight game to break out and put away in under 20 minutes.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hide and Seek
description:
You are Sheryl Holmes, terror of the first-grade playground. Known far and wide (at least three schools over!) for your observational skills, you have a reputation of being unstoppable at hide-and-seek.
In Hide and Seek, you will be placing cards around a grid of hidden playmates, trying to match their suit. You may reveal anyone’s identity at any time, and you score if the cards you placed match the playmates’ suit. The more playmates you find, the easier it is to narrow down the identities of the rest, so you must strike a delicate balance between guessing too early versus too late.

As part of the Isaludo collection, the rules can be found in this forum thread.

name: Compart
description:
Compart is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board).

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, for every viable area with one or more empty points, place a stone of your color on one of those points.

A viable area is a viable point along with all other such points one can reach from it through a series of steps onto orthogonally adjacent viable points. A viable point is a point that is empty or occupied by a friendly stone.

When the board is full, the player with fewer stones on the board wins. If there is a tie, whoever placed the last stone wins. Ties are only possible on even-sized boards.

To make the game fair, the second player will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.



NotesWalling off areas of the board with your stones multiplies enemy placements, but be mindful that your opponent will try to use those extra placements to enclose new areas that multiply your own placements.

-description from designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Enclosure, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: The Letter Game
description:
A game of cards and words made for 2 to 4 players of all ages. Het letterspel (the letter game) is card game where players create words from letter cards in their hands and on the table. After creating words, players can shuffle around and use letters from words that are already created. The game gives a twist with some action cards that alter the course of action in the game. The first player with no cards in his hand wins the game.

—description from publisher

name: Destination Xuzhou
description:
Destination Xuzhou is an operational level wargame simulates the Battle of Xuzhou in China during World War II. The map is devided by hex and one hex cross is nearly 25-30 km. 1-2 players control the Imperial Japanese Army and 1 player controls the National Revolutionary Army. Player who controls more VP areas win the game after 10 turns.

—description from the designer
publishers: Formosa Force Games, Kuro Neko Design Workshop

name: Ratty Ruckus
description:
Ratty Ruckus takes the classic game of tic-tac-toe to a whole new level with unexpected surprises and lots of rats. Players must create a sequence of matching rats in a line within the 4 x 4 grid either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. The first player to line up their rats takes the cheese. Each successful sequence earns a point and ends the round, the first player or team to reach three points wins the game.
—description from the publisher

User summary:
This game is marketed as Tic-Tac-Toe taken to the next level. While it is inspired by Tic-Tac-Toe, there are several key changes, including up to 3 players (or teams of 2 each) rather than just 2 gamers facing off. And spaces are not always owned by one player for the duration of the game, as other players can take over a space or co-exist in a space. With the need to get 4 in a row on a 4 x 4 grid, the game is still (but much less) susceptible to the "gridlock" of Tic-Tac-Toe that leads to draws among skilled players.

Can be played by 2 or 3 players, or with partner teams can be played by 4 or 6 players; not with 5 or more than 6 players.

name: The Scandal
description:
You are thrown in to a world of mystery, blackmail and deception. Solve the puzzles and break into the online vault - before it's too late.

A sports photographer, has stumbled across a story of match-fixing and blackmail at the Marseille Tennis Championships. A bank of files and documents are being used to threaten a leading tennis star and they need your help to disrupt the plan.

How to play: Solve all nine puzzles to reveal the passcode to the online vault, break into the vault where the files are hidden and delete them all before it’s too late!

name: Star of Alladore: The Official Rangers of Shadow Deep Fanzine
description:
In this scenario-filled fanzine, the Rangers must quell a revolt in the heart of the capital of Alladore, investigate a hamlet stuck down with plague, explore the dungeons beneath an abandoned tower, sneak into a gnoll occupied village, and defend a group of refugees as they flee the frontlines of the war.

Organized and edited by Rangers of Shadow Deep creator, Joseph A. McCullough, and presented with Barrett Stanley’s usual moody artwork, this collection gives five fan creators a chance to shine and to explore some of the aspects of the war against the Shadow Deep that are outside of the main narrative.
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Battletech: Record Sheets – Dark Age
description: BattleTech Record Sheets: Dark Age offers players the record sheets for all the 'Mechs detailed in BattleTech Technical Readout: Dark Age.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Party Games: Family Charades
description:
Split into two teams of two or more players. Shuffle the cards. The team going first has one of their players take the top card from the deck. Then the player performs the charade by miming one of the four titles on the card. Their team has a set time to guess correctly. If correctly guessed the team receives one point. If the team does not guess correctly the play goes to the second team.
The game ends when each teams member has performed three charades. The team with the most points wins.

name: Battletech: Record Sheets – Jihad
description: BattleTech Record Sheets: Jihad offers players the record sheets for all the 'Mechs detailed in BattleTech Technical Readout: Jihad.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Battletech: Record Sheets – Technical Readout: 3145
description: BattleTech Record Sheets: 3145 offers players the record sheets for all the 'Mechs detailed in BattleTech Technical Readout: 3145.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Bummert
description:
A domino-based trick-taking game for 2-5 players.

Bummert differentiates itself from other trick taking games in its use of dominoes as the primary component.

Dominoes are two-sided, meaning either side can be used as either the rank or the suit, either of which may switch around after the first trick is played.

Like many classic trick taking games, Bummert also features melding, a quick way to add additional points to your score-card.

—description from the designer

name: Codebreaker
description:
La Famiglia’s influence has proven to be far broader than anyone suspected. In partnership with the FBI, you embark on a special mission to strike at the heart of the organization. You arrive on a foreign shore and find a package awaiting you. Will you be able to dismantle La Famiglia once and for all?

Codebreaker contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of puzzles to decipher and clues to crack. It also contains a La Famiglia pin upon completion of the game! Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun.

Codebreaker is the final game of The Famiglia Trilogy, the sequel to La Famiglia (Game I) and The Takedown (Game II).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: iKnow 2.0
description:
The successful trivia classic - reimagined for a new generation! This is a trivia game where everyone has a chance to succeed! Each question contains three clues that take you closer and closer to the correct answer. You can choose when to answer, but the more clues you hear, the fewer points you get.

Generous question content means it can be played multiple times!
Everyone has a chance to score and win.
Game concept that is successful all over the world.

name: Roll and Rails: Italian Islands map pack
description:
Italian Islands map pack expansion for Roll and Rails game. This expansion includes 2 new maps:
Sardinia for solo play
Sicily for multiplayer game

name: Roll and Rails: Poland map pack
description:
Poland map pack expansion for Roll and Rails game. This expansion includes 2 new maps:
Upper Silesia for solo play
Poland for multiplayer game

name: Dorty jsou vrženy
description:
Have you always wanted to throw a cake like Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy or Charlie Chaplin did in black and white slapstick movies? Finally, you have the chance - and in colour. The winner is the person who is the most skilful at throwing cakes with different coloured icings and can stack the most matching icings next to each other.

Dorty jsou vrženy is a party game where age, knowledge or experience doesn't matter. But being skilful in throwing cards in different fashion might come in handy. And so a child can play with grandma or a bunch of adults - they all have similar chances.

Choose a card, pick one icing you like the most and throw the card on the table. If you connect the chosen icing on multiple cards, you score points! But beware, your scoring card dictates how to throw cards. With your eyes closed? Toss it like a disc? Or slam it to the table?

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Shattered Lands
description:
The world shattered. The primal magic that used to bind the lands has been freed. Now everyone can drain from it. The era of heroes and necessary alliances has begun. Enter the ruins of a once glorious world, where magic flows freely and the lands are scattered across the skies.

Be the first faction to get the maximum Victory Points.
You can trade your VP for cards. Use cards to create epic combos. The more VP you get, the stronger your spells become.
Collect VP for claiming lands (each board level is 1 point) or eliminating opponents (5 points).

Players fight using teams of two characters with unique abilities. Each turn players can use action points to: move, cast spells, claim land, use character ability or meditate (swap/draw card).

Plan your moves wisely as the higher you go, the lower you fell, and it hurts! Mind the position on the board of your and opponent's minis. It matters if you are hidden under an island or if you are on the verge of land. Someone can push you easily. Some spells cover wider areas or damage everything in the straight lines. Have fun.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Sons of Faeriell: Dornog the Spider
description:
Dornog the Spider adds a new menace in the Faeriell realm.

Dornog the Spider is a Corrupted creature, which can be put in play from the beginning of the game with its own miniature. The Spider is moved by players and affects the Region where it is placed with an emanation of Corruption.

name: Ranklotzen: 6 Spieler Edition
description:
On the blocks, get set, go! It's all about speed and skill. Compete against each other in many different modes and stack your blocks in a race. But watch out! Wildly mixed colors, misleading color names and crazy tasks won't make it easy for you. RANKLOTZEN is a fast and exciting game for family and friends. Unpack and start playing, perfect for in-between, whether at home or on the road. May the best "impostor" win!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Auf die Klötze, fertig, los! Hier dreht sich alles um Schnelligkeit und Geschick. Tretet in vielen verschiedenen Modi gegeneinander an und stapelt eure Klötze um die Wette. Aber Achtung! Wild gemischte Farben, irreführende Farbnamen und verrückte Aufgaben machen es euch nicht leicht. RANKLOTZEN ist ein schnelles und spannendes Spiel für Familie und Freunde. Hier ist Auspacken und Losspielen angesagt, perfekt für Zwischendurch, ob zu Hause oder unterwegs. Möge der beste „Hochstapler“ gewinnen!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Liars & Landmines
description: Fifty-six cards numbered one through ten are all dealt. Players take turns placing one or more cards face down onto a stack and announcing their value, which must be one less than or one greater than the value of the card(s) played by the previous player. The direction of play and the direction of value (rising or falling) can be altered by special cards. Players can challenge the announced value. The loser of the challenge collects the stack of played cards. The first player to rid his hand of cards wins.

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Nashorn
description:
The German Nashorn continues the trend of big German machinery, but on a budget! With 6 Firepower this is a cheap way to bring some big firepower to the table. A Camouflage Net is a must to add some Survivability while installing the smaller 7.5cm Pak 42 L/70 with a Gun Rammer can provide you with some needed Initiative.

Wave 10
Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ Nashorn
5 Tanks Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II

name: Cat Pageant
description:
In the glamourous and competitive world of feline pageantry, only one cat fancier can be the best! Seek out and attain the finest felines, groom them to perfection, and then show them on the catwalk to claim your rightful title as the ultimate cat fancier!

Each round is divided into 4 phases;
1) players will secretly place their time cubes on their time cards to choose their actions and bonuses for the round (time cards represent how the fanciers use their time.)

2) players will adopt cats from the adoption area.

3) players can groom cats, learn cat tricks or upgrade their fanciers' stats.

4) players with groomed cats can show them in pageants (this is how you get points and win)

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Print & Play

name: Air Mail
description:
Air Mail was released as one of six in Milton Bradley's "Radio Series" of inexpensive race games costing 15 cents each. It debuted in the Bradley Games catalog of 1927 and was sold through 1933. A slightly larger but cheaper edition, at 10 cents, appeared in the 1943 catalog.

This is NOT the same as the bagatelle/marble game, The Game of Air Mail, published by Milton Bradley in 1931.

Air Mail is a simple spin and move game in which the object is to get your plane from New York to San Francisco and back again. Along the way, you get points for reaching different stations at major cities (but the race track is in simple columns and no station can be avoided).

—user summary

name: Honey Buzz: Cornucopia Mini Expansion
description:
The Cornucopia expansion contains new components that you can include in your games of Honey Buzz: Fall Flavors, in any combination. Some introduce new rules that alter gameplay, while others increase the variety that the game has to offer.

3 new Fruit Order cards let you sell to animals known for being not-so-picky eaters (goat, pig, and dog). These cards feature wild symbols which can be satisfied by any honey or fruit.

4 new Foliage Cards reference the adjacency of leaves in your hive, putting an emphasis on placement in addition to set collection.

8 new Toast Cards for the Harvest Festival module give you scoring options related to actions taken on your turn or related to the other expansion modules.

30 new Bonus Tokens can be placed on the Harvest Festival board, making the reward for retired workers even more bountiful.

Finally, 2 new Queen's Contests for solo play reference sold or unsold fruit, and a new solo die can be used alongside the solo dice from the Honey Pot mini-expansion to make dice-based solo play interact with all of the new modules in Honey Buzz: Fall Flavors.

—description from designer

name: Karty Dżentelmenów: Epizod Siódmy
description:
Look no further! You've just found Gentleman's Cards - full of uncompromising black humour, a best-selling card game for adults who know where the boundaries are in jokes and love to break them.

The rules are simple. You have two suits of cards. Black has questions, white has answers. One person puts a black one on the table, the others answer it with white. The owner of black decides which answer is the funniest and gives his card as a point. The next person plays a black card, becoming a judge, and you go on. Whoever scores the most points wins.

The game already has 6 "episodes" that can (and should) be freely combined.

That's 243,968 combinations! It doesn't matter how often you play

—description from the publisher (translated)

Nie szukaj dalej! Właśnie znalazłeś Karty Dżentelmenów – pełną bezkompromisowego, czarnego humoru, bestsellerową grę karcianą dla dorosłych, którzy wiedzą, gdzie w żartach są granice i kochają je łamać.

Zasady są proste. Masz dwa kolory kart. Na czarnych są pytania, na białych odpowiedzi. Jedna osoba wykłada na stół czarną, pozostałe odpowiadają na nią za pomocą białych. Właściciel czarnej decyduje, która odpowiedź jest najśmieszniejsza i wręcza swoją kartę jako punkt. Kolejna osoba zagrywa czarną kartę stając się sędzią i jedziecie dalej. Wygrywa ten, kto zdobędzie najwięcej punktów.

Gra ma już 6 “epizodów”, które można (i należy) dowolnie łączyć.

To aż 243968 kombinacji! Nie ważne, jak często grasz.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Dschungelgedrängel
description:
There's a party in the jungle today, and the animals are gathering on the ancient statues, but space is limited, and all the animals want to climb on top. If too many animals are on a statue, they all fall down and have to climb up anew.

In Dschungelgedrängel, players each have four statue cards in front of them. In their hands, they hold cards with different numbers of the four animals: elephants, tigers, monkeys, and parrots. The goal is to stack nine animals of a kind on top of the respective statues. On their turn, players can either play any number of cards of the same animal type on a statue, or they can play an action card that messes with other players' plans. If at any time a player has more than nine animals of a kind on a given statue, they all fall down and the statue is empty again.

The first player to fill three statues triggers the game end; at the end of that round, the player with the most filled statues wins.

name: Tanto Cuore: Memento Mori – Twilight Manor: Kickstarter Promos
description:
The Kickstarter for Memento Mori - Twilight Manor also introduced five new promos.

Anise Deceased
Cynthia Corpse
Dead Eye Domino
Maligned Aline
Deadly Dermot
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: ☆秋葉原の野望☆ (Akihabara's Ambition)
description:
Let's run maid cafes in Akihabara. And if you managed to own 10 maid cafes, you won.

There are various maids to hire, such as students, office workers, underground idols, and cosplayers. The picture is very cute, so that's the number one selling point.

Buy interiors and clothes in the early days. But it's all about creating an atmosphere. So paying a lot for interiors and clothes doesn't affect the game much.

Promote part-timers to star salesmaid or store managers by hiring part-timers in large quantities.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ☆秋葉原の野望☆ 拡張キット (Akihabara's Ambition: Expansion kit)
description: This expansion introduces new maids, costumes and guests to the base game.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: PowerHaus
description: Players take turns rolling dice and moving along the streets in their neighborhood. Players can stop at their house and draw cards that display either a positive "Save" number or a negative "Waste" number. Players can also visit three commercial buildings in the neighborhood where they can purchase service cards that will enhance their "Save" numbers. At the beginning of each round, each player will receive income that is equal to the "Save" minus "Waste" numbers on their cards. The game also provides ways to acquire extra "Save" cards and to get rid of "Waste" cards. Play ends when all the cards in the house have been taken. The player with the most points (Save minus Waste) at that time wins.

name: Tricky War
description:
Tricky War is a card game mixing predictive bid, trick-taking and war.

In Tricky War, bid on uncertain duels and make the right choices to avoid losing too many points during the war phase.

Goal:
End up with the most “point” tokens when a player loses their last one.

Components:
- A 52-card deck (4 suits, each with cards from 1 to 13)
- 40 “point” tokens (you can also use a pen & paper)
- 20 “bidding” tokens (you can also use a pen & paper)
- Something to remember the trump suit(tokens, unused cards…)

A game is played in several rounds. The game is over as soon as at least one player does not have any “point” tokens left.

A round is played in several phases:

1. Bidding
2. Choosing the trump suit
3. War
4. End of round

When at least one player has lost all their “point” tokens, the game is over and the player who has the most "point" tokens is the winner.

The rules of Tricky come with some variants to add more control, a partnership mode and a solo mode.

—description from the designer

name: Pond Poker
description:
Pond Poker is a fast paced card game for 2-8 players, ages 8 and up. It is easy to learn and quick to play. Game play is about 30 minutes.

Here's how it works: deal 5 pond cards to each player face down, then lay 6 more face up in the center of the table to form the pond. Each round, a player draws an action card and reads it out loud, setting off a frenzy of activity as players rush to complete the action within the nail-biting 10-second time limit. Beware, though - if you can't complete the action in time, you'll have to draw a penalty card!

As the rounds progress, the game only gets more intense with unexpected actions that can turn the game on its head at any moment. At the end of 10 Action Rounds, all players score their remaining hand with the Score Sheet. Player with the most points wins! With 10 exciting action rounds, Pond Poker is the perfect game to add some chaotic fun back to your game night.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Command Cards, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Matching

name: Postcard Kursk
description:
Postcard Kursk is a fast, simple, but decision-demanding little hex-and-counter board-wargame about the 5th July 1943 Operation Citadel German Offensive. Hitler and his generals had misgivings about but prosecuted anyway, to catastrophic losses which decisively weakened the German Wehrmacht and then enabled the Russians to sweep all the way to the Dnieper River and even take Kiev at the end of 1943.

8 Russian and 7 German offensive and reserve - maneuver - units. Infantry implicitly in fortification lines on both sides.
Alternating turns, Germans first: move UnDisrupted units and then attack.
Same simple odds and Disruption-momentum combat system as in Postcard Brittany and Postcard Bulge, but additionally attacking odds can be rounded *up* in some cases.
8 turns. Game ends at the end of Turn 8 Russian player-turn.
Winning – more points than at start – cities last occupied and in supply: Belgorod and Orel worth 1 each – other cities 2 each. 4 points more is a strategic victory worth 2 games.
Print off onto A4/8.5x11 for the units and A3/11x17 for the map, for more comfortable gameplay.
As with my other postcard games, anyone is free to print off (unaltered) copies en masse in postcard A6/4x6 or A5/5x8 size and format, to mail/give to family and friends.
Anyone interested in commercially publishing/selling this for profit, I have publication rights - this is not public domain - so check with me about licensing.

-description from designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Bat Flip: Bases Loaded Expansion
description:
Add four unique teams consisting of 48 new players to Bat Flip!

San Francisco Clutch
When the goin’ gets tough, the tough get goin’. There are some players who can just turn "it" on when everything's on the line. Keep it close and back yourself into a corner because that’s when your boys are at their best.

Detroit Dirtbags
Deliver take-out slides and headhunting pitches and knock your opponent’s best players out of the game. Force your opponent to discard players you don't want to see. Hurt them before they can hurt you.

Baltimore Pinchers
You're a manager with a trick up your sleeve. The ol' bait and switch. Pinch hit. Pinch run. Bait your opponent to commit a defender and then instantly switch to a hitter or run they just aren't ready for.

Scottsdale Scouts
Scour your deck for talent. Sift through your cards to find precisely the players you need when you need them. Then outmaneuver your opponent and overwhelm them with wave after wave of talent.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: Safari Photo
description: Safari Photo magazine is looking for its new wildlife reporter. You are sent to Africa to take the most beautiful pictures of the animals of the savanna. The photographer with the most points will be awarded the coveted position of reporter in the prestigious editorial office of Safari Photo magazine. But beware, you are not the only one to covet this position, and wild animals are not so easy to photograph.

name: Palec boży: Wakan Tanka God Promo
description: Wakan Tanka is the newest Promo God introduced together with Cherry Blossom expansion.

name: Shadows Over Normandie: Achtung! Cthulhu – Add-on Pack
description:
This expansion is an add-on to the Shadows over Normandie KickStarter campaign. It adds three tiles and two units punchboards from the Achtung! Cthulhu universe. Print & Play version is available in the publisher's website.

Required to play the Achtung! Cthulhu campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Dziedzictwo Kazimierza Wielkiego
description:
Dziedzictwo Kazimierza Wielkiego is a regional game presenting Lesser Poland voivodeship castles founded by Casimir III The Great, the last Polish king from Piast dynasty.

In each round after shared pawn movement, players fight for the castle trying to get the highest number with a dice roll and score boosting cards. Only one contestant leaves the battleground with points and optional king emblem.

Whoever reaches certain number of owned points or emblems wins the game (15pts or 5emblems for 2 player game). The game may also end with last castle taken - then the player with highest score wins
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Roll / Spin and Move, Score-and-Reset Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Spearhead: The Balloon Goes Up! Volume 1
description:
The Balloon Goes Up! is a series which simulates hypothetical armored warfare in Western Europe, the Middle East and Asia from the mid 1980’s to the present day, all using a consistent core set of rules coupled with a situation-specific playbook that allows for a variety of situations to be portrayed. The first game in the series, Spearhead, represents a summer 1986 conflict between elements of the Soviet and East German armies and United States, West German, and French armies. The game emphasizes how long-range detection and firepower technologies dramatically increased the depth of the theater of operations in modem warfare. This “Deep Engagement” waged far behind the front lines can determine the outcome of a campaign even before the opposing ground forces truly come to grips. Players must learn how to fight and win the Deep Engagement to achieve overall victory, taking into account the different ways the forces of the two sides were prepared to fight.

Spearhead scenarios range from smaller battle scenarios that deal with specific situations, locations, and forces, and the larger campaign style scenarios that portray the wider battle between Warsaw Pact and NATO forces. Battle scenarios depict Warsaw Pact drives into the province of Hesse, with objectives of Kassel, the Fulda Gap, Frankfurt, and ultimately the Rhine River.

The game provides players with accurate accurate orders of battle for the participants down to battalion level (based on 1986 force levels)—the US V Corps, West German III Korps, French 1st Army, Soviet 8th Guards and 1st Guards Tank Armies, and East German 3rd Army. Spearhead is based on Mark Herman’s Flashpoint: Golan system, which has been updated and refined. The game uses a chit-pull activation system, with divisions being the primary formations. Game scale is 4km per hex, turns are 1 day (12-hour activation impulses).

Components:
Two 22” x 34” map sheets that combine to form a 34” x 44” map
Five counter sheets containing 1170 double-sided 9/16” counters
Twelve 8.5” x 11” Player Aid Cards
One 10-sided die
One Rules Booklet
One Playbook

Players:
2 but the game is well-suited to team play

-description from publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Zone of Control

name: Roll and Rails: Portugal – Spain Map Pack
description:
Portugal - Spain map pack expansion for Roll and Rails game.

This expansion includes 2 new maps:
Portugal for solo play
Spain for multiplayer game

name: One Page Expedition: Planets
description:
In Planets map pack, terrain might be struck by meteorites falling from the sky.

-description from publisher's website

name: One Page Expedition: Gold Rush
description:
In Gold Rush, players will try to build their camps near gold deposits so they gain as many victory points as possible from expedition.

-description from publisher's website

name: One Page Expedition: Amazon Forest
description:
In Amazon map pack, players will be researching new species of animals. The more they discover the more points they will receive.

-description from publisher's website

name: しあわせのいと (Shiawase no Ito)
description:
Competitive deduction game with up to 6 turns to settle the case
Beginner-friendly system that requires no notes
Enjoy the fascinating world view created in collaboration with Dr. Metawo Ueda

name: Route 66: Get Your Tricks
description:
"Route 66: Get Your Tricks" is a trick-taking card game for two players.

Enjoy the adventure of taking a road trip. Travel West along America's Main Street, stopping along roadside destinations and navigating Interstate Highways. This nostalgic twist on traditional European card games puts you right in the driver's seat.

The game is played over a series of rounds where players race to travel 66 miles. Depending on how well players pace their trip by winning rounds, they may be able to travel 1-3 states per round.

Greater rewards can be risked by closing the road. But choose your destinations carefully. If you fall behind, you'll have to rely on the dashboard warning lights to get you back up to speed. The first player to travel from Illinois to California wins the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Race, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Middara: Unintentional Malum – Lupercalia 2023, Debauchery and Legends Bundle
description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

This Bundle contains the entirety of our Lupercalia 2023 Resin Kit Sets in one immaculate bundle.
This includes miniatures for The Kreshka - Apollyon of Vanity, The Dark Mother Aspect, Somoe - Deep Sea Naiad, and the Erotes.

This Bundle also includes two 50mm bases, three 25mm bases, 5x Loyal Esper Cards, 5x Opposing Esper Cards, 10x Item Cards, 10x Initiative Cards,1x Ability card, and 5x Art cards.

name: You Who?!
description:
You Who?! is the game of you knows who, because sometimes we know people better than they know themselves. The squishy baloney gets tossed when we know someone is full of it. But be careful, when it's your turn to ask the question, the squishy baloney may be thrown at you!

250 card game questions, broken into 5 rounds that go from light-hearted to more thought provoking. The game questions are based on real life, because real life is more funny than we think!

name: Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood: Early Reading Game
description:
Children explore letter names and sounds as they create simple words to help pave the path to reading success. Play and read with Daniel Tiger and his neighbors in this board game for beginning readers that encourages social skills, literacy and counting.

Spin the spinner and move that number of spaces. Players will try to complete a word using the letter they landed on as the starting letter, and a card from their hand to complete the word. Special rules apply for landing on Q or X, as well as vowels (collecting gift tokens, etc.).

The player with the most gift tokens once all players have crossed the finish line wins the game.

name: オオカミ×トリック (Wolf x Trick)
description:
The player is a young man in a werewolf village who dreams of living in the city.

However, life in the city is full of dangers (circles)!

In order to be allowed to live in the city, you must prove that the circle does not transform you.
If you collect the most circles, you will transform, so aim for the second number of circles that you will not transform!

name: DJ部 (DJ-BU)
description:
The world is beginning to understand the impermanence of all things, and entertainment is fading from this world. The "DJ club" of the secret society "LSG" stands up to bring back entertainment to the world! It is up to you whether you want to fight against the society as a "DJ club" or betray the "LSG" to master the front and reach the paradise.

In each turn players take part in events to collect resources, you can give event cards to other players to block one of their's event cards.

The game ends when any of the players becomes the TOP DJ by having over 1000 cash and 500 charisma or the High priest by reaching the 10th level of virtue.

name: Reach Doll
description:
You play as a manager trying to help Reach Doll idols get their debut.

In your turn you try to match 3 cards of the same Idol by drawing from one of the 3 decks or the associated queues. By doing that you get a ticket to their concert.

The game ends when a player gets 7 concert tickets.

name: LEGO Timeline
description:
This Timeline game is a LEGO employee exclusive to celebrate 90 Years of Play.

Like other Timeline games, LEGO Timeline is a card game where each card depicts an important moment in Lego history with the year of the moment.
