Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Stonesmasher Promo Card
description:
The Stonesmasher Gear card is a promo card that was included with the Gnostin Stonesmasher miniature, which itself is not part of the game.

The Gear card comes with a Glossary card to explain its rules. It reads:

Stonesmasher (Savage, Demolish, Irreplaceable): This gains +4 luck when attacking a knocked down monster.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Lolowen
description:
Lagomorphs steal the poorly guarded eggs appearing in nests around their settlement. They return to the settlement and feast on the glowing green yolks before the ornate shells become too tough to break. The raw eggs are easily gained but rarely sit well in the survivors' digestive tract. To prepare for the blood rites, survivors will spend a lantern year incubating the eggs with their body's warmth, until the iron-hard shells crack, disgorging the helpless downy creatures they consume for their preparatory feasts. When it came time for Lolowen to incubate her egg, she lacked the patience to produce a sacrifice for the feast. Lolowen kit includes a painters scale model perfect for hobbyists and a gamers scale model for gamers looking to include Lolowen's story in their campaign.

Lolowen is packaged in a graphic box that includes:

1 x Hard plastic Lolowen miniature
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and scenic insert
1 x Large matte art print
1 x Seed Pattern card
1 x Seed Pattern Gear card
2 x Glossary cards
1 x Install guide for playing Lolowen in your Monster campaign
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Beetle Get!
description:
A flip-and-score game where you try to find and collect as many wondrous beetles as possible. Players play pattern cards to dig up the dirt hiding these beautiful beasts of the soil. Pay attention though! Beetles move and aren't always where you expect them to be.

—description from the designer

Lay out the beetle cards in a 9x9 grid. Flip over four of them to start. Pick up one of the cards from the draw deck and score the beetles down a row matching that cards layout. Flip over all cards in that row and move another row randomly. Try to get the most points on your score card to win!

—user summary

name: Pride of Ninja
description:
In Pride of Ninjas, you draft 7 cards, 4 in the front row face up and 3 in the back row face down. Some cards have different ability depending on the row it is played.
The goal is to win Temporary Points (TP) by playing these cards in the best spot. You may get slain during the round which means you will lose all the TP you've won so far.
After resolving all cards, you convert all your TPs into Victory Points (VP). Play multiple rounds until one player has scored 20 or more VPs.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Castle Party: Promo 1
description:
Place the wolfman card somewhere in the lower half of the monster deck.

When the wolfman appears at the party, it is a good idea to place him next to the window from which he can see the moon. If you do, when you score the fireworks event, you will get 3 points for the wolfman (instead of 1 point, as you would with the other monsters).

name: TAKIBI
description:
In Takibi, the players are tending to a campfire. Each turn, players will choose and simultaneously reveal a card. Most of the cards have two halves: firewood and cocoa.

The strength of the fire increases for each player who plays a firewood card. Depending upon the resulting strength of the fire, these players may earn points or take a penalty. If the fire goes out, players who were drinking cocoa will take a penalty. There are also firestarter cards.

The player with the most points after a series of rounds wins.

name: Capital Horse
description: Capital Horse is a trivia game in which 6 randomly chosen Japanese prefectures are running as the horses in a race. Each race, a category is chosen (such as size of prefecture or population), and the players make up to 3 wagers from 7 different options. Accurate wagers give a player points based upon the rankings of the prefectures.

name: Chou y es-tu?
description:
The game that turns the garden upside down! Cunning rabbits, take advantage of the gardeners' siesta to eat cabbage from the vegetable garden without being spotted! Attentive gardeners, will you be able to find the rabbits hidden under the cabbages?

An asymmetrical game of hide-and-seek in the vegetable garden

Quick set up: open the box and play!

Very simple rules for a subtly strategic game :

At each turn, the rabbits eat the cabbage under which they are hidden and move in any direction. The farmers then move around trying to catch the rabbits hidden under the cabbages.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Le jeu qui met le jardin sens dessus de chou ! Lapins rusés, profitez de la sieste des jardiniers pour manger les choux du potager sans vous faire repérer ! Jardiniers attentifs, parviendrez vous à retrouver les lapins cachés sous les choux ?

Un jeu de cache-cache asymétrique dans le potager

Mise en place rapide : ouvrez la boîte et jouez !

Des règles très simples pour un jeu subtilement stratégique

—description from the publisher

name: DECK THE TACTICS R
description:
Learn in 3 minutes and play 1000 times!

It is a game where you choose a profession and fight on the board using a special deck. Move the special class piece placed in the field of 6 squares x 6 squares, match the range and hit the opponent. You win by reducing your opponent's HP to 0.

Once you get used to playing, you can also create an original deck by combining occupations.

Game modes are:
・Multiplayer individual battle survival
・1vs2 asymmetrical boss battle
・2vs2 team battle

Use different game modes depending on the number of people playing.

-description from publisher's website (translated)

Deck the Tactics R is a competitive board game for 2-4 players. Each player uses their dedicated deck prepared for their character. Move your character and attack to reduce your opponent's HP to 0 for the win!
-description by user
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Kudousan no Game (工藤さんのゲーム)

name: Caesar's Gallic War II
description:
A major updating of the original Worthington Games 2009 classic by Daniel Berger. In the update you will now get larger blocks, an updated map with new regions/forts, cards and rules which now include solitaire rules.

Caesar's Gallic War II is a two-player Strategic level block board-wargame that covers Julius Caesar's conquest of Gaul from 58 to 51 BC. One person plays the side of the Romans, while the other plays the side of the Germans, with both players vying for control of the various Gallic tribes.

The game uses blocks and area movement. Players use cards to collect allies, move units and attack or play events. Certain leaders are represented in the game, including Julius Caesar, Vercingetorix and Ariovistus.

As the Germans you will start with fewer and weaker units, but you you'll have an easier time recruiting other tribes to your side. Eventually Vercingetorix will appear to help you. Will you confront the Romans directly? Or will you play defensively, and rely on raiding tactics and political maneuvering?

As the Romans you start with six legions, with four more on the way. Your units are stronger and faster. But you'll have a more difficult time recruiting tribes onto your side, and you'll not only have to worry about rebellions, but watch your supplies as well.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Events, Hidden Movement, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Secret Unit Deployment, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Unsolved Crime Cases: Endstation Sri Lanka
description: The intriguing case of dead travel blogger Adam Tardiff awaits you in this gripping crime escape game. As a successful influencer, Adam has only just realized his dream and embarked on a world tour, only to end up dead in the middle of the Sri Lankan jungle. What happened? A tragic accident? Have his followers become his undoing? Or was it one of Adam's posts that upset locals? Visit all locations related to the case, collect clues and evidence, question the witnesses and interrogate your suspects in an exciting multimedia finale.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Questions and Answers, Team-Based Game

name: Chicken Crimes: Il caso Chica Besada
description:
What is this decidedly attractive and mysterious character hiding? The questions about the Dom Gallignon case are not over! Help Detective Gallo solve another case!

Please note: This is an expansion to be played after the basic case "Chicken Crimes: the Mystery of Dom Gallignon."

name: Tiga
description:
A small tactical game for two players like Tic Tac Toe.

You have a 3x3 pattern with double sided tokens. When its your turn you can change position of two adjacent tokens or can turn over one tile. Goal is to have a line of 3 same symbols or colors.

—user summary

name: Cats vs Pickles: Mayhem
description:
Cats vs Pickles: Mayhem is a family friendly card game for 2-8 players. Where wacky mayhem scratches its claws across the globe, in this game players take turns tossing their characters to victory.

Players take turns drawing and playing toss cards which have a variety of challenges to complete. The goal of the game is to score points by landing their characters in a field; misses are punished by having the player draw a Chaos card, which may change of the fate of the game.

Cats vs Pickles: Mayhem comes with 2 game exclusive Cats vs Pickles plush but can be played with any Cats vs Pickles plush.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards

name: Cats vs Pickles: Mayhem – Nature Danger Expansion
description:
This nature dangery expansion is chocked full of dino-cats, alligators, shark-cats, spider-cats, whale-cats, jaguars, skunk-cats, chickens… Featuring 1 game exclusives Cats vs Pickles plush, this expansion includes an additional 10 toss cards and 10 chaos cards to add to your Cats vs Pickles: Mayhem game.

The base game is required for this expansion.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards

name: Cats vs Pickles: Mayhem – Pickle Panic Expansion
description: This Pickly Panicky expansion adds a bunch of panic and pickles ton your precious party of printed fun. The expansion features 1 game exclusive Cats vs Pickles plush and in addition 10 toss cards and 10 chaos cards to your Cats vs Pickles Mayhem game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards

name: Matchlocks & Witchcraft
description:
A skirmish wargame of 17th century Puritans facing the reality of their superstitions...

Matchlocks & Witchcraft takes historical accounts of American fears of witches and plays out a "what if" situation. What if a witch had actually kidnapped a Puritan child, how would an encounter between Puritans and a coven of Witches play out at the edge of the New England wilderness.

Using your own 28mm miniatures, a low model count, and a 3'x3' play area you can resolve this encounter over the course of 2 pre-written scenarios. In the first, you and your the older members of your family take chase into the woods in pursuit of a presumed witch that has kidnapped your newborn child. The outcome of this scenario will inform the starting numbers of the second scenario. Back at the farmstead, the remaining goodwives and children take shelter as an armed band of Puritans (and a reverend) from the nearby settlement have come to eradicate the devil's threat spawning from the Wood to save their righteous flock.

An asymmetrical mechanic allowing Witches the use of witchcraft tokens are deployed around the board, they are able to utilize these portals to vanish and reappear, simmulating phantom movement. Puritans have the opportunity to "investigate" these signs of witchcraft and remove them from play preventing this advantage. Once the tokens are gone the witches are stuck in whatever state they find themselves (permanently becoming a rabbit is a possiblility...) Meanwhile defenseless settlers are at risk of possession, influence, or death so ensure your matchlock-toting Puritans prevent the loss of their own.

Terrain rules are based on the Puritan's views on community and farming versus the untamed wilds of the woodlands. Witches gain advantage in the woods while the Puritans gain advantage on their cropfields and in their buildings. Trees are to be individually based in order to better recreate the disorder and densities of New England frontier lands.

But beware of the devil's ambush-like deployment in the form of the billy-goat, Black Bill...
categories: Book, Horror, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Slaughterball: Bonus Cards
description:
This deck of 60 cards includes:

 • 20 coach cards: An optional set of cards that grant each coach a special ability. Draw another card each turn, blind the refs, close the goal doors, nano-medbots, Lost Momentum immunity, and more!

 • 10 blank cards: So you can create your own strategy cards.

 • 40 collector cards: Showcasing famous Slaughterballers and their achievements.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Variable Player Powers

name: Krimi al Dente: Bunte 90er – Tödliche Geschmacksverirrung
description:
Julia Pfeffer, inventor of a weight-loss drink, has been murdered. The murderer is among you - can you find out who did it?

Players gather for a dinner party. Over the course of several 30 minute rounds, they will have to find the player who is lying. In each round, new information becomes available, until at last, the truth comes to light (or not). Aside from trying to find the murderer, each player has side tasks to fulfill that decide their final score.

name: France Rails
description:
France Rails is the next incarnation that uses the same Turn Order mechanism found in the previous games in this series, namely Preußische Ostbahn, then German Railways and now Prussian Rails by Rio Grande.

French Rails provides 8 railroads, each having a special ability or limitation, based upon the history of that railroad. The names of the railroads are simply the name of the city where they begin the game. This is due to the ever shifting mergers, bankruptcies and takeovers found in the history. No single railroad kept the same name from beginning to end!

The game accommodates 3-5 players and takes less than an hour for experienced players. When all railroads have connected to at least two other railroads, or that is determined to be impossible, the game is over. The player with the most cash wins, as stocks are just tools to generate money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Turn Order: Random, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Wipe 'em Out!
description:
In this fast-paced game, players are adventurers entering a cave full of monsters, using artifacts and magic to defeat as many of them as possible.

Each round, each player chooses an artifact to use, and can take turns playing magics to improve their artifacts or make their opponents' artifacts worse. At the end of the round, the player with the best artifact wins the monster currently in the cave, and each player chooses to complete their hand of cards or change their hand of cards completely.

A new monster is revealed and a number of rounds dependent on the number of players are held.

At the end of the game, each type of monster scores in a different way and whoever has the most points wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: RAW: the card game
description:
Zombies, vampires, skeletons, ghosts and magic so black noone unleashed it for 3000 years.
RAW is a quick, rough battle game for 2-6 necromancers. It's full of undead monsters, terrifying magic and vicious traps. The goal is to bite through opponent's defenses and turn the enemy necromancer into dust.

Featuring 4 undead races - zombies, skeletons, vampires and ghosts, each with unique way resilience. Playes build and army to defend their lair and to attack and loot the lairs of other players, all from a single common deck of cards.

Cards are (un)balanced in a way that brings hilarious twists in each game and their combinations give way to unexpected stories.

—description from the designer

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M4A3E2 Sherman Jumbo Expansion
description:
The American M4A3E2 Sherman Jumbo is the big-boned brother of the classic Sherman, with 2 Survivability making this a tough target to damage.

Turbocharger and the Ford GAA Engine help the Jumbo position, while the 76mm Gun M1A1 makes it pack a little more punch.

Contains a tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalized to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Achilles
description:
The British Achilles takes the flexibility of the American M10 Wolverine and throws a bigger gun into the mix to increase the lethality! Marcus Quince with Situational Awareness and Improved Aiming quickly improve the Achilles' Initiative to make a truly scary Tank Destroyer.

Includes a tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalized to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – Loza's M4-A2 Sherman
description:
Loza's M4-A2 Sherman is the Soviet take on the classic American Sherman, and has unique differences including Mobility 3 and 6 Hit Points, giving this Medium Tank the edge above the rest. Pair this Smooth Ride and Ivan Revinskiy to make any hit deadly.

Includes a tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalized to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Free at Last: Leaders and Coalitions
description: Contains redesigned leader counters, additional leaders, corrected replacement cards and a new set of rules for solitaire play.

name: Ovoo
description:
You are in the Gobi Desert, in Mongolia. Take the stones from the Ovoo, these stone embankments erected in the Mongolian shamanic culture in order to communicate with the deities of the mountains.

Use strategy to place them wisely. Build the tallest cairn to claim victory!

—description from the publisher

name: Mare Nostrum: Empires – Epic Scenario
description:
Alternate Victory Rules

A player must complete two Victory Conditions in order to win the game.

When a player achieves their first Victory Condition, they place one of their Control Markers on the matching Victory Condition on the back of this card.

The first player to achieve their second Victory Condition immediately wins the game.

Once a player achieves a Victory Condition, they do not loose it if they no longer meet the Victory Condition requirements later in the game.

name: Boss Monster: 10th Anniversary New Cards pack
description: This card pack includes the 18 all new cards added to the Boss Monster 10th Anniversary edition of Boss Monster: Master of the Dungeon (the first Boss Monster game). These cards are NOT needed if you've already purchase or received the 10th Anniversary ed.

name: The Astronaut Group
description:
In this rummy variant, players are astronaut recruiters trying to gather groups of similar astronauts for NASA. There are 10 sets of 12 astronauts represented by a unique color and symbol, each with a different theme. The cards are individually illustrated with the astronauts represented in a whimsical fashion (as the astronauts are also arts and crafts enthusiasts). There is also a set of 10 wild cards and a set of 10 cards with 2 symbols each.

Each player starts with a hand of three cards. On your turn, you draw a card from the deck or discard pile and either play a card to a group or discard a card. The first card of a group cannot be a wild or dual symbol card. Afterwards, card symbols must match. Players may not have more than three active groups, and a group may have no more than five astronauts. Five card groups are immediately set aside for later scoring. A player may otherwise forgo their turn in order to set aside an incomplete group. Once the deck is empty, players get one last turn and the game ends.

The winner is the person with the highest score. All groups are scored, both in play and out of play. Single card groups score nothing. 2-4 card groups score 2-4 points respectively. A five card "astronaut group" scores 10 points.

name: Randognon
description:
Randognon is a hiking game, in two modes:

Trail: finish the hiking in first position
Survival: finish the hiking alive!


In the trail mode, you have a backpack with things to eat, drink, sleep and wear from the weather! You have to anticipate!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 心霊衰弱 (Shinreisuijyaku)
description:
Curse Fear is an aggressive version of memory game inspired by Japanese supernatural -SHINREI- themes. Similar to traditional memory games, players flip over two cards from a face-down arrangement and collect pairs with matching numbers and suits. However, unlike traditional memory games, players use the collected cards to inflict curses upon each other on the central game board. The player who accumulates the most curses either by obtaining four curses or at the end of the game loses.

—description from the publisher

name: Merchants of Magick: Dangerous Business
description:
The townsfolk are restless and fearful of diabolical creatures threatening the realm. Which means demand for enchanted items, weapons, and armor is at an all time high in the kingdom! A perfect time for a shrewd Merchant to open up a shop and profit off of the frightened townsfolk and mighty warriors arriving to fend off monsters at the Queen’s behest.

Dangerous Business is the first expansion to Merchants of Magick, the acclaimed crunchy roll and write game of magical item crafting set in the fantasy world of Set a Watch. Dangerous Business includes a variety of new expansion modules to add new elements to the game. Choose from a variety of new Sponsored Adventurers and equip them to slay monsters or square off against a new Traveling Merchant solo mode.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bingo, Contracts, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Castaways
description:
Castaways is a party game that is inspired by the popular reality TV show 'Survivor' and combines social deduction, card drafting mechanics and superior social skills as players attempt to take their secret castaway character to the end and win the title of The Ultimate Castaway.

The arrival of Daily Mail and Camp Life cards causes uncertainty and chaos in camp (and around the table) as teams deliberate how to best play the hand dealt to them.

And then off to the Challenges we go! The challenges are totally random, and the choice of line-up (and who to sit out) can determine the final outcome.

The losing team will make their way to the Outcast Tribunal where one Castaway will be voted out of the game.

Not so fast! Tribunal Twist cards and personal advantages are real, and when played will induce a crazy tribunal experience.

Once down to 10 castaways the merge is on the horizon, bringing with it a shift in the game. At this stage, players now need to look out for themselves. And be confronted with the big question - stay true to your alliance or backstab and blindside?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Alliances, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Negotiation, Trading

name: Idols Clash
description:
Idols Clash is a strategic card game that combines building and deduction elements with the pleasure of collecting fanart illustrations inspired by the K-Pop imaginary.
The game is designed for 2-4 players for a duration of 30 minutes and is suitable for an audience over 14 as it tackles the severe and extremely important issues of mental health, burn out and exploitation of competition among young people in the K-Pop Industry. The game comes with trigger warnings about these topics.
It ranks among statistical games as the element of luck affects some actions (such as direct clashes between players that occur through the roll of dice and random distribution of cards). It is rebalanced through the adaptation of game strategies based on the placement of players on the board game and the goals to reach.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Quick 6 V Scenario Pack
description:
Designed for the participants of the 2022 West Coast Rumble, these six scenarios are designed for minimum set up time, resulting in maximum playing time.

Q26 – Encounter at Le Valtru, 16 June 1944: The 2.SS-Panzerdivision Das Reich was forced to delay its counterattack on the British penetration west of Caen in order to deal with the British 49th Division’s advance south from Rauray. This delay allowed the 9th Cameronians to occupy Grainville and the 7th Seaforth Highlanders to advance to the hamlet of le Valtru in effort to secure the right flank of the now named “Scottish Corridor”. Before the Seaforths could reach le Valtru, they were hit by Kampfgrüppe Weidinger of 2.SS-Panzerdivision Das Reich.

Game Length: 5½ Turns, Board: p, Estimated Playing Time: 3 hours 21 minutes

Q26 – Holzthum Hold Out, 16 December 1944: For the opening phase of Unternehmen Herbstnebel (Operation Autumn Mist), Oberst Heinz Kokott’s 26.Volksgrenadierdivision had one of the toughest tasks in that it had to clear the roads west of Our River for the panzers of the 2. and the 116.Panzer Divisionen. Crossing the Our in rubber boats at 03:00 hours and infiltrating their way past the American outposts, Oberstleutnant Kaufmann’s Füsilier Regiment 39 had reached Holzthum at 06:00 hours before anyone in the US 28th Infantry Division sector was even aware an attack was in progress.

Game Length: 5½ Turns, Board: 12, Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 28 minutes

Q27 – Stand at Sterlin's Castle, 8 December 1943: By 0600 hours, the 1st Canadian Infantry Brigade had crossed the Moro River and established a bridgehead; supported by engineers and armour, the Canadians then launched attacks on San Leonardo. The Germans retreated and San Leonardo was at last secured, but counterattacks directed at the fragile bridgehead held by the hard-pressed Canadians were the order of the day.

Game Length: 5½ Turns, Board: 9, Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 4 minutes

Q28 – Going in Light, 9 June 1944: The immediate objective for the newly landed US 2nd Infantry Division was the village of Trévières, located just south of the Aure River. The plan of attack was for the 38th Infantry Regiment to strike directly at Trévières from the north and west, while the 9th Infantry Regiment would outflank Trévières by seizing Rubercy to the southeast - thus isolating the German position. It was no accident the Germans had chosen the tiny farm of Haute Hameau to make a stand against the approaching 9th Infantry. The old Norman farm with its stone wall courtyard formed an ideal defensive position, commanding the neighbouring country lanes running south in the direction of Rubercy.

Game Length: 5½ Turns, Board: 43, Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 48 minutes

Q29 – Como Ridge, 22 July 1945: In late 1944, the Australian Army had assumed responsibility for Allied operations on Bougainville, replacing US troops who were subsequently redeployed to the Philippines. Following the failed landing by the Australians at Porton Plantation, the commander of the Australian II Corps, Lieutenant-General Stanley Savige, decided to focus the main effort of the Australian campaign upon driving south towards the Japanese garrison at Buin, where the bulk of the Japanese forces were holding out.

Game Length: 5½, Board: 36, Estimated Playing Time: 3 hours 7 minutes

Q30 – The Tombe Diversion, 1 July 1943: The initial plan for the capture of Viru Harbour called for a diversionary attack by Lieutenant Brown’s platoon on the small village of Tombe located on the east side of the harbour while the main body, under Lieutenant-Colonel Currin, would then attack the village of Tetemara on the west side of the harbour.

Game Length: 5½ Turns, Board: o, Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 24 minutes

name: Monsters Deck 3
description:
Monsters Deck is a collection of 24 tarot-sized cards, each with a monster for Four Against Darkness.
You may use these whenever you would roll on a table to determine which Vermin, Minion, Boss or Weird Monster you encounter. Instead of rolling, draw a card from the appropriate deck, play it and then reshuffle it into the deck. You can combine monsters decks together, expanding the variation of encounters with every new set released.

name: Trilaterum
description:
Trilaterum is a fast-paced tabletop miniatures game, set in a unique and expanding universe where emerging factions battle for survival on the edge of the universe!
Highlights include

– integrated turns

– D8 system

– Company Level Army Combat

– a unique firing sequence that rewards intestinal fortitude

– Stands take damage markers that will accumulate over time, causing decreased readiness and eventual loss of stands

– Full army creation system to allow any figures to be used with the system
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Push Your Luck, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Monsters Deck 4
description:
Monsters Deck is a collection of 24 tarot-sized cards, each with a monster for Four Against Darkness.

You may use these whenever you would roll on a table to determine which Vermin, Minion, Boss or Weird Monster you encounter. Instead of rolling, draw a card from the appropriate deck, play it and then reshuffle it into the deck. You can combine monsters decks together, expanding the variation of encounters with every new set released.

name: Indiana Jones and the Hidden Treasure of Pyramid
description:
Indiana Jones and his female partner team up to explore a dangerous pyramid deep in the jungle rumored to contain a powerful, magic jewel from an ancient civilization. They will need to use their wits, gear, and a bit of luck to find the jewel and escape with their lives!

This game is either for 2-4 players competing against each other or 4-8 players competing as 2-player teams (with one player as Indy and the other as the Heroine). Each team moves, fights, and explores as one, with the Indy and Heroine players taking turns playing Explore cards to move their player pawn through the pyramid's corridors and rooms on the game map. Each Heroine provides either a bonus or a penalty to movement or combat (presumably, some are adept and helpful partners, like Marion Ravenwood, and some are actively working against Indy, like Elsa Schneider). Indy can land on another team's pawn to fight that other team and force them to trade Heroines. In a team game, that means that the Heroine players have to trade positions and now have different partners.

Each team's ability to move and fight is based on the Indy character's power level, a value between 3 and 6 representing Indy's health. Power may be lost due to damage from a trap or losing a fight and may be gained by finding medicine throughout the pyramid. If Indy's power level falls below 3, the team loses all their equipment and reset their pawn back to the start of the current floor they are on.

The players explore rooms in the pyramid, discovering traps and monsters to fight. Combat is handled by rolling one six-sided die and adding the result to Indy's current power level plus any other bonus or penalty. If the total exceeds the monster's power, the player wins and may take the equipment listed on the monster card (medicine, key to open a locked door, whip or pistol to aid in combat, or a mine car to move faster). The treasure room that is every player's goal is found on the 3rd floor of the pyramid. The first player team to reach this room and win a fight against a monster with a power level of 11 takes the jewel and escapes the pyramid as victor.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Tomorrow: Promo Pack 2
description: Second promo pack, distributed by the publisher at conventions. It contains 4 cards (2 Dragonflies and 2 Government) to add to the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Take That

name: Realms & Royals
description:
In this game each player takes control over their own realm, represented by standard playing cards.

Realms & Royals is a simple racing/deck-building game where players try to expand cards on their hand in order to obtain the most valuable royal cards. Each suit represents distinct layer of the medieval society, and requires different combination of the cards in order to get it.

When it's your turn, you may do one of three actions:


buy a card - receive the social strata card from the common market
get a random card - play some cards with value at least 5 points to receive the card from the deck
get a royal card - play the card of matching suit and required value to receive the royal card
reset your deck - take all the played cards back to your hand


The game lasts until the deck empties or one of the players reaches 40 points by getting the right royal cards. Then the final scoring oncomes: each player gets points for their royals, but only the player with the highest total score of each suit in their deck gets the points.

There are multiple paths to victory. Will you focus on your people and build an everlasting empire, or you rather focus on your dynasty and introduce the most memorable leaders in history?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Market, Push Your Luck, Variable Set-up

name: Nastrond
description:
In this fast-playing riff on Talisman, you play valkyries fighting your way from Midgard through Niflheim to Hvergelmir to hold back the dragon Nidhogg from starting Ragnarok.

Defeat enemies by beating their strength with a roll of the dice, but score more points by using fewer dice to do so. Enlist the souls of dead warriors from Valhalla to gain dice manipulation abilities, but too many warriors in your band will penalize your score.

Defeated cards in the board's grid give you bonus dice against other cards in their row and column, so plan ahead and choose your path to the center carefully.

name: Ultimate Aquarium
description:
Ultimate Aquarium is a competitive tile placement game where players compete for the highest score by strategically choosing where and what to place in their aquarium.

You're trying to build a beautiful aquarium. Various fish, coral, decorations and other critters and objects can be drafted from the aquarium store into your tank. Each one provides points based on the type and position of other cards in your aquarium. Try to get a synergistic selection over 8 or 9 turns and build the Ultimate Aquarium.

—description from the publisher

name: Reavers of Midgard: The Card Game
description:
Reavers of Midgard: The Card Game will pit Viking Captains against one another as they travel to far off lands in search of spoils and a skilled crew.

Each player will receive a hand of cards that is identical, and on these cards are the locations where you can travel. Before each round, valuable spoils will be placed on each destination, and each player will think carefully about where they want to go, and then select that card from their hand, placing it face down on the table.

The players will reveal their cards at the same time. If you are lucky enough to travel to a spot where no one else is present, all of the available spoils will be yours to claim. However, if one or more Viking Lords go to the same destination, the players will have to negotiate with each other to come up with a fair distribution of the items available. If they are unable to agree, the spoils will remain, and they will all suffer the consequences.

At the end of the game, players will total up the points from their collected spoils, and whoever has scored the most will be crowned the Viking Jarl!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Negotiation, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Books of Time: Pele Promo Card
description: One additional Chronicle page for Books of Time. Add to the other Chronicle pages before selecting pages for your game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pottsberg
description:
Solo card game (54 cards) exploring an old village while searching for lost postcards to add to your collection.

Cards are drawn and placed in slots according to a layout plan. Find and keep POSTCARDS when your SELF card is on a TERRAIN card whose attributes match that POSTCARD. CAR cards allow you to travel to any TERRAIN, growing your chances to collect POSTCARDS.

SIDEKICK cards and TRUNK slots allow you to store extra items like REPAIR KITS and WEAPONS to help out if you encounter NEMESIS or CAR DAMAGE cards, and FLEA MARKETS can give you an end game bonus for extra cards.
When there are no more draw cards, the game is over. If an attribute appears in all 7 POSTCARD slots, you win. Postcards have attributes and values which add up to different final accomplishment designations.

—description from the designer

name: Le Fléau de Martina
description:
The Arab Conquest of the Levant A.D. 636-656.
Le Fléau de Martina comes with two scenarios and one campaign from the battle of Yarmouk in 636 to the assassination of the third calife in 656.

After several defeats against the armies of the Arab Caliphate, the old Byzantine emperor Heraclius presides over an empire practically cut in two. Far from lamenting, the emperor is determined to continue the fight at any price. Tensions are at their height because in addition to the military struggle, Heraclius' health and war efforts make the question of his succession more important than ever. Empress Martina is his second wife and the mother of nine of his eleven children. Two siblings will only complicate the succession and thereby compromise the resistance against the Arabs.
But despite early Arab victories, Syria is not yet subdued and casualties from fighting and epidemics are high on both sides. Each side stands to lose if they are not careful. While Byzantine armies rally in Asia Minor and Egypt, Arab troops are bogged down in sieges of cities and ports across Syria.
Will the Byzantines be able to regroup and reverse the situation with a military coup. Will the Arabs be able to parry the attack and complete the conquest of the Levant?
This game sees two armies confronting each other as they seek to reorganize their forces. The Byzantine player must retake Syria and, at the same time, avoid the loss of Egypt and Asia Minor while managing a succession crisis.
The Arab player must secure the Syrian terminus of the trade route to Mecca but also seize the Egyptian breadbasket and perhaps even Constantinople.

Units: 1 counter= from a few hundred to 2000 men
Fleets: 1 counter= circa 100 ships
Map: around 50km per hex
Turn: One year
Difficulty level: 6/9

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points

name: Make It To Monday
description:
Make It To Monday is a board game made by gays, for gays and the people who love them. The game blends chance, strategy and "a little bit of shade" for gameplay that feels familiar and fresh at the same time, with distinctive gay themes.

Players must work their way from Friday night to Monday morning. At each turn, players draw a Weekend card to earn Fun points. Weekend cards come in 4 categories: Sex, Party Favors, Travel and Breeders (straight people, for the uninitiated). Players are dealt Choices cards - and more can be picked up along the way - these are used at the end of a players turn to increase their own Fun points or cut down someone else's Fun.

The game ends when the first player Makes It To Monday, but the winner is determined by tallying up the Fun points, including any bonuses or deductions from the Choices cards. The player with the most Fun points wins, because after all, the weekend isn't about who survives, but who has the most fun!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Ladder Climbing, Multi-Use Cards, Race, Take That

name: Monsters Deck 5
description:
Monsters Deck is a collection of 24 tarot-sized cards, each with a monster for Four Against Darkness.
You may use these whenever you would roll on a table to determine which Vermin, Minion, Boss or Weird Monster you encounter. Instead of rolling, draw a card from the appropriate deck, play it and then reshuffle it into the deck. You can combine monsters decks together, expanding the variation of encounters with every new set released.

name: Malvinas 1982
description:
Falklands-Malvinas.1982 Operacional is a game for 2 players that simulates the air-naval campaign during the war for the Falklands-Malvinas islands in 1982 between Argentina and Great Britain.

The game runs within a hexagonal board (50 kms/hex), showing from an operational perspective the combat actions between ships and aircraft of both sides.

Its mechanics are realistic and very close to the tactical, trying to represent all decision levels. You must determine what type of units to attack, with what, and what weapons to do so or to defend yourself. The mechanics used make it possible to recreate all types of combat and operations (air-to-air, air-to-surface, anti-submarine warfare, detection, bombing...), even giving the British player the chance to land on the Islands.

The use of random dice is relegated to the last phase of the player's decision, each threat in the game has its counterpart for its neutralization, that is where the player must decide who, how and with what... Detection in this game, it is the main mechanic, without knowing where your enemy is, you will hardly be able to damage him.

A replayable game where either side can win through different levels of victory, which does not leave the Argentine player as a mere spectator.

Game will be published in english/spanish language.

name: 51. Stan: Master Set – Serwerownia Molocha
description:
Why hack the machines when you can go straight to the saurce? Hack the Moloch Server Room to slow down the onslaught of the Moloch's forces.

Set contains:

1 tile
1 instruction sheet

name: 18Norway
description:
18Norway is an 18XX game based on Francis Tresham’s 1829, and follows the development of the Norwegian railroad from 1854 onward. You will be dealing with harsh weather and difficult terrain as you build your track across hills and mountains and around the fjords along the jagged North Sea coast line. All the while, companies have to take the inevitable nationalization into account.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Home Team Heroes
description:
Home Team Heroes – the ultimate soccer-themed collectible card game!

Step onto the field of strategy and excitement as you strategically deploy Player Cards in attack and defense patterns. Unleash the thrill with Event and Referee Cards, showcasing the highs and lows of every match – Yellow and Red Cards, freekicks, and penalties. Each game is a unique spectacle, mirroring the unpredictability of real football. How many goals can you score?

Why choose Home Team Heroes?

Share the Fun: It's not just a game; it's an experience. Play a Quick Match with a friend, even if they're new to card or board games, using a single shared deck. You don't need to know anything about soccer to play and enjoy this game. Home Team Heroes is the perfect way to spend quality time!

Easy to Learn, Impossible to Master: Dive into the game in just 2 minutes, but be prepared for the challenge of a lifetime on your journey to becoming a true champion!

Unleash Your Competitive Spirit: Engage in heart-pounding matches where every turn is a pivotal moment. Meaningful decisions await at every move, making deck fine-tuning a true art form.

Collect and Conquer: Build your dream team by collecting your favorite players or the entire series, including special foiled cards. Every card is a piece of the soccer magic!

Level up your gaming experience with Home Team Heroes – where football meets strategy, and every match is a chance to make history! Are you ready to kick off your adventure?

name: Eboulis
description:
Éboulis is a throwing card game combining skill and strategy.

The goal of Éboulis is to get to the mine's treasure. To fulfill this, players need to throw "tunnel" cards between their own mine entrances and the mine's treasure (which is placed in the middle of the table). Be aware of your opponents: they can throw "scree" cards in your tunnel to prevent you to win the treasure (and the game)!

name: Wild Realms: Huacaya Alpaca
description: A legendary animal that allows all players to swap up to two animals from one of their locked realms with animals from unlocked realms, alliance, or hand. Or it allows all players to pull one realm type from their discard pill and add them to their hand.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Destined Day Promo Cards
description:
A promo set consisting of a Destined Day trait and and a ...'s Gift strange resource card. This is a customizable strange resource with variable rules. A Sticker sheets allows for the cusomization.

This promo set was included with the Kingdom Death Mystery Birthday Gift, which also contained a miniature that is not part of the game.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Globinsnarfer Promo Card
description:
This is a Gear promo card that was included with the Gunborg miniature, which itself is not part of the game.

Globinsnarfer (Unique, Cursed, Sentient, Bloodeater) - While you have 10+ bleeding tokens, this weapon gains Devastating 1.

The weapon has the Bloodeater trait, which is defined on an included Glossary card:

Demolish: A gear special rule. If you are adjacent to another survivor, you may spend [activation] to kill them. Transfer their bleeding tokens to you and it takes an additional 5 bleeding tokens to kill you this showdown.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Winteracing: Courchevel Méribel 2023
description:
Take the start at the alpine world ski Championships, Downhill, Super G, Giant, or Slalom.
Draw cards that will move you down the ski trail. But be careful not to get to the gates too hastily, our you'll have to stop to go through them. The goal is to be the first to cross the finish line!

name: Small Railroad Empires: Loyal Partner Promo
description:
Promo Achievement Card added by the publisher as token of appreciation to backers of the Freight on Board Kickstarter campaign.

Loyal Partner: I have constructed a route that connects three factories from the Calias Company.

name: Clash of Decks: Initiation Grimoire
description:
This is a 30-page booklet containing 10 game situations to solve based around the cards contained in the Initiation Pack (formerly known as the Starter Kit). For each scenario, you are shown what cards you have access to and the layout of your opponent's board. From there, you must figure out how to defeat the opposing "player" with the limited resource pool provided. If you get stuck, you can also find the solutions to each challenge in the back of the booklet.

While helpful, you don't actually need to own the Initiation Pack or any of the Clash of Decks stand-alone expansions to play and solve the game situations that are contained within this Grimoire. If so inclined, you can also create your own scenarios using an online creation tool found on the Clash of Decks website.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Puzzle
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ultimate Treehouse: Promo Pack
description:
A promotional giveaway pack for Ultimate Treehouse.

This pack includes unique tiles (two styles with two copies of each) that can be added into the store deck of the base game to provide additional options to build during gameplay.

The new tiles are a tent and a mineshaft and are intended to be placed in the lower left and right corners of the player mat.

Both promo tiles have a high VP value of 5 points.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Ferraria
description:
In the heart of the Espinhal Mountain, in the municipality of Penela, the schist village of Ferraria de São João is called so because it is likely that a small iron mine may have existed there. The shepherd’s horn echoed through the vast oak grove in the past, calling the community’s flock. After a day of grazing in the mountains, the goats would return to the village where they spent the night in communal goat pens, now preserved to bear witness to memories of the past. There are no longer wolves in the forest, but the biodiversity is varied and, at night, the village is visited by deer or wild boar. At the same time, the existing flora provides bees with nutritious food to produce high-quality honey.
It’s a beautiful experience to walk through the village streets, observe the architecture of the now-restored schist houses, and try to spot the traditional Maia flowers hanging from the doors in spring.
To protect themselves from fires, the villagers replaced eucalyptus trees with cork oak trees. Under their shade, the goat herds work meticulously as they graze to help prevent fires.
In this game, you experience the dynamic of a lively village, which you are invited to visit on foot or by bike on the mountain biking trails. Players take turns by playing cards with bees, oaks, or boars to collect goats to make collection sets that match the objectives.

—description from the designer

name: Имаджинариум: Прайм-Тайм (Imaginarium: Prime Time)
description: Прайм-Тайм ("Prime time") is an expansion to Imaginarium that illustrates the latest global events and trends.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Ninja Sloths: Custom Guard Card
description: A super-exclusive Custom card made just for your game! You'll get custom cards plus three copies of the card to use in your game or share with friends. Feature your pet, your foe, or yourself! Surprise someone with this special card - it makes a very special cards are only offered through our initial Kickstarter campaign, and never again!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: FLIP TRICK WRITING
description:
FLIP TRICK WRITING is a trick-taking game where a player wins by having the most points. It is a "flip and write" game, where cards are revealed from a standard deck of cards, and the players each draft a card. Drafted cards are either retained for later or consumed to activate a skill (such as the ability to declare a trump suit.)

Then, after each player has selected 13 cards, the players can again consume cards from their hand to activate victory skills (such as declaring a certain bid.)

Afterwards, the players complete in a must-follow trick-taking game with their remaining cards. The game ends after one hand.

name: Katootsie!
description:
Players separate the cards into 2 piles, 'Categories' and 'Letters'. One player (anyone) flips over a category and reads it to everyone. Then she flips over a letter card. The first person to call out something that fits the category and starts with the revealed letter takes the letter, and that counts as one point. 2nd letter is then revealed (for the same category), and again, the first person to call out something that starts with the letter and fits the category takes the letter as a point. Then a new category is revealed, and play continues, playing 2 letters for each (1) category. Play continues until all 52 letter cards are gone. The player that has collected the most letters at the end, wins!

Sometimes, a letter comes up with a category with a category and no one can think of anything. Anyone, at any time, can call "Katootsie!" and start the Katootsie! timer app (a free app you can download for your phone). This starts a 10 second timer. If no one thinks of an answer before the time runs out, the person that called Katootsie! gets the letter. But if someone does think of an answer before the timer runs out, that person wins the letter and also steals one letter from the person that called Katootsie!
Other rules: Q, X and Z can appear anywhere in the word (not just at the beginning), and it's shown on the card for clarity.
If there is a tie, ONLY the people that tied pull a 2nd letter and compete for that, and the winner takes both letters.
Proper nouns are generally allowed unless otherwise indicated.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Questions and Answers

name: Időfutár
description:
Időfutár ("Timerunner") is a young adult radio play that had gone through many adaptations in Hungary. Novel, stage play and board game had been created from it, so it craved for a card game adaptation. A competition was hosted in 2019 to design a card game related to Időfutár, so my colleague Gergely and I submitted our entries: his solution won the special award, mine won first prize.

A company of friends find a seemingly useless, worn-out, old object. The “compass” – as it will be revealed later – leads its user to a hidden treasure. Our story does not continue with treasure hunt but a desperate escape, as mysterious, dark figures in suits appear and start a wild hunt for the tool of fortune.

The Időfutár card game is an asymmetrical game for 2-6 players. Asymmetrical means – in this case – that a player handles the chaser suited enemies, while each of the other players play the role of a seventh grade student, who are the protagonists of our story. One against all. The adults aim to lure the children into a trap and get their hands on the compass. The latter ones, however, have to outmaneuver their chasers by dropping fake clues and creating diversions.
The game keeps up a slight tension throughout the chase for both parties. While the students have limited communication (as the opponent hears everything), trapmaking doesn’t always end up the same way, so sometimes we give away the position of the compass with our desperate fleeing. The player controlling the ‘suited ones’ cannot sit back either, as time is working against them, and it is easy to run out of time if the students play their tricks strategically.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Book, Card Game, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Communication Limits, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Industrollization
description:
Industrollization is a print and play, roll and write game for one to four players. In this game you will deliver goods to factories. The order in which you will place goods is crucial to score the most points. You can deliver goods by train or by truck.
The game lasts six Rounds. Each Round is divided into two phases. First phase is Loading Goods and the Second Phase is Delivering Goods to factories. There are four trains and a truck where players can place their goods. Each train will deliver goods to the specific factory while truck can deliver goods to any factory.

—description from the designer

name: 23 Knives
description:
It's 44 BCE, the pinnacle of the Roman Republic. At the end of Julius Caesar's civil war, he is left holding enormous power. He has the love of many, but for others, there is only fear. This fear leads Caesar's friends and allies to question his intentions. They're stoking a fire of conspiracy, a conspiracy that will end on the Ides of March, with 23 wounds, a republic in ruin, and the birth of an Empire.

In a game of 23 Knives, you take on the role of a Roman citizen with one of three allegiances: a loyalist to Caesar, a liberator of Rome, or an opportunist biding their time. Throughout the game, you travel through Rome, manipulating other citizens and swaying them to your cause.

At the end of the game, if 23 or more knives are in the Curia, Caesar is dead and the liberator most committed to killing Caesar wins. With fewer than 23 knives, the loyalist most dedicated to saving Caesar wins. Opportunists are those who linger, waiting to shift the fate of Caesar at the last moment, and if they do, they win as a team.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Bribery, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Voting

name: The King's Feast
description:
It is time to give your offerings to the King to ensure that you’re in his good books, if he likes what you’ve offered, the King shall duly reward you! However, what you’ve prepared smells so good that you really want to keep some for yourself, be really careful that this is not spotted by the King as he has a really sharp eye! A keen lookout on your fellow players is also important, do not allow them steal the limelight!

The King’s Feast is a card game that’s intuitive and easy to learn. Decide between keeping food for yourself and competing for the rewards of the King. Play the Food cards in the right order to highlight their flavors and receive bonuses!

—description from the publisher

name: One Page REV: Guns in the Summer Wood
description:
One Page REV: Guns in the Summer Wood is a solo roll and write American Revolution wargame. Players act as a colonial militia in upstate New York during the height of summer 1777. Six 6-sided dice are needed to play the game. The militia starts at one end of a map, with terrain generated randomly by dice rolls and drawn onto the map.

As the militia enters each hex, rolls to determine enemy units are made and combat follows. Different types of weapons (rifles, pistols, etc.) are affected by terrain and weather. Victory points are assigned to the player after defeating British units in combat, and British victory points are gained when the militia takes damage. Combat is resolved through dice rolls with the number of rolls depending upon the player's weapons, stamina and morale. Rolls exceeding a certain number count as hits, and the number of hits determines the attack's result.

If the militia accumulates sufficient victory points, it wins immediately. Otherwise the militia continues to an objective hex and if the militia has more victory points than the British, the player wins. Recordkeeping for the game is made on the map page and each game is played on a new page. The book contains a printer-friendly game page as well that can be copied and printed. The player could also use tokens and counters from other games to keep track of the game's progress.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Dice, Wargame

name: Precision Volleyball
description:
Each team has rating on Serve and Rally which must be subtracted respectively opponent's Pressure rating and opponent's Defence Rating.
Once these two ratings have been established, the teams alternate serving and Rally (with d100 roll), as in real volleyball, until one team scores.
Moreover, the game has a quick system for creating the matches of the other teams, if you don't want to play them set by set, but you want a result that is faithful to the real strengths of the national volleyball teams, with only one roll per Set per team (Quick Play System)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Skarby Świętych
description:
Game that brings the figure of the saints closer. It shows them as people who follow God with great commitment and support.

During the game, participants remember the details of the (short) stories they hear, find pictures from cards for large plans, give other players a task or have to associate a saint with an event themselves.

name: Birdie Pro: Fox Run Expansion Course
description:
Disc Golf Destination: Fox Run, Jeffersonville, VT

Fox Run, the sister course to Brewster Ridge at Smugglers’ Notch Resort, was first opened in 2013. Designed by Steve Brinster (2013 USDGC Champion) and Jeff Spring (DGPT CEO), it quickly became revered as one of the most challenging courses on tour.

Fox Run is a fan and player favorite on the Disc Golf Pro Tour. It has hosted three PDGA Majors, including Pro Worlds twice (2018, 2023).

You will need to focus to keep the disc in bounds. Be smart about when to utilize your skills and make sure to save a little for the signature 18th hole.

Do you have the skill, perseverance, and karma to conquer Fox Run?

Components: Two game boards.
Board 1: Holes 1-9
Board 2: Holes 10-18
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Resource to Move, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Tiletum: Tantrum House Character Tiles
description:
Tiletum Tantrum House Character Tiles from Board&Dice available through the Season 9 Of Tantrum House Board Game Media Kickstarter.

Includes three new character tiles to be used with Tiletum.

Changes in Gameplay

You can take the new tiles from the offer and place them on your player board as per normal rules described in the main rulebook.
They can be placed with any other Character tiles in the same building, then you can perform the action depicted in the upper left corner. For all other purposes the placed tile should be treated as if it were the same type as other Characters in the same building.
They cannot be placed in a building with only one room.
There can only be one promo Character tile in a building.




Tiles description

Pay 5 gold to move your marker on King Track to the same position as the first player (place it on top of their marker).
Pay 3 Gold to place a Pillar from your supply onto any Cathedral on the map. There must be an available Pillar space at the chosen Cathedral, and you cannot place the Pillar at a Cathedral that already has one of your Pillars.
Pay 3 Gold to place a House from your supply onto any Town on the map. There must be an available House space in the chosen Town, and you cannot place the House in a Town that already has one of your Houses.

name: Dikarya
description:
Through strategic moves, surround and capture enemy fungi and their mushroom king to dominate the field.

Based on the 2000+ year old Roman game “Latrunculi” however mushroom-themed with added mechanics and pieces.

—description from the publisher

name: Colosseum: Ave Titus
description:
Colosseum: Ave Titus is a new standalone game that is being built from scratch—out of pure love for the classic Colosseum. The original designers will return with the addition of Jonny Pac. Ian O'Toole will do all of the illustrations and graphic design work. The goal of the game is to bring a fresh, highly-thematic, mid-heavy gamers’ game to your table, with a familiar setting of organizing great spectacles in the Colosseum. This time the game will take place in the specific era of Emperor Titus, who celebrated the inauguration of the Colosseum in 80 AD with a series of games and spectacles that lasted for 100 days, often referred to as “The Games of Titus.” These games were a lavish display of entertainment and were intended to demonstrate the wealth, power, and generosity of the emperor. They showcased a diverse array of entertainment and were among the most significant and memorable events in the Colosseum's history.

As a master impresario, you will have the chance to carefully orchestrate all possible means that you have, to organize the most epic and glorious grand spectacles of the Colosseum. Your moment in the sun has come...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Set Collection, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Red Riding Hood
description:
Red Riding Hood is a game of decisions, chances, and luck!

Red Riding Hood defeats the Wolf...who defeats the Wood...who defeats Red Riding Hood...but perhaps to score points and make winning combinations, you'll have to lose some challenges.

A trick-taking game for all ages in which you always take, but sometimes you must take what your opponent wants! Will you use your cards to score points or to form valuable combinations? And will you play to win right away or to benefit from the mysterious "fog" card?

name: Dog Star Shippers
description:
The Sirius System... A system brimming with life and conflict...

Four factions struggle between planets, space stations, and moons for dominance. Stuck in the middle are the independent ship owners, like you - the Dog Star Shippers!

Dog Star Shippers is a one-to-two player game of risky outer space encounters. Earn credits, buy the best ship, discover new bases, and complete dangerous missions. Maximize your Valor to become Top Dog of the Sirius System! Woof.

Start with a small ship and, with skills and a little luck, buy the best ship and discover incredible new bases!

Play against a friend or challenge your abilities against Two Solo Opponents of different difficulties.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Push Your Luck

name: Operation VAULT
description:
Operation VAULT is a dice drafting, dial manipulation board game for 2-4 players, ages 10+, playing time 30-60 min.

The criminal organization "MEDUSA" is planning the biggest
bank heist in history – Operation VAULT.
The crew is set, only member missing is a safecracker.
That's why they have invited the best safecrackers to a competition.
The fastest player to crack 7 combinations will get the job and be the winner of the game.

—description form the designer

name: Spy Code: Operation – Escape Lab Disaster
description:
Spy Code - Operation: Escape Lab Disaster offers another batch of Escape Room Challenges you can play at home. This interactive family game tests your spy skills by challenging your team to work together to solve exciting tasks in order to find the keys and stop the Chemical Lab Timer before time runs out! The game challenges your skill, luck, and talent in your quest to prevent a terrible lab disaster.

—description from the publisher

Spy Code - Operation: Escape Lab Disaster features three challenging puzzles--Challenge 1: Run Through the Test Tube Maze; 2: Master the Atomic Clock Spinner; and 3: Solve 3 Puzzles and Get the Key.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: The Dust: Empire
description:
THE DUST is a rapid duel between two players or two teams.
It happens in a manga-styled world. Players choose their weapons and accessories to use in the battle. These items provide different abilities and styles. Many items have two ways to use. Switching the way at the right time can be vital to win the duel. Some items provide powerful one-time use ability but require dice to be consumed to charge it.
Every turn, players manipulate dice to trigger skills and perform attacks on their opponents. Whoever knocks down his or her opponent first is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: The Dust: Hunt
description:
This is the first stand-alone expansion to The Dust: Empire, a rapid battle game between two players or two teams. This expansion adds new artifact to choose from and tactic cards to the base game.
It happens in a manga-styled world. Players choose their weapons and accessories to use in the battle. Every turn, players manipulate dice to trigger skills and perform attacks on their opponents. Whoever knocks down his or her opponent first is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Cards Against Humanity: Family Edition – School Sucks Pack
description:
You know it, they know it: school sucks. Express your frustration with being forced to sit in a plastic chair and memorize pointless facts for eight hours a day with the all-new School Sucks Pack.

Includes 30 new Family Edition cards like “Paying Dad five dollars to do my homework” and “Being unable to learn, because I am a pine cone.”

—description from the publisher

name: Cards Against Humanity: Family Edition – Smarty Pants Pack
description:
Are you frightened by your child’s formidable intellect? Then your family will love the all-new Smarty Pants Pack.

Features 30 deliciously cerebral new Family Edition cards like “Calculating the volume of a sphere,” “Getting my butt stuck in a black hole,” and “An authentic 250-year-old George Washington turd.”

—description from the publisher

name: Sagrada: Promo – GenCon 2023 Window Pattern Card
description: Foil promo card given out at the Floodgate Games booth during GenCon 2023.

name: Sagrada: Promo 22 – Game Boy Geek 2023 Window Pattern Card
description: A promo window pattern card for Sagrada included in the 2023 Game Boy Geek - Season 11 Kickstarter that features a level 3 and 6 pattern on opposing sides.

name: Kappa, Monkey and Alien
description:
Players become hungry Kappas to win cucumbers. The winner is the player with the highest total score of cucumber cards.

Players complete their order to get cucumber cards by using Effort cards in their hands. In addition to Effort cards, Guts tokens can be played. It makes Effort Point stronger and makes it easier to win the race. Some Cucumber Cards contain a fragment of the legendary Kappa Medal. It will bring you much closer to victory by collecting them well.

name: Purzon: The Travelling Merchant
description:
Purzon is a merchant trying to sell their goods to the kingdom.
Assist them as they travel the realm selling their goods as they go.

Purzon is a tile-laying game where you use unique cards that have paths, and as the building connect, you may place goods. There are also special items cards that allow you to play extra goods that wouldn't normally be playable. The game is won or lost based on the ability to sell all the goods.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Pattern Building, Pieces as Map, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Astro War: Electronic Space Game
description:
Astro War is a programmable electronic game that uses a new technology in electronic switch circuitry. Any location on the game playing surface can be programmed to light the Astro Flash whenever a player "hits" any of the programmed spots. The players themselves determine the electronic switch program for each game.

More than 8 different games can be played with the electronic Astro War game board, and you may wish to make up others of your own later.
—description from the publisher

Included games:

Target Probe for 2 or more players
Space Maze for 1 or more players
Star Field I for 2 or more players
Star Field II
Space Cruiser I for 2 players
Space Cruiser II
Black Hole for 2 players
Sector Chase for 2 players

name: Battlecrest: Noxious – Fan Hero Set
description:
As ancient as the Fellwoods itself, Noxious is a sentient plant evolved to do one thing – kill.

Noxious is an unofficial, fan-made, Battlecrest Hero designed by Jay Yeates. In order to use it, you will need any other Battlecrest Hero Set and a Map Set.


This expansion was included in the ShyCon: Chicago 2023 wallet compilation.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Great Harbor
description:
Build your Roman colony in the Mediterranean, trade and engage with the Great Harbor of Carthage, construct mighty ships to fight the Cilician pirates in this dice drafting, worker placement game for 2-4 players!

In The Great Harbor, you play as a powerful Roman governor of a Mediterranean colony. The game is played over multiple rounds where players will draft dice from a common dice pool, and will use those dice as workers to place them on the tiles of the Great Harbor to play the corresponding actions. In order to place a die on a certain slot, the die must match the color with the slot of the tile. The die power (ranging from 1 to 6) will determine the strength of your action on that tile. Once someone places a die on a slot, that slot is taken and no other dice may be placed there until the end of the round.

The actions that can be played include: gaining resources that are important for shipbuilding, scheduling workers to work on building the ships, increasing your colony capacity to dock ships, sending your ships to patrol the Mediterranean and be on the lookout for pirates, hire special workers and diplomats and more.

The game ends is triggered when a player constructs a certain amount of ships in their fleet, after which all players will take equal amount of turns to end the game. Victory points from the constructed ships, pirates, resources and objectives are then calculated and the player with the most points is the winner of the game and proclaimed the most powerful governor of the Mediterranean!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: The Rolling Investor
description:
In today's increasingly developed Internet, lots of new projects continue to emerge. In the game, you are an aspiring entrepreneur who uses funds to recruit high-tech talents such as art, planning, and technology to complete Internet projects one after another. Of course, starting a business is not easy. Certain talents are often lacking and thus there’s a need to work with other entrepreneurs in the same industry to complete the project.
Do keep in mind that starting any businesses has its risks, and you need to be cautious about capital management, and eventually, earning more money is the ultimate goal!

Players take their turns respectively in a clockwise direction in the game. In your own round, you need to complete the following three stages in order:

Negotiation
Project Profitability
Talent Auction


At the end of the game, the player with the most combined cash and project value wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Negotiation

name: UNO: DragonBall Z
description:
In UNO Dragon Ball Z, the card game gets the characters from the famous Japanese manga and the popular TV series.
It includes a Wild Shenron's Wish Card unique to this deck with specific rules (using card with the famous DragonBall).
The classical wild card having the design of the DragonBall themselves.
As in the classic UNO game, players aim to get rid of all their cards by matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the discard pile.

name: Apenparadijs
description:
Apenparadijs is a sociable family board game for 2 up till 6 players. The age limit is 8 years and older, as there is a significant factor of strategy and thinking ahead in the course of this game. Apenparadijs is a race to the finish between the red colobus. The players take off in an epic battle full of obstacles and ways to oppose their opponents. Players and also speed up their movements by building an banana farm for example. Until the end of the game it will be fierce fight. The length of a round will take about 30 until 45 minutes, however if you have more or less time available, the board is adjustable to your preferences. Extra flexible!

In Apenparadijs the players will journey on an epic adventure through the jungle of Central Africa. As each player attempts to reach the promising paradise (finish) first, they are bound to face serious challenges. There are multiple obstacles along the way and meanwhile your rivals will attempt to sabotage you. All ingredient for a fun and competitive family board game, surrounded by funny looking monkeys.

—description from the designer

name: Diggin' Dino Bones
description:
Get ready to excavate dinosaur bones! Diggin' Dino Bones is a puzzle game that will have you digging for bones and assembling the skeleton of your favorite dinosaurs. You are the paleontologist commissioned to find the bones of a specific dinosaur. Search the excavation site and be the first to find and assemble your Dino bone puzzle to win!

—description from the publisher

name: One Card: A las Chapas
