description:
In One Card: A Las Chapas you will compete to be the fastest by creating three-word sentences with the three letters of each patent, respecting a slogan. Whoever gets 2 victory points will win the game!

Suggested Components:

1 6-sided Dice
4 Chips of the same type for each participant (pieces of paper, legumes, coins, etc).
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Le village de Nathalie
description:
Go on an adventure and discover hidden objects in Le village de Nathalie. Fill in your board with your objects and race back to your starting tile to win the game.


Partez à l'aventure, venez découvrir les objets cachés dans "Le village de Nathalie". Complétez votre carte d'identité pour revenir à la maison de votre personnage préféré, et gagnez la partie!

name: Bouquets
description:
Bouquets combines elements from Set, Rummikub & Dominoes to create an elegant tile-based game of pattern creation to test your visual perception!

Multiple players compete to place all of their tiles from their hand out onto the table the quickest! Not only are you creating, building and designing beautiful little patterns of 3+ tiles, you can also take and rearrange anything that has been already played on the table along with tiles from your hand.

While Bouquets can be enjoyed with multiple friends, it also totally rocks as a solitary experience! Test yourself to get rid of all your tiles quickest OR try and make the most crazy rearrangements and patterns you can imagine!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Electronic, Math, Number, Puzzle

name: Triplettes et Caméléon
description:
Triplettes et Caméléon ("Triplets and Chameleon") are two games designed for a "tridimensional" 96-card deck. Each card represents every combination of 3 properties: rank (1, 2, 3, or 4), symbol (spade, heart, club, or diamond), and colour (red, yellow, green, blue, black, and white).

The game includes rules for the following games:


Caméléon: A trick-taking game for 2-7 players. Players bid the number of card points they must win in tricks with a possible partner. The highest bidder gets to exchange cards with the talon, pick the trump colour, and play with a potential partner.


When playing a card to a trick, a player must follow both colour and symbol; if unable, follow symbol; if unable, follow color; and if unable, may play any card. Highest ranked trump card wins, otherwise highest ranked card that followed the led card's symbol, color, or both wins regardless of how well the card followed the led card. If there's a tie, then the card that followed the led card the best wins the trick (following both is the best, then symbol, then colour). Otherwise, the first card played wins.


Caméléon Croisé: Like Caméléon, except it's a 4-player, fixed-partnership game. Players include their intended trump colour in their bids and there's no talon.



Triplettes: A rummy game for 2-7 players. Players meld their cards by playing triplets, which are 3 cards where 2 out of 3 of their properties are all the same. Players can exchange one card from a played triplet with a card from their hand provided that there's still a valid triplet after the exchange.



Patience du Caméléon. The player deals 20 cards face up and looks for 4 cards whose 3 properties are all different.



Poker Caméléon: Describes new combinations to use to play any poker variant. Each combination consists of only 4 cards; players break ties by replacing the a card in their combination with a fifth card from their hand.



Partisans: A 4-player, fixed-partnership trick-taking game where the player who played the trick-winning card doesn't necessarily take the trick. There are only three colours in the deck, one for each partnership and a neutral one. Players must follow symbol, otherwise play any card. The card that wins the trick is the highest ranked card that followed symbol that's not the neutral colour. The colour of the winning card determines which partnership takes the trick.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Predictive Bid, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Boloa
description:
Boloa is a connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white. There is a sufficient supply of stones and pawns in each of the players' colors.



DefinitionsA party is a pawn along with all pawns one can reach from it through a series of steps onto orthogonally adjacent pawns. Note a party can include pawns of both colors.

A party is said to be smothered if no pawn in it is orthogonally adjacent to an empty point.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform exactly one of these actions:


Place a pawn of your color on an empty point.



Place a stone of your color on an empty point or on a point occupied by a pawn of either color. If the point is occupied by a pawn, move said pawn to an orthogonally adjacent point that is either empty or occupied by another pawn. The latter pawn is removed from the board.


Next, replace all pawns in every smothered party with stones of the same color as the majority of pawns in that party. If a smothered party contains the same number of pawns of each color, replace them with stones of your opponent's color.

At the end of your turn, for any two diagonally adjacent stones of your color there must be another stone of your color adjacent to both.

You win if there is a chain of orthogonally connected stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, the second player will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Connections, Enclosure, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Static Capture, Tile Placement

name: Spy Code: Cut the Wire
description:
Cut The Wire is a fun game of deduction and luck. Players are challenged to defuse the bomb as quickly as possible by testing each of the wires. The aim of the game is to figure out which wire is the special defuse wire. Players take turns reviewing the clues that flash on the device and then having a go at cutting a wire.

A variant of the game turns Cut The Wire up a notch by switching from Classic mode to Timed mode. While playing in timed mode, each player has only 15 seconds to take their turn. If a player doesn’t make a move in time, the device will explode and the player will be eliminated. Players must stay calm, listen to the clues, and defuse the device before it explodes.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Electronic, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deduction, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Lune
description:
LUNE is packaged in a box that includes:

1 x Hard plastic Lune miniature
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and scenic insert
Large matte art print
The Gaiety character card
Character install guide

The settlement struggled, constantly raided by packs of centiwolves, survivors would often return with less than they departed with. Then, a survivor was born dancing to the wistful tune that emanated in strains from her lantern. Despite the struggling means in which she grew, Lune danced free of care. One day, she heard a song in the darkness that compelled her to spring, swaying into the darkness in search of the melody. Impoverished, and downtrodden, the legacy of Lune still persist in the settlement, brightening their otherwise miserable existence.

Lune is a character who's memory has an enduring affect on the settlement.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Cresent Tessen Promo Card
description:
This is a set of two promo cards, the Cresent Tessen Gear card, and the related Fan Specialization Weapon Proficiency Card. They were included with the Sen miniature, which itself is not part of the game.

The Cresent Tessen is a weapon with Deflect 1, Barbed 1, and Unfurled: While you have any deflect tokens, this weapon has +2 speed and -4 strength.

The Fan Specialization gives the following bonus: At the start of your act, you may lose all deflect tokens. At the end of your act, if you are standing and have a fan in your gear grid, you may Deflect 1 for free.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: JinxO
description:
JinxO is a competitive word-association game.
The aim: to score the most points by writing down answers that matches other people in the group. Be careful with your words! If your answer doesn't match anybody in the group, you jinxed it and receive no points. However, if only one other person matches with you, you score more points - it's a JinxO!

name: From the Earth to the Moon
description:
From the Earth to the Moon is a novel by Jules Verne published in 1865, in which some adventurers, after the end of the American Secession War, embark on the adventure of reaching the Moon. To do so, they build an immense cannon and a bullet that will be their means of transport.

This "flip & write" board game for 2 to 6 players represents the essence of the novel. We will have to collect and produce resources, build the cannon, the base on which it rests and the bullet in which the adventurers will travel. In addition, the mechanics of gambling and dueling, concepts that appear repeatedly in the novel, are represented.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Novel-based, Print & Play, Renaissance, Space Exploration

name: Postcard Arnhem
description:
Fast 8-turn game about Operation Market Garden 13-29Sep44, from south of Eindhoven to north of Arnhem. 12 Allied and 15 German pieces.
"Monty Fantasy" 50% possibility the German SS panzer divisions *won't* be there at game-start to confront the paradrops.
Basic 25%-50%-25% combat odds allocation/resolution system.
Weather 50% good after Turn 1.
Hidden city garrison units.
Print off onto A4/8.5x11 for the units and A3/11x17 for the map, for more comfortable gameplay.
As with my other postcard games, anyone is free to print off (unaltered) copies en masse in postcard A6/4x6 or A5/5x8 size and format, to mail/give to family and friends.
Anyone interested in commercially publishing/selling this for profit, I have publication rights - this is not public domain - so check with me about licensing.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Push Your Luck, Sudden Death Ending, Zone of Control

name: Formula 1991
description:
Formula 1991 is a simple Formula 1 racing cardgame/boardgame paying homage to the epic 1991 season, all housed in a deck of 55 cards. The cards in the deck represent parts of the track that you will ride, drivers and strategies that will be applied. A pocket strategy and competition game that provides a lot of fun, and can be even more exciting with the addition of a second deck, allowing more players to participate and the track becomes even bigger.

—description from the designer

Formula 1991 é um cardgame/boardgame simples de corrida de Fórmula 1 em homenagem à épica temporada de 1991, tudo dentro de um baralho com 55 cartas. As cartas do baralho representam partes da pista que você vai montar, pilotos e estratégias que vão ser aplicadas. Um jogo de estratégia e competição de bolso que proporciona muita diversão, e pode ser ainda mais emocionante com a a dição de um segundo baralho, permitindo que mais jogadores participem e a pista se torne ainda maior.

—description from the designer (Portuguese)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Movement Points

name: 激闘！マッカーサー国連軍 (Fierce Fight! MacArthur's Last Battles)
description:
Our first post-WW2 historical simulation game in the "Fierce Fight! Army Group Manstein" series, set during the Korean War of 1950.
Can you win the largest ground battle since the end of the Second World War?

Published in Game Journal #88 with 激闘！ロンメル軍集団 (Fierce Fight! Army Group Rommel)

name: Wild Duo
description:
Wild Duo is a game collection that includes 5 games for 2 players. You can play these games with two players or in larger groups (4/6/8/10), in which case the games are rotated between the groups of two. There is definitely enough variety, as each of the games is a unique gaming experience.

The games are perfectly playable for both children and adult players, as the gaming experience depends entirely on your, respectively, your fellow player's skills. That's why some games can be decided after only 5 minutes, while others last 30 minutes.

Each of the games deals with a different animal species or a specific behavior of this animal species and thus takes the players on a journey into one of 5 worlds. Each of the five rule explanations therefore always includes an exciting, thematic text on the corresponding animal species.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Movement, Tile Placement

name: Hide 'N Find
description: Choose a hiding place. The other players use spy cards to narrow down your location and catch you, but will they run out of chances before it's too late?

name: Slice + Dice & Deliver
description:
Slice, Dice and Deliver is an I Split, You Choose, Roll, Write and Deliver game where players compete on a shared map of New York to draw and move along routes that connect to deliveries for pizzas that collect via splitting a dice pool.

Each round the start player rolls the dice pool, splitting the dice into sets based on the number of players. Each player chooses a set of dice with the start player choosing last. Play then proceeds from the start player, drawing roads, moving your vehicle, delivering pizzas and collecting tips. The player who delivers the most pizzas and collects the most tips is the winner!

Slice, Dice & Deliver was included as a Print and Play reward for the Tantrum House Season 10 Kickstarter.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Drawing, I Cut, You Choose, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Tetralchemia
description:
Tetralchemia is a stand-alone card game for 1-4 players about alchemist girls who roll dice to capture creatures and use them to fight and craft.

The Master Alchemist of the kingdom of Evenfall has called a contest that will decide who her new students will be. Teams of alchemists compete for the title by capturing the souls of strong enemies, summoning them at the right time in battle, and molding them into powerful magics. Will you be the next students?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Hincks Gazette Volume 1: Issues 1-6
description:
Hincksville is quite the perplexing town! As a resident, and avid reader of The Hincks Gazette, you know it’s up to you to unwind the enigmas hidden within this puzzling newspaper.

Each issue of The Hincks Gazette is a self-contained game which includes a front-page article filling you in on the debacle currently turning Hincksville upside down, and a path of connected puzzles which will ultimately help you solve the central conundrum and save* the day! (*wherein “save” can be defined as, but not limited to: successfully troubleshooting your houseplant that won’t stop sassing you, preserving the historical record of astronautical dinosaurs, or uncovering the truth behind the suspiciously helpful robot bellhops).

The Hincks Gazette is best played with 1-2 players, and has a playtime of 60-120 minutes per issue. The rules are simple, just start at START and you'll be on your way. While this game is mostly played offline, players can visit the Hincksville website to solve the mystery or access hints.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Hincks Gazette Volume 1: Issues 7-12
description:
Hincksville is quite the perplexing town! As a resident, and avid reader of The Hincks Gazette, you know it’s up to you to unwind the enigmas hidden within this puzzling newspaper.

Each issue of The Hincks Gazette is a self-contained game which includes a front-page article filling you in on the debacle currently turning Hincksville upside down, and a path of connected puzzles which will ultimately help you solve the central conundrum and save* the day! (*wherein “save” can be defined as, but not limited to: uncovering the secret behind the perfect dancing of rival town Fhincksburg, ascertaining the fate of a favorite town icon, or exposing the nefarious plot of a meddling brother in a robotic contraption).

The Hincks Gazette is best played with 1-2 players, and has a playtime of 60-120 minutes per issue. The rules are simple, just start at START and you'll be on your way. While this game is mostly played offline, players can visit the Hincksville website to solve the mystery or access hints.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: U-Boat Captain: Solitaire WW2 Wargame – Advanced Edition
description:
U-BOAT CAPTAIN, Advanced Edition is a solitaire, tactical-operational level game covering individual German World War 2 U-Boat patrols and combat encounters, 1939-1942.

This edition (44 pages) comes with full rules, optional and advanced rules, eight U-Boat Displays, map, logsheet, 37 counters, and Reference Cards, along with with several historical scenarios and campaign games (of various lengths), extensive examples of play, historically rated U-Boat "aces", and Designer's Notes.
The game has the feel of a miniatures rule set, but with boardgame format. Utilize various historical German U-Boat Types (Type VIIA, VIIB, VIIC, IXA, IXB, IXC, IIB, and IID), each rated for fuel capacity and consumption, number of torpedoes carried, deck gun characteristics, and durability/survivability.
Conduct monthly partrols to various locations (North Atlantic, Norway, the Arctic, Spain, West Africa, etc.) from 1939 through 1942 and try and achieve the most tonnage sunk you can, without being sunk yourself. In each patrol, you wiill sail to your area of operation...
conduct daily patrols/searches...
if you have an encounter, decide when/if to attack (watch out for escorts)...
if you attack, perform the attack sequence and launch torpedoes, or use your deck gun.
When fuel starts to run low, or your boat has accumulated too much damage, you can sail back to port for refit and rest, before beginning your next patrol. Sink at least 100,000 tons of allied shipping in your career and earn for yourself the coveted Knight's Cross.

This Minden Battlegame book (Volume 11) emphasizes high playability combined with authentic historicity to produce a game that plays quickly but retains a strong historical and authentic narrative. As such, U-Boat Captain aims to be your "go to" game for highly playable WW2 submarine action covering the Battle of the Atlantic. The game system often reflects the "risk versus reward" nature of the theater, as it places you in the role of a U-Boat commander, working with your crew to employ good tactics in an effort to sink allied shipping, while avoiding being sunk yourself.

This Advanced Edition retains the game system as published in Panzerschreck #19, and is fully compatible with it, but it adds new U-Boat types and additional optional rules, providing players with a comprehensive game that covers the war years from 1939 through 1942, the pivotal period of the Battle of the Atlantic.

Can you be a successful U-Boat Captain?

—description from the publisher

name: Shell Company: Don't Write Me Off
description:
Welcome to the high-paced world of turtle dating! Your goal is to run the most successful turtle dating company, helping to romance turtles and sweep them right out of their shells. But you’re not the only one vying for their attention; you might find yourself at odds with a rival company as you attempt to woo these reptiles. You better make sure you have just the right gifts to make the best impression. If that doesn’t work, you could always donate the gifts and write off the expenses. After all, it’s not just about the love; it’s also about the money.

Shell Company - Don’t Write Me Off is the first in a series of games Born at PAX®. What does “Born at PAX” mean? We at Lynnvander Studios teamed up with the PAX team to run a panel called Design a Board Game Live. Shell Company - Don’t Write Me Off was conceived by the crowd at PAX East 2022. They came up with the combination of turtle dating sim and tax evasion, and we refined their ideas into the board game you’re holding now!

Shell Company is an auction-style bidding game with a touch of bluffing where players will need to manage their finances in order to acquire gifts. These gifts can either be used to romance potential clients, or they can be donated and used as a tax write-off. Both of these things are important because players are scored based on their weaker area.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Economic, Humor
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Income

name: Power Shark
description:
It's summer! Resorts, beaches and swimming. Sounds like a lot of fun. Of course there are sharks. Just like humans, there are many types of sharks, some powerful and some not. Modern sharks are crossing race barriers and "hunting" in teams. So, which team will capture the most humans and feed their appetites?

Draw cards to roll dice so that you can eat as many humans as possible.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Grave Robbers From Outer Space: Director's Cut!
description:
Resurrected from the dead after 15 years out of print, in Grave Robbers From Outer Space: Director's Cut!, you as a B-Movie director build up your own film with Location, Character, and Prop, and Special Effect cards while defending against Hollywood Creatures.

Differing from the original game, rather than using a single communal deck to draw from, GROS now focuses upon players building their own custom movie decks, CCG style, to play head-to-head. The initial release is made up of ten 16 card Feature Packs, each pack based upon a movie genre — new players and seasoned players alike can simply shuffle two or three together and play. However, those who are savvy can build their own decks from scratch.

Popcorn, the resource system introduced in the Resurrected Edition, has been retained, balanced, and expanded upon. In order to play cards, you need to meet their Popcorn costs by "tipping" cards already played in your movie with a popcorn bucket icon, or discarding cards from your hand.

Finally, Roll the Credits cards - where they still exist for Classic play - have been replaced with the new game-ending mechanic: Plot Twists — secret goals kept face-down on the table that trigger from in-game actions. Bank a Plot Twist to lock in points. Bank the requisite number of Plot Twists and the final scores are tallied.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Multi-Use Cards, Storytelling, Take That
publishers: The Academy of Resurrected Games and Holdings (ARGH)

name: Six Second Scribbles 2
description:
Draw ten pictures in just one minute but can anyone guess what you drew? Played over three rounds this contains 108 brand new category cards, 8 pencils and a pad of drawing paper.

Category cards come in three difficulties - easy, tricky and almost impossible - and they may be combined with those from the original Six Second Scribbles.

name: Sydamerikas hemligheter
description: Sydamerikas Hemligheter is an exciting and unique roll & write game where you embark on a journey throughout South America to discover clues leading to valuable missing objects. In the frantic pursuit, you traverse the terrain using a jeep, boat, and airplane, requiring strategic planning of your route for the best possible outcome. The player who first locates the missing objects and reaches their destination city wins the game!

name: Guarding the Land: The Battle of Fort Griswold, September 6, 1781
description:
Guarding the Land: The Battle for Fort Griswold is a 2-player postcard wargame that covers the British assault on Ft. Griswold on September 6th, 1781 in Connecticut. Benedict Arnold (a Limey who became a Yank and then turned Limey again) was in overall command of British forces and this was his last combat action of the war. He was on the west side of the river busily sacking the town. A British detachment landed on the east side of the river to tackle the American defenders in Ft. Griswold. Historically, the Americans were quickly routed and there were claims of a massacre by the British. Several poems were written later to commemorate the event.

This game requires a deck of regular playing cards and a six-sided die (d6) to play.

name: Mixtape Massacre: Time Warp Expansion
description:
Mixtape Massacre: Time Warp is the brand new expansion in the long running Tales from Tall Oaks 1980's collection. It is also the final entry in this SIX part collection.

In this brand new expansion for Escape from Tall Oaks (with additional components for use with Mixtape Massacre) Time Warp has players working together as you travel back and forth through time in an attempt to clean up, or mess up the Tall Oaks timeline.

During your travels, you'll be chased by new slashers of Tall Oaks past and future. With new survivors and slashers, new modes of play, and multiple possibilities for endings, prepare for the time of your life... or death.

It's Time to head back to Tall Oaks!

—description from the publisher

name: Bayou Bash: Hog Wild
description: This Bayou Bash expansion turns up the chaos with new riders, new game modes, new track elements, and the ability to play with up to 8 players!

name: Epipolae: The Athenian Expedition in Sicily, 415-413 BCE
description:
Sicily, 415 BCE. The Athenian expedition to Sicily was one of the great campaigns of antiquity: a grand adventure to remote shores, featuring a massive fleet and army, that was heavily financed, and benefited from the complete commitment of its citizenry. The goal was the subjugation of all Sicily in order to secure another source of grain. It was simultaneously bold and foolish, and it ended in disaster. But it nearly succeeded.

For the first time, Epipolae brings Volko Ruhnke’s Levy & Campaign Series to the Ancient World, portraying 5th-century BCE Greek military operations with a focus on logistics and maneuver. Players will raise and equip their armies and navies, build alliances through diplomacy, and ravage, siege, and battle their way to victory.

Historically, the Athenians were initially led by three leaders: Nicias, Alcibiades, and Lamachus. Nicias planned to circumnavigate around Sicily, settling a dispute on behalf of an ally, then parading the majestic and renowned Athenian fleet in a show of strength on the return voyage home to Greece. Alcibiades aimed to travel around Sicily conducting diplomacy, building a coalition of city-states, bringing the entire island into Athen’s imperial alliance known as the Delian League. Lamachus was inclined to immediately besiege and capture Syracuse, the strongest city in Sicily, before they could react and adequately prepare.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Final Girl: The Killer from Tomorrow
description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

A cyborg from the future has come back in time on a mission to destroy some kid they call "The Savior". Unfortunately, he's kind of a brat who doesn't want to listen to you. The Mark V Hunter will be your first challenge. You'll have to destroy it before the Mark X Hunter arrives to have any chance of getting through the ordeal alive. Will you rebuild the Mark V to assist you against the Mark X? Or go it alone and try to survive against long odds?

The newly built Sunny Daze Mall is THE place to be! An all-new two-story shopping mall (one of the first of its kind!) with the most popular stores and a food court like none other. It would be a real shame if people got attacked and thrown through the walls of stores or were tossed from the 2nd floor balcony by some uncontrollable killer.

- description by the publisher

name: Tattletail: An Introductory Scenario for Harpoon
description:
Tattletail is an introductory scenario for the Harpoon V game system.

Set in 1991, Standing Naval Force Atlantic (STANAVFORLANT) is being shadowed by a Russian during a time of rising tensions between Russia and NATO. At the start of the scenario, the Russian vessel receives orders to attack.

Form 10s with complete data on all ships and aircraft are provided in the supplement.

-Description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame

name: Special Ops Issue #11
description:
Special Ops #11 has six articles, two ASL scenarios and two ASLSK scenarios, The magazine also features the game Gettysburg.

Featured in-depth articles cover The Third Winter and Strike - Counter Strike. There are also an article on the upcoming Valley of Tears, a new scenario for The Third Winter, Curt Schilling's advice for being a better ASL player, and more

Gettysburg is a quick playing game based on the Napoleonic 20 series of games. It includes a 22" x34" map, 40 1" counters, and 72 5/8" counters.
categories: Civil War, Wargame, World War II

name: Race for Crete
description: Race for Crete - The Aegean Campaign is a board wargame tht recreates the Battle of Crete from May 20, 1941 to May 30, 1942 in 5 turns. It is a two player game. One player as the German side and the other player plays as the Commonwealth side. It is based on Bonsai Games Race for Manial wargame by Yasushi Nakaguro.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Zone of Control

name: Heralds of Defeat
description:
Heralds of Defeat is a Free PnP Tactical level board-wargame that recreates the Civil War inside a Civil War that took place in Madrid during the first week of the last month of the Spanish Civil War.

As Madrid's Republican garrison split in two factions: Socialists and Anarchists seeking a peace agreement with Franco and the Comunists trying to extend the war, this two player game pits them into a bitter battle downtwon Madrid and its close environments.

Propaganda and negotiation are as important as combat itself, as both players need to knit a viable command structure in the middle of chaos; combatants shift back and forth between neutrality and beligerancy and Franco's fifth columnists pop up to wreck further chaos.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civil War, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Great War at Sea: Iron Dogs
description:
Several times a year, when we feel like it, the Golden Journal brings Gold Club members some fun extras for their Avalanche Press games. Our new-model Golden Journal features a “real” booklet, just like a small magazine, and a small set of die-cut, silky-smooth playing pieces.

The first clash of modern dreadnoughts took place at the Battle of Dogger Bank in January 1915, where five British battle cruisers met and defeated three German battle cruisers (plus one large armored cruiser). The battle features heavily in our Great War at Sea: Jutland Second Edition, and we delved into the battle more deeply in the analysis book Jutland: Dogger Bank.

Iron Dogs presents these nine heavy ships (plus three more than could have been present, and are used in the variant scenarios in the Dogger Bank book) on the huge, oversized pieces we’ve used before for battleships in Golden Journal No. 31: Deluxe Bismarck. You don’t need these pieces to play Jutland; they’re the same as the pieces in the game. Just way bigger and way nicer.

name: Battles: Medieval
description:
Battles: Medieval is a 1-2 player Tactical level skirmish board-wargame depicting warfare in medieval England during the 1200s.

The game features 10 different medieval soldier types, 4 types of battles, and 10 battle maps.
Campaigns consist of either 5 or 10 random linked skirmish battles.
For solitaire players, the game offers an advanced AI bot opponent which makes calculated decisions based on its current situation.
Features such as day/night, weather, line of sight, 9 terrain types with movement/cover effects, ranged/melee soldier attacks, and castle sieges are also included.


One D6, one D20, and two D10 dice are required to play. A dry erase pen is also required.
Solitaire or 2 players.
5 minute game setup and breakdown times.
May be played on a small size table.
Adjustable difficulty based on player's skill level.
Total campaign play time is approximately 2.5-5+ hours (depending on campaign length chosen). Individual battles can last between 15-45 minutes.
For game support, please be sure to visit the Black Cat Wargames Facebook group.


With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization.
And with 10 soldier types, 10 battle maps, randomized enemy soldiers setup (single-player), an advanced AI bot opponent (single-player), randomized enemy soldier skill levels (single-player), small table footprint, and quick setup/breakdown times, Battles: Medieval offers an entertaining game for players of all skill levels, plus high replay value.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Chicago Speakeasy / Rush Belt 2112
description:
This is a two map release for Age of Steam 2023. Maps are printed on high quality poster stock front and back.

Chicago Speakeasy (3 to 5 players recommended), map design by Ashley Miller

The Windy City. Speakeasies and bootleggers in the Roaring ‘20s. Your stomping grounds are the famous haunts of the likes of Al Capone and other Chicago gangsters. This ain’t gonna be easy. You will need to build the best underground network to deliver the ‘goods’ and ‘handle’ the Feds to come out on top.
This map is based on 1920s era Chicago speakeasies and the battle with agents from the Bureau of Prohibition to keep them running. Black cubes represent the Bureau agents and may only be delivered to the Bureau of Prohibition. Goods cannot be delivered to Cities containing black cubes. Bribes must be paid for delivering goods through Cities containing black cubes. The special action ‘Bump Off an Agent’ can be used to remove a black cube from the map.

Rush Belt 2112 (3-6 players recommended) , map design by Kevin McCurdy

The year is 2112. Everything has changed. Sea levels have risen. Some say a comet fell from the sky. Followed by tidal waves. Those that survived have built and sheltered in massive dome structures. Finally, the first signs of life above ground are reappearing. Your goal is to explore the abandoned Cities, collect resources, and bring them back to the domes.
This map is based in the near future in the heart of the USA. Domes start with demands for specific colors of cubes providing +1 income. When the demands are met, the domes become a colored City with +1 income for deliveries to the dome. Players must build out from Domes and explore the land afresh after the great disaster and bring back the high demand goods to succeed.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Operation Canuck
description:
From 1943 to the end of World War Two, both the American Office of Strategic Services and the British Special Operations Executive (SOE) materially assisted the anti-Fascist, anti-Nazi Partisan movement in Italy. Teams of agents were inserted behind the Axis lines by submarine or parachute to make contact with the Partisan groups and brigades.

An example of this is Operation Canuck, an SOE mission undertaken near Turin in 1945. Captain Robert “Buck” MacDonald of Nova Scotia, seconded from the Royal Canadian Dragoons to the 2nd British Special Air Service Regiment, arrived with his team in the area of Alba, a large town about 30 km from Turin, in January 1945. They set up their main base in the village of Castino and began to work with local Partisan leaders to train and arm fighters and arrange air drops of supplies and weapons. The climax of the operation was on 26 April 1945 when their combined forces liberated Alba and forced the occupiers to surrender, several days before Allied troops arrived in the area.

Operation CANUCK is a short game that portrays the activities of this mission in an abstract way. The game is intended for solitaire play. During the game the single player (the Partisan) will draw from a deck of ordinary playing cards. The Partisan will deliberately select from the red cards drawn to execute operations representing the efforts of their forces and draw randomly from the black cards to show the Fascist, German and collaborator (collectively, “Axis”) counter-actions.

This is a free print-and-play game. Besides the material downloaded, players need 6 dice and a deck of ordinary playing cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mastering Resistance: Orange Gobi
description:
From 1943 to the end of World War Two, both the American Office of Strategic Services (OSS) and the British Special Operations Executive (SOE) materially assisted the anti-Fascist, anti-Nazi Partisan movement in Italy.

This themed module for the Mastering Resistance game system abstracts and fictionalizes the work of OSS teams in and around Turin during the final months of World War Two in Italy. The Mastering Resistance basic system consists of rules for a single player to practice and play through a series of missions and operations typical of a covert team sent in to organize and direct resistance within a country in conflict, what the US Special Forces call “unconventional warfare”. The general idea is to present this along the lines of the USMC tactical vignettes book Mastering Tactics, via the popular genre of simple solitaire interactive “book wargames”.

This is a free, print-and-play solitaire wargame (with the possibility for 2 players). Besides the downloaded material for the game, players need 8-10 dice, 1 deck of ordinary playing cards (2 decks if playing the 2 or 3-player experimental versions) and 3 containers for markers.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chit-Pull System, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Wyrdhollow – Paths of Prophecy Rivals Deck
description:
In the arcane caverns of the Wyrdhollow, cosmic omens and dire portents abound. Those with the wit to interpret these signs can avert the vicissitudes of cruel fate and lead their followers to fortune untold. Such warbands follow strange auguries and subterranean constellations that point them to places of power, lost relics, and objects that can shape the very future. Will you walk the Paths of Prophecy to a glittering destiny, or be cursed to strife and obscurity?

Get stuck into Warhammer Underworlds or mix up your game with the complete Paths of Prophecy Rivals deck, usable by any warband – including those from past seasons. These cards can be used as a standalone deck in Rivals games, mixed with a warband's unique cards for Nemesis games, or used to build a deck from the ground up in Relic games. This deck doesn’t include any spells, so warbands from any season can put it to good use.

Each card is brand new to the game, focused on seizing and holding specific objectives according to their prophetic significance. Warbands with lots of models which look to control the board, such as Skabbik's Plaguepack and Grinkrak's Looncourt, will find Paths of Prophecy particularly suited to their play style.

This deck contains a 32-card universal Rivals deck consisting of:

12x objective cards
10x gambit cards
10x upgrade cards
1x background card that includes a deck list of the Paths of Prophecy cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Fish or Chips
description: Gather your family members and friends around and brace yourself for a fish ‘N’ chip-tastic ancient adventure as you push your luck, encounter absurdly fun surprises, and risk it all in your quests to save chips from this cone-turned-castle dish!

name: Gettysburg:  Will Lee Turn?  Lee Has Turned!
description:
Both (where) Will Lee Turn? strategic and Lee Has Turned! operational-tactical games at division combat unit level for the South and corps for the Union overall.
Fast and simple. Can be solitaire at the strategic level. Different maps for different scales, including a specific one for the Battle of Gettysburg, if Lee turns to it as historically.
Hidden units - only for South robot in the solitaire strategic game - both, stand-ups for the 2-player game.
Union: 7 3-factor infantry corps and 3 0-1 cavalry divisions.
South: 9 2-factor infantry divisions and 1 1-3 Stuart cavalry corps and Lee himself with the supply train.
Simple 25%-50%-25% combat odds/resolution system.
Point-to-point movement.
Southern objectives: Philadelphia and/or Baltimore and/or even Washington DC which would end game immediately.'

—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Bluffing, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Minimap Resolution, Multiple Maps, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Kilt'N'Strong: Game of Clan's
description:
In this card game you have to collect event cards for all four disciplines and have at least a record in one of them and no fail to win. Be aware that the other players could steal your cards. The gameplay is as follows: Every player starts with 3 cards and can do one of the following before drawing a new card:

play a card on his own or (if it has negative impact) on another player's clan
play an action card or
discard a card.


—user summary

Immerse yourself in the world of the Scottish Highland Games and compete in the Kilt'N'Strong against the best from across the country. Under the motto "Heavier - Higher - Further", you must be the first to achieve a record and a valid attempt in all events.

The traditional challenges of the Caber Toss, Stone Press, Farmers Walk and Weight over Bar await you.

But be careful when chasing records - the strongest in the land will do anything to beat you. What seems like a sure victory can also be snatched from you at the last second.

—description from the publisher

name: Dragon Eclipse: Untamed Arena
description: This expansion doubles all Mystling action cards, allowing for more deckbuilding options as well as adding new Arenas. It enables arena PvP mode so that you can play epic 2vs2 or 1vs1vs1 duels!

name: 青い靴とオズの魔術師 (The Blue Slippers and the Wizard of Oz)
description:
A tornado carries Dorothy and her dog, Toto, off to Oz. Dorothy's house lands on a witch, freeing the little people of that land. A good witch arrives and presents Dorothy with a pair blue sapphire slippers. The good witch directs Dorothy to the Emerald City, where the Wizrd of Oz can help her return home. Join Dorothy as she makes new friends and goes on strange adventures!

青い靴とオズの魔術師 ("The Blue Slippers and the Wizard of Oz") includes 32 cards, 16 black and 16 blue. The cards are numbered, but OR cards offer a choice of numbers. This anthology includes rules for three games, each one being the designer's take on combining other popular games. Certain cards also have special effects that change from game to game.

In Shoes (Old Maid x Werewolf, 2-6 players), a player only keeps 2 cards in their hand. Players take turns drawing from other players' hands in an attempt to form pairs. If a player can't make a pair with the three cards in their hand, they must discard one card to the discard pile. Optional rules include special effects for the cards, including making a player immediately lose if they play or discard the 0 or Oz card.

In Liar (Cheat (BS) x Dobon, 2-5 players), players place a card or cards face-down and declare the number, which must be equal to or higher than the previous card. Players may play a card face-up, but they must draw 2 cards as a penalty. If a player accuses a player of lying and are correct, the previous player must take their cards back and draw a card. If the accuser is wrong, they must draw instead. Optional rules include special effects for different cards, and you may include a rule allowing a player go out if they can add, subtract, multiply, or divide all the number sin their hand to equal the previous declared number.

Quartet (Poker x Color Matching, 2-4 players) is a bluffing game where players place cards in their own tableau. Players hold only two cards in their hand at a time, and the goal is to have four cards in a row with the same color. Players may play cards face-down, but not if they did so on their previous turn. Optional rules add more opportunities to reach the goal and block the other players.
mechanics: Deduction, Ladder Climbing, Matching, Set Collection, Take That

name: Pulgas a la Carrera
description:
Use your cards to move around the map and be the first flea to reach the dog. Anything goes in this race so you'll have to use your bluffing skills to try to scrape a few meters and at the same time detect the lies of your opponents to be punished.
You have to win any way you can!

During your turn, you play face down any number of cards from your hand and declare the number of moves you are going to do.
The other players will decide whether they believe you or not. If any opponent doesn't believe you, you must reveal the cards and take the consequences. If you lied, you'll go back squares. If you told the truth, you'll move forward and the player or players who doubted you will move backward.
If no player doubted what you said, you'll move the number of squares declared, ignoring the real value of your cards.

Players take turns and advance through the modular map, which is full of traps and bonuses. The first player to reach the end of the path with his or her flea is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Events, Impulse Movement, Movement Points, Race, Voting

name: The Cursed Menagerie: Dark Fortunes
description: Mini-expansion for The Cursed Menagerie, that includes 3 new ghosts and 1 new object.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Hoard the Hams
description:
Hoard the Hams is a hilarious card game for the whole family. Easy to play but surprisingly deep.

What is it all about?

1.Hoard the most Hams!

It’s in the name bro! Whoever has the most Hams at the end of the game wins.

2. Steal from Others!
Make your pile bigger, and make their pile smaller by using the time honored tradition of theft.

3. Protect what You've got!
When you still it's cool but when they steal it's lame. Protect yourself from those DIRTY THIEVES by placing trap hams.

4. Take Care of Yourself!
Help yourself without hurting anyone else because we all deserve a little self care.

5. Counter Attack!
Even the best plaid plans can be turned on their heads! Use reaction cards as a last minute counter.

6. Strategize!
Strategize the best combo of placing traps, stealing cards, taking care of yourself, and counter attaching to come out on top in Hoard the Hams!

-description from designer

name: Materia Prima: Transmutations
description:
The strength of an Alchemist is manifested in the special quality of his transmutations.
Whoever wants to be the leader of the alchemists' guild needs faithful and unique homuncali and a selection of extraordinary tools.
For some, this is even their life's quest.

name: Endless Winter: Annual Gathering Promo Card
description:
An Endless Winter promo card available at Essen SPIEL '23 fair.

Era I Culture Card with the following effects:

- Self: Gain 2 Tools and 4 Food.
- All other players: Gain 1 Tool and 2 Food.

name: Art Frenzy: Symphony Edition
description:
The game consists of playing cards depicting a classical music piece and an app.

The app plays a piece of classical music or describes verbally. The players try to be first to find and touch the corresponding card. If you are first and correct, you get one point, and the card is removed from the game - if you are wrong, you lose a point, and the card stays.

There are varying game modes for shorter and longer games, and for different levels - on the harder levels less known parts of the pieces are played.

name: Nusa Mystic
description:
A mysterious island appeared and a team was sent to explore it. Only four survivors returned, shaken, with with strange stories and strange powers. Now you lead a second team in search of the mystical flowers.

Nusa mystic is a trick taking game that takes place over three rounds. At the beginning of the round, reward cards are dealt out, and each trick wins one of the reward cards. Reward cards may provide flowers, which score based on majority control, direct points, or skulls. If a player takes too many skulls, they lose all points they have earned so far that round.

In each round, players are dealt six cards, with which they play two hands. In the first hand, five tricks are played and the final card is discarded. For the second hand, players select three of the five cards they already played as their hand.

At the end of three rounds, the player who earned the most points from the reward cards wins the game.

name: Lanfeust de Troy, Chapitre 1er: Evilhëne
description:
Lanfeust de Troy is a game of exploration and adventure in which you'll embody one of the heroes from the famous comic strip.

A world of magic, rich in adventure, where every feat is possible.
Fight monsters, explore dark caverns, plunder treasures...

When it's your turn, you'll need to mark your passage on the central board.
Roll the dice up to three times and place them on the "Compass Rose" to make a shape.
Draw this shape on the central board to explore as many squares as possible. In order to fight monsters, discover random events, or open doors leading to treasure chests!
Finally, you'll record the Experience Points you've earned and check off your Tower box.

These experience points will enable you to level up and gain new powers.
To succeed, you'll need to collaborate with your fellow adventurers, who are themselves in search of victory. In fact, you'll have a limited number of turns together to find your way off the board!
And if you do, only the player with the most experience points wins the game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Lanfeust de Troy est un jeu d’exploration et d'aventure où vous incarnerez l’un des héros de la célèbre Bande-Dessinée.

Un univers de magie, riche en aventures, où tous les exploits sont possibles.
Combattez des monstres, explorez de sombres cavernes, pillez des trésors…

A votre tour, vous devez indiquer votre case de passage sur le plateau central.
Lancez jusque trois fois les dés et les placer sur la "Rose des vents" afin de réaliser une forme.
Cette forme, vous allez la dessiner sur le plateau central pour explorer le plus de cases possibles. Afin de combattre des monstres, découvrir des évènements aléatoires, ou encore ouvrir des portes qui mènent à des coffres aux trésors!
Enfin, vous allez noter les points d'Expérience gagnés et cocher votre case Tour.

Grâce à ces points d’expérience gagnés vous monterez de niveaux et gagnerez de nouveaux pouvoirs.
Pour réussir, chacun devra collaborer avec ses compagnons d’aventure, eux-mêmes à la recherche de la victoire. En effet, vous aurez un nombre de tours en commun limités pour trouver la sortie du plateau!
Et si vous trouvez la sortie, seul celui qui aura cumulé le plus de points d’expérience remportera la partie!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Drawing, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Flippi
description:
Paraphrased from their official German web site:
Flippi is a dexterity game that combines elements of pinball and mini golf.

It's manufactured from sustainable materials. The production is carried out with a lot of passion and enthusiasm in the publishers rehabilitation workshop. A rehabilitation facility for people with chronic mental illnesses.

name: 우리집 돼지저금통을 훔쳤다! (Piggy Bank Snitch!)
description:
You just snitched the piggy bank from the living room for a secret snack party!
But it thurns out that you are not the only snitch in town.
Join a sweet clash for most delicious treats and acquire more snacks than any of your peers!

▶Playing the Game
The game lasts for 15 rounds, when the deck runs out of cards. Each round will follow the steps below:
1. The starting player draws the top card of the deck and reveals the card for everyone.

2. Each player reaches their hand into the pocket for the coins, places the coins in front of them, then reaches for the revealed card.

3. The first player to have their hand on the card buys the card. The player may compare the price written on the card with the total value of the coins they have taken out.

-If the total value of coins taken out is equal to the price or even the price exceeds, the number of change is 5 or less
The player takes the card and displays it in front of them. Then they receive the charge, which is the difference between the price and the total value of coins taken out. All the coins taken out go to the bank, and they may take coins of value equal to that difference from the bank in any combination of coins.

-Otherwise(if the player must recieve at least 6 coins for change, or the total value of coins is less than the price):
The player returns the revealed card and one of their displayed card to the gamebox. If the player does not have any card in display, only the revealed card is returned. All coins taken out return to their tray.

4. Each player puts all the coins they have taken out back into the pocket. Then start another round by revealing the next card from the deck.

5. The first player to have their hand on the card at the previous round becomes the starting player of this round. The games lasts for 15 rounds, when there are no more cards to be revealed.

-description from publisher

name: Five Nights at Freddy's: FightLine
description:
Team up with your favorite Five Nights At Freddy’s characters, including fan favorites from across the entire franchise. Build a team that can take down your opponent, spend Faz Coins to use character powers, and be the first to score 7 point tickets!

The FightLine Premier Pack comes with everything 2 players need to play. The Premier Pack includes 4 exclusive character figures available nowhere else, as well as premium components and tokens. Character Packs are blind and random, with 1 character per pack. Each player needs one just Character Pack to play, it comes with tokens to let you play with just 1 figure.

Series 1 features 20 character figures from the Five Nights at Freddy’s universe. The Premier Pack contains everything you need to play, including four character figures with unique special abilities! Combine with Character Packs to add more figures, character powers, and new ways to build your team!

—description from the designer

name: Frenemies Inc.
description:
Dive into the thrilling world of startups, betrayals, and corporate high jinks with our dynamic card game, where every play is a story of ambition and intrigue. But that's just the beginning.

Frenemies Inc is an easy to learn card game that has 3 decks of cards, event, valuation, and resources. And the player that reaches a $1 million company valuation/the last player standing wins.

Each player starts with a random set of event, valuation, and resource cards. During a player's turn, they will start with a decision on drawing a resource or valuation card, players must strategically manage their resources to build up a valuation for their companies.

At the end of a player's turn, they will pick up an event card. There are many unique event cards in the deck that will allow players to attack/sabotage others, defend themselves, take risks, collaborate, or pick up a bankruptcy card that will put their company in danger.

Every round is a business "ad-venture", and every card is a decision. In Frenemies Inc, you'll experience the highs of success and the lows of sabotage and betrayal. Whether you're collaborating for mutual gain or plotting your next move in secrecy, every game tells a unique startup story!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Stock Holding, Take That

name: ÍNTIMOOS Hot: Para [re]descubrirse en profundidad
description:
The game that will cheer up your relationship as a couple. Cards with questions divided into 3 levels (soft, average and hot) depending on how "spicy" do you want the cards.

The players (a couple) choose a number of cards to fulfill and the first to reach said number of cards fulfilled, wins. It is a game where you enjoy the path, not only the goal.

Contains a total of 180 cards with 5 different categories:

Conversations
Action
Redeemable for
Positions
Tricks and tips

The game includes a QR code with a soundtrack.

name: Hydra
description:
Countless ships dance on the waves in the harbor of Arizont as life pulses through the city streets. There‘s a bustling crowd, with people from all corners of the known world trading and haggling over exotic spices, foods, and other treasures. But this idyllic scene is deceiving, for doom is already awakening, as the next lunar eclipse is imminent. Far out in the Maelstrom, the Hydra rises from its deep slumber. Four necks stretch out, countless heads raise, hungrily targeting Arizont. The city walls, once proud and solid, tremble under the looming threat as the beast charges relentlessly.

But this time, the story shall take a new turn. The Guild Council has sent out a call for aid in all directions, promising rewards of princely stature. Brave heroes have heeded this call. However, wealth and honor will be bestowed only upon those who can earn the city‘s admiration through courage and determination against the Hydra.

Thus, you too have found your way to Arizont. Your hearts burn with resolve to protect the city and return with pockets full of gold.

Together, you face off against the many-headed Hydra. But in this epic battle, each of you not only strives for the city‘s welfare, but also for the sole glory awarded to the triumphant victor in the end. Each of you will choose from available actions, block crucial cards with Action tokens, and formulate tactics - be it in combat against the Hydra, constructing defensive Barricades, or advancing into optimal attack positions. Yet, the Hydra retaliates, drawing insurmountable power from remaining action cards and the darkening moon.

The city‘s fate is in your hands. By standing united, you‘ll be hailed as true heroes. But only the best among you will go down in the city‘s history as an epic hero, weighed in gold. Are you this much-sung hero? Will you stand shoulder to shoulder, only to stab your comrade in the back when it counts? Beware, for they too are waiting for that moment.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Solitaire TacOps: Ortona
description:
Solitaire TacOps is a campaign system that simulates the battlefield space where operational decisions meet tactical realities. For Ortona, you start with four infantry battalions, one armored regiment, an artillery battery, and an engineer company. These are represented on counters ranging from platoons to squads, with tank groups and artillery guns. Players will make operational decisions such as when and where to engage the enemy, which forces to use, and the type of support to provide them with. The scenarios are then played on hex maps that use a megahex activation system to manage the opposition.

An innovative dice system handles both player and opposition actions, providing a wide range of outcomes with fast resolution. This allows you to keep your focus on the map action and the narrative that emerges from play. The scenarios, which last from 30 to 90 minutes, will pull you in as you attempt to achieve objectives with the fewest losses. Each scenario can be played solitaire, with cooperative setups also available for some of the larger ones.

While the scenarios can be played as one-offs, the TacOps system comes alive over the course of the full campaign. The outcome from one scenario will determine which one is played next, all leading to the final engagement in the streets of Ortona, where the Canadian 1st Division will find the well-prepared German defenses of the Fallschirmjäger Division. Destroyed buildings, rubble piles, mines, snipers, and other traps will challenge the tactical and operational skills players will need to survive “bloody December” in Ortona.

Components:
Three double-sided 11" x 17" Maps
One Dashboard Display
Two Countersheets of counters and markers
Dice
12 Scenario Cards
One Campaign Tracking Pad
One Rulebook with Historical Notes
One Learn to Play Booklet

-description from designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Wandering Towers: Close The Raven Castle
description:
Originally available as a free promo at Spiel 2023 from the AbacusSpiele booth.

Close The Raven Castle
Effect: If you use this magic spell, you may close the Raven Castle, so that nobody can move into the Raven Castle for the moment. To do this, place this tile on top of the Raven Castle with the back side facing up. For now, no movement may be made that would land a tower or a wizard on the Raven Castle. When it is your turn again, place the tile back in the middle of the table with the front side facing up. The Raven Castle is now open again.

name: Crimson Star Road
description:
This is a doujin (fan-made) game that was produced for sale only at Japanese game shows. It was not made for the general public and to get one you had to order in advance. The game would then be made, and you would pick it up at the show.

This game deals with the Legend of the Galactic Heroes, an anime series from the late 80's to mid 90's.

—user summary

A strategy-class wargame with the theme of battles around volumes 1~5 of The Legend of the Galactic Heroes. As the Commander-in-Chief of the Galactic Empire or the Free Planetary Alliance, each player is responsible for the mobilization of troops, the personnel of Starfleet, and even the actual operation of troops.

The game is a simple reproduction of strategic combat in space with the sequence of move-reaction move-pitched battle-second move.

There are five scenarios as follows.
1. Idol of Heroes (July 796)
An all-out war scenario that begins immediately after Jan's capture of Iserlohn.
2. The Wise Man's Miscalculation (October 796)
It begins when Yang's intentions are derailed, and the Alliance forces invade Imperial territory.
3. Those who walk the path of supremacy (April 797)
Civil war scenario using only the Imperial territory map.
4. Twilight of the Gods (November 798)
Recreation of Reinhardt's masterpiece of war art, Operation Ragnarok.
5. Old Tree (January 796)
A thrilling setting in which the coup d'état of the Lippstadt Campaign and the National Salvation Military Council occurs in an event in the middle of the game.

The game includes a four-part laminated map, rules, two tactical displays, and a sheet of counters. Assembly s required.

—description from the designer
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Diavolo: Deck Builder
description:
Descend into hell at vanquish its demons.

Deck Builder that can be played with a 40 card deck of standard playing cards; Either using an Italian 40 card deck or removing the 8s, 9s, and 10s, from a poker deck.

The game setup will remove the lower value cards to form the player deck and the rest of the cards remain as the enemy deck with the top 3 revealed as the enemy row. If the player can remove all the remaining enemy cards they win. If they can not perform a legal move they lose.

Players will perform actions each turn and each action is decided based on the suit of the card played:

Fighting - Eliminate a card from the enemy row

Banish - Move a card from the enemy row to the bottom of the enemy deck and eliminate a card from your hand.

Buy - Purchase any non-face card from the enemy row and add it to your hand.

Rest - Do nothing on your turn.

The final rule that requires some strategy is that the player may not take the same action twice in a row. Meaning, a player can not perform a fight and then another fight action. So while the Rest action might not do anything, it's the only action that can always be performed and can help players.

Players will start with a weak deck of cards and slowly buy stronger cards, cull weaker cards, and fight their way to victory.

-description from designer

name: Mad for War
description: Mad for War is a gaming system for recreating 17th century naval actions with miniature ships. The game uses a simple system for movement under sails and combat. Crew quality plays a central role and special characters allows to differentiate ships. The rulebook contains also scenarios, fleet lists and information about the historical background.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Crisis Imperator
description:
You have been appointed as the Imperator over a galactic Empire that is in the throes of an existential crisis. The long-decaying Empire is now under threat from four enemies, and must defend itself from, and ultimately defeat, these alien and internal threats.

Utilizing a unique battle system that combines resource allocation with dice rolling, you must keep the enemies at bay until the Empire is strong enough to counterattack and damage one enemy so badly that it can no longer threaten you.

Each of the 12 rounds of this solitaire challenge starts with the selection of a policy that the Empire implements to improve its chances of survival. Next, resources are spent to build and improve the Empire's forces. Lastly, the Empire's forces are allocated to face the various enemies, strategically losing where necessary, and holding the line in other theaters where the peril is too great.

Meanwhile, as the Imperator, you must maintain the support of the Grand Senate, which appointed you. If they believe that you have become too ambitious, or that you lack the necessary qualities, you will be forcibly removed. By balancing the use of an iron fist and a velvet tongue, will you be able to maintain your grip on power while preventing the Empire from epoch-ending ruination?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Melding and Splaying, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: There's The Effing Scheer
description:
“As I was crossing the compass platform the captain hailed me, not with the usual rigmarole of 'Enemy in sight, bearing, etc', but with 'There's the fucking Scheer! Open fire at her!'… But the name of the enemy ship was of course the Graf Spee.”
– Lieutenant-Commander Richard Jennings, HMS Exeter's gunnery officer during the Battle of the River Plate

Heroic quotes are overrated, focussing too much on the individual or on the big picture. I sometimes feel the same about naval wargames. They are either so sweepingly huge that the tactical battles aren't as fun, or they are so granular that five minutes of combat takes an hour to simulate.
There's The Effing Scheer is my attempt to create an exciting game that doesn't devour your time.
You have half a dozen or less models per side.
Terrain isn't really a worry.
You just need a tape measure, a ruler and some 12-sided dice. Plus this ruleset.


Realistic accuracy and damage (though luck is always a reliably unreliable factor).
Small battles won't last an hour of your time. Even large engagements should be finished in under a few hours.
Historical design decisions are built into the rule mechanics, e.g. the rate of fire of 6" shells over 8" shells means they hit smaller targets more easily, but won't pack as much of a punch against cruisers.
Launching torpedoes, firing, critical hits, changing formation and more are all simplified to speed up play time. Your subordinates are professionals after all.
Critical damage such as loss of power, damaged fire control, fires and magazine explosions are all possible (but not encouraged, unless on your opponent's ships).
Advanced rules cover collisions, night battles, Long Lance torpedoes and more.
Six starter scenarios set across the Atlantic, Mediterranean and Pacific.
Open architecture. How I designed these rules is shown in the Appendix if you fancy constructing scenarios of your own for the miniatures in your collection.


Overall, if you want a game which isn't going to take up all of your time, give realistic-ish results and allow you to roll some dice with friends as you refight the early naval engagements of World War 2, look no further.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Mad Maxence
description:
Why is the world in such a state? Wasn't our planet once welcoming to humans? Maxence doesn't have time to ask herself these questions; instead, she has to drive straight ahead to escape the Erasers. With less than a day's ahead, she sets off on the dusty track...

Mad Maxence is a post-apocalyptic game where you play as Maxence, a tough, vengeful young girl. Behind the wheel of your car, you'll travel to different parts of the wasteland, equip yourself, brave the dangers, learn about your past and, above all, avoid dying before you find your escape route...

Gameplay: Each turn, choose a new location and consume a unit of time. In each location, you'll find either good things or problems, and sometimes you'll have to pass tests that are solved using 3 coins and heads or tails combinations.
If you exceed the "20" time unit, the erasers catch up with you and eliminate you.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Protocole G117
description:
Earth 2043. A conscious AI bursts in and initiates the G117 protocol to eradicate humanity as an "invasive species". Despite the surprise, humanity fights back and launches a last stand on Earth and in the Matrix to pull the plug on the AI before it's too late.

Opposition game where two players fight for the survival of their own species. One as the AI player, the other as the human one.

Gameplay: Wargame in which you must simultaneously take control of two planes: the Earth and the Matrix. In one, troops and drones battle, in the other deckers and bots.
A game lasts 10 turns and there are ten different actions, so you have to play them all.
Each turn, the first player selects an action from which he chooses either the operation points or the bonuses indicated. The second player must play the corresponding action (which is necessarily different) and then he becomes the first player... and so on.

—description from the publisher

name: ToroBall
description:
Created in the Landes region (Aquitaine) just over 60 years ago, Toroball represents both the Landes' sense of humor and their relationship with festivities.

Each summer, at small village Ferias, a sort of temporary arena is set up, and on Sunday mornings, after little sleep, youngsters throw themselves into the arena in colored jerseys and play soccer like everyone else. it's just that there's a cow lurking in the middle.

Gameplay: Each player in turn moves his 3 Sunday sportsmen and women. They'll try to hit the ball in the direction of the opponent's goal, attract the cow to their opponents and, above all, avoid taking a nasty charge. The cow always moves towards the nearest target. 

The first team to score two goals wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Dune: Imperium – Uprising: Arrakis Revolt
description:
A promo card offered by Dire Wolf for preordering Dune: Imperium – Uprising

Type: Fremen Card
Cost: 6 persuasion
On gain: 1 Troop
Agent symbol: Blue
Agent Ability: with a Maker hook, Pay 2 spice to tear down the shield Wall and summon a sand worm.
Reveal ability: Increase persuasion by 1 and combat strength by 3.
publishers: Dire Wolf, Geekach Games, Lucky Duck Games

name: Winter Rabbit
description:
The village elders have predicted a severe winter, and so the villagers have agreed to work together to ensure that the village has all of the necessities. In a spirit of healthy competition, the villagers have decided to compete to see who can be the most helpful. However, Rabbit, the constant trickster, has decided that he does not want to work. Instead, he has decided to confuse everyone else so that he can take all of the resources for himself.

Winter Rabbit is set in the world of traditional Cherokee animal stories, where each player takes on the role of one of the animal characters. In this semi-cooperative game, players cooperate to provide everything the village needs for winter while also competing to see who can contribute the most.

Winter Rabbit features a unique hidden worker placement system. Villagers are drawn randomly from a bag. The active player knows whose villager they have drawn and can choose where to place it, though this information is hidden from other players. Resources are only generated when enough villagers are present. When resources are produced, every player gets one, but those with villagers present gain additional resources.

Rabbit villagers do not produce resources. When one of these appears in a resource location, resources are instead diverted to the Rabbit Burrow. In later turns, players can steal these resources back.

Players can spend resources to build their personal engine through village cards. They can also spend resources on stories that affect the game for all players, or complete tasks that score points, progress the game, and provide a benefit to another player.

Players are encouraged to manage resources carefully. Storage is limited, and overproducing can result in difficulty producing resources in future turns.

The game ends after a variable number of rounds, depending on player count. If players have collectively produced enough supplies for the village to survive Winter, then the player with the highest score wins. If Winter arrives before the necessary supplies are produced, then players share a collective loss.

Winter Rabbit attempts to create a counterpoint to common colonial game themes by focusing on indigenous values and concepts. Winter Rabbit won second prize in the 2021 Zenobia Awards.

-description from designer

name: WAy of the ShoTgun
description:
Earth 2043. The apocalypse has taken place, and human societies have collapsed, along with their populations. The survivors have decided not to be fooled twice, and have organized themselves locally, without a state, according to the principles of anarchy.

We invite you to simulate the construction of this new society, before the ShoTgun's revenge, which is the theme of our next single-player game.

Gameplay : Each turn, select a location and resolve roleplaying situations that changes while time is passing (turns). Your goal is to establish your anarchist community according to its principles, while the reaction of AuTority is growing in the shadow.

At the end, you will get a situation that will be transpose to our next solo game “WAy of the ShoTgun” as starting conditions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 02 Hundred Hours: Desert Raid
description:
Intrepid members of the LRDG and SAS travel hundreds of miles through the deserts of North Africa, braving sandstorms and extreme temperatures to raid German airfields.

The 02 Hundred Hours: Desert Raid adds two opposing forces ready for night raids in the desert, plus the new weather events. Now you'll battle the elements as well as the enemy!

The miniatures in this set can represent either LRDG or desert-based SAS, or a mix of both. For SAS, use the recruitment cards from the main 02 Hundred Hours set.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: 02 Hundred Hours: Partisan Resistance Cell
description:
A courageous group of Partisan fighters resists the German occupiers, gathering information, forming plans and launching night-time raids on the enemy.

The 02 Hundred Hours: Partisan Resistance Cell expansion contains new models and forty unique cards that add plan cards to the game, allowing the partisan player to choose special tricks and stratagems before the battle starts: cut the phone lines, receive coded messages, or even place sausages to distract the guard dogs! Plan cards are a bit like the event cards, except that you choose three (normally) before the battle starts; the more partisans in your force, the more plans you will have to choose from.

This expansion includes recruitment cards for Jedburgh teams: three-man groups tasked with helping the local resistance cells to prepare for D-Day. Jedburgh miniatures are sold separately.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: 02 Hundred Hours: Operation Torchlight
description:
